name: Cat and Mice: Cheesepyramid Traps
description:
A group of mice must navigate a giant pyramid of cheese, racing each other to see who can collect the most before reaching the top. Mice can wiggle through the holes in the cheese to collect even more, but watch out for the cat!

Having found a lot of holes in the cheese, the pussy howls: “Mice must feel too much at ease, eating up the master’s cheese. I will guard it night and day, shooing naughty mice away!” Careful, mice - the cat is sly, it will hit you – you will fly. Go running to the top! Keep the cheese and do not stop! Traps are no threat with cheese, win, do not be scared of these!

GAME COMPONENTS:
Cheese pyramid – 1,
‘cheese lumps’
with holes – 4,
numbered tokens – 25,
chips: wooden mouse — 4,
wooden cat — 1;
glass balls – 4,
dice – 1,
rules — 1.

THE PURPOSE OF THE GAME:
To be first to reach the cheese pyramid, and gain as many points as possible!

THE PROGRESS OF THE GAME
• The game participants take turns to throw the dice and move the mice game pieces towards the top of the cheese pyramid along the tiers (levels). • The game pieces may only be moved anti-clockwise. • The movement to each subsequent tier (level) is via four staircases. • Only one game piece may be located in the field. Game pieces may “step over” each other. If the relevant field is occupied by another game piece, the player should go to the free field ahead of it. • On the fields with symbols the players must comply with their conditions (see the playing field symbols). • When moving or “stepping” with a game piece over other game pieces the players must hold the marble with a finger of only one hand.

PLAYING FIELD SYMBOLS
1. The mouse game piece stopped in the field with this symbol: • If the player does not have the “holes” of his/her piece of cheese closed, he/she will take one token from the bank, and cover the holes with it blindfold, i. e., without turning the token with the number upwards. • If all the holes are already covered with tokens, the player will make an additional move.
2. The cat game piece has stopped on this field, so the move is to be made to the player who is next in turn. • If the player’s game piece gets onto the field with the cat’s symbol, the player will throw the dice and move the cat’s game piece by the number of points shown on the dice. See special cases that may occur during the cat’s movement in VI and VII.
3. If the game piece gets into this field, the marble will fall into the hole and roll down to the other tier (level). The player will move the mouse game piece to a new field, cover the marble with it again, and take two tokens from the bank and cover the “holes” on the cheese piece with them. See special cases in IV and V. NOTE. The trap field will be inactive if all five holes on the cheese piece are closed with tokens. In this case the player will put the mouse game piece near the hole, so as prevent the marble from falling.
4. On the upper tier the Players’ game pieces will be moving in a circle until one of them (or the cat game piece) stands precisely on the field with a red flag — the finish field. NOTE. For the smallest kids the game may be finished when the first player reaches or crosses the field with the flag. • Then the players turn their cheese pieces upside down and count the points on the tokens. The one who gains most points will be the winner. • In the event of two players with equal number of points the one who has reached the finish or is closer to the same will win.

Developing game "Cat and Mouse" in the form of a dimensional pyramid develops fine motor skills, memory and attention. Gives an idea of ​​numbers and scoring. Trains accurate eye. Unique 3D form of the pyramid allows you to play not only in one-dimensional plane but in three-dimensional space.
—description from the publisher

The object of the game is to be the first to get your mouse to the top of the pyramid while avoiding the cat.

Each player controls a wooden mouse covering a marble. Players take turns rolling the die and moving their mouse. Some spots allow the marble to drop, requiring the player to move their mouse to that lower location. Other spots trigger the cat to move.
—user summary

name: All About Town: Burlington, Vermont
description:
The object of this game is for the PLAYERS, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the gameboard from a RESIDENCE SQUARE to the bank and shopping locations shown on their SHOPPING LISTS. The first PLAYER to return to his RESIDENCE with the TRAVEL CARDS for all locations contained on his SHOPPING LIST wins the game!

—description from the rulebook
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Flipper
description: Children's dexterity game based on TV and movie dolphin Flipper. Each player gets ten hoops they try to send flying on a rotating board. Battery operated board spins, with player colored dolphins poking their noses up and down. Player with the most hits is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Real-time

name: Moons: Hi Energy Gravity Tractor
description:
Promo from 2017 Game Boy Geek Kickstarter Campaign.

Text says:
When you are the target of an asteroid card, deflect the action to another valid player
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Space Exploration

name: 21st Century Problems
description:
"I can't use my phone in bed because the charger cable is too short."

"The remote control is on the OTHER couch."

"I got a gift card for a store I don't like."

Everyone has experienced these kinds of annoyances in this fast-moving, ever-connected world. In 21st Century Problems, guess which of these problems your friends will find most excruciating, and score stars based on their rankings. After everybody has taken a turn at being the judge, the player with the most stars wins!

name: Lord of the Wings: A Bird Trump Game
description:
Which has the widest wingspan, a California Condor or a Magnificent Frigatebird? Which lives longest, a Wandering Albatross or an Emperor Penguin?

This avian trump game rates 32 birds by criteria including Clutch Size, Rarity and Courtship Display. Find out who’s first in the pecking order with these beautifully illustrated trump cards.

name: Monster Facial Expressions
description:
Who thinks they can reach their nose with their tongue? And who can puff out their cheeks the most? The monster-sized funny faces provide guaranteed fun. Here we go! Throw dice, find a monster, make a monster face. A silly game for 2-4 players ages 5-99 that playfully helps to encourage verbal and motor skills.

—description from the publisher

name: Salt and Pepper
description:
Get ready to add some spice to your game night with Spicy Games! Each of the spice bottles hold all of the pieces you need to play a game. Each game takes 2 minutes to learn and 10 minutes to play. For ages 8 and up.

On a player's turn, they shake up the bottle containing the 19 discs that are white (salt) on one side and black (pepper) on the other and then pour all them out calling out either Salt or Pepper.

They score 1 point for each token that came out on the side they called out. Those go back in the bottom while the others are set off to the side.

They repeat the process and may call out a different color with the remaining tokens. A player continues to do this until there are no more tokens in the bottle.

There are a few other special rules for outcomes based on what side of the tokens come out (all the same side, 7 or more of the same color. etc)

First player to 100 points win.

name: Flea (fan expansion for Hive)
description:
Must be placed touching a piece of yours and one of your opponent’s
May hop (like a hopper) over 1 (only) in a straight line OR
May move 1, but must fit through
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Monopoly: Landkreis Böblingen
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the aera Böblingen, in Germany
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Avengers: Infinity War – Das Spiel
description:
Battle the villains around Thanos with the Marvel heroes. Each player tries to defeat as many opponents as possible and earn the most victory points.
In addition to tactics, a strong will also counts to protect the universe from Thanos.

Each player plays a hero from the Avengers universe. Each player has the same well-mixed deck of cards, which always plays from the top.
The required combat strengths of the outlying opponents must be achieved together as a team (among all players) and finally one lucky player lands the decisive hit to defeat opponents. "Avengers, assemble!"

---

Bekämpfe mit den Marvel Helden die Bösewichte rund um Thanos. Jeder Spieler versucht möglichst viele der ausliegenden Gegner zu besiegen und die meisten Siegpunkte zu erspielen.
Neben Taktik zählt auch Siegeswillen, um das Universum vor Thanos zu schützen.

Jeder Spieler spielt einen Helden aus dem Avengers-Universum. Jeder Spieler hat ein gleiches gut gemischtes Kartendeck, wovon jeweils immer von oben abgespielt wird. Die benötigten Kampfstärken der ausliegenden Gegner müssen zusammen als Team (unter allen Spielern) erreicht werden und letztendlich landet ein glücklicher Spieler den entscheidenen Schlag, um Gegner zu besiegen. "Avengers, sammelt euch!"
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Yuushi no Kusabi
description:
勇士の楔 (Yuushi no Kusabi, "Bonds of the Brave") is about heroes deciding which army to join. You want to be the strongest member of the winning army, but you'll have to find out what the other players are planning while hiding your own intentions.

At the start players are dealt three cards, and four cards are dealt to the middle, two face up and two face down. Each turn you take cards from the middle, put some from your hand back, and then add more cards to the middle from the deck. Once someone has ten points in one color they can announce victory for that team; everyone else gets one chance to announce victory for another color if they also have ten points, and then you move on to scoring. Declaring victory in a color is advantageous but might not be enough to overcome a sneaky player; whoever has the most points total over all victorious colors wins the round. This means that besides winning on the strength of your own hand, you can win by investing in multiple suits other people are stronger in.

The most subtle part of the game is the different kinds of cards. While some cards give a simple color bonus, those are the rarest. The next most common type can count for either of two colors during scoring, but don't count towards the 10 for declaring victory. Most cards are worth few points on their own, but worth more in pairs with specific cards - in particular, the purple color has no invidually strong cards, but is worth the most with the right pair. Each color has its own distribution, and keeping that in mind is key to victory.

Can you read the other players to figure out which color you should throw your lot in with?

—user summary

name: Four Levels
description:
Four Levels is a two player, 3D abstract strategy game for ages 8 and up with gameplay 10-20 minutes. The simple rules makes it easy to learn and fun to play. With easy assembled of 3D structure makes a unique playing field.

The object of the game is to create four similar half pieces of the same color in a straight line on one or all four levels. Playing pieces include wild pieces that can work in combination with other pieces to create a winning combination. Parts are played in a set sequence, so you always know what piece your opponent will be playing next. Some of the pieces can also share the same spaces so you have to beware.
Let’s Take Fun to A Whole New Level

—description from the designer

name: Fake News Game: Kanye Edition
description:
Introducing the highly anticipated second edition of #FakeNews. Kanye West. The king of abstract and baffling statements. His creative and egotistical antics are as infamous as his honest lyrics. But can you sort the fact from the fake? With an enigma like Yeezus, this is more challenging than it sounds.'
—description from the publisher

Guess the 56 statement cards to be True or Fake News.
—description from the box

name: Achtung, Baustelle!
description:
Achtung, Baustelle! is a children's game for 2 to 4 players 5 years or older. It is about concentration and speed in finding the correct building machines to fulfill orders.

Each player has a set of cards featuring different building machines. Each round a task card is revealed showing 2 to 4 of these, and the players have to choose the correct set from their cards to match the task. The fastest player with the correct set gets the task card, and the player with most task cards wins.

—user summary

name: XORIO
description:
XORIO is an abstract game for two players that explores the logical operation "XOR".

The game takes place on a 5x5 grid, with both players aiming to complete their cyphertext. The players each have 5 tokens showing "1" on one side and "0" on the other. The tokens each start in a player's home row. In the middle of the board are neutral tokens for a fixed bit, inversion bit, and multi-bit.

During setup, each player is dealt a card with a 5 digit binary number on it (e.g. 10010 or 01100). A player wins if their bits, from left to right, match their card. The bits do not need to be in the same row, but there can only be one per column.

On their turn a player moves either one of their tokens or one of the neutral tokens as far as they can in a straight line (without entering the opponent's home row). Depending upon the pieces that end up adjacent, various changes occur based upon the XOR function.

name: Hackin' Packin' Alpaca
description:
Hackin' Packin' Alpaca is the hilarious kids' game with lots of cargo and one spittin' mad alpaca! To play, take turns stacking pieces of your cargo on Al the Alpaca's back. Watch the time, though -- this alpaca has a temper! To get started, turn Al's head to face the first player, then start the timer. You've got five seconds to stack a piece of cargo on his back. If you fail to stack a piece before the time runs out, Al will SPIT water at you! You'll have to use skill and touch to stack your pieces -- the game gets more challenging as more cargo is piled on Al's back. If you knock over any other pieces, you'll have to add them to your personal stockpile. The first player to stack all of their pieces wins -- can you do it before Al loses his temper?

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Humor

name: Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game – The Color of Madness
description: The Color of Madness adds a new game mode, which offers a different experience, outside of the campaign mode. The sort of expansion that you can take out with friends for a challenging and fun game that will be played in about 90 minutes. You still need the core box in order to be able to play The Color of Madness.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: Stap voor stap
description:
In this game all players are working together in search for a solution to a social, health, animal or environmental problem.

One player (the know-all) is given a problem and can choose a fitting solution from 25 cards laid out on the table in a 5x5 grid. The other players (detectives) should find this one card from the possibilities by eliminating cards based on hints given by the know-all. Hints are given based on color, shape, size, whisper, depiction or drawing on the back of a detective.

If the detectives eliminate all but the solution card, they win the game. If the solution card is eliminated, they lose.

name: Bajsmemo
description:
Young children love talking about poop. This game is about learning about different animals' poop.

Look at the picture of the poop, connect it with the right animal and then find the matching pictures.

An educational game that's way too much fun!

--description from publisher

name: Domino Bagger, Lok & Co.
description:
With backhoe, locomotive, fire truck, shovel loader, tractor, dump truck, and concrete mixer there are seven different vehicles in this domino type game. In each case, the same motifs are placed next to each other. Who has the matching vehicles and manages to be the first to put all his domino cards?

The game is played clockwise, starting with the youngest player. On your turn, you look to see if you can match one of your tiles with one of the tiles in the middle of the table. The tiles can only be placed at the two open ends of the domino queue. Only identical motifs may be placed, for example, locomotive to locomotive or concrete mixer to concrete mixer.

If you have a matching tile, you may place it. Then it's the next player's turn.
If you don't, you must take a tile from the draw pile. If this tile you just took is a match, then you may place it on the table immediately.

The game ends when a player has played all tiles. The game also ends when none of the players can place a card. The winner is the player who has the fewest cards left.

name: Lukuset
description:
Celebrate Finnish literature in this trivia game. Four categories of questions on your way to the finish.

Similar to Trivial Pursuit, players roll a die and move around the board, answering questions based on the colour of the square you land. The first player to reach the final square and answer the question correctly is the winner.

name: Sorry!: Pets Behaving Badly
description:
It's a twist on classic Sorry! gameplay with a hilarious pet theme. In the Sorry! Pets Behaving Badly game players move around the board as the furry or feathered troublemakers who have trashed the house. It's a race to be the first to hide before the human gets home, but watch out for the poops! It's an unpredictable game of strategy, chance, and luck as players chase, race, jump, bump, slide -- and more -- to score. Be the first player to get all 4 pawns to home base to win. This family board game is a great choice for Family Game Night and makes a great gift for pet lovers and kids ages 6 and up.


DON'T GET BUSTED: The pets have done it again! They've trashed the house and they race to hide before they get in trouble. Players move around the board trying to be the first to get to the hiding place




OOPS CARDS AND POOP TOKENS: The game features classic Sorry! moves like jump, bump, and slide. It also includes Poop Tokens and Oops cards that can change a player's luck in an instant




CHALLENGING AND EXCITING GAME: The fun Sorry! game you grew up playing now has a pet theme. It's a challenging game of strategy, chance, and luck...mixed in with some oops and poops


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Beano The Board Game
description:
It is an average day in the school yard when you decide that it is time to play some pranks.

Players take turns to journey around Beano town and try to prank the different locations whilst avoiding the teacher. Perhaps you will drop a whoopee cushion at Mount Beano or splat custard pie at Bunkerton Castle. Will you be the first player to prank six different locations and win the game?

—description from the designer

Players each hold a hand of Prank cards, and take turns to roll dice to move their chosen character across the map, landing on spaces on which the they must perform the associated action. Idea cards detailing a location and prank are collected along the way, and when a player has a matching combination of Idea and Prank, they can head to the specified location to perform the prank, banking the Idea card.

The Teacher piece is moved throughout the game and acts to bar your way across the board.

The winner is the first player to bank 6 idea cards.

name: Towering Purrfection
description: You have stumbled upon an abandoned warehouse overrun with playful and pleasant cats. Your task is to turn the warehouse into a sanctuary for your cats to climb and play in. You will each utilize colorful tiles and cat trees to turn the warehouse into a bright, cozy environment for your cats to climb and enjoy. You are in charge of the renovation, so each tower build is unique to its designer—but remember, these cats accept nothing but purrfection.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Ravipeli
description:
"The Harness Racing Game" is quite literally that. The basic game has a lot in common with TOTO-ravi and Solvalla: for example, while the number of players is limited to 8 - with everyone driving 2 or 3 horses - any number of outside players can also participate in the totalisator betting. Just as in the other two games, the rules suggest a separate 'banker' player to handle the money and bets, presumably making the game feel more thematic.

In the actual gameplay Ravipeli is quite a bit more involved, though. The most striking difference is the innovative movement technique, where instead of simply rolling and moving players must first promise a certain number of movement points, then roll 2 or 3 dice; the more they promise the faster and farther they move, but the risk of galloping also grows ever greater. Gallops bring negative points and at certain moments in the race or if happening repeatedly, may even result in disqualification. There is also a multitude of small rules on how to drive a galloping horse, how to change lanes voluntarily or involuntarily, how to drive in between and in front of other horses, etc., which imitate the real rules of harness racing (even including things like "Shouting at the horse, getting heated up") and lead either to disqualification or a fine that is taken from the offending driver's monetary prize, if they manage to reach the finish line.

The rules are a bit vague in who actually wins and how so in that sense this game aims to be more of a harness racing simulator than a competitive game.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Eastward
description:
Official cooperative board game based on the critically-acclaimed video game Eastward.

This cooperative tabletop game sees 2-4 players working together to rescue villagers and defeat enemies, racing against a sinister miasma that threatens to engulf the world — complete with a foldout game board, 15 food cards, 10 item cards, and 4 unique playable character standees.

Two versions of the board game are available for preorder from iam8bit:
- Eastward Exclusive Collector’s Edition (Nintendo Switch)
- Eastward 2xLP Vinyl Soundtrack (Limited Edition Board Game)

Each version can be played independently, or together as an integrated experience.

name: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire Card Game
description:
Put Yourself in the hot seat of one of the nation's favourite quiz shows and take on the iconic money ladder. Using your wits and four lifelines, can you handle the pressure and climb to £1 million?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Magic: The Gathering – Mystery Booster
description:
Mystery Booster is a special Magic: The Gathering set designed as a "Chaos Draft" experience, where cards from all across the history of Magic can show up at random. The set contains nearly 2,000 different cards, making it the largest expansion to date.

In its first print run, Mystery Booster was exclusive to conventions, and featured 121 weird, wacky "playtest cards" that were usable only in draft and sealed formats. The following year, the set was made available in retail, with the playtest cards replaced with 121 foil reprints. The year after that, a new printing of the Convention Edition was distributed to affiliated local game stores to celebrate the return of in-store play after the lifting of pandemic restrictions.

Unlike most Magic expansions, Mystery Booster was only printed in English. It was sold in draft boosters in displays of 24 per box.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Take That

name: The Challenge Trilogy
description:
A Sherlock Holmes inspired collection of brainteasers from Professor Puzzle.

Use your powers of deduction and reasoning with this compendium of three different mystery games. Featuring over 150 riddles, puzzles and enigmas, this collection of games and quizzes will put your brain under closer scrutiny than a magnifying glass!

The Case of the Double Agent:

Pose the right questions to uncover your new alter-ego, or exercise your powers of deduction to reorder some tricky anagrams.

The Case of the Cryptic Clue:

Far from elementary – follow the clues to crack the case.

The Case of the Curious Conundrums:

Summon your inner detective to solve these testing riddles.
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle

name: Angry Birds: Knock-out!
description:
The angry birds are ready! Flip Red, Chuck, Bomb, Matilda, Jim, Jake and Jay on the meadow and try to hit as many pigs as possible.
The player with the most stars wins the game.

—user summary

name: Mod Ten
description:
Mod Ten is a cutthroat shedding game for 2 to 6 players. The game uses one or two stripped decks of traditional playing cards.

Players take turns playing a card to a trick. You must follow suit, and if you bring the value of the trick to a multiple of 10, you put the trick aside and start a new trick. If you cannot play a card you must pass.

The objective is to be the first player to play your last card.

name: Corona de Aragón
description:
Corona de Aragón will transport you to an exciting era in which your decisions during the game could change the course of history. Travel through the events and enclaves that forged a territory that came to dominate the Mediterranean. What are you waiting for to make history?

Learn by playing and banish the myths surrounding the birth of the Crown of Aragon. This edition of the game will focus on the first years of the history of the Crown of Aragon, which emerged after the dynastic union between the kingdom of Aragon and the county of Barcelona with the marriage between Petronila and Ramon Berenguer.

Crown of Aragon is a fun card game, recommended for 2 to 4 players from 8 years of age and with a duration of about 30 minutes.

Battles, betrayals, crossroads... Strategy and fun are mixed during the game, where players will have to travel through the enclaves of the Crown to improve their skills and discover the most fascinating historical events. Play your cards right and get ahead of your opponents by using actions and historical objects to sabotage the rest.

—description from the publisher

name: Hamilcar: Silver Edition
description:
Who shall rule the Mediterranean Sea? A nascent land-based empire with no naval traditions or the world’s premium trading and maritime power? Stand with Rome and lead mighty legions to expand its power beyond the confines of the Italian peninsula, or take Carthage’s side and lead its battle-hardened fleets and generals to victory and glory!

Hamilcar is an asymmetrical card-driven wargame for 2 players based on the legendary Hannibal: Rome vs Carthage by the world-renowned Mark Simonitch. Use Strategy Cards to maneuver armies, fleets, and generals, raise new troops and build warships, gain political control of provinces and regions across the Mediterranean, and play powerful historical events. Achieve victory by dominating the Mediterranean Sea by military and political means, and make your indelible mark on the history of the ancient world!

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Dice, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Mitspieler gesucht!
description:
The game was published by the "Ali Baba" gamer's club at their 25th anniversary.

Every player owns a gamer's club and needs to organize games, player and tables.

The players collect colored cards to buy everything they need. The cards have a color on each side of the card. The players may choose during the game to flip the side of all their cards in their hand.

The player with the most gaming tables and the highest valued games with the most players, who play the game may be the winner.

name: The Amazing Spider-Man Game
description:
In The Amazing Spider-Man Game, players take turns rolling the die and swinging Spider-Man up and down on the city skyscrapers.

At the start of the game, lay out mask and spider tiles at random in front of the skyscrapers. After moving Spider-Man, a player drops 1-3 wooden blocks — more blocks if he's at a taller building — from the air into the playing area formed by the city walls; if he lands a block into the colored cup matching the tile in front of the skyscraper, he claims that tile. Land in the wrong hole, though, and the Lizard starts moving through the city. If he catches Spider-Man on your turn, you place one of your collected tiles in the reserve. If you roll an X on the die, you place the top tile from this reserve into an empty space, giving Spidey more things to capture.

The first player to collect two mask tiles and two spider tiles — or six tiles of any type — wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Magor the Magician
description:
Recommended for children Ages 5 - 10.

Each child simultaneously places one of their 8 potion ingredient tiles on the board. Decide whether to play a snake, bone, toadstool, or the unwanted spider tiles. Then the electronic Magor the Magician figurine (2 AAA batteries) is moved around his potions pot. He makes his little magical tune and his conical wizard hat lights up and flickers. If his hat stays lit after his piping and peeping sound is done, he is suspicious and wants to check everyone's ingredients. If you tried to sneak a spider into his potion, you are caught and most remove the tile. If his hat doesn't stay lit, Magor trusts you and doesn't check your ingredient and it stays on the board.

First player to lay all eight ingredients, including the unwanted spiders, wins. Ties are possible.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Punch Cards: Wasted Lands
description:
This is a game of luck using cards with pretty pictures on one side, rules and numbers on the other, and four holes punched through the cards. Players secretly select one of their card corners and the cards are held back to back with numbers showing through the holes. The value of each card is determined by the lowest number showing through one of its holes; the highest-valued wins. Ties use the next lowest number, etc. This is the 'quick play' game.

The more complex game involves each player selecting five different cards (the two players could each use the same card, but no player may play with duplicates). Players select cards secretly and compare them as in the quick play game. The losing card is withdrawn (to be replaced by a new card in the next round) and the winner scores the value difference. Quick plays continue until one player runs out of card or concedes and the winner is determined according to accumulated score.

Additional rules exist for using the cards as a convention-wide game in which players attempt to accumulate cards originally belonging to as many players as possible through trading and quick play victories. (See the web site if you want to run this at a convention.)

The initial set of 20 Punch Cards uses artwork from Dave Dorman's Wasted Lands series.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading

name: Magnetic State to State
description:
Racing game to see who can go from their starting state to finishing state. Players pick state cards, then can either place them on the board, hold on to them (to mess with the other players), or ask for a state card the other players have to play on the board. Once a players states are connected from starting state to finish state, they win.

From the Publisher:

Magnetic States cling like magic to the USA
gameboard as player draw or ask any other player for any of the different " State " cards that
will link their starting and finishing states. Without even realizing it, children will learn state
capitals, landmarks, and basic geography of the United States.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Racing, Transportation

name: 100 Plus
description: A ladder-type trick-taking game in which the object of the game is for players to first make 100 points by taking ten tricks of ten points each. Second is to make whatever number appears on the randomly-drawn "plus number" disk, thus making "100 plus". The first player to do this wins.

name: Rakennusurakka
description: The players are building contractors who are making offers for building contracts in auctions. After winning auctions you'll of course have to get as rich as possible by building.

name: Diletto: Secret of Eden
description:
One day, an angel gave you two rings, one silver and one gold. Upon reading the inscription, a horned man in a tailcoat appeared. "I will grant any wish you ask, but will take the soul of the bearer of the silver ring in compensation"

You cleverly place the silver ring on a stone statue that has a soul that eternally replenishes itself. With this, you can have any wish granted without losing anything! Or so you thought...

Your goal as a player is to be just a bit greedy, to be happier than everyone else by getting the Devil to fulfill more of your wishes. He will grant any wish you have, and the statue will provide the soul in payment. But sometimes mischievous stuffed animals will steal the soul and the price will not have be paid.

Initially, the Devil will forgive you with just a warning, but if payments are late too often, horrible things will happen to the last player to make a wish. Sometimes you will need to be bold and other times you will need to be more modest, in order to have the most wishes granted, but not have made the last wish when the Devil's patience runs out.

Diletto: Secret of Eden is a card game for two to five players, in which you will take turns having a wish granted. The larger the wish, the more of your soul that must be given in compensation. Draw an appropriate number of cards from the ring deck, and if you draw an 'oops', place it in play. Once three 'oops' are accumulated, the wish fails and the players receive a warning. Players accumulate 'sense' during the course of the game, which can be used to reduce the risk of a wish by reducing how many ring cards to draw.

When the final warning appears, the Devil will take the soul of the next player to fail a wish, causing them to instantly lose and the game ends. The winner is the remaining player with the most wishes granted.

Diletto shares characters and story with Domina Games' previous game Eresia.

name: According to "Professor" Hoyle... Pocket Trivia
description:
A series of 12 trivia card packs, each dealing with different major topics.

Series 1: Movie
Series 2: Television
Series 3: Music
Series 4: World
Series 5: Sports
Series 6: Political
Series 7: Kid's
Series 8: Teen's
Series 9: 50's & 60's
Series 10: Bible
Series 11: Travel
Series 12: Potpourri

name: Baker Street: L'héritage de Sherlock Holmes
description:
The game allows two teams of investigators compete who will be the first to solve the crime that happened in the quarter of Westminster by visiting 4 main locations, solving puzzles and gaining indications. These indications will direct to one of multiple suspects. Whoever finds the murderer first wins the game. There is also cooperative variant where one team tries to find the correct solution to the case. Cases are randomly generated by a combination of 4 main puzzles (each in its respective location) chosen out of 9 possibilities for each location.

—user summary

Il semblerait que Sherlock ait besoin de votre aide pour résoudre des crimes de plus en plus nombreux à Londres.

Résolvez les énigmes, arpentez le Londres du XIXe siècle, et épatez le plus célèbre des enquêteurs...

Des cartes " Énigme " pour explorer Hyde Park, Crystal Palace, Kensington Gardens ou encore le Albert Hall.

Des cartes " Indice " pour progresser et résoudre le crime.

Un poster pour identifier le coupable !

—description from the publisher
publishers: Broadway Toys LTD, Hachette Boardgames USA, Panini Games

name: Gawp
description:
Gawp is a card game for ages 7 and upwards.

The game is played using a set of 86 playing cards.

15 of the cards are laid out on the table (face up) in a 5 by 3 grid. Players look at the grid and try and spot "pairs".

Each card consists of a pattern of rectangles of different sizes laid on top of each other giving the effect of an outer, middle and inner rectangle. Each rectangle can be one of three colors red, blue or yellow.

In a "pair" ALL the rectangles on one card must beat the equivalent rectangles on its "pair". There is a combat rule to show what beats what: RED beats YELLOW; YELLOW beats BLUE: and BLUE beats RED. This sounds confusing but there is a combat help card as a reference, very soon this will not be required.

Whenever someone spots a "pair" he shouts "Gawp" and takes the pair from the grid. These are then replaced by 2 more cards, from the pack, by the dealer.

The game is over once all the cards are laid in the grid, and all the "pairs" are found. The player with the most cards is the winner.

There are rules for several variations of the basic game: Sudden Death Gawp; Gawp Solitaire 1 & 2, and Advanced Gawp.

name: Stock Market Tycoon
description:
In short, buy stocks and make the most money by the end of the game.

The board looks like a Monopoly track. The players start on the Start space and get $10,000 every time around the board. Instead of properties, various spaces let you buy and sell stocks, pay taxes, get some stock options, and go to Vegas. Other spaces let you draw cards. Dream and Reality cards can be good or bad. Do you have to pay for your kid's braces or get an inheritance? Market cards change the price of a stock. Do You Dare Day Trade lets you take a chance at day trading.

The first person that accumulates one million dollars wins.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Monte Carlo
description:
Monte Carlo is one of the most popular forms of Solitaire with a deck of regular playing cards.

Components: one deck (52 cards)

Preparation: Deal 25 cards into five rows of 5 cards each.

Object: To discard all the cards in pairs of the same rank (eg pairs of "3"s).

How to play:
1. Select and discard pairs of cards of the same rank. Both cards of the pair should be adjacent in a row, a diagonal, or a column.
2. After discarding all possible pairs, move the remaining cards from right to left and from bottom to top to fill the empty spaces.
3. Deal additional cards from the stock pile to bring the number of cards back to 25.
4. Repeat until no possible pairs can be matched.

The amount of cards remaining counts as your minus score. The game is won if the entire deck is discarded by pairs.

name: The Cinderella Game
description: In this children's game based on the popular fairytale and cartoon movie, players take turns spinning the game spinner, and move their playing pawns accordingly. The board tells the classic tale with words and pictures, and there are special pumpkin and slipper squares placed throughout the board. A player landing on one of these squares either moves back 6 squares for a pumpkin, or forward 7 squares for a slipper, and also takes a card representing that item(if that particular item has already been taken, a player either takes a rose card or takes another turn). The first player to reach the finish at end of the board or collect all three cards(rose, pumpkin and slipper) wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Tough Luck!
description:
"A game of skill for 2 to 6 adults or streetwise kids.

"Have you got the nerve or the cunning? One wrong bid, one bad trade and it could be... TOUGH LUCK!

"Each player pays £10,000 into a common pool which will increase as the game proceeds and eventually will be taken by the winner.

"Starting with the youngest player, players take turns to draw a ball from the Ball-a-matic, which is passed in a clockwise direction.

"The first player to complete a straight line of 5 balls in either a vertical, horizontal or diagonal direction on his/her board is the winner."

Alex Randolph and "Mediaplay" are credited with the design of the ball-dispensing device. It is not clear who designed the game around it.

name: Armory
description:
The first product from M.E.K.Games, ARMORY is a non-collectible, medieval fantasy card game for 2-4 players. Each player needs a 60 card deck (identical to Opponent's) The objective is to arm your 3 Combatants with their weapons and thus be first to ATTACK card your Opponent to win. Cards are the 3 Combatants, Weapons and Mystics (spells and damage), Guardians and Attack cards.

After each player lays out his Combatants, a Player, during his turn, will have 1-3 cards to play from his hand of 7: lay out required weapons or trade-in's to seek cards he needs from his deck. He then announces he is open to attack and the Opponent will then try to strip off weapons or damage the player. When the attack is done, the next play is the Turn-Player and has 3 cards to play, etc. Defense from Opponent's attack is played from cards left in hand after the 1-3 turn-cards are played.

COMBATANT REQUIREMENTS: 2 Warriors each get a Shield, Helmet, Sword and Spear. 1 Archer gets a Helmet, Bow and Quiver.

The game is configured and sold for 2 Player action (optimal play). With 3-4 players, each Player, on his turn, will tactically decide who his Opponent will be for that turn. Other players, with special cards can occasionally butt in. 3 Player action can get pretty hot because of this. 4 Player action, does get a bit slow and though able for play, is not the optimal number of players. 2-3 Players is what turns this game on!

Streamlined to 11 Rules and 11 Card Tips makes this quick to learn.

Rules, FAQ, and the cards may all be seen at the game website www.mekgames.com

name: Dietro Front
description:
Dietro front is a simple game for a funny brain training. The winner is who guess quickly a word, after heard few second, in reverse.

Inside the box

1 board map
804 cards in 10 deck
2 dice & 1 special dice
8 trackers
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Game of Life: The Wizard of Oz
description:
(From back of the box)

Travel along the Yellow Brick Road with your favorite characters from The Wizard of Oz: Dorothy, Scarecrow, Cowardly Lion and Tin Man. Experience The Wizard of Oz as you steal an apple, get caught by the Wicked Witch of the West, visit the Wizard of Oz and ultimately find your way home. Visit all of the magical locations like the poppy fields, Emerald City and Munchkinland in a quest to return to Auntie Em's Farmhouse with the most money and win the game.
categories: Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Starsky and Hutch Detective Game
description:
Based on the hit ABC TV series that ran from 1975 until 1979 starring Paul Michael Glaser (David Starsky) and David Soul (Kenneth "Hutch" Hutchinson)

Players begin the game with a randomly distributed 'criminal' card. By moving around the board by the roll of a die, players obtain other cards that either match their criminal or one of their opponents.

Cards that match are placed face up. Cards that do not match are discarded into a single discard pile for each player. If a player lands on an opponent by exact count, he may steal one card from the opponent's discard pile.

The first player to get four cards that match their criminal wins the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Arrow Games Ltd, Koliopoulos, Milton Bradley

name: Gremlins
description: The Gremlins are coming! The Gremlins are coming! Travel with Billy through the town of Kingston Falls, warning the citizens of the Gremlin danger. If you reach a destination and find Gizmo in your backpack, you've made it in time, but if you find Stripe there instead... make tracks! The first player to successfully reach five Kingston Falls locations, wins the game.

name: Scooby-Doo! Who Are You? Game
description:
(from back of box)

Scooby-Doo and his friends are all dressed up in this fun and exciting guessing game. Each player gets their own game console with 24 different pictures on it. Secretly choose one of the characters - Chef Scooby-Doo, Baseball Daphne, Sombrero Velma, Bearded Shaggy, Fred with Glasses or any one of the other characters. On your turn, ask the other player a "Yes" or "No" question as you try to guess who they chose before they guess your card. As you get answers to your questions you'll start to figure out who your opponent picked. The first player to make a correct guess wins.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Scooby-Doo Pop 'N' Race Game
description: A 2 to 4 player racing game Ages 5 and up. Race to be the first player to get all four of your movers to the finish. Comes with a colorful plastic game board with a dice popper in the center, and 16 movers.

name: Hello My Name Is
description: Can you name an actor who's short, blond, and musical? How about an athlete who's bearded and married? In Hello My Name Is, play a trait, then race to name someone — real or fictional — who fits the description. Use your creativity to win the most cards!

name: Monopoly: Cambridge Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Cambridge, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Toads and Frogs
description: This game is played on an empty 1row x n coloumn board with m stones on each side. At each turn, each player must do one of the following actions. Move a stone forward (i.e., left to one player, right to the other) or jump over one enemy stone, landing on the immediate empty cell. The player who makes the last move wins the game.

name: Power Sharks
description:
PowerSharks! is a card game based upon the classic "war" card game. The larger the shark the higher the value. Sharks range in value from 1 (Ratfish) to 20 (Megalodon). Both extinct and current sharks are depicted. Ties are broken by drawing a card from the "Power" stack. This game will only interest young elementary kids or kids really into sharks.

Contains:
48 Shark Cards
10 Power Cards
Instructions
18" X 24" Color poster
Shark stickers
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental

name: Codename: Kids Next Door Trading Card Game
description:
From WotC Press Release:

CODENAME: KIDS NEXT DOOR TCG players start with a deck of cards featuring the five agents on 5 different color cards. On their turn, players decide if they want to engage in a face-off competition using their top card, or instead place that card into the Kids Next Door's tree house headquarters. Cards placed in the tree house help boost the power of cards that are played in future face-offs.

When cards are played in a face-off, the player with the higher number (which may get boosted by a card banked in the tree house) wins the round. The first player to win 5 rounds wins the game, ensuring an entire game can be played in five minutes or less.

And what happens when each player plays a same-colored card? Both players race to be the first to slap a giant panic button placed on the playing mat to determine the round's winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Lätt och lagom
description: Fast paced Swedish trivia game. Each team or player must answer the most simple of questions in under five seconds. Failure to do so will result in laughter from your fellow participants. Each correct answer generates a token. The player to first reach twelve tokens wins.

name: Party-Time
description:
This is a game for ages 10 and up. The box contains a board, a wooden champagne bottle, 48 cards, 6 party characters and 20 chips.

The board shows 6 persons who are more or less undressed. In the middle of the board there is a tract on which the champaign bottle is moving. The tract contains 4 kinds of fields.

The cards are showing a number value of a special symbol. The party characters are the ones also showed on the board. But now they are dressed and each character is split in 4 parts.

Each player takes place in front of one of the characters on the board and gets the 4 pieces of his character. These pieces have to be put on the picture on the board.

Aim of the game is to stay dressed as long as possible.

Each players gets 3 cards from the shuffled stack, the rest of the cards are put aside the board.

On your turn you play one of your cards and you draw one new card from the stack. If a numbered card is played , the champaign bottle is moved accordingly on the tract. You get a chip when the bottle lands on a dark green field, you have to give a chip if the bottle lands on a red field. Landing on a light green field results in nothing.

On passing the start field with the bottle, a piece of clothing has to be removed from your character. This can only be prevented by playing one of the 4 special cards instead of a numbered card. When playing the R-card, you can leave the bottle where it is and the player on your right is on turn. If you play the card with a rectangle on it, the next player has to remove a piece of clothing from his character. Playing the card with a star on it brings you right to the start field and playing the card with a question mark on it causes your left neighbor to draw a card and play that card immediately.

The chips have a special meaning. Each player can only have max. 3 of those chips. When playing a card the use of a chip allows you to lower the number of fields you have to move by one.

The game ends as soon as one of the characters is completely in his underwear. The winner is the character which is still most dressed.

name: Squawk
description:
Roll the dice and then press on the chicken’s chest the number of times shown on the dice-then you’ll hear a funny 'squawk!' If you’re lucky, the chicken will lay an egg that you get to crack open. Does the token land egg side up or chicken side up? Hope for chicken side up because then you get to keep the token! The player who collects the most chick tokens is the winner!

—description from the publisher

name: Candyland Bingo
description: Candyland Bingo is a delightful color-recognition treat for your children. It is composed of two different games with different objectives. In game #1, players try to be the first to place four gingerbread men in a row. In game #2, players try to completely fill the entire board with gingerbread men.

name: Cycloneopoly
description:
Monopoly-like game based on the Iowa State University.

Tokens include: Alarm Clock, Pencil, Gym Shoe, Bicycle, and Graduation Cap. Board Spaces include: Union Drive, Cy, Reiman Gardens, Memorial Union, and Hilton Coliseum.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Piratjakten
description:
Co-operativ children's game. The parents have been captured by pirates, and the children must free them from the bottom of the pirate ship. However, if they encounter pirates on their way, they may be forced to walk the plank, in which case they may be eliminated. If they manage to free the parents you win, but if all but one of the children are eliminated, you lose. Any player can move any playing piece, so it is not really player elimination, just playing piece elimination.

—User summary
publishers: Games4u, WOW! (Plasto World of Entertainment AB), WOW! (What a World of Entertainment AB)

name: The Christmas Game
description: Players work together to complete four Christmas scenes before the manger scene in the middle of the board is covered. Players roll the die and move their piece around the board. They can land on “good” spaces (e.g., “gift giving”, “do a good deed”, etc.) which allow them to draw one of the scene pieces, trade pieces with another player, etc. They can also land on “bad” spaces (e.g., “people are mean to one another”, “robbers”, etc.) that cause the player to cover up a section of the manger scene by discarding one of his scene pieces.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: War of the Sky Cities
description:
After centuries of fighting, man finally accomplished what he had attempted for centuries: the destruction of the world he lived on. After the last and greatest war, some people survived underground. But radiation had penetrated even there and they were forced from their new homes. They rebuilt their great cities as floating platforms to carry them above the radiation belts that now encircled their planet. Some launched themselves to safety before it was too late, but others were slow or miscalculated. Their sky born heirs were mutated, some horribly beyond belief, others invisibly. The centuries passed and the radioactivity began to fade away. The sky cities began to look for ways downward to the planet. But they found each other first, humans and non-humans, as allies or competitors. Then started what man had left off: WAR.

You are the ruler of a sky-city. Your objective is to capture or destroy your enemies, and find an opening in the radiation belts. The action occurs in the upper atmosphere, about 55 to 75 miles off the surface of the Earth.

WAR OF THE SKY CITIES is an exciting two-player science fiction table top game, where players become rulers of complete cities in the sky. Each side has small scout/research centers, medium battle cities, and/or large battle cities. There are two objectives: capture or destroy your enemies and find an opening in the deadly radiation belts surrounding a future Earth. In addition, optional rules introduce the use of small fighter craft and airborne landing parties. WAR OF THE SKY CITIES is a game of tactical "air" combat, but instead of aircraft you command large floating cities with their own engines, armour and weapons.

The components include two pages of cardstock counters and a cardstock reference sheet (printed on one side).

Game Scale: Each inch represents 200 miles.

name: Land Race Card Game
description: Collect all 3 REGION cards in numerical sequence to win the race (a cross between UNO and Mille Bornes). For ages 4-9.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Racing, Transportation, Travel

name: Atlantis 12500 B.C.
description:
"Excalibre Games Simulation of Atlantean Fantasy."

"Remnants of an ancient past, flee the path of their destruction."

"This 349 series simulation introduces Atlantis as a modern civilization with anti-gravity hovercraft, rockets, lasers and the ultimate weapon. Atlantis warlike and bent on conquest faces the combined but weaker forces of the ancient Greeks in the great sea and powerful Lemurian Empire of Mu in the Pacific. Allied with these forces are the 'gods' of Norse, Egyptian, Mayan and Pacific legends. Time is working against Atlantis, however, as the island is breaking up from strong natural disasters triggered by the use of an ultimate weapon -- so powerful it's use disrupts nature."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: SomeBody
description: A collection of five human anatomy games, designed for children 6 on up. There are different levels of complexity for each game. You draw cards relating to the different body parts and attempt to place it into the correct position, and at a higher difficulty answer basic anatomy questions. At times you will draw a body breakdown card that will force you to discard the afflicted body part. This is an educational game designed to teach children basic and not so basic human anatomy. Even parents may learn something new.

name: Walk the Plank
description:
The object of the game is to collect 4 pieces of treasure from the Treasure Chest.

To this end, players have to move their ship from a dockside towards the island where the treasure is. They do this by rolling up to 4 colored dice. Each player rolls as many dice as there are players each time it's his/her go. Each player moves their ship according to the number on the die corresponding to their ship. If a player lands on a place next to a plank, the other players must shout out "Walk the Plank" before the dice are thrown again. If they succeed in this, the player concerned must go back to the start.

name: Up The ...... Corporation
description:
Up The......Corporation was designed to take an irreverent look at the corporate office environment. Everyone who has ever worked in an office will recognize the “employees” in this game, as they will have met their counterparts.

The situations presented are actual experiences with incompetent management, office politics, corporate rules, unending meetings, nepotism, discrimination and dysfunctional office workers.

However, don’t get the wrong idea, this game isn’t work! IT’S FUN!!! You can vent all of your frustrations and laugh at just how ridiculous the corporate environment has become.

Features:
1 Game Platform with Corporate Ladder
8 Character Playing Pieces
8 Character Profile Cards, 8 Rewards Cards
54 Salary Cards, 76 Education Cards, 72 Politics Cards
88 Hardwork Cards, 92 Ethics Cards, 100 Strategy Cards

name: Grabbin' Grasshoppers!
description: Each player takes a net and on the count of three, presses four grasshoppers down on the board as fast as they can. In a few seconds, the suction cups will loosen and the grasshoppers will hop high into the air. The player who catches the most in his or her net wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Die Türme von Babylon
description:
The Towers of Babylon is a game by the designer of Crazy Diamond and Karatino. The large, modular board consists of the center tower with areas surrounding it. Players win the game in one of two ways: capture one of the three tower Princesses and then conquer the Citadel, or gain 50 crown points. Crown points are earned by successfully attacking other knights and holding certain territories.

While described as a family game, there are some more serious aspects of the play that make this questionable. Knights must be trained before they can be brought into your army, and having access to on oasis is necessary to make this happen. This requires planning and a strategic eye toward how others are building their resources. There are different rules for attacks based on the relative location to the palace. Attacks are made using cards, and this is true when attacking other knights or trying to conquer the tower.

name: Joel Harden's Mogul
description:
The game was designed, according to the press release announcing it, by a Philadelphia real estate mogul. Players move along a track similar to that of Monopoly or Life. On certain squares, players are allowed to draw a series of cards from different decks -- the deed, condition and ownership decks -- to put together profiles of properties. Once the property is created, it may be purchased. Other spaces allow potential tenants to be found. Players must also use forms and charts to keep track of the ongoing amortization costs as well as the ongoing costs.

The game ends when a player reaches a predetermined net worth. The game suggests $500,000, $1 million or $5 million.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Trivio 6000
description:
This is a roll-and-move spanish trivia game where players must answer questions at specific spaces to get progress toward victory, like in Trivial Pursuit. Same mechanics with cheaper components.



Un juego español al estilo Trivial Pursuit. Misma mecánica con componentes más baratos.

name: Selfie: The Game of Silly Expressions
description: In Selfie: The Game of Silly Expressions, you draw a card, take a selfie, then watch as friends and family try to guess your expression. The favorite guess gets a point, and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

name: Warbit: DICEJAR vs PSYCHOLON
description:
Description from the designer:

"Warbit" means "War on the planet orbit".
You dispatch a spaceship, and cut the opponent's side ground!

"Warbit:DICEJAR vs. PSYCHOLON" is a sci-fi space game.

［Game board］
Photos in Gallery is a prototype.
In the final product, this sheet is on a white board.
It applies lenticular printing.
It’s a technique using optical illusion.

Planets and routes appear three-dimensionally and some stars appear to move.
Put a spaceship on the board and move it. You can enjoy a mysterious three-dimensional impression.

[Spacecraft]
Three types of spaceships in red and blue, total of 16 vessels in the box.
Made of plastic, it’s strong.
Erect the plastic sheet’s wings and attach the disk.
You can easily assemble the spaceship.

The big number indicates the ship’s "max cruising speed" and "durability".
The little number in the window is its "defense shield".
Turn the disk to change the "defense shield" value.

[Overview]

This is a two-player game.
The players alternately take turns.
Each player has 8 spaceships.
Deploy spaceships on the planet under your power.
Move your spaceships to the planets ruled by your opponent and conquer them.
You win by conquering your opponent’s 5 planets or 1 mother planet.

In your turn, you can take one of two actions.
Move your spaceship to another planet.
Or, raise your spaceship’s "defense shield" level.

A spaceship can advance over distance matching its “big number”.
When you stop at a planet without using up this power, the remaining power counts as the defense shield.

Multiple spaceships can move to the same planet.
All planets have a satellite orbit for spaceships to anchor.
The spaceship entering the orbit earlier takes an advantageous position.
If both players move their spaceship to the same orbit, a battle breaks out.

The battle outcome is judged by dice.
Thus, the battle is based on probability.
Move spaceships strategically to battle at an advantageous position.
You can make a preemptive attack if your spaceship is at an advantageous position on the satellite orbit.
The "defense shield" protects your spaceship from your opponent’s attack.
With your multiple spaceships, you attack your opponent’s spaceship from both sides.
You can retreat and attack later when the "defense shield" of the opponent falls down.

If you have power remaining after annihilating the enemy on the same orbit, you can build a base or shipyard on the planet.
The "base" improves your spaceship’s offensive power.
The "shipyard" helps your destroyed spaceship go into service again.
Conquer your opponent’s planets and build a base or shipyard.
Using such facilities, advance further to your opponent’s mother planet.
Such is the gameplay of "Warbit : DICEJAR vs. PSYCHOLON".
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Hai Schnappen
description:
Hai schnappen is a dexterity game for children where you try to rob fish out of the mouth of a shark, while trying to getting caught by it.

Beware of a voracious shark!

The shark has already devoured a lot of fish, octopuses and other things. Carefully try to catch its catch from its huge mouth. Once you have done it, you may collect the items in your boat, but beware! If you catch the wrong object, he snaps!

Contents: 1 shark, 12 fish and crustaceans, fishing rod, bait, 4 boats, 1 dice, 1 sticker sheet, instructions


German Text from the publishers website:

Achtung ein gefräßiger Hai!

Der Hai hat schon jede Menge Fische, Kraken und andere Sachen verschlungen. Versuche vorsichtig seinen Fang aus seinem riesigen Maul zu angeln. Hast du es geschafft, darfst du die Gegenstände in deinem Boot sammeln aber Achtung! Erwischt du den falschen Gegenstand, schnappt er zu!

Inhalt: 1 Hai, 12 Fische und Krustentiere, Angel, Köder, 4 Boote, 1 Würfel, 1 Aufkleberbogen, Anleitung

name: The War in Vietnam
description:
The War in Vietnam is a relatively simple yet accurate portrayal of the Vietnam War that features two decks of event cards, an area map of Southeast Asia (and parts of North Vietnam), deployment cards (for easy set-up), and dozens of specific and unique game piece sculptures at the regimental level in most cases (everything from mortars to aircraft carriers), plus special and optional rules and bonus material like a computer version and a strategy guide.

The game can be played as individual scenarios spanning different periods of the war or as the entire Vietnam War on an area map with ~800 miniatures of air, land, and sea units of all combatants in a set-up designed to be playable in a few weekends.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution

name: Looping
description:
Go on the funniest roller coaster and be the first to finish the ride!

Deal all the cards evenly between the players. They will keep them in their hands facing down.

The starting player is the player who has ridden a roller coaster most recently, otherwise the youngest player will be.

In turns, players play cards in the center of the table, one on top of other, in clockwise order. They must perform the actions corresponding to each played card correctly (see Game Cards). So that the first player who makes a mistake or otherwise, the last player who does it right, will draw 2 cards from the central deck as a penalty.

Regardless of the player who drew 2 cards, the game continues with the player who is next in turn.

The first player who runs out of cards wins the game!

Contents: 55 cards

-description from designer

name: Star Wars: The Ultimate Space Adventure Game
description:
"You and your opponents are commanders in the Rebel Alliance. The remote ice planet Hoth has been your base since you escaped from the superior Empire forces. But wait! The Empire has sent probes into the far reaches of the galaxy, and your position has been revealed. Even now, an Imperial TIE fighter commanded by the evil Darth Vader is invading Planet Hoth's atmosphere. To escape, you must pilot your X-Wing Fighter on a perilous journey through the unknown to Planet Dantooine. One - and only one - Rebel fighter can complete the journey. Will it be yours?"

Ages 7 to 14

Includes:
Game board
4 Rebel X-Wing fighter markers
1 Imperial TIE fighter marker
4 puzzles of X-Wing fighters
Rebel and Imperial spinners
The Force card
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Andere Länder, Andere Sitten!
description:
Andere Länder, Andere Sitten! is a straightforward trivia game about the customs of various countries.

Gameplay is simple: One player reads a question and lists five countries as possible answers. Other people guess which of these answers matches the description. Points are awarded for correct answers. Most points wins.

name: Age of Tyrants
description:
From the publisher:

'Age of Tyrants' is a game of mass combat using 6mm scale miniatures in the Draconis Alba Galaxy, a futuristic alternative universe that has been in development for over fifteen years.

The game is slick, with an intuitive command and control system inspired by combined arms warfare that allows you to pull together different parts of your army to focus on a particular target or objective.

Players face each other with one or more company on each side - each company is led by a company commander leading 4 platoons with 4 bases each that also have their own platoon leader.

Players alternate using leaders to give commands. Accruing suppression points makes it harder for units to actually follow orders. The army size is bounded by a total points value that players agree on before the game starts.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Spaghetti Junction
description:
Match the traffic cones to build crazy roads in this fun twist on an old favourite. If you reach a dead end, build a bridge or add a corner to continue on your way!

A dominoes style traffic game, where the tiles have vehicles and traffic cones. The number of traffic cones must be matched along with the direction of the traffic flow to place a new tile. You can build bridges or add corner pieces to create a 3d spaghetti junction.

name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone Quidditch Chapter Game
description:
This is a game in the Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone Chapter Game series, in which games are contained in a portable box designed to look like a book, and the theme of the game corresponds to chapters in the film, Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone.

From the back of the blister packaging:

Use the book game board to carry your game pieces.

Play Seekers Harry Potter and Terence Higgs as they compete for the elusive Golden Snitch.

Score points with the Quaffle and ultimately "catch" the Golden Snitch.

Roll the die and try to hit your opponents with the Bludger, knocking them off their broom.

Contents: 1 mini game book, 1 Quidditch grid, 4 support arms, 2 movers (Harry, Terence), 1 Golden Snitch, 1 Quaffle, 1 Bludger, 2 dice (number, letter), 6 customer applied labels
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Spider-Man vs The Green Goblin
description: Tie-in game for the first Spider-Man movie. Players roll a die to move around board collecting power tokens. If they land on a battle square, they draw a battle card and follow the instructions--most, if not all, cards call for one or more power tokens to be discarded. Once a player has a set of all five tokens they may attempt to enter the central track to fight the Green Goblin. This is accomplished by using a special piece of apparatus: the Battle Wall. This consists of a 3-D office building with a spinner attached to the base. The spinner is spun and a button in the center is pressed whenever the player wishes. The button causes either Spider-Man or the Green Goblin to pop out of one side or the other of the building. If Spider-Man comes out, the game is over and that player wins. If the Green Goblin comes out, the player must make one more circuit of the board before they may try again. Youngest player moves first, according to the rules, so perhaps there's a very slight German influence here?
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: These Gö To 11
description:
Game box

Will you turn it up to 11?

Rock the house or get left hanging with this fast-paced dice game! Like Blackjack for rockstars, "These Go To 11" combines luck and a lick of strategy with the goal of building the ultimate guitar collection.

Here's what you get:
25 custom dice
5 collection boards
54 awesome guitars

User summary
These Gö To 11 is played with a set of 25 custom d6, numbered 1,2,2,3,3,4. At the start of the game the dice are divided evenly among the players, any extra are set aside. Play proceeds in rounds, starting with the first player, he or she rolls as many dice as there are players and places them in the center. Each player, starting with the person to the left of the roller selects one of the rolled dice and places it in front of them so that all players can see the value. The round ends when a player's dice add to exactly 11.

The player who ended the round gains 3 guitar tokens from either the draw pile or one each from the other players. Players whose total did not exceed 11 can gain 1 guitar token from the draw pile. Players who "busted" (their total exceeds 11) must discard one guitar token to the draw pile. The first player to collect 11 guitar tokens is the winner.

Bring this game with you and you will ROCK the Party!

name: CrunchTime
description:
CrunchTime means the last few minutes of the game, when the big plays are made... with the game "ON THE LINE!"

CrunchTime is a new and exciting, action-packed basketball board game. Players face each other in a head-to-head, 12-minute timed, quick pace game. The play goes back and forth like real basketball: fast breaks, fade away J's, slam-dunks, fouls, steals, rebounds, and those game-changing 3 pointers! Combine all of that b-ball fun with rolling the dice, moving your pawns, placing the foul chips, marking your score, watching the clock and spinning the spinner (for fouls and 3's)! Lots of variety and action!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mensch ärgere Dich nicht Kids
description:
Note: the old traditional game is here... Mensch ärgere Dich nicht / Pachisi.

Mensch ärgere Dich nicht Kids is similar to the traditional version except there are 3 pawns for each player instead of 4 and on rolling the color die, the player may move one of their pawns to the next square with the same color as the die indicates. The player who brings all of their 3 pawns home is the winner.

name: Ant Assault
description:
Quick Overview

Ant Assault is quick and easy to learn card game that puts each player in charge of their own ant nest. They must send parties of ants out to forage, all the while defending themselves and their nest from assault by the other players.

Details
Players can experiment with many types of ant, including scouts who root out the enemy and find new resources, honey pot ants who store food, soldier ants who fight, and the dreaded bullet ants who lead assaults.
Enter the world of an ant nest, and dominate the garden!

name: Hitchiker
description:
Hitchiker 2012 is an easy to play adventure where a little imagination, free thinking spirit and love of satire will take you for a wild ride on an emotional rollercoaster.

The premise is simple. Players (2-6) assume the role of carefree Hitchikers and set out on the road to make their fortune while trying to avoid trouble along the way. Hitchikers don't have jobs so you'll have to find some more creative ways to make your money.

Each player begins with a HOMETOWN, $25,000 and a Bank envelope. The object of the game is to be the first player to save $250,000 in your Bank or accumulate $50 million in traveling cash. You can only deposit money in your bank by passing through or landing on your own HOMETOWN.

The mechanics of the game (play method) will be familiar to anyone who has played a traditional board game like Monopoly except unlike most other games, you're never really out of it until someone actually wins.

Hitchikers travel by rolling two dice and following the highway clockwise around the board. Each city or location along the road counts as one space. Upon arrival at your new location, you will either be presented with an opportunity to earn huge sums of money or face a potential disaster like a Bad Ride or worse.

Although random luck (dice) will play a role during the game, there is also a need for strategic planning. With two ways to win the game delivers an opportunity for everyone to have a chance. If you tend to be cautious by nature, you can win by being conservative and saving money in your Bank. On the other hand, if you like to gamble you will love the pursuit of monster payouts as you stack up your traveling cash.

Fast paced, high stakes action.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Economic, Humor, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: In der Falle
description: In The Trap! - An early Kramer game, you must pass through the forest and avoid the pitfalls laid by the thieves. Play is by rolling dice numbered 0-3 with 2 special moves. The board includes a turntable which is rotated and if red spaces turn up, you're trapped. A childrens' game, with nearly enough to engage the adult player.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Welfare Game
description: Satiric game about public assistance and the department of Social Services. From the rules: "Each player attempts to purchase as many home appliances as possible before the finance company can repossess them. The more appliances a player owns, the more often he can collect finance charges from his opponents. A player may also collect when he lands on his own appliance."

name: Crouching Hamster, Hidden Translation
description:
"A strange game of Martial Arts and poor dialog dubbing for 2 to 8 players!"

Players travel around the board eliminating other players. Each turn, eight dice are rolled. The dice have words on their faces, and the player rolling must attempt to concoct a sentence in the style of a bad martial arts movie dub using as many of the words as possible. The other players award honor points to the sentence as they see fit. The point values of the words and honor points are totaled, along with any bonuses, and the player uses this total to select an Attack/Defense Mode--which run from purchasing prices of 14 up to 60. If the A/DM purchased allows movement, the player does so. Visiting the various shrines on the board will award players with bonuses and weapons, but each shrine may be visited only once per player. Each player begins the game with 50 life points and 50 spirit points, and is eliminated when either total reaches 0 or lower. Last player left alive wins.
categories: Dice, Fighting, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Markoolio
description:
A party game to promote the swedish-finnish rapper Markoolio (Marko Lehtosalo), this is essentially a pot pourri of simple, small partygames. Each player is dealt a 12-piece puzzle (which is a "signed" photograph of Markoolio) which is simply used to keep track of points; the first player to complete their puzzle wins.
