By rolling two six-sided dice, players move around the square track board to hit event spaces which are either one of the sub-games or an immediate event (lose a turn, lose or gain a point etc.)

The main sub-games are:

Studio: Played with a deck of cards. Another player reads one of three rap rhymes on each card, player in turn must know/guess if Markoolio has rhymed right or not. (These may be based on actual Markoolio rhymes?)

Scen: Played with a deck of cards. Charades with two levels of difficulty to choose from, for 1-2 points. Correct guess also earns a point.

Press: Played with a deck of cards. Simple general trivia, choose randomly from 5 questions on each card.

Arga Leken: ("The Angry Game") Choose a fellow player to stare at while both try to look angry. First one to laugh loses.

Tärnings Duellen: ("The Dice Duel") Play simplified Blackjack against a fellow player with the two dice.

Finsk Bingo: ("The Finnish Bingo") Deal the 9 cards with values 1, 2 and 3 face-down on a 3x3 grid, then reveal, hoping to get 3-in-a-rows. (The numbers are also spelled out in finnish on the card, otherwise there is nothing particularly "finnish" about this)

Hitta Jokern: ("Find the Joker") A more random version of the Shell Game; shuffle the three joker cards, only one of which is actually a joker, deal them out face-down in front of you and try to guess which one is the joker.

Mät Publikens Jubel: Spin the spinner to see how your concert went; lose or gain a point, or nothing happens.

name: Bamses sjörövar-spel
description:
Translation from the game box:
Will Teddy and his friends reach the gold ring treasure before the pirates?

name: Power CARDZ Collectable Card Game
description:
Sub-titled: The Definitive Super-Powered Collectible Card Game

With additional 'credits' to: Tim Parsons; Stephen Stegelin; Chris Riley; Dan Harbison; EDITOR-Chester Jacques; PUBLISHER-Gary Reed; PLAYTESTERS-Todd Wartman as well as the many others previously listed; and SKYVERSE.
The LIST of 'artists' is as follows: Gary Barker, Leann Buckley, Andy Dimmitt, Jerry Foley, Gene Gonzales, Brad Gorby, Mark Hester, Don Hillsman, Quinton Hoover, Raff Ienco, Jake Jacobsen, Greg Land, Chris Leidenfrost, David Mack, Deon Nuckols, Sean Parsons, Willie Peppers, Steven Redinger, David Rowe, Kevin Sharpe, Brent Trammell, and Wayne Wong, as well some of the others already mentioned in the credits.

EACH Power CARDZ Starter Deck consists of 50-CARDs of 2-types: either Characters Cards OR Enhancement Cards and these have this denoted upon them, as well as a set of Rules for playing this. There is also a Power Scorecard sheet printed within this rules sheet, that needs to be enlarged and copied prior to gameplay. The Characters are also divided into HERO and VILLAIN Cards for simplicity's sake. Basically, you have 25-points for each Character, or object, and once these are exhausted, then that particular card is K.O.'d!

There was a means of obtaining a supplemental Power Scorecard, plus six Power Stones of various colors, as well as a checklist of the entire initial release-300 cards. These have a decidedly comic book look and feel in the components and gameplay, while being geared towards a generic approach for this so as not to impinge upon anyone's IP rights.

The game was really released twice with very different rules and many changes to the formatting of the cards. The second release was based on input from Martin A. Stever.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Mein buntes Türmchenspiel
description:
This very simple game is for children of 3 years and older and is designed to teach color recognition. Each player has an empty pole and six wooden beads in the colors red, blue, green, yellow, orange and purple. On their turn the player throws a color die, and if they do not already have a bead of the color thrown then they place one on their pole. The winner is the first player to have collected a set of beads of all six colors. In a variant game, the beads are all placed in groups on the board, which shows a multi-colored worm. The beads must be placed on a player's pole in the same order in which they appear on the worm.

Similar to:

Rainbow Towers
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: CSI: The Board Game – Encore Edition
description: This is essentially the same game as the original CSI: Crime Scene Investigation – The Board Game, but with 8 new cases to solve, new board & card graphics, and new random events. This is a completely stand-alone game: you do not need the earlier CSI game to play this one.

name: Possession
description: The devil's in the details, and apparently, maybe in you too! From Toy Vault comes Possession, a deceptively fun party game that lets you battle the onslaught of the demon called Legion. As the weeks roll past you must use your wits and special talents to keep Legion's evil essence from spreading throughout the group. With Holy Men, the Parishioners, and the outcast Shamans, you stand in the path of evil, preventing the One Who Is Many from gaining the power needed to bring forth his demonic gathering.

name: Scrabble Junior: Dora the Explorer Edition
description:
Explore the magic of wordplay with Dora and her friends. Play your very first game of scrabble with Dora and her friends. Learn simple words in English and Spanish. Teaches word building and letter recognition. Two different games and two levels of play for both younger and older kids. Features double sided board, double sided cards and auto-corrective tiles.

This edition of Scrabble Junior has a two-sided board, one for English words and one for Spanish words. The rules play similarly to other editions of Scrabble Junior. The goal is to lay down letter tiles one at a time to complete words pre-printed on the board. Letter tiles are played twice per turn, and must be used from the beginning of each word and sequentially toward the end. All tiles are face up once held by a player. Kids learn the strategy of maximizing point values for themselves while preventing points for other players. They also learn its okay if other players do earn points because of the rules that a letter must be played if a space is available to play it on. Players use all the tiles available to cover all of the spaces on the board.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game
publishers: Mattel, Inc., Nickelodeon, Parker Brothers, Tinderbox Games

name: Stockholmsspelet
description:
Each player leads a character that goes around the city and responds to questions about Stockholm. Each correct answer gives 10 "Stockholmscred." The goal is to visit all the districts. When a player has been able to cope with questions for all puzzles, the endgame can begin. At the end, all the players Stockholmscred are counted up and the player with most wins.

Complete description in Swedish can be found at http://www.stockholmsspelet.se/

name: Winds of Fortune
description:
The game "board" is made of plastic, with a riverbed twisting amongst several islands. To set up, fill the riverbed with water, place a sailboat on one end, and give each player their tikis, a straw, and a random card which shows either 6 or 8 gems. Place all gems in the bag and draw a random group of 6. The tikis have symbols on their bottoms meaning either take a gem from the display, take a gem from another player, or give a gem away. Players place one of their tikis on each of the islands.

On your turn, roll the die until you roll a symbol for an island on which you have a tiki (or water; pick an island). Then, sail the boat to that island by blowing through the straw into the sail. You are trying to stop exactly at the pier. Meanwhile, the other players are taking turns rolling the die; if they roll the same island, your turn ends immediately! If you reach your destination, take your tiki and follow its instructions. If you took a gem from the display, replace it randomly from the bag. If you collected all the gems on your card, reveal it and place the gems there; they may no longer be stolen from you! Then, draw a second card. If that was your 5th tiki, replace all the tiki onto the islands at the start of your next turn.

The first player to collect all gems on 2 cards wins the game!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Memory, Nautical, Real-time

name: Solar System
description:
Theme of this card game is space exploration.

Each planet card(includes Sun and Pluto) represents heavenly body of our solar system. Your purpose is to complete these planet cards through auction consist from two stages. If you won and got planet cards, you can take them as Victory Points or enter them into your hand to use for next auction. Used cards at auction are removed from the game.

Planet collection must be consist from unique cards. Thus if you got another planet already be in the Victory pile, you cannot take as VP and you must enter it into your hand.

Who can get highest score at the end of the game?

name: Geo200
description: The game consists of cards for 193 countries plus 7 special cards. The country cards contain pictures of the flags, the flags of the neighboring countries and some other information. There are various games which can be played with this material; most notably trick-taking games in which the players can form "alliances" by playing cards of neighboring countries together, which makes the cards stronger.

name: Non-Stop
description:
A pure dice rolling two player game. To win the game, a player must be the first one to have all numbers from 1 to 10 either marked or locked. Two dice is used to hit the numbers. A turn, ie. rolling the dice, continues as long as results of both dice (individual results or their sum) can be used in actions.

The actions are:-
1 mark own unmarked number, or
2 unlock(mark) own locked number, or
3 unmark the other player's marked number

At the beginning of a turn, a player is supposed lock all his remaining marked numbers (that the other player has not managed to unmark on his turn). During a turn, a player has an option to unlock some of these numbers (depending on the dice results), but can decide to not do so.

name: Monopoly: Cardiff Edition
description:
Version of Monopoly based on the city of Cardiff in the UK.

From the publisher:
The city of Cardiff is bustling with attractions like the Millennium Stadium, the National Museum and Cardiff Castle, all sitting alongside luxury hotels, shopping malls, restaurants and cafes. Now you can tour this amazing city and all its famous locations with the new Cardiff Monopoly! From the much-loved 'Chippy Alley' to the Wales Millennium Centre, it's all up for grabs as you race around the board building a property empire to beat your opponents!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: LangGuini
description:
What is LangGuini?

LangGuini is a multi player card game for 3 or more players. The game was designed during the 2010 Global Game Jam in Philadelphia, PA. last year's theme was "Extinction" so we decided that the English language has been deteriorating rapidly so we needed some new words. Being big fans of party games we wanted to make a social game, hence the three player minimum. After almost a year of play-testing and messing around with the mechanics we really want to print this game and get it out there.

What comes in the initial deck?

The deck comes with a box with instructions printed on the back. 108 cards in the deck. 12 cards are the decision cards (hopefully to be replaced by DICE) 94 cards that each have two word parts listed on either the yellow or orange side. The final 2 cards are our special thanks and stuff like that cards.

How do you play?

LangGuini is played by one player being selected as the first to deal/judge. The player selects from one of the 12 decision or "dice cards" (hopefully to be replaced by DICE if we get enough pledges) to find out how many word parts and what color(s) will be used. After selecting from that portion of the deck the dealer selects the word part cards and uses the parts to spell out a word of their own design. After laying out the cards the dealer pronounces the new word for the other players to hear. Then in clockwise fashion the players explain what they think is the definition of the word. After all players define the new word the dealer becomes judge and decides who wins that round. The winner keeps the cards that were used and then takes the role of dealer/judge until they pick a winner and so on. The player who wins XX (number of cards, we play to 15 usually, take a break and start again) WINS the game.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Peppa Pig: Muddy Puddles Game
description:
Peppa Pig loves playing in the rain and jumping in muddy puddles is one of her favourite games. Can you help Peppa jump in lots of muddy puddles on her way to school? Peppa Pig’s Muddy Puddle Game is designed for young children to have fun and enjoy a basic board game layout. Players use the Peppa playing figures to jump their way around the board and try to be the first in class - and win the game. The centre spinner adds fun and excitement - you’ll want to be the muddiest in class to win the game.

The game is for 2 to 4 players. There are some words on the game board – Start, Fiinsh and jump! -, but players do not have to be able to read to play. The game uses different coloured ‘squares’ to move around the board, and the spinner uses images to indicate where the players move to next, so this game can be enjoyed by your young Peppa Pig fan.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Emoji Wars
description:
Emoji are not new to this earth...

They have lived in an unseen parallel dimension for thousands of years engaged in fierce battles to find their one, true ruler. Now you can join the fight.

In Emoji Wars, players choose a commander, form an army of allies and use magic and weapons to battle their opponents for dominance over the Emoji empire.

When a player's commander has been killed, that player is out of the game. The player with the last commander standing wins Emoji Wars and rules the Emoji Empire... until the next battle!

The general idea is easy - Players pick a Commander, choose 3 Allies and then battle their opponents with magic spells and weapons. The numbers on the cards line up so you can see if a character has the ability to wield a particular spell or weapon. You can also see how many "Life Points" a character has or how much damage he has taken from a weapon or spell.

1. Card Types
Gold: Commander
Green: Ally
Blue: Spell
Red: Weapon
Yellow: Energy

2. Reading the Cards
Each card has information about the character, spell or weapon in the numbers below the image. A character card shows life points, magic or strength ability and the energy needed to launch an attack. Weapons and spells cards show how much ability is needed to use them and how much damage they will do to a character by reducing his life points.

3. What a Hand Looks Like
After a player has their "Army" assembled, they draw weapons and spells cards from the blue and red decks. Energy cards are included in these decks and get chosen randomly. A player's hand is visible to the rest of the table. Note that there are also "Shield" cards that add to a character's life points.

4. Attacks
On each turn a player can attack his opponents if they have the weapons and engergy needed to do so. As an example attack, Orin is using the Deep Freeze against Garlon. The spell card is placed under Orin to show that his life points have reduced by 30. On a later turn, the player draws a Shield, which he adds to Garlon to increase his life points to 30. This is how much damage it will now take to remove him from the game.

5. Win
When a player's Allies have been killed off, he fights with his Commander. If his Commander is killed he is out of the game. The last player with a standing Commander wins Emoji Wars.

name: Cats Against the World (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
description:
Cats Against the World is a parody game for horrible people... who LOVE CATS. Unlike most of the party games you've played before, Cats Against the World is as awkward and sassy as you and your 40 plus cats at home are.

This deck (36 Cards: 27 White & 9 Black) is an expansion pack for Cards Against Humanity. This means, you need to have or buy a Cards Against Humanity deck before using these cards.

100% OF PROFITS GO TOWARD SAVING THE LIVES OF HOMELESS & SICK CATS IN CALIFORNIA.

Each deck sold supports SOXrescue's No-Kill shelter initiatives within Kern, Los Angeles, and San Bernardino County; adoption program; Trap-Neuter-Release (TNR) project; and their emergency medical/disaster relief funds.

THE SALE OF ONE DECK CAN PROVIDE FOOD, SHELTER, AND MEDICAL TREATMENT FOR ONE HOMELESS CAT FOR ONE WEEK.

Unfortunately, although this product is still advertised on the Cats Against the World website, and orders can still be placed, it seems to be no longer be shipped, and the seller no longer responds to purchasers' messages sent via any contact method.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: I Spy Bingo
description:
I Spy Bingo is a bingo game based on the 'I Spy' picture books by Walter Wick and Jean Marzollo. The bingo boards (4 space by 4 space) are double-sided - one side with the letters in sequence for beginning players and the reverse side with randomly arranged letters. Each bingo card square contains pictures of objects beginning with the letter in the square. The letter cards are also two-sided - the beginner's side features the letter to be called out, and the "advanced" side only contains pictures whose names are to be called out and the first letter of the word used. Per the game box, ages 4+ are appropriate for the game.

From the game box: "Popular I Spy pictures become a fast and fun bingo game...get 4 in a row and shout Bingo!
* Players learn beginning sounds and practice reading skills.
* Promotes manual dexterity, verbal and visual skills.
* Two levels of play."

name: The Da Vinci Quest
description:
From the publisher's Web site: Let Leonardo be your guide to the secrets of the ancient world and the great achievements of civilization. In this new trivia game, follow the path of the famed Templar Knights as you journey across five continents in your quest to crack a mysterious "code word." Each correct answer to one of 100s of multiple choice trivia questions reveals a new clue to the "code word." Categories consist of Genius and the Grail, People and Places, Faith and Fable, and Quest Curiosities.
Players are dealt five cards, face up and one, face down. Each card features a word and a letter. The word on the face down card is a player's "code word." As players move around the board answering the multiple choice trivia questions, they are afforded the opportunity to trade and/or "steal" oppponents' or supply stack letter cards to replace their own stack of 5, face up cards, in a quest to form the "code word." Once players have formed their "code word" with their 5, face-up cards, they proceed to a central (Grail) square and attempt to answer a final question to win the game and complete their quest.
categories: Educational, Medieval, Mythology, Novel-based, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Kung Fu Party
description:
Defeat your opponents with martial arts strikes in this party game designed and illustrated by Demis Savini.

Kung Fu Party is a game for 2-10 players, simple to learn, fast to play, able to engage anyone, even those who normally do not love the tabletop games. Players will be furry fighters, mimicking all the fighting movies, cartoons and videogames collection. Divided in two schools, the White Tiger and the Black Dragon, face your enemies with amazing martial arts strikes. The purpose of the game? Defeat all opponents!

In order to fight, the players use their red Attack cards and their blue Defense cards. Each of these cards is characterized by a “battle scream”: the longer it is, the greater the strength. It will be up to you to guess where the opponent tries to hit you and defend accordingly with correct blocks.

With the Challenge mode you can play even in solitary, facing one Boss after another until you reach the top of the tower for the final challenge!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game

name: Der Bunte Hund
description: Skateboarder Benno is known as `the colourful dog' because he likes to wear different colours for each of his items of clothing. The game consists of four rounds, each played with a different deck. The card representing what Benno is wearing is hidden underneath the game board and the remainder are dealt to players. On each turn a player will ask several questions about the colour of Benno's clothing items on the cards that the other players have; questions specify a clothing item and a colour. If the answer to a question is `no', then the player asks the same question to other players. If all of them say no then the colour that Benno is wearing for that item has been determined and the player gets a victory point chip. If someone answers `yes' then a new question must be asked of the same person. The round ends when all of the colours have been determined.

name: Maatilapeli
description:
Players are part-time farmers in Maatilapeli. Each player owns a small farm with some arable land and forest. It is possible to grow wheat, potatoes, sugar beets and strawberries. Players buy seeds, sow and harvest them and sell the crop paying also taxes. The most successful farmer in terms of capital wins.

A round of the square game board represents one year, each side roughly representing one season: in winter players decide which seeds to buy and to what extent, in spring the seeds are sown, in summer (and partly autumn) it is the harvest time.

Advancing on the board happens by rolling a die. Each square represents one week and has special instructions on it: paying random expenses, drawing a surprise card, getting income out of the forest etc.

The harvest times of different plants are sequential and differ in length. The die roll the player lands on one of the harvest squares of certain plant also determines the hectare price of that crop (lookup table used). It is possible to miss the harvest season of any plant resulting in a crop failure for which the state pays a small compensation.

Harvesting machinery may be bought to increase the crop price and a tractor decreases the sowing expenses. More land can be rented or bought as well. At the end of the year the taxes are paid, the accounts balanced and a new year may begin.

The game includes two sets of rules: in the simplified set e.g. everyone grows one hectare of each plant, there is no machinery or, obviously, no option to rent or buy more land.

name: Shuffle: Twister
description: Shuffle: Twister is a take on the traditional game of twister with a card based shuffle. In this version you start the game sitting in a circle on the floor with a single card between each player, color side up. Then players take turns drawing a card from the remaining cards in a deck that is placed in the middle of all the players. The card you draw will tell you to place the card on another player somewhere on their body and it may tell you to touch them with a head, hand, or foot. If you're given a card you must keep it in place and not let it fall even while you're placing cards on other people. If you do drop a card you lose a life, if you lose a second life you're out of the game. Last player in the game wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: Gwiezdny wyścig
description:
A fun and simple family board game. Each player gets two secret missions to transport goods. These missions correspond to two specific spaceships on the board. The goals are achieved by wisely using the set of actions available.

In his turn, a player plays one of his Action card and does the action described on the card. These actions consist of moving one or more spaces on the board, closer to planet (Card+), further from planet (cards-) or by switching two spaces(Switch cards).

A round can end either when a spaceship reaches the planet or when all players have played all their Action cards.

Each player then reveals his two Mission cards and scores the number of points corresponding to the spaceships on each of his Mission cards.

This reimplemtation of J'ai mon voyage introduces two variants to the game: family and advanced. Family variant does not use more complicated “Swap”, “Copy” and “Reverse” cards. Advanced variant allows players to use special abilities of the planets and limits their hands at the beginning of the mission, to make game more challenging.
mechanics: Race, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Danger Guy
description:
An envelope game a-la 'Cheapass' style from Alien Menace, a newer contender in the simple, inexpensive, low-budget market.
From the publisher:
You’ve seen him trapped beneath a fallen vending machine, burnt with acid, and even pulled into a wood chipper. He boldly stands between you and the perils of the modern world. He is Danger Guy, a faceless hero throwing his very body in harms way to protect the innocent, the hapless, and the stupid..

Using cards, counters, and the exclusive Anthropomorphic Danger Guy Cut-Outs you and your friends will face roaring fires, flashing blades, crushing weights, and much more as you plot your course through Danger Guy’s perilous world, countering dangers and seeding hazards as you go. Every danger mitigated is a point for you, every hazard an obstacle to your opponents, but remember, Danger Guy has only one ticket home: Death

name: Playboy: The Game of Elegant Lifestyles
description: Victory Games' take on the Parker Brother's classic game "Careers". Players move around a board aspiring to achieve the targets they set themselves at the beginning of the game. The big difference is the players do not want to accumulate fame and happiness; rather they must buy the best cars, hook up with the prettiest women, and in general obtain the best possessions that they can.

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Foot Clan Street Fight Game
description: The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles' weapons have gone missing and it's up to you to help find them. Roll the die, travel through the path of manhole covers and reveal what's underneath them. Will it be a delicious pizza, a weapon, or the dreaded Foot Clan? Be the first to get two slices of pizza and find your weapon to win!
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cheers
description:
A trivia game based on the Cheers television series.

Each player rolls and moves around the board, gaining tokens for successfully answering questions based on Cheers.

When a player lands on "Normie's Olympics" he may challenge another player to a 'flip-off'. A small plastic stand-up of Norm is placed in its holder with a plastic 'beer tray' is placed on Norm's outstretched hand. If a player can 'flip' Norm forward without spilling the beer, he may take a token from the player he challenged.

The first player to gain at least one each of the 5 different colored tokens wins.

name: Baby Animal Lotto
description: For ages 3 1/2 to 6 years old, this game has 4 lotto cards with pictures of 9 baby animals. Players draw from 36 cards and try to match pictures.
publishers: Egmont Litas, Kirjalito, Otto Maier Verlag, Ravensburger, Tactic

name: Paw Patrol: The Adventure City lookout
description: Mayor Humdinger planned an Adventure City celebration that (as usual) has been ruined by a storm. Even worse, he's also putting lonely pups in obedience school! Use your mission card to see what items to find around city. Once the items are found, you can rescue the lovely pups!
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Banco Imobiliário Cartas
description:
Card game based on Brazilian Banco Imobiliário (Monopoly), but with simpler rules and shorter playing time.
Basically, there are property cards which have distinct color band on the top, signifying the "color-group" to which them belong. The card also displays the property name, the number of cards in its "color-group", and the value of the complete group and each house attached.
The idea of the game is to draw and trade cards and organize them into "color-groups". Players take turns drawing and discarding until one player announces that he/she has a completed hand with three groups of the same color.

name: Pentagonal
description:
Pentagonal is a 3-D, five-layer game that challenges players with complex strategies, yet is deceptively simple to learn and play. The object of the game is to place five marbles in a row either vertically, horizontally, or diagonally. The challenge of the game is to master the mind-boggling number of combinations and permutations possible with every move. Beginners will have instant fun; accomplished players will be endlessly challenged.

The game's collapsible board consists of five layers connected in a flexible stack, which requires nothing to set up or put together. The result is a unique three-dimensional gaming experience that can begin the instant the game's box is opened.

Pentagonal can be played individually or in teams. Marbles can be added and rules can be customized to add challenge to the game.

Essentially a Tic Tac Toe game in 5 x 5 x 5
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Party Game, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Points, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Got Milk?
description: Collect three matching treats or else it's an all out food fight with everyone flinging their cards and scrambling to make matches! Got three of a kind? Then spin the beverage wheel and see if you can wash them down with a glass of milk. Watch out for pickle juice and snail colas that will sour your appetite. The first player to get 8 milk tokens wins.

name: Le Chat Noir
description:
Consists of only 24 cards with happy situations on one side (true love, buying a new home, vacationing, etc.) and the Black Cat ruining the situation on the other side (heartbreak, getting locked out, getting lost, etc.). The loser of the game is the one with the most catastrophes at the end (everyone else wins).

Re-implements: Who Is Going to Do the Dishes?

name: Chug-It
description: A drinking game where the object is to be the first person to collect all the letters necessary to spell Chug-It.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Rushin' Russian
description: Race to guess the 10 Russian words in these amusing and surprising stories. Collect the most rubles and win.

name: Balancing Bears
description: Players take turns placing 3 different sizes of bears onto a balance beam (based on the roll of the dice). The player who wins is the first player to balance it perfectly.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Missile Crisis
description: An operational simulation of a hypothetical invasion of Cuba in 1962. Contains map, rules and counters. This game came in a ziplock bag instead of a box.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Calling All Care Bears
description: Players must bring their four Care Bears from the start space to the "Home" space by moving along the board and avoiding "Stopper" spaces. First player to get all four Care Bears "Home" wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Bug Game
description:
"Bugs" comes with a special deck of 44 cards, each of which contains the name of a "bug" and half of a picture (a well done close-up painting) of the named bug. Players get a detailed view of 22 different creepy-crawly creatures and learn which of these "bugs" are insects or otherwise.

Players can use these cards to play Concentration (1-6 players), Go Fish (2-6 players), or an original game called "Buzz the Deck!" (1-4 players).

Ampersand Games produces simple games aimed at children teaching about nature.

name: True Colours
description:
Though traditional in format the True Colours game is a fast moving and highly competitive clash between players for six prize rings, employing directly confrontational card play on a “battlefield” of striking colours.

The True Colours Game is much like everyday life.
In order to win you must compete, but how you wield your power over others and how you respond when they wield their power over you defines your character - your True Colours.

http://www.truecoloursgame.com
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Jungle Hunt
description:
Ropes are the unique feature to this game. There are five of them which pivot from a spindle perched in the middle of the game board. The game board is divided into quarters. Each of four ropes has its own matching colored section from which it must not leave. The fifth rope may move forward and backward all around the board.

In turn, each player will activate the spinner and move any number of ropes any combination of whatever number was spun. A player’s explorer (pawn) can only move via rope. An explorer can jump on a rope that is on its space. One of the spaces on the spinner activates the Mad Monkey pawn. Mad Monkey can knock explorers off if they share the same rope.

The first player to lap the game board, therefore reaching Jungle Girl, wins the game.

Based on the famous arcade game from Taito.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: SportQuiz
description: Sports trivia game in Danish (also available in Swedish) with 3000 questions all about sport and 66 special cards. Questions in six different types of sports.

name: Monopoly: Bremen
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Bremen, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Tweedledum and Tweedledee
description: A 'ticklish' game of Tweedledum and Tweedledee, the aim is to rebuild your figure of either character on its pedestal using the two wooden sticks known as lifters to pick up each section of the body.

name: Imagination Station
description:
Back of the box says:
Set out on your very own fantastic, fun-filled treasure hunt. Use Whit's inventions to search for the Diamonds of Virtue. Be the first player, or team of players, to recover one of the Diamonds of Virtue, then return it to start and you win!! It's that easy.

Players try to collect three different cards to complete a diamond jewel they collect from landing on special spots. Movement is determined by dice and by landing on time warps that allow moving to other parts of the board.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Thomas the Tank Engine & Friends Domino Game
description: A children's game of dominoes. The pieces are made of thick cardboard showing two engines on each card. The game can be played as a memory game similar to concentration or a simple matching game. The game helps develop memory, color and shape recognition.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Trains

name: A Round With Malice
description:
A ROUND WITH MALICE - The armchair golf game with no holds barred.
It's Match play with a difference, a chance for non-golfers to get their revenge on their golf-mad partners! There's a choice of general knowledge and golfing trivia questions to suit all players and you can play individually or in teams. Answer a question correctly and play your stroke, but you'll need skill and strategy to reach the hole first, as you avoid the Water and the Rough.... and your opponents!

Contents:
1 pack of 84 cards
1 plastic golfing green
1 yardstick
1 bag of tiddlywinks balls

name: Football Dice
description:
NFL Football simulation. Three colored dice for offense. Two more colored dice for special actions.

Roll the dice and see if you scored a touchdown or not.

name: Ark
description: In Ark you collect animal pairs or families to fill the Ark. Use action cards to create pairs (male + female) or families (2 male + 2 female) and score the most points. Ages 8 and up

name: Dominoes 2
description: Dominoes 2 uses playing cards instead of tiles. Allowing the cards to be stacked on top of each other inside a three by three tray. Rather than placing two identical numbers end to end. Players in Dominoes 2 must match two numbers directly on top of the identical numbers in the tray. The playing cards are held securely in place with pegs, allowing for many layers of cards to placed on top of one another.

name: Dora the Explorer Card Game
description:
Go on an adventure with Dora and collect the cards from the images on your backpackcard. The player who collects them first is the winner.

Each player has a backpack card with four different items depicted. Each player must collect and play those four cards plus a Dora card to win the game.

Each player starts with a backpack card and 4 random object-cards who are put in a row in front of you. Shuffle the remaining object-cards and put it in the middle.

Youngest player starts. He takes an object-card from the middle. If it is a Dora card or an object-card with an object also on his backpack card, then the card goes "into" his backpack. If it is not the right card, the player can discard that card or swap it with one of the cards in his row. The swapped card (with the right object) can go "into" the backpack. This ends his turn.

The player who has collected a Dora card and his 4 object cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Rummy for Kids: Toy Story
description:
This is a good introductory rummy game for children. The game is for ages 3+ and is for 2-4 players. There is a game board that has four toy story characters with numbers 1-6. The idea of the game is to be the player with the most set tokens once the game board is filled.

The game board is filled by either laying a set 3 tiles of same suit in sequence (1, 2, 3 of Woody) or 3 tiles of the same number (4 woody, 4 buzz, 4 what's the horses name again). You can also add to a set.

There is a wild card in Zurg and there are bonus plays with him.

The Sesame Street version is effectively the same game with a different character-set.
publishers: Crown Products, Funskool Games, Ruibal Hermanos S.A., Selecta Spielzeug

name: Sound FX
description: In sound effects you are trying to be the first team to correctly guess as many oral sound effects as possible and advance clockwise around the game board from start to finish.

name: Waddington's Cricket Game
description:
From the box:

"Waddington's Cricket Game with batting and bowling. An activity game of real skill and excitement."

Players can either bat or bowl. Although only two players can participate others can act as onlookers or wait their turn to bat and bowl in teams.

Waddington's Cricket Game recreates a cricket pitch on your table or floor. There is a plastic ramp for the bowler to use to deliver small ball-bearings. Another plastic mechanism holds a bat in tension with an elastic band. The batsman releases a trigger to strike at the ball. Scoring depends on how far the ball ends up from the nearest fielder. Fielders are press out cardboard figures that fold into a 3D shape.

name: Hälge: Jaktfeber
description: You take the role as "Hälge" the Moose and are supposed to move around in the forest (the board) collecting elk antler. To win you need to find 12 of them. But in the forest the hunters Edwin, Uffe and their dog Blixten (Flash) lurks making the life hard for Hälge.
categories: Animals, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wacky Races
description: The game is a variant on Chutes and Ladders set in the Wacky Races environment. Players roll dice to move generic plastic cars (not miniatures/replicas) around the board, which represents a racing track with a number of side routes which can bring you from being in the lead to being well behind if you are side-tracked. Cards are drawn from a stack featuring images of Wacky Races cars. Players must collect four car cards and land exactly on the finish line to win (which means that you usually complete several circuits of the track). Car cards can be lost if players draw the Mean Machine card. The stack of draw cards also feature event descriptions and commands which make you miss turns, take alternate routes, or go forward or backward several spaces.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Party Game, Racing

name: Road Trip Quizwit
description:
This is a travel version of Patch Products Tiny Tins Quizwit game. The game consists of a magnetized board with six pawns and a pack of cards containing 1000 questions.

The game is a standard trivia game where players take turns answering trivia questions in one of three formats: 1) Multiple Choice 2) True/False 3) standard Question and Answer. Correct answers allow you to move forward with the first player reaching the finish line being declared the winner.

There are currently three editions:

Hollywood Flicks -- questions about movies
TV Tube -- questions about TV
Top Tunes -- questions about pop music

name: Möhrenklau
description:
From the game description in the rules :

The Rabbit family wants to bake a carrot cake, but first they need some carrots. The most delicious carrots are growing in the garden. Can you help the rabbits gather some carrots ?

Be very careful though! - don't let the farmers see you! On the way, you can hide behind a hedge or under the fence. But if the farmer turns around and sees you, you must run back very quickly to the safety of your burrow and try again later !

name: Fortune Maker
description:
From the box: "The action packed stock market game for 2 to 6 players".

On a board with 2 tracks the players move around the outer track using a d6, landing on squares that let them buy/sell shares, move the share index or gain/lose money.

The inner track (share index) indicates how share prices are altering.

Players try to buy low and sell high, gaining dividends over time. If you get it wrong, you're bankrupt and out of the game.

The game ends when all but 1 player is eliminated or after a set period of time, the winner is the player with the greatest value of shares and money combined.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding
publishers: Blue & Red Box, UK Ltd., Schmidt Spiele

name: Inspector Morse
description: This board game is based on the TV series, features the first three episodes of Inspector Morse. You must collect clues from different places. Visit the police station to examine the police records of the suspects. Even visit Morse’s office to check out his notebook and the case notes. The game includes 3 cases, each with three 6-question cards which makes total of 9 different mysteries to play. Players gain or lose points from promotional cards and by answering as many of the questions as possible.
publishers: The Games Team Ltd., Toy Brokers Ltd

name: Murmel Fiff
description:
Taken directly from the translated rules

"Murmel Fiff" is the name of the friendly marmot, who organizes a fun apple harvest with its friends: On the marmot hill stands a strange apple tree, whose bright glowing fruits have different colors-exactly like the marmots. Each one especially loves the apples of its color and wants to add these four to the stock in its own hole.

(I love this bit)

Whoever will manage it the first? Whoever gathers diligently at the beginning; and in the second phase, with the luck of the dice and foresight, gives away apples, pinches them and brings them back to safety, which influences the exciting race.

In any case you have only won, if the marmot has all four of its own apples-and only those-in its own hole and then also places itself in it!

Ages 5 and up.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Screamin' Genie: The Frantic Sound & Race Game
description:
From the box:

"Somewhere far away, in a deep, dark cave, lies a magic lamp full of precious stones. The lamp is guarded by a sleeping but fearsome genie.

Now you are about to discover this magic lamp. Your goal is to capture the precious stones, but to do it, you must first rub the lamp. Do you dare risk disturbing the genie to get them?

If the genie wakes up, you will be forced into a frantic race against time to save your stones and stop the genie as he screams! Can you win the race before the screaming stops?"

name: Mutual Fundz
description: Each player builds a portfolio of mutual funds through purchase, sale, and trade. Players roll dice and move around the board, landing on squares and drawing cards that make funds in their portfolios rise and fall. Some cards allow players to swap their poor funds for the good funds of others, or cause various catastrophes in their funds. Players can also earn bonuses for being the first to traverse each quarter of the board, or for accumulating all five funds in any of the six fund sectors. After four quarters of the board have been completed (eight quarters in the two player version), the player with the highest value of funds plus cash wins the game.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fussball Weltmeisterschaft 1974
description: Soccer game released by an Italian publisher. Based upon the 1974 world cup. No dice.

name: Junnutonni
description:
1985-2005 in Finnish television there was a really popular show called Kymppitonni (~Tenthousand). In the show there were always five celebrity competitors who in turn got a word that was meant to be an answer to a question. The competitor now had to come up with an ideal question. If no-one else knew the answer or everybody else knew the answer the competitor would have got minus points for making a too hard or simple question. If only one of the others came up with the right answer both of these competitors would have got the maximum points and so on.

In early nineties another show, Junnutonni (~Juniorthousand), was created to satisfy the needs of younger audience. Words were easier and a boardgame was also created a bit later.

name: Thomas & Friends Mix ‘n Match Bingo Game
description:
From the Press Release:

Preschoolers will delight in rolling 3 dice that create a one-of-a-kind picture. Match Harold, James, Toby, Thomas and Spencer images on the bingo board to the picture created by the dice. Four levels of play are included so the game grows along with your child. Develops observation and reasoning skills. No reading required. Complete game rules included plus 6 board games, 3 mix ‘n match dice and 36 color coded chips.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Trains
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Strawberry Shortcake Housewarming Surprise
description:
From the bottom of the box:

Equipment: Game board, 4 International Friends movers and 4 plastic bases, 24 cards: 20 Recipe cards and 4 Captain Cackle cards, a movement spinner, Strawberry Shortcake / Purple Pieman die, Strawberry Shortcakes's Housewarming Surprise Recipe Booklet

Object: All is not well in Strawberryland! The Purple Pieman dropped in on Strawberry Shortcake's surprise housewarming party, and stole her housewarming present. Now he has the "berry" special recipes from her "berry" special International Friends. It's up to you and your friends to get the recipes back. Move from room to room in Strawberry Shortcake's new house, collecting the Recipe cards. The one who has the most Recipe cards at the end of the game is the winner!

name: Zoodoku
description:
Zoodoku is the perfect introduction to the modern-day classic Sudoku game.

Designed for ages 6 and up, Zoodoku features colorful animal tiles native to Japan, in place of numbers. Players take turns choosing a tile and placing it on the board to score points. Young children learn reasoning, beginners math, and problem solving skills. Serious fun for one, or interactive play for two to four.

—description from the publisher

name: Activity Ruhrpott
description:
This follow-on to Activity (1993) premiered at Essen 2000.

It is a party game for teams with progress being tracked using up to 4 pawns on the board.

One player of a team draws a card showing something from the Ruhr area of Germany. Then, depending on the card type, the player either draws on paper, silently acts out or verbally describes what is displayed on the card so that his teammates can guess it.

A sand timer determines whether the clue was achieved in sufficient time and whether the team's pawn may advance.

Usually lasts about an hour.

name: Dracula Mystery Game
description: Dracula Mystery Game produced by Hasbro © 1963 from the Universal Pictures movie of the same name. Lid reads "Will The Vampire Catch You?". This is a simple roll and move game.
categories: Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: DDR-Reise
description:
DDR-Reise is the same concept as Explore Europe or Deutschlandreise. Players must optimize their route to visit places in the German Democratic Republic (GDR - DDR in German).

Each player has a home city and draws five cards for other cities that they must visit. The first player to visit all their cities and return home wins. There are 52 city-cards and 52 five cards with random encounters to deal with.

As far as I know the game was available in West-Germany (also produced by a West-German company) during the short period following the initial opening of sections of the Berlin Wall in 1989 until the decision that the territory of the Republic would accede to the ambit of the Basic Law for the Federal Republic of Germany in 1990. As a result of the unification the German Democratic Republic officially ceased to exist.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Monopoly: Chicago Bears
description: This is a version of Monopoly themed on the National Football League (NFL) team the Chicago Bears. Players can buy and sell many of the team's most famous players, including Walter Payton and Brian Urlacher.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Kvitt eller Dubbelt
description:
Swedish trivia game, based on a famous TV show, this game from the 1970's or 1980's is played with one die that have different colors, a block for points and question cards. You roll the dice, answer a question, if you are right you may stay and take the points you are on, or continue to earn more points. If you answer wrong you get 0 points.

Categories are:
History
Geography
Animal/Nature
Science
Sports
Entertainment.

name: Little People Bingo
description: The Little People Bingo is a Little People themed Bingo for children 3-6 played with cards with objects rather than balls with numbers. The boards have 2 sides: one with a grid of 6 objects (for younger children) and one with 6 objects in a scene (for older children). On top of that, there is a Little People figure (Eddy) which goes on your side each time you get a card. There are Eddy cards too. When they are drawn, the player with the Eddy figure on his side gets the Eddy card.

name: The Golden Compass Daemon Dice Game
description: A tie-in game for the movie The Golden Compass. The game is played with four dice: three regular six-sided dice and a "daemon die", which shows six animal silhouettes. Each player selects one of the daemons (monkey, hare, leopard, ferret, crow, butterfly) and if they roll that daemon their score for that turn is doubled. Otherwise, it is a two-roll, three-die version of Yahtzee.
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Querulon
description:
Players roll dice to place pawns on a board. Pawns are lined up towards the centre. The first player to reach the centre with his pawns wins the game. The dice determine whether you can place your own pawns or remove those of others.
The rules claim it's a game full of tactics, but the dice completely determine what you're going to do.

name: BIG FISH little fish "The GREATER than less than GAME"
description:
BIG FISH little fish is a comparing whole numbers game for Kindergarten through 2nd Grade.

BIG FISH little fish is designed to reinforce basic critical thinking skills by comparing whole numbers and co-operation skills by having Players make correct comparisons.

BIG FISH little fish:

44 Number cards
1 Spinner

2 ways to win:

"Everyone is a Winner” - The game is over when each Player has played all their cards.

“Individual Winner” - The game is over when the first Player has played all their cards.

name: Jenga: New York Yankees Collector's Edition
description:
Take the Yankees to the top!

Play Jenga a fun new way – with New York Yankees blocks and die! It’s the same great Jenga with a baseball twist. Build your tower with Yankees blue and gray blocks. As the tower builds so does the difficulty. Custom Yankees Jenga rules throw each player a curve ball making the game even more fun – and more challenging! Game comes complete with 54 Yankees hard wood Jenga blocks, 1 custom die, custom Yankees Jenga baseball rules and a loading tray for assembly.

name: Monopoly: Perry Rhodan
description:
Monopoly - Perry Rhodan was a freebie given away at Essen 08.

It consists of a map printed on glossy paper and cards to be punched out. The rules appear to be standard Monopoly rules, but themed on the SF series Perry Rhodan, with sets of planets rather than hotels. Free Parking and Jail still make an appearance!

The game is printed in German but could easily be played by anyone familiar with ordinary Monopoly.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Österreichisches Spiele Museum e.V., Parker Brothers

name: Bamse: Kvartettspel
description:
The goal is to get four of one kind of card. The active player asks another player of his/her choice for a card, and if there is a match he receives it and gets to ask again. If not, the turn goes over to the next player in line.

This game is similar to another Swedish cardgame called "Finns i sjön" (Go fish) which is played with an ordinary deck of cards.

name: Monopoly: Lyon
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Lyon, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: O Desafio
description:
O Desafio (Portuguese for "The Challenge"): A crosswords game.

This game is similar Scrabble.
The goal of the game is, using letter pieces, to form words in a crossword layout to archieve the most number of points.

name: Smart 7 Jorden runt
description: Here, the first to reach seven correct answers is the winner. Smart Games are different compared to other issues. For each correct answer you win a badge in your color. The fewer questions you need to take advantage of seven correct answers. The faster you can collect your seven tiles the faster you win the round / game. Each game includes 700 questions and answers in which the post operates as the short clips. In addition, 28 smart cards, a protocol blocks and game rules.

name: Life, the Universe, and Everything
description:
Winner of a 2001 contest for chess variants on a board of 42 squares. Each player has a royal piece (either Arthur Dent or Zaphod Beeblebrox), a Life, a Universe, an Everything, a Ford Prefect, a Wowbagger, and six Marvins. Properties of these pieces extend beyond movement -- for example, the Life can transmit powers between adjacent pieces. All moves except for the first consist of moving two different pieces. The goal is capture, rather than checkmate, of the enemy royal piece. Complete rules are here.

Life, the Universe, and Everything has been programmed for Zillions of Games.

name: Froschjagd
description: The game board is spinning (mechanically). The ten frogs in the spinning pond jump up at somewhat unforeseeable intervals. The task of the players is to try to catch them with a kind of plastic landing net. Frogs in different colors count different points; the player with most points at the end is the winner.

name: Sink or Swim
description: Sink or Swin is a die game that comes with the collectible Octopi Grippa. In the game players roll dice until either they come up with a clownfish or seahorse, which takes the die out of for the turn, or another face which is worth 1 to 3 points. Players keep rolling until they are happy with results or out of dice to roll.

name: Sportz Dice: Baseball
description: A dice game simulating the game of Baseball by using two dice. One die is the "Pitching" die, which has STRIKES, BALLS and HITS. The second die or "Batting" die (used when a HIT is rolled on the "Pitching" die) has FOUL, CAUGHT and HOMERUN on its faces.

name: Tőzsde
description: This game is a variation of his big predecessor Broker. A Hungarian company published this, with somewhat easier rules and 10 company places. The players to have bought and sell the shares of the 10 company. The players can modifiy with a dice roll the price of a company's shares down and with another dice roll the price of a company's shares upwards. The game consist 12 days. Every day a fortune sheet represents the foreign country changes.

name: Paper Trails: Civil War!
description:
50 tear-off sheets in each Paper Trails pad make this an ideal travel game. Each game combines the luck of the dice and strategy in the attempt to reach the destination before your opponent. Be the hero of the Civil War in the HISTORIC SITES! edition. Includes a 50-sheet Game Pad, a Pencil and Die.

Both players start at their home base. Each rolls to see how far they can move. A bad roll results in damage. Receive too much damage and that player is out of the game. When a battlefield is reached, players must deliver their supplies. The fist player to deliver supplies to all the battlefields wins.

name: Stacket!
description:
Stacket! is a game of placing uniquely shaped wooden pieces in an ever increasing tower. Players seek to keep the tower stable after adding a piece while creating ever more difficult challenges for the next player to do the same.

The basic set contains 1 base (starting) piece, 24 additional wooden pieces and a rules sheet in a convenient carrying case.

Stacket! shares a number of mechanics with other block-stacking games such as Bausack, Animal Upon Animal, Blockhead! and Jenga. It is distinct from these other games insofar as each piece placement much touch the previous piece and there is no piece duplication in the common pool. As a result, Stacket! forces players to interact directly on the structure itself and it allows players to use position as well as orientation and weight as a constrain on their opponent's future choices. The dynamics of gameplay which arise from these unique features make it likely that Stacket! will appeal to an audience that is slightly more aggressive and directly competitive. But like each of the other games in the genre, it appeals to any audience that enjoys creative challenges balancing blocks with a degree of strategy.

Optional rules for Stacket! allow players to score points based upon how many existing pieces a new pieces touches when it is placed. Stacket! also has a rules variant for multi-set competition.

name: Lanfeust de Troy CCG
description:
Each player has 40 cards that make up its game cards are either characters (heroes, village ...), magic, creatures, objects or places, all from the world of Lanfeust of Troy.
Each player represents a wise man who manages to start a group of villagers. Group that, throughout the game, grew in size and weapon, gets help from creatures, use of magic, visits to weaken the enemy wise.

The goal is to be the strongest or least injured at the end of the game.

In turn, each player performs in succession all the following phases:
1. managing the presence of heroes
2. care management of the characters and creatures
3. draws 2 cards
4. completion of 6 shares of its choice (ask a character, a creature, make use of magic, give an object to a character, use an action (the power) of a character placed in his camp ...
During these six stocks, the adversary can achieve in one and only.
5. launch an attack (either a general attack with all his forces, an attack with all characters flying and flying creatures, an attack against creature creature).
6. managing the presence of heroes
7. return of the hero in the neutral zone
8. discard any cards from his hand.

Once the player has completed all its phases, it is his opponent to do the same. And so on until the end of the game that occurs when a player received 10 wounds or one player has more cards in his deck.

Contents in the starter decks:

2 sets of 40 cards (each set includes 28 common cards, 9 cards unusual and rare 3)
40 chips (20 "P", 20 "Axes")
A 6-sided dice
1 Rulebook 23-page
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Gladiators
description:
You are a gladiator fighting for Glory in the Roman arena. Savage beasts and vicious warriors are all that stand between you and eternal fame. Defeating your foes is not enough; you must win the crowd’s favor. In Gladiators, you can play as you want: from lightning-fast matches with simple rules to epic tournaments with extra components for added depth.

Bravely attacking face-to-face earns the cheers of the crowd while attacking from behind is harder to block. To make things more interesting for the bloodthirsty mob, the arena is strewn with dangerous traps and helpful objects. The crowd’s mood changes throughout the match, and by entertaining them you can win their favor and eternal Glory. Even your glorious death can win you victory!

The core of Gladiators is simple symbol-based play:
Swords are your attack power
Shields are your defense
Feet are for movement
Stars are for special skills

When attacking and blocking, you compare swords to shields. If you have more swords than your foe has shields, you win and cause wounds. You spend dice symbols to move, use combat abilities, and play (optional) action cards – trips, head-butts and more that gladiators can learn above and beyond their core skills.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Sudoku 2
description:
A whole new way for a group to play the world's most popular numbers challenge. There are no puzzles! Just be the first to place your number cards by using the Sudoku number rules. For 2 to 8 players.

Components: Sudoku board with 81 blanks spaces. A deck of 90 cards consisting of nine sets of numbered cards (labeled 1 through 9) and nine Switch cards.

Set-up: Randomize draw deck. Place draw deck in centermost empty space. [The Draw deck has a Sudoku value of 2 until the last card is draw and space is left empty.] Give each player 5 cards to start.

On your turn: Within 15 seconds, place one card on the gameboard according to the rules of Sudoku, or place one card in your face-up area, or play a Switch card. A Switch card lets you swap a card from you hand with a card that is on the gameboard or in another player's face-up area.

Game End: Game ends after draw deck is empty, and all Switch cards have been used. Numbered cards in your hand and face-up area give you points equal to their face value (1 through 9) and Switch Cards give you 0 points. The Player(s) with the fewest points is the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: You Cry Wolf!
description:
User summary:

A guessing/bluffing dice game. All players have special dice showing either sheep, sheepdog, wolf or cow. All players roll their dice so that only they see, and one by one, they put forward a die, making a claim (guessing) how many there are total of that sort. The trick is that sheepdogs may be claimed to be wolves, and wolves may be claimed to be sheepdogs – or even sheep (as wolves go clad in sheep's clothing).

The higher claim (guess) you make, the better, but at a certain point, someone will call out an exaggeration, and all animals (dice) are accounted for. If you've over-guessed, you get a penalty, but if you haven't, you get points. The player with the most points wins.

Components are language neutral.

name: Candy Land the Train Game
description:
Candy Land the Train Game is a game for very young children.

The object of the game is to collect a token from each of the train stations. On their turn, players move the Candy Train to a station of their choice, and reveal a die under the train. If the color matches the color of the station, they get to take a token from that station.

name: Travalgo
description:
Gold seekers come over sea (by ship) and over land (by horse). With the gold they have found they can buy tools. These tools give you extras during the game and you will need them as well. The goal is to collect 6 points, the tools are worth 1 or 2 points.

In a game turn you roll the dice and walk/sail exact the amount on the board. There you can have special actions. These are: collection coins, collecting cards (you can use them during the game) or flipping over tiles (water becomes land, en land becomes water). Most of the tiles have on the reverse side special events that will happen. Some are good, like collecting gold, some are bad like a storm.

To buy tools you have to go to the shops, which are on the side of the game board. You have to walk/sail of the board to collect them.

name: Alliances: Means of Power Expansion
description:
Kickstarter Exclusive Means of Power Expansion

Four new special action cards that will help vary each game and give it greater replayability.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Alice's mad burger party
description:
※The first player will be the one who has the most recently eaten a hamburger.
1. The first player reveals the ingredient cards from the card deck, placing on the game table. 2-player: 4 cards, 3-player: 5 cards, 4-player: 7 cards, 5-player: 8 cards.
places it on the second deck. (But the rat card is not an ingredient.) She reveals the fourth mushroom card and places it on the second deck. She reveals the fifth cheese card, places it on the first deck, and stops revealing the cards.
3. If all decks are made, each player chooses one of the tools cards (tongs card or teas card) and places it face down in front of him/her. If there is only one tools card left for each player, take all the used cards to their hands.
4. Reveal the tools cards at once. The player who played the teas card cannot take any ingredient deck. For all players who played the tongs card, take one of the ingredient decks in clockwise order starting from the next player of the first player, till there is no ingredient deck left.
If all players played the teas card, all ingredient decks are placed on the first player’s wastebasket.
Place the used tools cards into a deck, keeping them secret to other players.
2. The first player arranges the cards on the table one by one, according to the number of players. Then, place the game rest of the cards on those to make new decks. The rat card is not considered as ingredient, but should be placed on one of the new decks.
Example for 2-player game
Alice reveals the first lettuce card and places it on the first new deck. She reveals the
5. For players who took the ingredient deck, stack the ingredient cards to make a hamburger.
5-1. If a rat card is included in the ingredient deck, take the rat tokens as the number of rat cards, and place the
second onion card and places it on the second new deck. She reveals the third rat card and
After placing the cards, Alice plays a tongs card. Other two players play a teas card. Alice
takes all the ingredient decks on the table.
Example for 3-player
rat cards under the wastebasket card. The rat tokens should not be revealed.
5-2. To stack the ingredients, the bottom bun should be placed first. If there is no bottom bun card, flip one of the ingredient cards to use. (Since the rat card is discarded, it cannot be flipped into the bottom bun.)
5-3. To make the complete hamburger, it should contain both bottom and top bun, with ingredients according to the recipe. The top bun must be placed after all other ingredients are placed.
5-4. Hamburgers can only be made according to the recipe. The ingredients may be stacked regardless of the order.
5-5. Place the unused ingredient cards under the wastebasket card and keep them hidden.
6. The game ends if there are 8 or more complete hamburgers in 2- or 3-player game, 9 hamburgers in 4-player
game, and 10 hamburgers in 5-player game. Also, the game ends if there are no cards enough left in the draw deck to make new ingredient decks. If any of the conditions are not satisfied, the player who takes the last ingredient deck becomes the first player. Go back to No.1 and continue the game.
7. After the game ends, you may flip the wastebasket card to use as the last top bun.

name: Star Wars: Box Busters – Battle of Yavin
description:
From the packaging:

"Two Players face off in an epic battle of planetary conquest in the Star Wars universe. Roll the dice, blast through your opponent's defenses and capture their command center to win"

Each player needs their own Battle Cube, which is a small diorama. Each has a unique combination of abilities.
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: The Cat's Pajamas
description:
Help your cat to undress so that he can go to sleep.

Deal five pajama tops and bottoms to each player. Stack your pajamas on your cat. Place BJ the Cat on the game board. Roll the die and move BJ the Cat. If your pajamas match in color or pattern, you can take them off. The winner is the first person to get all of the pajamas off of their cat.

Not the same game as Cat's Pajamas:


The IDEAlogists game is a card game, where you collect sets of sleeping kitties.
The Haywire/Tactic game does not have any cards, and you don't collect sleeping kitties but you help your cat to undress so that he can go to sleep.

name: Lexit
description:
Description from the publisher:

Lexit is a clever and witty word game without words! Place the deck face down on the table. Turn the card over, then take a close look at the colorful image. What do you see? You can probably name several things pictured on the card right away, but can you transform these words into something different? You have four possible modifications available — add one letter, remove one letter, replace one letter, shuffle the letters — and you can use three modifications on the top card of the deck to turn words...into other words!

Don't forget to write down your results! The longer the resulting words are, the more points you score and the closer you are to victory. Show off your vocabulary!

name: GOOLF
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Wacky Golf Board Game!

GOOLF is a family friendly game where each player tries to score the best round of golf they can on nine unique holes.

On their turn, a player spins a club to take their shot. That player then moves the amount of spaces as described by their spin. To influence their odds at getting the correct shot, players can chose between four clubs (A driver, Mid-Iron, a Short Iron, and a Putter) with differing values.

Players tally down a mark after each spin. Players continue to spin on their turns until they land exactly in the hole. After all nine holes have been finished, play ends and the tally marks are totaled. The player with the lowest total amount of these marks is declared the winner

name: 5 tegen 5
description:
Party game for two teams competing against each other.
The game shares its name with the Dutch version of Family Feud, but the game elements have only vague resemblance to that game.
Each game is played in five rounds, varying from a round that plays like Taboo to a round that plays like Time's up.
Points are scored for answering quiz questions (none of them in the style of 5 tegen 5 the tv show). First team to get to 50 points wins the game.

name: My Big World: Korea
description:
One of the "My Big World" series, featuring historical monuments and tourist sites in Korea.

First, a card is drawn from a pile. It may show a monument, a famous building, or anything that is related to a specific place.

The players should locate the place on the map, as exactly as possible. The first player puts his token on a grid. Other players do the same, one by one.

When all players have placed their tokens, the card is turned over, revealing the exact location (grid) on the map. Then, the players receive points accordingly. The closer to the answer, the more points he or she will receive. If two or more players' tokens are on the same grid, the player whose token is at the bottom receives more points.

Play continues until 12 cards are revealed. The player with the most points wins the game

name: Weeeooo Weeeooo
description:
Description from the publisher:

Small childrens game, where you play a fireman on a mission. Rescue cats with a ladder, kill fires with water or use the boat to rescue people from the water.
However... Your firetruck isn't big enough to take all the equipment with you. Choose wisely and add a little luck.

Competitive push your luck game for the youngest kids, 4 and up.
Easy rules, short rounds and with components that invite for some free role playing as well.

name: Mom's Happy Hours
description:
Fresh veggies! Fresh veggies! We have cabbages, radishes, and apples! Salad for diet, steak for celebration, and everything you need for your dinner is here. As a mom, you want to buy fresh food for your family, but you also don't want to spend too much money, so you have to focus on food that is on sale and grab it quick before the other mothers in the market.

Mom's Happy Hours is a game of dexterity. The player needs to check their shopping list and make sure the food they want is in the basket. If you are the first one to complete the shopping list, you win the game. You can bring the food as your trophy back to your home now!

name: Cheaters' Chili
description:
Get ready to add some spice to your game night with Spicy Games! Each of the spice bottles hold all of the pieces you need to play a game. Each game takes 2 minutes to learn and 10 minutes to play.

Tokens are numbered 1 to 40. Each player received 4 random tokens and 10 chili pepper markers. At the beginning of the round, each player antes 1 pepper marker.

The start player will place a token face down and claim it is higher than X. Players can challenge or the next player may place one of their tokens face down saying it is higher than X (what the previous person claimed).

Instead of placing a token, you may challenge someone and place 2 of your pepper markers in the pot or you may challenge out of turn by placing 3 peppers. Reveal the card, if the player was lying the challenger receives all the peppers. if they were telling the truth, that player received the peppers. Players then redraw back to 4 tokens.

Play continues until one player is out of peppers and whoever has the most peppers at that time wins.
publishers: Goliath Games, Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: TooT!: A Nerdy Little Game
description:
A TooT! is a playable card or group of cards. Yep, that's it. But, the logic and definition of a TooT! allow for some TooTs to combine into a single larger TooT and this allows for some intriguing, challenging and fun games.

In ALL games, a only a SINGLE TooT! is allowed.

TooT! Includes 57 play cards, 1 die, 2 basic rules & sample sheets and instructions for 4 games - Progressive TooT!, TooT! Pursuit, Fluke TooT! & Speed TooT! From Missing Piece Press.

In the introductory Progressive TooT! game, players are first dealt 4 cards. Cards are arranged to play a SINGLE TooT! that uses the most cards. Any remaining cards are pointed AGAINST the player.

The rounds PROGRESS with 5 cards, then 6, then 7 etc., up to 10. The player with the lowest score wins!

In TooT! Pursuit, players take ONE card for their turn and see if they can use it and any other cards that they have accumulated, to make and leave ONE TooT! that all players must add to. If they are able to make a leave a TooT!, regardless of how many cards they used - they earn a point. Most points when cards are gone- WINS!

In Fluke TooT! players roll the die, take THAT number of cards and try to play cards into a SINGLE TooT! that all players add to. The player with the fewest remaining cards when all cards have been played - wins!

IN Speed TooT!, players draw 7 cards. Get set - GO! First to use ALL cards in a single TooT! wins. Can't do it? Grab more cards if needed but, you MUST use them all.

name: D'Lerium
description: In this game you roll the custom dice to see which gestures to do, and the player who is slowest gets stamped (a rubber stamp is included in the game). You lose the game when you have three stamps.

name: Speak Out Showdown
description:
Speak Out Showdown is the electronic 'head to head' mouthpiece challenge game with ridiculous rambling and random interruptions. Players simultaneously try to get their teammates to correctly guess more correct phrases than their opponents, but the electronic interrupter unit's hand randomly determines when it's your turn to speak out and when it's not! One player from each team sits in front of the unit and tries to say different phrases while wearing a speech-inhibiting mouthpiece that keeps their lips open.
