Their teammates try to guess what they’ve said when the hand is flipped down in front of them, indicating that it’s their turn to talk. The phrases on the cards utilize specific letter combinations that are hard to say without the ability to close their mouth. Cards are collected for correctly guessed phrases. The two players switch so that their partner gets turns saying phrases. After two rounds, the team at the end with the most cards, wins!

—description from the publisher

name: In a Wobble
description:
A game of precision, skill and silliness! See how steady your drawing hand is with a giant wobbly pen! In A Wobble is a laugh-out-loud drawing and guessing game designed to be played in teams, and is a guaranteed way to get the whole family involved in the fun. Great for parties or family occasions, In A Wobble challenges players to remain steady and draw specific items while their team mates guess what it is though the catch is that all this is done with a giant vibrating pen! So put your artistic skills to the test and see how you handle the wobbly pen, then enjoy the attempts of your friends and family in this fun game anyone can play. The set includes 1 x giant vibrating pen, 1 x paper pad, 25 x cards (featuring 150 x items to draw), 1 x sand timer and full playing instructions.

—description from the publisher

name: NonSense Family
description:
After the success of NonSense Classic, the game is back with a Family edition, illustrated for the youth. The rules are the same. A situation card known by every player sets the scene, a card "word" known only by the narrator who needs to slip this word casually into his story, and there it goes: the imagination takes care of the rest, but time is limited! The illustrations stimulate the kids imagination and help them project themselves into their story. The theme are inspired by their every day life: family, friends, school, food, animals... with mini-scenarios full of humor, signed par the illustrator Pierre Dalla Palma. Challenge, tension, chance, perspicacity, laughter… All is there to make really fun parties.

—description from the publisher

name: Word Solitaire
description:
The deck has 49 cards with a single letter, one card which can stand for any one of J, K, Q, X or Z, and two wild cards that can stand for any letter. The initial tableau for the game is:

11 cards face up across the top
6 cards each placed on 6 of the top row, alternately face down and face up
5 remaining cards face up as the surplus


A play is to make a words starting with one of the uncovered top row cards, using cards that are face up and uncovered (from the surplus and column ends), or from the ends of existing words. As cards are exposed they are turned face up, and can be move to the surplus (up to a maximum of 7 cards there).

The object is to have a word starting with each letter of the top row, and all letters used. For the beginning game, the 11 cards with underlined letters are used for the top row. For a more difficult game, the starting row is dealt randomly; for even more difficult, only 10 cards are in the top row.

—user summary

name: Mud Party
description:
The farm animals are having a day off! Lay your animal tiles on the towels around the pool and try to splash as many of them as you can by dropping the pig right in the mud! The game characters take a step for each animal you splashed but be careful - or you might end up helping your opponents move towards the finish line!


Comes with a plastic mud pool, mud tiles and a hilarious rubber pig!
Amazing 3D gameplay that requires just the right amount of skill.
Full of colourful illustrations!


—description from the publisher

name: Rick and Morty: Find the Morty
description:
Roll the dice, then be the first to grab the right Morty!

Place the 36 Morty cards on a table, then roll the dice to give a Morty species, effect and accessory. The first player to grab the correct Morty wins the round. Be the first player to grab 5 Mortys to win the game!

name: Aves
description:
In Aves (Spanish for “Birds”), players take on the roles of hungry birds. Seek out the best grubs to score points and gain special powers. Outwit your opponents and rule the skies!

The goal of Aves is to score the most points by eating grubs.
At the end of the game, the player with the highest score wins!

Players draw cards to move, eat grubs, collect bonus points, and affect others players moves.

The game ends the moment the Grubs deck runs out.

All players count up their points as well as bonus points from set bonuses or special rules. The player with the highest score wins! If there is a tie, the player who ate the most Grubs wins.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Move Through Deck, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Family Feud Jumbo Card Game: Platinum Edition
description:
Survey says ... fun, in a big way! Challenge friends and family to give the top answers to survey questions.
--- Description from box
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Family Feud: Late Night Edition
description:
It’s time to put your mind in the gutter and answer survey questions that might make someone blush. But it’s all in good fun, with questions like: “We asked 100 Women, Name something your husband wishes was bigger” … “At what age do most men suffer a midlife crisis?” … “What word or phrase might a partner whisper in your ear to be romantic?” … “Name a sure giveaway that a couple has just been doing some heavy petting.” You get the picture. So now let’s get down and dirty with the game that may get a rise out of you. Late Night Family Feud is recommended for 3 or more players, ages 16 and up.

• Includes: 200 Face Off Cards, 1 Emcee Card, 1 Dry Erase Scoreboard, 1 Dry Erase Marker, 1 Instruction sheet
categories: Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Buen Camino
description:
For centuries, the Camino de Santiago has brought together pilgrims from all over the world who, for different reasons, decide to undertake their journey year after year.
Be the first to arrive at the Cathedral of Santiago and win.

In Buen Camino, two to four players will competitively build and move through the "camino" - the way of Saint James. In a turn, players usually place a "camino" path card, play an event card or move their piece to another card. Some cards have events (blisters, storms, etc), others activities (time to eat, walk with someone, etc), and even equipment (map, raincoat, etc).
The first piece to reach the Santiago de Compostela Cathedral Place wins!

name: Nie puść Pawia!
description:
Players meet to drink "lemonade" and to play this fun party game.
This is a party card game in which players take turns to play cards full of interaction between them. Each player has to play one card during their turn, after the card is played, players perform the action mentioned on the cards: swapping, drawing or discarding the cards etc.
There are no winners in this game - only one loser. The loser is the player who was forced to play the "Puściłeś pawia" card. The game ends after one of the players plays this card.
The game is humorous, and fun to play during the party.

name: Grunt to zdrowie
description:
This board game has been published together with two other Polish games "Gierki Małżeńskie and "Kariera Polityczna" in a series of games illustrated by famous cartoonist Andrzej Mleczko.

Grunt to zdrowie is a party game where you and your fellow geriatric friends race to see medical specialists. Start in the ER and stand in the queue for hours to finally get an appointment with a gastrologist to treat your pinworms or psychologist to help with your egocentrism. Go to work, get more money and let your health deteriorate or get a prescription and heal yourself to win!

The game starts with pawn racing to the ER. Players draw cards and count the number of plaster icons on all of them to move forward and avoid losing points at the end of the game. To visit a doctor, bids are secretly made by choosing cards with the earliest appointment times and modifying them with time tokens. Then, patients in individual queues fight with each other to get to the doctor's by dexterity tests. Manage to be the first one in the queue and visit all the doctors you need to before you lose all your health points and win the game as the only one standing!

name: Jurassic World Stomp and Smash
description:
This is a spin and move game where you try to smash your opponent's dinosaurs that are made of kinetic sand. The idea is to smash the most dinosaurs before getting around the board. Be the first player with 5 Jurassic tokens and don’t get stomped on by the T-Rex!

Includes 1 Horizontal Gameboard, 1 Vertical Gameboard, 2 Plastic Cups, 1 T-Rex Dino Stomper, 2 Dinosaur Molds, 4 Dinosaur Movers, 4 Plastic Stands, 1 Bag of Kinetic Sand, 1 Sand Container with Lid, 30 Cards, 1 Punch Sheet With 30 Jurassic Tokens, 1 Instruction Sheet
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Prehistoric

name: Château Lafortune
description:
Discover Château Lafortune, a money game that is simple to play and really fun! The rules of the game are simple, each player operates their own Hotel to receive visitors. Will the desired room type be available? Will your hotel be luxurious enough for visiting guests? Get your guests through checkout, quickly upgrade your hotel to reach the highest quality standards. Be the first player to reach $250,000, the road to victory will be spiced up by emails received. Anything can happen at Château Lafortune!

—description from the publisher

name: Harry Potter Whomping Willow Game
description:
You just hit the Whomping Willow with your flying car and the Willow goes wild. Can you save your luggage without getting whomped?

The game has three types of play: Time Trial, Collection, and Free-for-All.

- In the Time Trial, each player competes individually to use their flying cars to remove luggage from the tree, racing against the game's internal clock. Any number of players can take part in the Time Trial.
- Collection is for 2 to 4 players. Everyone plays simultaneously, racing to be the first player to remove one of each type of luggage (suitcase, books, owl) from the tree.
- Free-for-All, also for 2 to 4 players, challenges competitors to collect the most pieces of luggage from the tree.

The game has two modes; easy and advanced. In advanced, the tree limbs spin faster and less predictably.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Fantastic Gymnastics Vault Challenge
description:
The exciting Fantastic Gymnastics Vault Challenge game lets players imagine being the next star gymnast! Players time their speed and strength to launch the gymnast down the vault track. At just the right moment, press the red button to send her up and over the vault, and try to stick the perfect landing. Get her to land on the 100-point zone on the mat for the win! Step-by step instruction sheet also features tips for getting the perfect 100-point score.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Sports

name: Quick Count
description:
Taken from the rules included with the game:

There are three main types of cards in the game: run, pass, and catch. You can play run cards anytime. Pass and Catch cards can only be played together - and only if their yardage matches exactly. The game lasts four quarters. Each quarter is one time through the deck. A typical game last about 30 minutes. Players score touchdowns by advancing exactly 100 yards through Run, Pass, and Catch cards (you can't play a 20-yard Run card if you are on the 10-yard line). Each touchdown is worth seven points.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Math, Number, Sports

name: Picknick Panik
description:
Its time for a picnic. With the food, the players also bring an assortment of fly swatters and bug spray to defend against the hordes of bugs sure to come.

The starting player pulls a bug card from his hand, and passes it to the next player; who can either play another bug -- passing the larger horde on to his neighbor -- or defend his food with one of the aforementioned weapons. If he fails to do this, he loses food.

The game comes in two editions -- the standard which is comprised of 114 cards and 24 food tiles; and the deluxe, which features 138 wooden tiles.

name: Aggieopoly
description: In this variation to Monopoly, players move around a board based on Texas A&M University, one of the most spirited campuses in the United States. Properties include Sbisa Dining Hall, Kyle Field, and the infamous Dixie Chicken. Cards allow you to go to Fish Camp, attend the A&M /Univ. of Texas football game, and buy your own Aggie Ring.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Rainbow Towers
description:
Tornspelet (the tower game) is a game for young children, which concentrates on color-recognition. Every player has a 'tower' and 6 beads in 6 different colors. In the game, player try to move blocks in different colors placed in three stacks from so that each stack is of the same color. Which blocks the players can move is decided by dice.

Variant 1: roll the die (with all 6 colors on it) and add your bead to the tower if you roll a color not already on your tower.

Variant 2: roll the die (with all 6 colors on it) and add your bead to the tower if it's the same as the example: you now have to add your beads in the same way as pictured on the box.

Similar to:

Mein buntes Türmchenspiel
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Dice, Educational
publishers: Hausemann & Hötte N.V., Jumbo, Noris Spiele, Spear's Games

name: Swack!
description:
Swack is Ideal's wacky, new game that's loaded with action. What happens when you take the cheese off the giant trap...just wait and see. You might move ahead on the big cheese scoreboard or you might move back if the trap goes swack.

On a player's turn he or she can take up to 3 pieces of cheese from the pan. The player must take at least 1 piece of cheese from the pan. A player gains 3 points for each large piece of cheese and 1 point for each small piece of cheese taken. If the trap springs, the player springing the trap loses 10 points.
Players take turns removing cheese until someone springs the trap- then all of the cheese taken is replaced and the trap is reset.
When a player reaches the end of the scoring track- the game ends immediately.

name: Calling All Cars
description: Players have small metal police cars on separate tracks. Two spinners indicate which car is to move and how far. The player whose car arrives at the police station first is the winner.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Revenge of Dracula
description: Roll the special die to move closer to the edge of the forest. If you roll a moon, Dracula awakens and moves along the path. If Dracula lands on your space, you must return to start. The first player to get out of the forest is the winner.

name: The Rainbow Fish Game
description:
Let’s Play! Just like in the book, the Rainbow Fish shares hi glimmering scales with the other fish in the ocean. Divide the playing cards by color and give each player the pile of cards of the color they chose. Then each player turns two of their cards face up in front of them. On your turn, roll the die and move the playing piece that number of spaces in either direction. Your goal is to reach the picture of the fish that matches one of the cards you have turned up in front of you. When you do this, put the card you’ve matched in the middle of the game board and then turn up another card from you pile. If you roll the rainbow fish on your turn, you get to move to one of the pictures on the game board that matches one of your cards, and you get to choose another player to do the same. Look out for the shark, because if he turns up on the die, you lose your turn. The first player to get rid of all of their cards wins!

Ages 5 and up

name: Panzerschlacht Blood and Armor in Hungary October 1944
description:
It depicts the while armor battles around Debrecen and Nyireghaza, Hungary in October 1944 from Oct 9 to 27. During this time, both sides attacked and counterattacked in bloody see-saw battles which saw the Germans destroying three Russian Corps.

This game is an updated version of his game The Last Panzer Victory: The Battle of Debrecen – Hungary, 1944 with completely new rules, better counters and covers the battle depicted in The Last Panzer Victory: The Battle of Debrecen – Hungary, 1944 and the battles that followed(essentially covers more than his earlier game).

276 counters

name: I Am NOT a Communist
description:
The year is 1955, and communism is spreading in the US Senate! One by one, it is silently overtaking a majority of the voting Senators--that is, unless the stalwart Special Investigator can help the remaining red-blooded, freedom-loving, true-blue American faction as they hold hearings in an attempt to oust the evil Original Communist in the nick of time.

For the growing communist faction and their stealthy Original Communist leader, the goal is to convert a majority of the voting members of the Senate to communism. For the freedom-loving members of the Senate, the goal is to successfully identify the Original Communist and remove his voting rights before his evil creed takes over.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Political

name: Alphabattle
description: Two players write down a 6-letter-word behind the word hatch on a plastic word panel and take turns trying to guess the opponents words by guessing a certain letter. The opponent answers with "lower" or "higher", which is "marked" with arrows on the panel to help find the word.

name: Harry Potter MagiCreatures Card Game
description:
Collect Point Cards by trading creature cards with other players, until you gather six (6) of a kind. When the last Point Card is taken, the player with the highest score wins.

This game contains 7 types of Harry Potter creatures, each with a point card valued at a single value from 1 thru 7, and each with 6 cards for play (no point value). Therefore, there are 42 creature cards, and 7 point cards. The point cards themselves need to be won, and are not dealt out. The creature cards are the ones dealt out, and that players are trading blindly ("2 cards", for example), with other players while trying to collect a set of 6.

Along with the 42 creature cards are 3 other cards: Harry Potter, Hagrid, and a Dementor. These add extra intrigue to the trading & collecting.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading

name: WM Superspiel Mexico 86
description:
According to the cover: Two option to play this game. As a dramatic WM-Championship while the WM is going on or as the longest game of the world which takes the whole four weeks of the original match.

On the back of the Cover (in German):
Das große WM Superspiel ist nicht einfach ein Fußball- oder Sportspiel. Es ist ein Turnierspiel, wie Sie es bis heute noch nicht kennen. Spiel für Spiel, Runde um Runde erleben Sie die ganze Dramatik des bedeutendsten Fußballturniers der Welt. Sie müssen die Reaktionen Ihrer Gegner exakt abschätzen. Sie müssen sich Ihre eigene Taktik genau überlegen. Und dann müssen Sie auch noch das Glück des Tüchtigen haben.

Auslosung:
Ziehen Sie Ihre Favoriten. Und schon beginnt das taktische Spiel. In welcher Gruppe bin ich verteten? Mit welchen Nationen will ich weiterkommen.

Vorrunde:
Gruppe um Gruppe wird ausgespielt. Wieviele Tore habe ich erzielt? Was tun meine Gegener? Habe ich sie richtig eingeschätzt?

Achtelfinale/Viertelfinale:
Wer bingt seine Favoriten Runde um Runde weiter?

Halbfinale/Finalspiel:
Die beiden Finalspiele werden Mannschaft gegen Mannschaft ausgetragen. Nach sieben Würfen mit dem Würfel sind sie beendet. Ereigniskarten steigern die Dramatik, sie können vorwärtsbringen aber eine Führung auch schnell zunichte machen.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Monopoly: Devon
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Devon, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Scotland
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Scotland.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Hide and Seek
description:
An interactive children's memory game. Taking turns each player tries to find a matching 'Crazy Creature' which matches the Hide and Seek card. If a player successfully finds a match they can move 'IT' one space closer to their opponents Gotcha circle. When 'IT' reaches either players Gotcha circle the other player is the winner.

This game simulates a game of hide and seek and allows the players to interact with each other using phrases like 'You're it' and 'Gotcha'.

---

Find the hidden creatures to win this easy to play memory game.
For 2 players aged 4 years upwards

A game for 2 players aged 4 onwards.
OBJECT:
To keep out of the CAUGHT YOU space by selecting the correct hiding Crazy Creature.

PREPARATION:
1. Place the playing strip on the table with the yellow CAUGHT YOU space in front of one player sitting one side of the table and the blue CAUGHT YOU space in front of the other, sitting opposite.
2. Attach MR. IT to his stand and place him on the start facing the yellow end of the playing strip.
3. The player at the yellow and of the playing strip takes the eight HIDING PLACE cards with the yellow sky and places them lace (CRAZY CREATURE SIDE) down spread out in a straight line in front of him. The player at the blue and does the same with the blue cards.
4. The Crazy Creature cards are shuffled and stacked face down on the table between the two rows of HIDING PLACE cards.
5. The top Crazy Creature card is turned over, showing the players which creature they are looking for, and the game i.e. ready to begin.

HOW TO PLAY
The player on the yellow side of the playing strip starts by reaching over and turning one of his opponent's HIDING PLACE cards over to find the Crazy Creature of the same colour as on the card in the centre. If the creature on the HIDING PLACE card does not match he turns the "HIDING PLACE" card back over and his turn ends. The player on the blue side now turns one of his opponent’: HIDING PLACE cards to find the same Crazy Creature.
When a player turns a HIDING PLACE card and finds the matching Crazy Creature, he yells YOU'RE IT and turns MR. IT to face his opponent and moves MR. lT one step towards his opponent's CAUGHT YOU space. The hiding place card is left face up. He then turns over a new Crazy Creature card in the centre and goes again, looking for the next Crazy Creature.
If all 8 Crazy Creature cards in the centre have been turned over before MR. IT gets to a CAUGHT YOU space, the Crazy Creature cards are re-shuffled and placed face down between the players. The players then turn all hiding place cards Crazy Creature side down and rearrange them. The last player to find the hiding Crazy Creature continues the play and turns over the top Crazy Creature card in the centre.

When a player moves MR. IT into his opponent's CAUGHT YOU space, he wins the game.

name: Quadominoes
description:
From the packaging:

"The game consists of 36 square tiles with between 1 and 6 dots on each side.

The object of the game is to place all of your tiles, ensuring that the numbers on any touching sides are matched, while scoring as many points as possible. Points are scored according to the number of sides matched, with the number of points awarded being the square of the number of sides matched."

This game is different from Quad-Ominos which has numbers in the corners instead of dots on the sides of the pieces.

name: Adventures in Oz
description:
From the publisher:

Magic, fun and adventure await as you travel along the Yellow Brick Road to see the Wizard of Oz! Help the Scarecrow get his brain, the Tin Woodsman find his heart, the Cowardly Lion gather courage and Dorothy find her way back home. Call on Toto to help move you along but beware of the Wicked Witch who is waiting to spoil your plans and send you back to Start! So, click your heels, roll the die and let the adventure begin! Comes in a colorful fun box.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Front Porch Classics, Sababa Toys, Inc., University Games

name: Jolly Octopus
description:
Your challenge in the Jolly Octopus mitbringspiel is the same as in the larger board game (namely Jolly Octopus): Don't tickle Jolly O, or else you're looking at a world of hurt. But while the board game uses a motorized octopus with sensitive anti-touch gizmos, the travel game uses only the eyes of the other players, who must watch for octopus movement in order to detect your crime.

Your goal in the game is to move your two crabs clockwise around Jolly O in order to reach the starfish at the goal line. Why not go counter-clockwise and travel only one space instead of seven? Because you have the brain of a crab and cannot reason that well.

To set up the game, you assemble the octopus, which has alternating high and low legs, place all the crabs to the right of the bandaged leg (when looking from above), place the starfish to the left of this leg, and place the shark opposite the crabs.

On a turn, you roll the two dice. If both dice show numbers, you can move one of your crabs ahead the sum of the two numbers or you can move each crab forward equal to the number on one die. To move, you must push the crabs gently under the arms of the octopus, not disturbing Jolly O in any way. If the other players do spot movement, then you return the crab to its starting location and lose the movement points for that action. If one of the dice shows a shark fin, you move one crab forward equal to the number on the other die, then move the shark clockwise that same number of spaces. If the shark lands in a space with a lone crab, that crab is moved backwards two spaces.

The first player to move both of her crabs to the starfish wins!

Reimplements Jolly Octopus

name: War Stories
description:
War Stories is the first game by Symbiose, a small Dutch publisher. Only 1000 copies were printed.

It is a small strategic boardgame for two players that can be best described as a combination of Chess and Memory with a 16th century feudal Japan theme added to the mix.
The story is that two Daimyos are discussing a battle they once fought, during a tea ceremony (the discussion, not the battle). The problem is that both Daimyos don't have very good memories. They try to remember how the battle developed and who won eventually.

As mentioned, the basic mechanics of the game are a combination of Chess and Memory. Finding combinations of identical cards on the board results in new units, which act as chess pieces. Hence, good memory and some tactical insight may be of good use in playing this game.
mechanics: Memory, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Chauvinist Pigs
description:
The game that finally resolves the Battle of the Sexes.

Hey Guys! Do you know all the stuff that guys are supposed to know about cars, sports and the stock market? Hey girls! Do you know your way around a sewing machine? Are you a queen of the culinary arts? You'll find out in Chauvinist Pigs, the game that lets you slice and dice the opposite sex with your all-around knowledge of the male and female lore.

OBJECT
Be the team with the most chips in their piggy banks after each player in the game has selected and read two questions for his or her team.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Humor, Memory, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Jasta
description: A simple Finnish WWI air combat game from the 1970's. Players try to eliminate opponents' planes by rolling dice. Components include a board with pictures of WWI airplanes, 3 dice and 6 plastic airplane pawns in four different colors.

name: JUMP: Genesis Savage Manakins vs. Micro Titans
description:
JUMP: Genesis Savage Manakins vs. Micro Titans is a strategic level conquest game that can be played solo or with up to 4 players if a second set is used.

The object of the game is to conquer the Home World(s) of the other player by using space and ground forces, and fortifications as defense. Although most of the pieces are hex tiles, special measuring sticks are included which are used in the basic game, and even more sticks for the miniatures game.

The components are actually usable in three ways. (1) As a stand alone game for 1-2 (3-4 with additional sets) player, (2) as an expansion for JUMP: Into the Unknown game, or (3) as a tactical miniature game.

name: Forest Friends
description:
Forest Friends is a spin and move game similar to the classic Candyland.

Players take turns spinning and then moving to the next animal pictured on the spinner. If a skunk is spun, the player moves to the skunk, then receives another turn. On that turn, he/she either has to move forward or back depending on the animal on the dial. If one lands on another, the lander goes ahead to the next bird, the landee moves back to the previous bird.

The game ends when the first person reaches the rabbit at the end. This must be done by exact spin.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopoly: Alaska's Iditarod
description: Proving that there is no topic that can't be turned into a Monopoly game, Alaska's Iditarod has players buying, selling and trading various towns and landmarks along the course of the world-famous dog-sled race. The set comes with special collector tokens including: Dog Sled, Dog, Ski Plane, Head Lamp, Lantern, Boots, Bull Moose and Mittens.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Pan American World Jet Flight Game
description:
Australian mid-sixties release. Box art shows a Pan-Am jet flying across Sydney Harbour with the landmark Sydney Opera House conspicuously absent (it was yet to be constructed).

The game consists of a map of the world with selected major destinations connected by plane (presumably Pan-Am) routes. Players are dealt a series of destination cards at the start of the game; all destinations must be visited before returning to the start (Sydney).

Game components are of low grade but acceptable quality - 4 generic pawns for movers, a thin cardboard gameboard that folds in three and thin cardboard destination cards.

The destination cards are mildly educational (each have stats about population, currency, languages spoken etc.) although now very dated.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Livequiz
description:
Livequiz is a trivia game where questions are updated on a daily basis, on the internet: one can connect to the website of the game and find new questions.

The game is composed of a gaming board and 400 hundreds questions cards. As most questions concern the news, the answer can change from day to day and are therefore not printed on the game material itself, but can be obtained the Internet.
publishers: Identity Games International B.V., TF1 Games

name: Ice Age: The DVD Game
description:
From the publisher's website:

Make game time even cooler with Ice Age: The DVD Game. Featuring content from all three movies, including Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs! Play as Manny, Sid, Diego or Ellie and solve cool puzzles and play video mini-games to speed your subzero search for precious acorns hidden under thawing ice.

Game Includes:
Game DVD
24 Double-Sided Board Tiles
Game Board
5 Game Movers

name: Cookie Fu: Grandmaster Chi Battles
description:
Cookie Fu: Grandmaster Chi Battles is a fast, fun, combat card game. Players take on the role of their favorite Grandmaster battling each other head to head in an all out Chi smack-down to see whose Cookie Fu reigns supreme!

Grandmaster Chi Battles is a DUAL PLAY product, usable both by itself and for the Cookie Fu dice game. No more fumbling with slips of paper for your Cookie Fu moves! Each card displays all critical battle information, an essential aid for any Fu Fighter.

Three decks are featured for this release and support the already existing Cookie Fu Clans: Chocolate Ox, Vanilla Hare, and Coconut Monkey. Plus, brand new allies from: Lemon Dragon, Orange Tiger, and the Berry Rooster Clans also make their appearance in the Fortune Decks to aid in the battle vs. the evil sorcerer Bok Choy!

Each fixed 56 card deck contains a customized set of all Fu moves released with the Cookie Fu base set dice game. This includes all Chi actions (Blast, Block, Heal) as well as all Clan specific moves found in the fortune cookies. Adding to the fun, Ally and new Clan moves round out each set - along with a few uninvited guests.

Using a unique mechanic of seeded and opening moves, players duel with rock, paper, scissors, against their opponent's moves. Utilizing attack and defense scores with a "refocusing strategy" as well as hand management all combine to make Grandmaster Chi Battles an enjoyable alternative to the Cookie Fu dice game.

Fast and furious, Grandmaster Chi Battles are different every time. Just unwrap, shuffle and play! With or without dice, Cookie Fu Fortune Decks are guaranteed to Kick Some Cookie...

Integrates with:

Cookie Fu
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Card Game, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Blindfolded Twister
description:
The game that ties you up in knots now features blindfolds and textured shapes for a touch of mystery and loads of fun! In the Blindfolded Twister game, players still move to spots on the mat, but now they do it wearing blindfolds and play completely by touch and memory. The player chosen as the Spinner calls out the moves on the game spinner, and then the players wearing blindfolds feel around the textured shapes with their hands and feet to move around the mat. Get ready for loads of laughs whether playing the game or just watching! It's hilarious to see how players can end up in some really funny and awkward positions. Who will be the last player standing to win?

—description from the publisher

name: Chow Crown
description:
Who will reign supreme in the ultimate snack eating competition? Chow Crown puts a fun twist on viral food-eating challenges! To play, load the six hanging forks with various food items of your choosing. Place the spinning crown on your head, and eat as many snacks as possible before the music stops to keep your crown!

Chow Crown can be played solo or in a head-to-head tournament. The game includes the electronic crown, six plastic forks, and instructions. Requires 3 AA batteries, not included. Food not included.

name: Arlukkachase: Card Game
description:
Get the key, win the game.

But wait! One plays as the dark power infecting players on the way. Get infected & you join the dark side. If everyone is infected, the dark team wins. This isn't squid game but it is a race to the key.

In this card game, players take turns drawing or putting a card into the deck until someone wins (find the key card).

Can you get the key before they get you!

—description from the designer

name: Schickeria
description:
Description of Big Funeral (1964, Kookie):

A card game of wits for 3-6 people.
Theme: Throw Wild Funeral Parties While Still Alive
Scheme: Make Your Friends Look Cheap Send Them To Slob Hill In An Orange Crate Coffin
Dream: Accumulate $50,00 Worth of Hearses, Tombstones And Other Status Symbols
Trick taking game where the 2nd highest card takes the trick. You are trying to collect 4 objects to fill you card.
A coffin, hearse, tombstone and plot. Along the way you can collect status as points. Beware, if your the last one left without all 4 items, you become a Zombie and score no points that round!

Description of Schickeria (1989, Hexagames):
Schickeria means the "in" crowd. Apparently the way to join the "in" crowd is to acquire the requisite status symbols. Players attempt to collect high-value status symbol cards in four categories - homes, jobs, money and cars - by taking the right tricks. The card with the second-highest value played takes a trick.

name: Harry Potter Rescue at Hogwarts Game
description:
This cooperative game based on a section of the third Harry Potter novel the Prisoner of Azkaban pits a team of players against an electronic hour glass in a race to the top of Hogwarts' tower.

Each turn, players roll dice to move Harry and/or Hermione as they gather tiles on their way to Hagrid's Hut to pick up the hippogriff, Buckbeak. However, three Dementors patrol Hogwart's grounds and tower. Players must avoid their soul-sucking kiss or they will be frozen for a turn. Meanwhile, the battery-operated sandtimer ticks silently away, changing color from blue to red to flashing red as the 15 minutes of allowed time elapse. Extra time can be added to the clock by use of Hermione's Time Turner spell, and Dementors can be repelled by Harry's Patronus spell. Once on Buckbeak's back, the two young wizards fly up the spiral path on the three dimensional tower in their attempt to rescue Harry's godfather, Sirius Black, before time runs out...
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Hackers Guild
description:
Do you have what it takes to accomplish the impossible?

The year is 2120 and the world’s population is still trying to overcome the devastation of the worldwide market crash of 2117. After a number of studies, it was revealed that corruption in government and the lack of unity among the government leaders caused the crash. As a result, a group of world leaders are now pushing for a single, worldwide government. Monolith Global Inc, an expert in cybernetics, has suggested that the government be run by robots, claiming that “It’s not possible for a robot to become corrupt, and as a result, they will always make the best decisions for the fate of mankind.”

However, a small number of people see this for what it really is – an attempt to enslave mankind. Known as the Hackers Guild, these ragtag freedom fighters are branded as criminals and are living as fugitives from the law. All reasonable attempts to convince the powers that be that they are making a huge mistake have failed. The only option remaining appears to be the destruction of the program from the inside out. There is only one problem: hacking the company’s network is said to be impossible. Despite this, more and more of the common people are joining in the cause.

Time is running out for the guild as they strive to perform the impossible: hacking Monolith Global Inc and saving humanity from slavery.

The Hackers Guild is a cooperative game for 2-4 players ages 14 and up that plays in about 90 minutes. In the game, players take on the role of members of The Hackers Guild and are trying to work together to complete the final hack against Monolith Global`s data center.

Along the way, players will be able to add additional dice to their dice pool, acquire hacking tools, and other powerups that will make completing their objective a lot easier.

Opposing the hackers is the Network Administrator AI whose sole objective is to delay the hackers long enough for the machines to take power and enslave humankind.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: The Incredible Hulk with the Fantastic Four!
description:
From the box:
Dr. Banner has turned into The Incredible Hulk and is running wild in the city! Choose your favorite Fantastic Four character and move about the board trying to collect four different "Dr. Banner" cards. But watch out for The Hulk! If you collect all four parts of Dr. Banner's face, you win the game and The Hulk changes back into Dr. Banner.

name: Monopoly: Coronation Street
description:
Now you too can experience life on the Street! Travel around the board buying Properties from Britain's best-loved soap. Will you buy Elliot's Butchers, I say will you buy Elliot's Butchers? Or would you rather be pulling pints at the Rovers Return?

Whatever happens, life on the Street will never be the same again!

Game includes: Gameboard, 10 Playing tokens, 2 Dice, 32 Houses, 12 Pubs, 28 Title Deed cards, 16 Chance cards, 16 Community Chest cards, Play money, Banker's tray, instructions
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Parker Brothers, Waddingtons, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: City Blocks
description: City Blocks is an abstract game of placing “pentomino” pieces onto a 20 by 20 square board for 2 or 4 players. Each player takes turns either placing a single piece onto the board or passing. When all players pass in the same round the game ends, scores are calculated and the winner announced. Points are scored for the largest single area that each player has covered and for each edge bordering an empty square on the board.

name: The Cube: Area 51
description:
You are a department head at Area 51, assigned to The Cube reconstruction project. Manipulate, move, tessellate, and plan as you work to rebuild the alien craft with your fellow department heads. You’re all working together to reactivate the ship, but only one of you can be the ship’s captain and interface with the companion AI! Which department will gain control over The Cube?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Kill Steal, Map Addition, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pattern Building, Square Grid, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Wortelboer
description: In this very unusual card game, players are given equal stacks of cards, which have either carrots, bunnies, or foxes pictured on them. The idea is that players set the cards out in biological pyramids, with the carrots eaten by the bunnies and the bunnies eaten by the foxes. However, there is nothing simple about this intriguing and mystifying little game.

name: Skylanders Giants Portal Master Game
description:
Skylanders Giants Board Game is a luck based four-in-a-row game. Spin the spinner and place one of your color rings on a Skylander that has the element you've spun. You can even place one of your rings over an opponent's to try to get four in a row faster.

The Skylanders Giants game is designed for two to four players and includes a game board, 24 rings in four different colors, eight giant rings in four different colors, a spinner card and rules for playing.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Identity Games International B.V., Pressman Toy Corp., Tactic

name: Říše snů
description:
In the game players represent a fantastic creature that enters the realm of dreams. They try to ally powerful beings by completing their quests. Every player has a set of few special cards that can be placed on a gameboard to slow down the progress of other players. In fact it's a fantasy adventure board game where characters are moving around the gameboard, completing tasks and killing creeps.

The played time is somewhere between 30-90 based on the picked mission at the beginning of the game. There are plenty of different missions to choose from, and they have a big impact on the game system as well. You can choose cooperative mission where players play together, or PvP mission, or even solitaire.
mechanics: Action Points, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Jogo!
description: The goal of Jogo! is to get rid of as many cards as possible, and have the lowest score while utilizing various cards to skip, reverse, and perform various in game abilities.

name: The Busytown Board Game
description: There's a parade today in Busytown. Join Lowly Worm, Huckle Cat and all their friends as they march through the magical streets of this enchanted village. The first player to parade through the town and cross the finish line is the winner. Chance cards chosen during play can send you on detours, so the suspense continues to the very end. As young children roll the color die and move their character playing pieces along the board they develop important skills: how to follow directions, wait their turn, and win or lose gracefully. Verbalization, visual discrimination and fine motor skills are enhanced as they play the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Cheers and Tears
description:
Card game with 54 cards in 18 sets of three cards. Two are identical, the Cheers cards, and one is the opposite to the Cheer card, the Tears card.
Players aim to win a trick, made up of the two Cheers cards from any set, but this trick is not won yet. You win the trick permanently if you can play the matching Tears card on to it in a later turn. If another player does this to you, the trick is discarded. The game is won by the player who has the most cards in their 'captured' pile, less any cards still in their hand when the Cheers Cards are all played.

name: Hexenjagd
description:
from the review:

The central bit of the game is a giant lazy Susan with several compartments each covered with a large plastic witch hat. One of the compartments contains a strange little laughing witch that cackles when you spin the lazy Susan. The speaker lines up with holes in the bottom of the unit to help mask where the sound is coming from. The center of the lazy Susan has a giant plastic witch in the middle to complete the effect.

The idea of the game involves rolling dice to move, then occasionally spinning the witches. When you spin the witches, you must then try to locate the laughing witch by tracking the sound.

name: The Cigar Game
description:
This is a set collection card game. You are attempting to play as many completed cigars as possible. Cigar cards come in 3 qualities which may not be combined in the same cigar. the quality of a completed cigar is also its point value (1 to 3). There are also 3 types of leaves needed to complete a cigar and they must be played in order. First the filler then the binder then last the wrapper to complete the cigar. You may have as many incomplete cigars down at a time and you may play on as many cigars as you want but you may not play more then 1 card to each cigar. This means that each cigar requires 3 turns to complete. There are the usual special cards that help you in various ways.

At the beginning of each round the start player is bid on in increments of half a victory point. A round ends when 3 special drought cards have been played to the table or one player has 7 or more points of cigars played. The first place finisher receives his total cigar points not to exceed 7 and the second place receives his total cigar points not to exceed 6. No other players score. A game is played to 21.

name: Bronco Ranch
description:
A mix of action cards, special dice and drawing tiles as cowboys collect mustangs into their corral. The square tiles have multi-coloured edges, and players should place tiles to match the colours.

From MNG-AJM Games Catalog 2005: Wild west ranching game in which the players try to get as many horses and especially broncos into their paddocks as possible. This is done by drawing and laying tiles, where the edges of the tiles must match those they are laid adjacent to on the paddock boards. Action cards allow a leader to be kept in check, and the need to keep your herd together so it is harder for others to raid it adds to the decision making.

name: Drei Chinesen mit dem Kontrabass
description: Three Chinese with a Double Bass! Based on a children's tongue-twisting game in Germany in which you must sing a song whilst swapping the vowel sounds around. Players have cards with a variety of phrases and roll a die showing which vowel to swap. Each player has a double bass and cover the 5 vowels as they progress. Baffling (and impossible for non-German speakers).

name: Sandsplatters
description: A simple 3D sci-fi wargame, with miniatures.

name: Die Schätze des Ali Baba
description:
The Treasures of Ali Baba

extrapolated from a review done by Kevin Whitmore

At the beginning of the game each player starts with a pawn in the bottom corner of the board. At the opposite corner of the board is the entrance to the cave. Every turn each player rolls a D6 to move. Players must move their pawns in a clockwise direction along the edge of the board upon a narrow track. At the left-hand corner is a space marked “Wüste” (Desert). Each pawn must stop there. To leave the desert a player must roll an odd number. Upon reaching the far corner players must pause on the corner before opening the mountain.

The heart of the game happens within the cave. The cave is large, dominating the game mat. Up to 40 square cards can be placed face down, one per space, within the cave. This number will be reduced if the optional obstacles and tea light are used. The cards show the same back, depicting a vase. When a pawn ends its move on a vase the active player may inspect it, and claim the treasure shown. In addition, the player rolls a die to see if they break the vase. If not, they replace the treasure card with a blank card showing the same vase on the back. In this way the game board becomes depleted of treasures and filled up with worthless empty vases, or voids where vases were broken.

Complicating the player’s lives is the band of 40 thieves. Really it is just the black pawn, but he travels the board seeking to prevent the players from absconding with the treasures. Combat slightly favors the black pawn, encouraging all the players to give him a wide berth.

As players collect more treasures, they become encumbered, and forfeit movement points as their load increases. This allows the black pawn to possibly catch a player’s pawn. However, some of the treasure cards are empty backpacks and sacks, allowing a pawn to carry more treasure before becoming encumbered. Further, the black pawn is slow, rolling a special die with a top value of four.

Once a pawn has escaped from the cave, he must continue clockwise upon the track along the edge of the board. At the right-hand corner is a space marked BAGHDAD. Each pawn must stop in Baghdad, and may only leave on the roll of an even number. Should the pawn fail to leave, one of its hard-earned treasures will be lost. Staying in Baghdad is expensive! Eventually the pawn will escape Baghdad, and travel back to the starting corner.

To win the game the player must have more treasures than any other player, and they must also have more treasures than what remains within the cave.

name: Harry Potter Dicers Game
description:
From the Warner Bros. website:
"Dicers is a collectible dice game with two levels of play. Knock your opponents dice out of play in the basic game, or develop unique combinations to expel dicers to the dungeon in the advanced game. For ages 5 years and over."

The dicers game is played with collectible dice. These have 5 clear sides, with a figure representing the character inside of the dice. The sixth side is solid, and shows the name of the die, its "casting number", its special ability, and its affiliations. The clear sides are numbered from 1 to 5, while the solid face is the '6'. Each die represents a character or item from the Harry Potter stories.

The starter set includes 6 dice; Harry Potter, Hermione Granger, Draco Malfoy, Severus Snape, Hagrid, and the Sorting Hat. It also includes a sheet of rules.
The rules actually have 3 levels of play described in them. The basic game only uses the casting numbers on the dice. The Intermediate game adds in the abilities of the dice, and different areas of play, and the advanced game adds in the affiliations of the dice, and reserve abilities.

In the basic game, players set out the six dice and each take turns picking one to determine which dice they will use. Players then roll to see who goes first (the "Challenger").
The challenger picks one die, and then the defender picks on of their dice.
The challenger may roll the die a number of times up to its Casting number, looking for as high a roll as possible. Only the last roll made counts, even if it is lower than a previous roll.
The defender does the same with his or her die.
The lower roll is expelled (removed from play) and the winner becomes the new challenger. This is repeated until only one player has dice left.

In the Intermediate game, there are three areas of play. All dice begin in the Field. A losing die is placed in the dungeon, where it cannot be used. A winning die is placed in the Keep. Dice in the keep cannot be used until a player has no dice left in the field, at which point all of the dice in that player's Keep are moved into the Field. The winning die can choose to either expel the losing die to the dungeon, or to just place it in the Keep and activate the special ability of the winning die. One side of the rules lists the different special abilities. A few examples include:
Capture, which lets you take the enemy die and use its special powers as well as your own.
Summon, which lets you retrieve a die that has been placed in the dungeon.
Swap, which lets you trade the locations of two of a player's dice.
The game ends when one player's dice are all in the dungeon or captured.

In the Advanced game, you can use the affiliations on the dice. The affiliations include the four houses, creatures, and wizards. For every die with the same affiliation as your chosen die in your Field, your die gains +1 to its casting number. This level of the game also adds reserve abilities. These are special powers that, when activated, have no immediate effect but allow the die to be set aside in 'Reserve' and activated later.

Extra dice are sold as single dice. The die you are buying is clearly displayed on the outside of the packaging.

The packaging stated that there were "54 characters to collect" but only 36 were released.

There were two 'Starter Packs' with 6 dice each and 24 individual dicers.
categories: Children's Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Zwergenkönig
description:
The Dwarf King moves around his kingdom amongst the imps.

In Zwergenkönig, players play as dwarves that strive to become the Dwarf King. The board has a maze of tracks. Players roll and move through the labyrinth trying to get four different treasures from the goblins hiding in the trees. The trees have holes in them, through which you can see through the board. Below the board, a rotating disk shows goblins with different items so their faces appear in some of the trees. Players move toward the trees; if they reach one with a goblin, they say a short verse and claim the treasure item. Afterward, the disk is rotated so the goblins appear in different trees. The player that first collects all four treasures becomes the Dwarf King and wins the game.

Ages 4 and up
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Pazaz
description: Each round, players are dealt five cards that have a number on them. They then take turns rolling the two dice. If they roll a number that is on one of their cards, they turn that card over and collect the bets that are on it. If they do not have the number rolled, the next person in clockwise order that does have that number gets to turn their card over and continue the turn. When a 7 is rolled, the player antes another chip into the pot and hands the dice over to the next player. The person with the most chips after three rounds of play is the winner. The board is covered with a fuzzy felt-like material. It helps keep the cards in place when people are rolling the dice on the board.
publishers: E. S. Lowe Company Inc., Milton Bradley

name: Roots
description: A word game using lettered cards that emphasizes your family's heritage by including bonus cards. So, for example, if you hold the Family card and your hand spells R-O-O-T-S or the first letters of your family's name, you win immediately. The game has a deck of cards, a scorepad shaped like a tree, sort of, and rules for a basic, a rummy and a solitaire game.

name: Mork & Mindy
description:
This game is based on the 1979-1982 ABC TV series starring Robin Williams and Pam Dawber.

From the rules:
"Meet Mork. He's from Ork, and he's come to Earth to learn all he can about our planet. To win the hearts of Earthlings everywhere, Mork has brought along this crazy Orkan game. In it, you and your opponents move around a special Orkan board doing such out-of-this world things as "splinking" and "grebbling up." All the while, you'll be trying to win coins called Grebbles. But don't panic. Mork and his Earthling friend Mindy will be there to help. So shake hands Orkan style, and begin!"
categories: Bluffing, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Guess My Name Game
description: You know the difficulties of trying to describe an item in short and accurate words without using your hands. Players try to guess what the player who is "it" is describing. The first to correctly guess the object places a marker on it, and the first to correctly guess 5 objects wins the game. The idea of this game is to guess items which are described by a co-player quickly and correctly in order to get rid of 5 play stones first.
publishers: Educa Borras, Otto Maier Verlag, Serholt Läromedel

name: Snare
description:
Essentially this is Rummy played with 108 lettered cards. There are 26 red letter cards, one for each letter of the alphabet, 74 blue letter cards, and 8 wild cards.

Players meld words of three or more letters, add to their own or opponents' word melds, and can capture others' melds and add to or rearrange them.

Minimum count of 100 to go out. The game ends when a player has 1000 points.

3 letter words are worth 30 points
4 letter words are worth 40 points
5 letter words are worth 50 points
Words over 5 letters add 20 points for each letter over five.
Words of all red letters have the value multiplied by the number of letters in the word.

name: Kool-Aid Kid's Trivia Game
description: Be the first player to go from start. around center, and back to home, arriving on an exact count. To do so, players must answer color-coded questions from four trivia categories. After correctly answering a question, player then rolls the die and hopefully avoids such obstacles as the slide squares and the Thirsties squares.

name: The Van Gogh & Friends Art Game
description:
The Van Gogh & Friends Art Game contains thirty six oversized cards. Each card shows a color illustration or detail from paintings by VanGogh, Gaugin, Cezanne, Seurat, and Toulouse-Lautrec. The cards come with rules for "Go Fish for Art" and "Masterpiece Memory." In "Go Fish for Art," each player tries to collect sets of six cards by the same artist. In "Masterpiece Memory" the cards are spread out face down. Each player flips three cards. If the three cards are by the same artist, then the player collects the cards. The cards are also color coded by artist to aid in set collection.

The game also comes with an art book that describes the period, a time line, biographies, and some information about each painting in the deck.

Renaissance Art Game and Impressionist Art Game have the same mechanics as this game, but with different art work on the cards.

name: The Fairly Odd Parents Game
description: Based on the Nickelodeon TV show, players take on the roles of Timmy's godparents and try to grant him wishes (no matter how silly.) The first player to land on all three of their place cards wins. Be careful! Vicky is on the prowl and will block your path or make you go the wrong direction.
categories: Children's Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Book of Mormon Challenge
description: Made for Latter-Day Saints (LDS), players roll the dice and move your piece around the board as you answer multiple choice questions about characters and events from the Book of Mormon. Play continues until all players advance their tokens to the Celestial Kingdom!

name: The Ultimate Hockey Trivia Board Game
description:
From the rules:

Welcome to The Ultimate Hockey Trivia Board Game. As the name suggests, this is a trivia game for hockey fans who want to test their knowledge about the greatest sport in the world.

While the game does focus primarily on the NHL teams and players, it also includes questions on hockey history, international hockey, junior hockey and other professional hockey leagues. One feature, which many people appreciate, is the 'rookie' category for novice hockey fans. This allows everyone to play and have a chance at winning.

name: The Cottage of Content
description: A game of "Right Roads and Wrong Ways". The first player to reach The Cottage of Content wins the pool of counters paid out as penalties during the game. Movement is determined by a teetotum marked Front, Back, Left, and Right. If Left or Right are rolled, the player must go in the designated direction; if Forward is rolled, the player may move in any direction; if Back is rolled, the player loses a move.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Hyena
description: The board consists of a spiral line with a number of points marked along its course. Each point represents a camp at the end of a day's journey. A larger point at the center of the spiral represents the well of an oasis, and the starting space represents a village. The players seek to release the hyena (at the well) or to bring their marker back to the safety of the village.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement
publishers: (Public Domain), ABRA, Bibelot Games, Editora Abril, Fratelli Fabbri Editori  (Fabbri Editore), NewVenture Games, Rogue Productions, Inc.

name: Towers of Terror
description:
Print board, and rules. Also needed are eight stackable pieces (checkers) per player.

Object of the game: Build siege towers from your existing materials and use them to battle with your opponent for control of the practice field.

From the website:
Who says engineers can't be warriors? Meet the few, the meek, the "I'd-rather-be-talking-about -torque-stress-ratios -over-a-keg-or-two" kind of men from the king's BUILDING BATTALION. Join with them as they hit the training grounds that will one day prove their 'metal' (and wood, and gears, and ...)

Download the game at: http://kenmgames.wordpress.com
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Enclosure, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Turista Nacional
description:
This game is similar to Monopoly, but has a few differences. The game was published only in Mexico.

According to the Publisher's Website:

Turista Nacional crosses the colorful places of Mexico and players make productive investments to avoid bankruptcy in this game of economic strategy.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: The Camper's Knot Tying Game
description: This is more an instruction manual on tying knots than a game. A card is turned over and players race to complete the pictured knot. Who ever ties the knot first is awarded the points listed on the card.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Educational, Real-time

name: Jump Off
description:
All the thrills and spills of the show-jumping ring.

Features:
An authentic show-jumping ring layout.
Use realistic model horses and jumps to set up a different course every time you play.
Will you jump a clear round and beat the clock, or will your horse refuse, knock down or run out and earn you time penalties?
Use the good luck horseshoe to wipe out your faults and jump ahead of your competitors.
Take part in a Jump Off if two or more riders have equal fence faults and time penalties.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Barnen i Bullerbyn
description: Abstract strategy game based on the story of the same name by Astrid Lindgren.

name: The Wishbone Game
description:
Based on the PBS television series about the little dog with a big imagination.

The object of the game is simple: race around the board to collect your hero's favorite things. Along the way, you'll leap into literature, sniff out adventure, dig for clues, scratch out a game-winning strategy, and search for food (dogs can't live on books alone). The Wishbone Game is a great introduction to the classic works of literature introduced by the world's most classic dog. It's designed for parents and children to play together, and it's more fun than chewing on an old sneaker.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Dash Hounds Game
description:
Just like the game's name...these four adorable, "growable" hounds really "dash" to win the race. The dogs are small at the start of the race...but as the race progresses they grow longer and longer. Unlike other races - the dog whose TAIL crosses the finish line first wins the game!

Players spin the spinner and move their dogs the appropriate number of spaces toward the finish line. If the front legs of a dog should land on a colored space, the player whose dog matches that color must add a section to his dog.

name: Straight Arrow
description:
Straight Arrow (trademark of national biscuit company) is a 1950 game manufactured by by Selchow & Righter co. The directions are printed on the inside of box cover. The gameboard contains a track which all players follow as the spin and move, and measures approx. 18-1/4" x 18-1/2".

Players attempt to earn golden arrow tokens as they move along the board path.

Contents: Four playing pawns, spinner, 18 golden arrows, 15 metal steers, one Straight Arrow Indian on a horse pawn, game board.

name: Navigator
description:
From the Invisible City Productions website:

Investigate and explore with two to four detectives and a map.

Goal: Discover your opponents’ hideouts before they find yours.

Players move their pawns around a map (any map will do, ideally one that’s bigger than 8" x 10".) Using poker cards and 20 Questions-type questions, players try to deduce the location of their opponent's hideouts.

Winning: In a two-player game, the first player to successfully guess a Hideout wins. With more than two players, the player with the most points (which are gained by finding hideouts) wins.

Rules are available here:
http://www.invisible-city.com/play/65/navigator

name: Jakten på djungelbananerna
description:
Children´s game about monkeys building bridges across a river in order to collect bananas. On their turn, the players roll the die and move their monkey along the riverside. If the monkey ends up on an empty stone, the player may start building a bridge from that stone towards the other side of the river by placing a bridge tile. If there is a bridge already, the player may extend that bridge by adding a bridge tile. A third tile completes the bridge, and monkeys may now cross the river to the other side. Each bridge tile equals one step, so you need at least a four on the die to cross on one single turn. If a monkey ends up on the same bridge tile as another monkey, the latter is moved off the bridge. When a monkey reaches the other side of the river the owning player collects one banana, and the bridge that was used to cross the river is destroyed. The first player to cross the river three times, thereby collecting three bananas, is the winner.

Contents:

1 board
4 plastic monkeys
14 bridge tiles
1 die
9 banana tokens

Rules are in Swedish but components are language independent. The Swedish title means "The Hunt for the Jungle Bananas".

name: Chums
description:
"Fish love to be with their friends! Can you bring all the Chums back together? Ask others for cards by number or go fishing to try and catch a pair of matching Chums. The player with the most pairs at the end of the game wins."

A SimplyFun version of the card game "Go Fish". Cards depict colorful fish.

name: Squails
description: A game close to that of Crokinole and "Bowls" or other Bocce-related games. The object is to get your colored or otherwise marked Squails (round flat disks, usually 4 in number) as close to or touching the Procese/Jack (smaller diameter, but thicker and heavier flat disk) by setting your Squail on the edge of a table and striking it with the palm of your hand. There is a version from House of Marbles in thier "Around the World with Eight Great Games" series, which details some terms to be used in the playing of Squails, such as "To Flute"-To strike a Squail or the Procese off the table and "Excrunch"-To hit an enemy Squail very hard.
publishers: (Unknown), House of Marbles, John Jaques of London

name: Partyzone: Spy Ring
description:
You are about to enter a world of romance and intrigue, of high society and scandal. Many surprises lie ahead...and the party you are about to throw will be remembered and talked about for months to come!

Each Partyzone Game is a complete mystery party in a box. It is a party game for you and your guests. It provides a theme for your party. It is an icebreaker to help get your party started. You don't sit down and play; instead, you and your guests move around and socialize with each other. Just what you would want at any good party!

In the Spy Ring Scenario, your guests are given roles as spies, defecting scientists, and double agents, each trying to complete their secret goals. Throughout the evening, players engage in secret conversations, drop passwords, and attempt to uncover the identities of the other players. Each guest has a mysterious past and some secrets to protect, and each has one or more missions that involve the other guests at the party. Many of these missions conflict with one another.

This Partyzone game of intrigue and deception for adults includes instructions and party planning booklet, 12 invitations and envelopes, 20 identification badges, decorations, and much more.
categories: Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Missä lahjat herra Hakkarainen?
description:
Mr Hakkarainen (famous character from Mauri Kunnas' children books) has messed up birthday presents in vans. Each players object is to find his/her presents as soon as possible.

The playing mechanism uses a wheel of fortune (which is attached on the gameboard) which tells how many steps the character can move and what to do when certain things happen.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: 1-2-3 Home Free
description: This game is played just like the real playground game. One player is “IT” while the other players select a hiding place on the board. When the SEEKER finds a player, the race to home begins.

name: Xtreme Limits
description:
Here is a description of the game from Die Poppelkiste:

In Xtreme Limits, the timer's running. With the help of chips, a player can change the hand. The goal is to have the three hands in the right orientation once the time has run out. And there is one extra piece of meanness: If a hand is on 4 or 8, a player can switch his task card with another's.

name: Cats in the Fish Shop!
description:
From the box:
"Each player is given a cat. The cats lick their lips and lurk around the fish stall. When the fishmonger isn't looking, they try to steal a fish.
This is an exciting game for all children who can be crafty."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Capitan Harlock: Il Pirata dello Spazio
description:
Game for children from the famous Japanese cartoon.
The players fight against the Robots of Queen Lafresia with their tanks "Docros", working with uranium fuel.
The robots accidentally move on the map and the players must avoid to remain to dry with theirs tanks in order assaulting the base of the Queen.

name: Hopp Hopp
description: Rabbits, hedgehogs, pigs and tortoises have decided to have a contest. Which pair gets over the river fastest jumping from stone to stone?

name: Golf-Dice Challenge!
description:
A standard Golf simulation driven by 5 different dice replacing golf clubs.

Game components:

- 6 dice
- score pad
- a cute little case for the dice presenting as a golf bag
- a pencil

name: Getaway
description: An exciting game of Travel & Trivia using a factual world map as your playing board. Players start with airline itineraries & travelers checks and need to be the first player to visit all the cities on their itinerary, collecting the appropriate visa, and return to their country of origin all the while managing their money, navigating detours & diversions. The first player to collect 10 visas and return to their country of origin is declared the winner. PLAY: Players must announce their intended destination before the role of the die which will determine the amount of the fare. The die role will determine the destination and the cost by displaying full/half or free fares. If a player rolls divert, transit, geography or general knowledge then they must take the appropriate card from the board and their travel is suspended or diverted depending on the instructions of the card. Many times players may answer trivia questions about their particular region to allow their flight to continue to their previously stated destination, however, a wrong answer usually keeps the player grounded or relocates them to an undesirable location. Money is collected by opting not to fly and answering trivia questions or a combination of both. The Australian game designer recommends this game for ages 12+.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Strandburg
description:
'Strandburg' (sandcastle) was produced in Austria in 1979. It is part of the first wave of cooperative games that hit europe(an kids) in the late seventies and arguably among the most intense experiences, because it features real experiences most kids have.

The goal of the game is to finish a sandcastle before it is destroyed by the rising tide. As with most of these games directed at players around the age of 5, decisions do not change the outcome of the game too much, it comes down to the luck of the dice.
Depending on the colours you roll on the 2 dice, you either add waves, parts of the sandcastle or help other players out. The feeling of being 'in this together' is very present.

Distribution in the Benelux was done by Jumbo, the game appeared there under the same name.

name: Platsch
description:
Called Splash in English. Listed as Haba game Nr 4377. Almost identical in concept to the 2002 game Platsch! by Haba listed as designed by Heinz Meister, where the kittens become hippos and the fish are life preservers. Very simple dice rolling game for young children.

From Game Box:
The aim of the game: 2-6 hungry kittens are trying to catch some tasty fish out of the sea. But whoever throws the dice too many times and comes too close will fall - splash! - into the water and will have to go back and take another turn.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Strategie auf Schienen
description: Players try to the first to reach the end of the track. A normal six sided die is rolled together with a die with colored sides. The train may move the number of spaces rolled on the numbered die, but only when the colored (signal) die is not red. Trains may move forward or back, but may not overtake. Trains may change track at the yellow switches, but only if the signal die is yellow.

name: Cascades
description:
DROP - Each stone is dropped on an empty cell, next to and below a stone of the same color
MOVE - First player drops one stone at the first turn, then each player drops up to two stones (he may pass).
GOAL - Wins the player with more stones on the bottom row.


Some words from the author: For some time now [Apr 16, 2001] I have been toying with the idea of trying to model/abstract the flow of water carving out a mountainside. A related geometric pattern is the fractal on certain seashells. [...] The image in my mind is a root-pattern forming or tributaries of a river. [...] The game generalizes to any MxN board. Without more experience playing and "figuring it out" I don't know how M and N affect playability. My intuition suggests 8x8 (really 8x15 if you measured it at the bottom) is already nontrivial and 10x10 might be "tournament".

Online Play


Super Duper Games

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Movie Game
description:
Unfold this game board to reveal the sewers and manholes of Manhattan plus the ever-changing headlines of the New York Daily.

Players ages 6 and up use their ninja skills to capture Max Winters’ Alien mob while scoring the most points. Turtle power rules in this fast-paced game but beware! Players may not only capture but can also allow Aliens to escape. Each game box includes a spinner, 22 Turtle Power cards, 8 Alien cards, 18 Daily News Cards, 4 TMNT tokens plus a game board. The TMNT Movie Game was created for 2-4 players.

name: Tennis Shoes Among the Nephites: The Game
description: A roll of the die takes players into Book of Mormon lands. Players answer gospel questions to collect Gold Plates. Special questions for players ages eight and under. Theme based on the popular series of books by Chris Heimerdinger.

name: Sonic U.F.O.
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to fly their four UFO's back from outer space and land them on Planet Earth.

On your turn you cover your eyes with the mask provided while another player moves the large UFO round the board. As it moves it "beeps" and you need to identify where it landed. If you guess right then you can move your UFOs and "ZAP" another player back to outer space. If you get it wrong then the other players get a free move.

Not quite as easy as it sounds (especially if your hearing isn't that good) and you can also "freeze other ufo's by landing on them.

name: Walt Disney's Peter Pan Game
description: Spin and move children's game based on Walt Disney's Peter Pan

name: Rally 6
description:
Rally 6 is more than just a car rally game but a spark to the imagination for all ages. The unique board design enables re-arrangement of the aerial view of the village of Whittlton to give six different layouts at varying levels of play.
