No mid-game boredom with Rally 6. Driving through the village involves thrills and hazards, natural features such as fords, level crossings and junctions in addition to those brought about by landing on the yellow cross-hatched Incident squares. The game is always close run and maintains the excitement right to the end.
Choose and navigate your own route to pass through all ten checkpoints, encounter and overcome the hazards, re-adjust your route to deal with changing conditions and race home to win Rally 6. The thrills of Rally 6 are endless because no two games are ever the same.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Planes Game
description:
Trick-taking card game of the Pepys Series Card Games, as usual well produced and designed.

Game consists of 44 cards: 12 class cards, 2 helicopter cards and 30 trio cards(depicting various planes in different classes and point value).

Object of the game is to win cards with tricks.
After dealing out the hand further cards are turned up until a class card appears. Players then choose 3 cards from their hands which they believe give a good point value vs. the class.
The packs are revealed simultaneously, winner of the trick is the one with the most point value (helicopters belonging to every class).
The winner also takes all the cards exposed by the other players depicting the class.
When the last class card has been played for the game ends and all the tricks are valued with a special count score.

Gameplay is the same as in the CAR GAME and GIRL from the same publisher.

name: Älypää!
description: Älypää! is based on the most popular Finnish internet trivia game. At first you'll have to estimate to how many multiple choice questions you can answer correctly. Each correct answer brings you points and reaching your estimate gives you a bonus. The questions are of three different difficulty levels and in the beginning you're answering easy questions and in the end the really hard ones. During the game you can once skip answering a question, once delete a wrong answer choice and once ask for a clue. The board has two sides: On one side the winner is the player who has given most correct answers, on the other side the winner is decided by points.

name: Gotcha
description:
Gotcha is a board game created in the 1980's by a division of a jewelery company (Roset by Reid) based in Medicine Hat, Alberta, Canada.

The goal of the game is to create rows of 5 chips in your color across a board divided up into rows of colored and numbered squares. On his turn, the player will play one of 5 cards from his hand of cards, each of which have a number and a color on them. The information on this card indicates a limited set of squares on the board matching the color and number on which a chip can be placed. There are also 2 special kinds of cards: Wild cards which allow a chip to be placed anywhere, and Gotcha cards which can be used to remove an opponent's chip from the board.

A round is over once a player has created 2 rows of 5 chips. Each row of 5 garners 50 points. Several rounds are played until one player reaches 500 points and is declared the winner.

This game can also be played in 2 or 3 teams of 2 players each.

name: Fire Storm in Adlore Valley
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

Take the part of a local fire commander and allocate your limited resources to attempt to halt and extinguish a fire sweeping through the valley. You have at your disposal three firefighter units, a fire jumper unit, and a fire suppression aircraft. You may also use "backburn" units to halt the spread of the fire. If you lose any of your firefighters before the entire fire is extinguished, the game is a loss.

name: Dork Wanderings
description: Welcome to the Dungeon of No Return. You and your friends are a party of wily adventurers who have stumbled upon this dungeon through the machinations of your superlative game master. Luckily, you live in a world where it's perfectly okay to kill other creatures and take their stuff, so you will win the game by killing other creatures and taking their stuff. Included in Dork Tower #25.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: C'est la vie!
description:
(Description from game publisher)

In life, there are good times and bad times. That's life.

With a bit of creativity, luck and common sense, you will go through all challenges of life.

Make your way in the following domains "Career", "Wealth", "Family" and "Fitness".

The future is upon your hands, make the best of all unexpected events.

The player who will have the happiest life will win the game.

This game has been created by a Swiss insurance company.

It contains:

1 boardgame
2 dice (one red and one white)
6 pawns
1 Destiny Stone
50 Lucky Pigs counters
50 Horseshoe counters
80 Clover counters
12 Destiny cards
32 Precaution cards
3x55 "C'est la vie!" cards
33 Career cards
33 Wealth cards
33 Family cards
33 Fitness cards
1 rulebook in German, French and Italian

The boardgame contains an inner circle and an outer circle. Players move their pawn in the inner circle and the Destiny Stones moves in the outer circle.

Once the Destiny Stone has made a complete turn in the outer circle, the game ends, and the player with the most Luck points wins the game.

Lucky points are earned by winning the challenges in the inner circle.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Schmetterlings-Spiel
description:
Different butterflies have to be placed on coloured flowers, trying to pair them with their same-coloured counterpart.

From the box:

A butterfly flutters by - and alights on a flower - it opens its wings... Will they be the same colour as the blue flower it is resting on? Hard luck! They're not!
Where then is the blue butterfly to match the blue flower?

A concentration and memory game for 2-6 players between Ages 5 - 8

name: Tycoon: The International Shipping Game
description:
Players compete in the port of Singapore to be the most successful Managing Director of their company. Players move around the board purchasing real life shipping companies and ships (in a similar way to Monopoly) and hoping to avoid their competitor's shipping spaces.

Players may find themselves hopping around the board via the travel spaces, encountering shipping problems or engaging in contracts and charters to try and raise their income. Be warned though as defaulting on contracts can lead to a hefty fine!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Regatas
description:
Roll the dice and move forward. The player that arrives first to the house with the 80th number on the board will win the game.

Good Luck!

name: Puck Attax
description:
Puck Attax is a new multi-player collectible hockey card game.
The game is designed for kids and features NHL player card discs.
The game allows players to manage their teams and face off against friends in head-to-head gaming.

Each Puck Attax game card is in the shape of a hockey puck, featuring player image, player name, team logo, and position and player ratings. Each player disc has an offence and a defence rating. There are two rounds called shifts. The player mat has spots for 14 NHL player discs. The mat is broken in two by a centerline and each side of this line has 3 forward 2 defence a goalie and shootout spot where your discs are to be placed face down. Gamers take turns deciding whether they will be on offence or defence. They then pick a face down disc and the game becomes a game of war where players simultaneously flip over a player discs and compare offence and defence ratings. The higher of the two ratings scores a goal. You go through 6 turns in 2 shifts keeping track of goals (a tie in ratings equals no goal) if after two rounds the score is still tied you go to the shoot-out player and the game is decided by a tie breaker...
Every NHL team is represented and special foil game cards featuring hockey’s top stars will are included. A starter box includes random game cards and play-mat, and enough cards for one player to ice a team. Additional booster packs of 6 cards can be purchased to add different players to your bench…

name: El Internado: El juego de mesa
description:
Boardgame based on spanish TV Serie called "El Internado", produced by Globomedia for Antena 3 TV. In this game players must explore (roll the dice, move your pawn) "El Internado de la Laguna Negra" and try to resolve several missions to win the game. Game includes:

A board
A DVD: events that players must resolve before play his turn.
90 Events Cards Maze: similar to DVD (can play with DVD or cards)
36 Mission Cards: resolve missions to win Victory Points
6 players pawns (for six diferents roles)
10 pawns
25 objects tokens
1 dice


URL "El Internado" (spanish): http://www.antena3.com/PortalA3com/El-Internado/programa/P_8...

URL Board Game (spanish): http://www.antena3.com/PortalA3com/El-Internado/Juego-Mesa-I...

Juego de mesa basado en la serie de televisión "El Internado", producida por Globomedia para Antena 3 TV. En este juego los jugadores deben explorar (lanza el dado, mueve tu personaje) "El Internado de la Laguna Negra" y tratar de resolver distintas misiones para ganar el juego. El juego incluye:

Un tablero de juego
Un DVD con eventos que el jugador debe resolver antes de jugar su turno.
90 cartas de eventos, similar al DVD (el juego se puede jugar con DVD o cartas)
36 cartas de misiones que deben resolver los jugadores para obtener puntos de victoria
6 peones de jugadores
10 peones de personajes secundarios
25 fichas de objeto
1 dado


URL "El Internado": http://www.antena3.com/PortalA3com/El-Internado/programa/P_8...

URL Juego de Mesa: http://www.antena3.com/PortalA3com/El-Internado/Juego-Mesa-I...
categories: Dice, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ruler of Decktonia
description:
From the rules: "When the playing cards go away for the night, everything seems calm. But really, inside the pack, the cards are battling it out to see who will be the Ruler of
Decktonia! Will it be the Blacks or the Reds? Each night the wars rage on, and the kingdoms change from one to the other. Who will it be this time?"

A simple card game where players use a regular deck of playing cards to see who can have the largest standing army by the end of the game. Each turn the player can lay a card to build his or her army, and use a royalty card that has various effects such as taking away an opponent's army, drawing cards, or protecting one of their own armies from the enemy.

Perfect as a filler between larger games, or fun on its own - this game is easy to learn, and since it uses just a regular pack of playing cards, can be played anywhere.

name: Jääkiekkoshakki
description:
As exciting as ice hockey, as interesting as chess - it's ice hockey chess!

Ice hockey on a chesslike board. Each player has 6 pieces (players): 1 centre, 2 wings, 2 backs and 1 goalkeeper, and before the start of the game can nominate one of them as a "star player" who will be a more efficient passer than the others.

Roll a d6 to shoot, pass, or move a piece 1 step. Watch out for penalties and offsides. The game ends after a pre-agreed time or number of goals.

The three players depicted on the box front are all Finnish ice hockey legends, from left to right: Jukka Porvari, Veli-Pekka Ketola and Juhani Tamminen.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Disney Princess Friends Forever
description: Who will be your "PFF" (Princess Friend Forever)? Collect magical Friend Gems as you travel with your Princess BFFs to the enchanted castle. The first to enter the colorful castle wins the game. The game is a race using cards and gems for players as princesses to enter the castle.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Face To Face: The Face Identity Game
description:
Object: "To be the first player to correctly identify two photos of each color (a total of at least eight cards), and to them correctly identify a "Final Face" photo." (From the rules of play)

Players: 2 to 8, individuals or teams

Equipment: 2 card boxes, 800 Face cards, 1 pair of dice, 1 master list, 4 card holders with locking windows, 8 player tokens, 1 game board.

To begin play, players insert (without looking) one Face card of each color (gray, burgundy, blue, and gold) into the matching-color card holder, making sure the six windows on each holder are closed. Each card holder is then placed window-side up on the game board, in the matching-color rectangle. Each player selects a token, places it on the 'Start' space on the game board, and rolls the dice to determine who plays first (highest roller, play continues clockwise).

Ona player's turn, that player rolls the dice and moves his token that number of spaces in any direction (backtracking in the same turn is not allowed). If the player lands on a colored, lettered space, the player must open the corresponding window (by letter) on the corresponding card holder (by color). If a player lands on one of the four outside corner spaces, all the windows on the corresponding card holder (by color) may be opened. When a player lands on a pink "Face ID" space, the player selects any card holder and opens all unopened windows. When landing on a pink space marked FAID, the player selects any holder and opens the F, A, I, and D windows.

During his turn, after opening any windows allowed, a player may try to identify the person on the card in the card holder that corresponds (by color) to the space his token is on. To identify the person, the player must state the name of the person on the card--not the name of any character the person has played. (Example: "Bob Keeshan" would be correct, but not "Captain Kangaroo".)

All players determine whether the player is correct. If there is a dispute, the Master List is consulted by revealing the identification number at the bottom of the card. The player making the identification consults the list in secret. If he is correct, the card is removed from the holder and rewarded to the player, who closes the windows and places another card in the holder. That player rolls the dice and moves again.

If the player is incorrect, he places the card holder back on the board (leaving the windows open or closed, as they were). He does not reveal the correct identity of the person on the card, but he may not (of course) make another guess on the same card.

An incorrect guess, or no guess, ends a player's turn.

After a player has collected two cards of each color, he must land on a FACE ID space to attempt a Final Face Identification. When he lands on a FACE ID space, the player must attempt to identify the face in the corresponding (by color) card holder. The player consults the back of his collected face cards, which contain assorted letters. Those letters determine which if any of the unopened windows on the card holder he may open before attempting to identify the person.

If the player is incorrect on the Final Face Identification, his turn is over and play resumes as normal. On that player's turn, he must attempt again to land on another FACE ID space to make another Final Face Identification.

If the player is correct on the Final Face Identification, that player wins the game.
publishers: The FACE TO FACE Game Company

name: Monster Mashup Lunchbox Game
description:
Publisher Blurb:

A lab experiment has gone bad and monster parts are scattered everywhere. You are a scientist trying to make a special monster from all of the monster parts. Create your own monster. Collect arms, legs, a head and a body to complete your unique creature. The first player to mash-up a complete monster, no matter how silly he looks, wins the game. Game includes 54 cards and instructions for two levels of game play.

name: La conquista del West
description:
La conquista del West is a simple strategy game that simulates the massive move towards the Far West.

The game is played by throwing a coin to get "heads" or "tails" and follow the rules listed. At his turn, each player flips a coin 2 times and makes the following actions:
- move his pawn one space for each "heads"
- placement of an obstacle (versus other players) for each "tails".
Some hexagons give the possibility to pick up a card and to make an extra action.

The goal of the game is to be the first player to reach any of the four hexagons marked with the logo Levi's, located in the fort or in the mine.

La conquista del West was a promotional game by Levi's and the was not commercially sold.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Teenage Mutant  Hero Turtles Card Game
description:
Card game for 2-5 players from ages 7 and up.

The purpose of the game is to be the first to collect all 4 turtles. every turn the players take a card from the face-down stack and put one from their hand on the face-up stack. Shredder card get their own stack. There are 3 special types of cards which let you skip a turn, take two shredder cards or change the turn-order.

name: Der 7. Sinn
description:
Objective:
Reach target line (= opponent's start position) with as many of your 10 cars as possible.
Each player/team starts with 10 cars (red or blue), moving them by die and turn.
For any obstacle (building, park...) you have to make side steps; you may choose ANY of your cars to be moved, opponent's car(s) may be thrown out. Game ends if one player/team has moved all their cars into target line.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Black Stories Junior: Pink Stories 2
description: How could that have happened? Pink Stories is a game similar to the Black Stories game series. The players try to reconstruct an obscure event by asking, guessing and fiddling about. Only yes/no answers are allowed. This version of the black stories has mysteries related to various themes that are interesting to girls - fashion, dressing up, horses, fables, princesses, jewelry, pets, and much more

name: Devine Tête: Célébrités
description:
Devine tête version with celebrities.
Players draw a card without looking it and put it on their headband.
They ask as many questions as possible in the limited time to guess the celebrity on their card.
By asking questions to other players they cannot answer with "yes","no" or" maybe".
For each card guessed, you eliminate a token.
The first player who gets rid of his tokens wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Real-time

name: Ryzykanci: Koleje Fortuny
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Discovering the tradition of the 19th-century Mazovia region via a card game? Why not! Ryzykanci: Koleje Fortuny (Daredevils: Wheels of Fortune) presents the time of revolutionary industrial changes, political storms, building fortunes, and the first steps of the capitalistic society in Poland. The rail played an important role at that time; it revolutionized transportation, production and trade. Welcome to Mazovia, the world of industrialists, tycoons, magnates and patrons – in other words, daredevils.

In the game you take a role of a famous Polish industrailist from the 19th century and develop your company. The goal of the game is to achieve the highest number of prestige points. Players may gather prestige points through buying shares, building investments (such as Train Stations, Theaters or Boarding Schools) and collecting cash.

The box contains: 110 cards, 16 wood markers and a rulebook with an educational brochure.

The game was prepared for the Mazovian Center of Culture and Art.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Liliput
description:
A children's game themed on Jonathan Swifts "Gulliver's Travels", specifically on Gulliver's encounter with the Lilliputians.

Each player is head of a Lilliputian family clan, consisting of four members. The aim of the game is to tie down the sleeping Gulliver while gaining as few points as possible. Players take turns taking one of the Lilliputian figures, each of which has either a number from 0 to 5 or a rope symbol on its base (not visible when players choose which figure to take). The active player announces the figure's value and decides if they want to put it on their own family card or return it. If a rope symbol is drawn, the player must exchange two of their family members (they may choose to exchange for a member of a different family clan), announce the new values and tie Gulliver down on one arm or leg. A Lilliputian with a rope symbol is worth ten points.
The game ends when Gulliver has been tied down in all four places. The player whose family clan has the lowest total value (all family members added together) wins the game.

name: Consequential
description:
Earth has been connected to the fantasy world of Laris. The result of the mixture of technology and magic is the Cataclysm, an event that tore holes in the fabric of time and space. Five heroes have been pulled together on Laris, where they embark on a journey to mend both worlds.

Consequential is a co-operative board game that lets players live the tale of this adventure. Over the course of four acts, the story will be told. The base game box contains the board, and all the cards for Act I. Acts II, III, and IV are packaged and sold separately. They contain additional cards, new locations, and new mechanics!

The unique aspect of this game is that it is not solely a tabletop experience. A free companion app for your iOS/Android device or laptop is required for play. It will display voice-acted events that are triggered by actions in the physical game, and tell more of the story. The app also is responsible for keeping the timer for the real-time portion of each episode. One episode of Consequential contains a turn-based phase (about 45 minutes) and a real-time phase (about 10 minutes) to conclude the session. The real-time phase can be played without a timer, if players prefer.

name: Ice Age 3: Das Scrat-Spiel
description: Brrr! Scrat shivers on the ice floe. While holding his precious nut, he throws ice cubes from the ice floe. Whoever grabs all the ice-pieces of his color fastest wins the game. All wrong cubes must be put back.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Real-time

name: Johnny Tractor's Apple Adventure
description:
Drive around Merriweather Farm gathering apples, but be ready for a few surprises to crop up! If you find a raccoon, you'll have to put one Golden Apple back. Corey Combine and Allie Gator may pop up along the way to give you an extra turn! If you and Johnny Tractor find four Golden Apples and get to the barn on the other side of the farm first, you win!

The game consists of cards that slide into the game board. The tops of the cards represent trees and the bottom of the cards which are hidden have an item. The object of the game is to move your tractor game piece from one side to the other collecting four cards with a golden apple. Once a player has four golden apples they try and get to the barn which is opposite their starting spot. Upon arriving there they win.

name: Story Smash-Up
description:
From the box:

"Story Smash-Up is the laugh-out-loud game where movie worlds collide. You create sentences using word cards that feature your favorite scenes. The more you mix 'em, the funnier the sentence!

"Create sentences by playing cards ...
Noun (an alien) + Verb (kissed the prince) + Fragment (on a turtle shell) + Fill in the Blank (and made Mom jealous) = 4 points.
Score 1 point for each card played! At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins!

"Contents: 112 Cards, 10 Tokens, Instructions. "

This game uses story elements from 4 Disney & Pixar films: Cars, Finding Nemo, Toy Story, and Snow White. The basic idea could be used with many other stories of course.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Monopoly: Boston Edition
description:
Classic Monopoly with the properties and currency, along with some special spaces and cards, re-themed with Boston-centric details.

Gameplay
On his turn, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned property, he has the opportunity to buy it and add it to his portfolio or allow the bank to auction it to the highest bidder. If a player owns all the spaces within a color group, he may then build houses and hotels on these spaces, generating even more income from opponents who land there. If he lands on a property owned by another player, he must pay that player rent according to the value of the land and any buildings on it. There are other places on the board which can not be bought, but instead require the player to draw a card and perform the action on the card, pay taxes, collect income, or even go to jail.

Goal
The goal of the game is to be the last player remaining with any money.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Injawara
description:
Injawara is a project co-financed by European Union that aims at promoting Development Education among youth of different European countries.

In this cooperative game at the beginning of each turn a new challenge is drawn and placed in a specific continent of the world map gameboard. All the other kind of challenges that are in the same continent make the related indicators to low down in the development track. If one of this indicators reaches the skull space, the game is over and the team has lost.

The team each turn chooses one resource on the world map, and may use special actions provided by a resource, then, the team may move a resource and/or answer to a question in order to solve a challenge.
Each challenge require the presence of a specific resource in the same continent to be solved.

Solving a challenge makes the indicator of that challenge to move three spaces up, on the development track and removes the challenge from the word map.
Moreover it allows the team to unlock the power of that resource, now available to be used in the next rounds.

There are 6 different continents and 8 different kind of challenge (each one related to one of the 8 Millennium Development Goals).
If the team manages to solve at least a challenge per continent and at least one challenge per MDG, the game is over and points are scored depending on the position of the various indicators on the development track; the world is a better place now!
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Chip Up!
description: Chip Up! is the fast-playing dice game that will have you stealing stacks of chips from your opponents or from the pot! Roll the dice to reveal which chip colors are fair game and whose chips are at risk. Play it safe by banking chips when you have the chance, or push your luck to add to your stack instead. When the pot is empty, the game is over and the tallest stack wins!

name: Monsuno
description:
Choose your Monsuno and battle using amazing Strike cards for intense action and incredible effects!

Monsuno is a two-player trading card game (TCG). Each player has three Monsuno creatures, and a hand of Strike cards used for summoning Monsuno from the "clip" or for enabling a Monsuno to attack.

The aim of the game is to knock out all three of your opponent's Monsuno.

name: Star Wars: Box Busters – Rebels TIE Fighter Attack
description:
From the box: "TIE Fighters chased after The Ghost in an attempt to capture them or destroy them."

Star Wars: Box Busters is a series of small plastic dioramas. The dioramas fold into a small plastic cube known as a Battle Cube. Each player needs their own Battle Cube to play.

The basic game uses a simple battle-dice mechanic. Advanced rules incorporate a Battle Cube's unique special abilities.

The Rebels TIE Fighter Attack Battle Cube portrays four TIE fighters attacking The Ghost ship from Star Wars: Rebels.
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Star Wars: Das große Lichtschwert Duell
description:
Players in Star Wars: Das große Lichtschwert Duell first need to collect either three different cards of the same side of the Force (Light or Dark) or collect three identical cards. Once they do this, they lay down the cards and challenge an opponent to a duel.

To duel, you press a button on an electronic device, then wait for the blue light on top of the device to go out. Whoever pulls out their lightsaber from the device first wins the cards, and once the deck is empty, whoever has collected the most cards wins.

Star Wars: Das große Lichtschwert Duell also includes variants that provide additional ways to play.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Emoji Cards
description:
Four or more players divide into two teams, then lay out 40 emoji cards on the table. When it's your turn, you pull a clue card from the deck -- it could feature any category from "Blockbuster Movies" to "Rock Stars and Legends" to "Children's Books" to "Animated TV."

You have 90 seconds to use the emoji to get your teammates to guess as many of the five clues on your clue card as possible. While you can't talk or make noises, anything goes with the emoji cards -- move them around, point at different parts, combine them however you need. After your turn, tally up your points and replace the emoji you used with new ones from the deck.

—user summary

name: Wij zijn...
description:
Wij zijn... ("We are...") is a card game consisting of 56 cards (5 cards with rules and the rest have positive words on them; one per card). The game can be played in two ways.

Either as a Simon Says game in which players in turn play a card and declare to whom they ascribe the positive ability. Every player in turn has to repeat all cards played before they can play a card themselves.
Or it can be played as a meta game over a period of time in which you need to say your own positive words and at the end you want some players to guess your words but not all players.

name: Reinos e Relíquias
description:
Reinos e Relíquias is a fantasy card game in which players take the role of a hero from one of three kingdoms (Light, Darkness and Neutral) trying to defeat heroes from other kingdoms and, by doing so, stealing relics to his kingdoms. Players can equip new itens, cast powerfull spells and recruit new allies playing cards from their hands. Each weapon/spell has a different range and power and, if the defending player does not evade or absorb the damage by using his armor, he subtracts his hitpoints. When a player reaches zero life, the attacking player takes one relic from the pile and one from the defeated player.
When all the relics are gathered, the players score relics for their kingdoms (based on the value for that particular kingdom printed on each relic card). The players with the most points (in other words, the kingdom with the most points) at the end, shares the victory.
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Inspire Game
description:
Inspire: Works of Mercy is all about learning to recognize the needs of other people and wanting to help them out as best you can be performing physical and spiritual acts of mercy. The game ends when only three unexplored "people in need" cards are on the table, and whoever has the most such cards wins.

Inspire: Works of Mercy includes several play variants.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Memory, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Turkey Catchin'
description:
Tom the Turkey is no dummy. He knows that Thanksgiving is right around the corner, and he needs to get out of here before you and your friends fence him in.

Players take turns playing fence pieces trying to capture Tom. But with every piece, Tom also makes a move! Plan your moves carefully, but if you get stuck, you can always lure Tom back with Turkey Feed.

The players win if they can make a complete fence around Tom. Tom wins if he makes it all the way off the map before the players fence him in.

name: Dino Volcano
description:
"The petrifying prehistoric race game"

Throw the dice to try to escape the lava. Each round the lava creeps further, and you have to score enough and not get stuck on 'bad' squares in order to keep ahead. The one that gets their dinosaur to the end first without being caught by the lava flow is the winner.

A little like Snakes and Ladders with lava making the board smaller every turn.

Contents:
6 x Dinosaur Piece's
12 x Lava Piece's
9 x Jigsaur Game Board Piece's
2 x Interlocking Volcano Piece's
1 x Die
1 x Timer

—user summary

name: Lucy Hammett's Texas Bingo
description:
Facts about the Lone Star State can be learned while playing Texas Bingo. A few characters are Alamo, Armadillo and Bluebonnet.

A creative spin on classic bingo featuring brilliant color photos and informative facts on the back of each calling card. Suggestions for different ways to “Bingo” are on the back of each game box to add interest to playing the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Quizoo
description:
It's a musical guessing game, but not as you know it! From "Ring of Fire" to "Despacito", see if you can hum these popular tunes into the kazoo for your teammates to guess.

Set contains: 4 kazoos, 100 songs and instruction card.

—description from the box

name: Piggy Pearls
description:
Splat! Oh no! Granny Smyth's pearl necklace has snapped – and now all the precious pearls are lying in the mud where the pigs wallow. The pigs immediately charge out to get as many pearls as possible. Help them by finding the right pearls as quickly as you can and placing them in your trough. Be the first to show off the perfect string of pearls!

Aim of the game:
The aim is to be the first to find the pearls that match the face-up pearl cards and get the most points. This means turning over the mud tiles as fast as you can.

The game consists of several rounds. One round is always played as follows:


Rooting (all pigs at the same time!)
Claiming the pearls
Checking the claim and awarding the pearl card
Preparing for the next round


The end of the game:
The game ends when there are not enough pearl cards left to make the row back up to three. Each player now counts up the points for all the pearl cards they have collected. The player with the most points is the winner. If more than one player scores the highest total, they are joint winners.

name: DIG!
description:
Super colorful HOWEVER an Icon-Driven card play design allows for 100% Colorblind Compatibility gameplay!

Fast play, quick card discovery action. Players bury (deal) piles of cards that contain various items, at increasing card values as the item itself is more valuable.

Players then search for these buried treasures, by using o of 4 different tools in the hand. the starting tool, as a Spoon and Fork, is the least likely digging apparatus! As such, you can peek at the top card in a pile with the spoon, and upon returning to that card on a later turn, DIG! it up with the fFork.

Players can upgrade their tools to DIG! faster by trading in found treasures for a Rake, Spade and Shovel. As players upgrade to these better tools, the no longer peek at piles, instead DIG! up cards right away.

Find more treasures per turn with each upgraded tool.... and avoid hidden bombs laced within the piles! Discover a bomb, loose your collected loot, and start your treasure collections all over again.

The player with the most treasure by the time all the piles are uncovered, wins!

With gameplay under 10 minutes, there is more than meets the eye. When do you upgrade? How many holes do you DIG! Can you avoid the bombs and leaving your opponent no other choices?

Fun, Fast, Gamer/NonGamer, All-Ages Excitement! 2 Players per deck, add a second deck for fully supported 4-player action.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Income, Memory, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Set-up

name: Astroid: Гладиаторы будущего
description:
Astroid: Гладиаторы будущего, Astroids: Gladiators of the Future is a tactical board game with collectible miniatures of fighting robots: Astroids.

Astroids are easily assembled without glue and can be painted with any model paints.
The set of the game includes 12 collectible miniatures of astroid robots, 12 armlists, elements for assembling fortifications, three cubes, two cardboard rulers, 40 sliding arrows, a legend, assembly instructions and rules of the game in Russian.

Astroids are remotely controlled robots designed specifically for heavy work on asteroids. They are equipped with a control computer, a biosensor unit, which allows you to control the robot using a “biopotential” helmet and overalls. When there were a lot of Astroid robots, and the demand for them fell, gladiatorial battles of Asteroids with a sweepstakes began to be very popular. Choose a squad of Astroid robots and test your robot control skills and win the arena.

To start playing, place various objects - books, boxes, building blocks and other elements.
When the field is ready, choose the edge of the field from which to start the game and place your robots no further than 10 cm from the edge.
Place your Robots' armlists next to it.
To determine who will go first, all players roll a dice, the one with the highest result will go first, then clockwise.

The player who is the first to destroy all enemies is declared the winner.

–user summary

name: Boat Canasta
description:
Boat Canasta is the fast-moving card game where teams score points by melding cards (combining at least 3 or more cards of the same rank). The goal of the game is for each team to create at least one Canasta, or meld of seven cards, in each round. Teams work in unison, and their luck can change depending on how the cards fall. Point values are printed directly on the cards for easy scoring.

To score the most points by creating Melds, Canastas and earning bonuses. The first team to reach 10,000 points wins the game. If both teams reach a score of 10,000 points in the same round, then the team with the most points wins. For a shorter game, players can agree on a lower point total before play begins, say 5,000 points.
mechanics: Hand Management, Melding and Splaying, Set Collection

name: 10 Clues
description: A trivia game where you get 10 clues to guess the answer. The player may make one guess per clue to identify the person, place, or thing. The more clues the player uses, the fewer points they earn (10 points for a correct guess on the first clue, 9 points on the second clue, 8 on the third, and so on). Players rotate reading the clues and guessing until each player has guessed a few cards (suggested play is 4 cards per each player). Whoever earns the highest points total wins the game.

name: Quartette
description:
Setup:
Alternate light and dark men on each of the back rows. Back rows will have 4 men each. Also the light and dark men will oppose each other across the board. (See picture)

Movement:
Players alternate moving by moving one man one square either horizontally or vertically. Diagonal movement is not permitted.

Goal:
To move your 4 men into a line either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.

Equipment

Rule sheet on dark red paper
4 dark men, 4 light men
4x4 grid gameboard with checkerboard coloring
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Catch The Cryptid/Hunt The Human
description:
Catch The Cryptid/Hunt The Human is a 5-10 minute secret role game with two identities; this 2 in 1 card game with beautiful artwork pits Cryptids vs. Humans. Utilize bluffing, hidden information, and deduction to find out who is the Cryptid (if playing Catch The Cryptid) or find out who is the Human (if playing Hunt The Human). What sets this game apart from other secret role games is all of the players could be Cryptids or Humans, and if guessed incorrectly, every player loses! Players only get 1 Action card to figure out hidden information but they may ask as many questions as they like; it's up to the other players to be truthful or to outright lie. Players must vote to decide and majority rules! Players may also choose to play a variant where 2 players can either be Cryptids or Humans, and the odds are stacked against you as both must be accused!

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Fantasy, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Mythology, Science Fiction
mechanics: Memory, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Voting
publishers: Meet Me At The Table Games

name: Fuchs-Alarm!
description:
The fox is trying to steal all chickens. Roll the dice and put the amount of chickens into the fox's pockets. If the pockets are full, he'll drop his pants and then you have to catch all the freed chickens with one hand.

The player who first fills their chicken coop wins.

This is a kid's dexterity game. There is a springload mechanism inside the fox plastic puppet that gets loaded bit by bit after pressing the fox's head which you have to do after putting the chickens into his pocket. After a random time this mechanism kicks in and retracts the pants.

name: Captain Scarlet and the Mysterons Adventure Game
description:
Based on the Supermarionation TV series by Gerry Anderson

The object of the game is to be the first person back to cloud base after picking up two location counters. If you are a spectrum agent you must fight the mysterons, free your colleagues from the mysterons' grip. If you are the mysterons you must foil spectrum agents and convert them to mysterons, and win for the mysterons.

Good luck and SIG
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Europa-spillet
description: Travel through Europe answering questions on European geography, history and culture. whoever completes the initiary first wins.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Home Builders
description: A real-life theme. We help to build as many homes as we can. The homes are from different cultures past and present, so we learn a bit about other kinds of shelter. Natural Disasters can strike and wreck what we build. We have to be ready to take Safety Measures at the right time. We also can use the Special Card that lets us Rebuild. The game nurtures discussion, planning and memory skills. Younger players start with a few homes. The more homes you add, the more complex the game!

name: Lost Kitties Game
description:
In this Lost Kitties board game, the kitties are lost in the factory and players have to help them find their friends. Kids move their Lost Kitties character pawn around the board, drawing cards, and flipping over mystery kitty tokens as they search for their squad members. The game includes a meme sticker and an accessory hidden inside the shaping compound.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Strange But True?
description:
Described by the Publisher/Designer:

Do you think you know when a published headline is Strange But True? Do you think you can write a headline that other player will think is Strange But True? Now you can do both while playing a fun game that allows players to wager points whether actual published headllines are true or unverified. You'll be amazed at how wacky people in our world can be.

name: Rund ums Taschengeld
description:
Boardgame for 2 – 4 children (Ages 6 to 10) in which they have to manage their pocket money. Thematically based on a fun-fair visit during the holidays the players have to spend their money on various items. But with their limited amount of money they can't afford everything they want - they have to earn some money. Only if they are able to manage their pocket money successfully will they win the game.

Gameplay:
The players start with a given amount of pocket money and move across the board rolling one dice (d6). Movement is allowed in any direction and players may move less spaces than their dice roll. On special card fields they are able to fulfill six actions (spending money on several items and earning money to afford them) which are needed to win the game. The placement of the action cards is strictly ruled - making following-up cards harder to buy things (prices will rise) and harder to earn money (earnings will decrease). After each players' turn the turn marker is moved one day further. When the 7th turn ends (= one week) all players receive a new amount of pocket money.

The first player who has fulfilled all his actions, wins. If there is a tie, the player with most of the cash wins.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Great Shakespearean Deaths: Card Game
description:
A card game depicting various deaths that occur in Shakespeare's work. Each card shows an illustration of a Shakespearean death (illustrated by Chris Riddell) and a number of categories: Speed of Death, Gore & Brutality, Fairness, Piteousness, Dramatic Quality and Last Words. Each category is accompanied by a value from one to ten.

Two to five players are dealt all the cards and hold their hand with only one card visible on top of their deck. The game is played in rounds. The current first player chooses a category. The round winner is the holder of the card that shows the highest value for the chosen category on all the currently visible cards. The round winner adds all the visible cards to their hand and everyone turns over a new card. The winner of the round then chooses the next category. The winner of the game is the first player to hold all of the cards.

name: Shroom Boom
description:
In the card game Shroom Boom players are hunting strange shrooms and everyone is trying to collect as many as they can before the season ends. The experimental shroom collectors evaluate useful shrooms by tasting them. However, tasting the wrong shrooms could lead you to hospital at the end of the game.

The game play is mostly memory driven but very challenging. During the game, players exchange the location of known shrooms with other players for their info on known shrooms while trying to memorize the current locations of the shrooms they are tracking. As soon as a player thinks he knows where to find a good set of shrooms, he starts to collect and taste them. Successful tasting makes the collector feel better (positive points), but tasting unknown shroom causes damage (negative points). If the player has less than zero points at the end of the game, he is considered to be sick.

name: A B Seas
description: You make the sea out of the box, and have the "fish" in the sea. Each player takes a player mat and catches a fish. If it matches the letters on his player mat, the player keeps it. If not, the player throws it back. The first player to catch all the fish they need wins the game. This is a game that teaches upper/lower case letters.

name: Pillow Fight
description:
Game #8 of the "Pick Your Battle" series of card games from Toresh Games

Players take turns drawing a card from a deck of 120 cards of Single and Double Pillow hits, Single and Double Pillow bursts, Pillow Piles, Exploded Rooms, and Mom and Dad cards. After drawing a card, the player may hit other players with the Single or Double Pillow Hits; place a Pillow Pile in front of them to throw pillows in front of them rather than draw a card; take out a Pillow Pile with an Exploded Room; use Single or Double Pillow bursts to remove pillow hit(s), or place it in front of them to protect them from a pillow hit; skip someone by giving them a Mom and Dad card; or discard the card if it cannot be played. Once all cards have been drawn and played or discarded, the player with the fewest remaining hits is the winner.

Game instructions include 2-player and Strategic Play variants.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game

name: Killer Instinct
description: Based on the homonym video-game, this collectible card game deals with punch and kicks and... more fights.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme

name: Sea Hawks
description: Sea Hawks is played on a board that is an authentic map of the Carribean in the 18th century. Ten chests are buried in the islands, but only one contains treasure. Each player is a pirate captain searching for that chest; navigating dangerous waters, picking up clues, battling with rival ships in the quest for the hidden treasure.

name: Compact Sprint
description:
The game is a simple race between a snail, a tortoise, a squirrel and a hare. Each rolls a custom die, the hare being swift and the snail slow. To compensate, each animal's track is of varying length, so they are roughly matched.

Diset has another game of the same name ("Sprint"), but the latter is a completely different bicycle racing game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Super Mario Bros.
description:
A re-enactment of the original Super Mario Bros. computer games by Nintendo. Knock down the bricks to get to one of four possible locations for the princess.

This is a different game from Super Mario Bros., evidenced by board layout and appearance.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: Små kloka barn på piratäventyr
description:
The little smart pirate shall go from the sinking ship to the island there the pirates treasure is located. On his way to the island the pirate has to answer some questions. The right answer can give him one or several gold-coins. But on his way there is also dangerous things that want to stop the pirate from reaching the island. Like the dreadful pirate captain, the evil octapussy and the hungry shark.
The pirate with the most gold is the winner
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Nautical, Pirates, Trivia

name: Check Lines
description: A two player game using an asymmetric board. Each player has five pieces and to win must be the first to position these so that they have two straight lines, both of three men (i.e. one piece must be used in both lines)

name: The Game of the North Pole
description:
A roll-and-move race game portraying the hazards faced by Arctic explorers. The game was first published in 1909 by McLoughlin Bros. and again in 1910 by J.W. Spear. The rules of the two versions were slightly different.

In the McLoughlin version, up to four may play. An "indicator" (spinner?) is used to generate numbers from one to six for movement purposes. The goal is to be the first player to move to the North Pole spot and back to start. Jumping over the piece of another player causes the jumped piece to be moved three spaces backward on the route home (and three more if that spot is occupied).

--user summary

The North Pole Game is to the child what a cinematography lecture by [polar explorer] Sir Ernest Shackleton is to a grown-up. During the game all incidents of a voyage of Polar exploration are met, e.g. sturdily built whaler caught in the ice pack, landing party building snow hut, engaging Eskimos for the journey, shooting Walrus and Seal, admiring the Aurora Borealis as it stretches athwart the sky. Here they are making a sledge dash for the pole, and at last planting the flag upon the untrod solitudes that surround the Axis of the Earth.

--publisher description
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Alien Galaxy
description:
Guided by the voice of Mission Control, Squadron Commanders must avoid deadly Laser fire, pierce Meteor storms, defense missile systems and many other perils of the Alien Galaxy....Surround yourselves with the sound of Intergalactic Adventure as the audio cassette tape included with the game dictates the moves....

The object of the game is to maneuver your spacecraft avoiding the hazards, black holes etc ..The winner is the last player with any of their spacecraft surviving..

name: FloridaOpoly
description:
FloridaOpoly is a monopoly style game with a Florida travel theme. Features a colorful board and pink condos instead of hotels. The cards represent various Florida cities and tourist attractions.

Global Games Ltd. (c)1997
publishers: Global Games Ltd., Late for the Sky Production Company

name: My Little Ladybug
description: Full title is My Little LadyBug Fly Away Home game. Players try to be the first to collect three different colored baby bug chips for their ladybug house. A plastic ladybug acts as a spinner when placed on top of each player's flower base as well as a device which shoots out the chips when her head is pressed. No reading required. Ages 3 - 6.

name: Kiwi Quiz
description:
Kiwi Quiz is an educational card game designed & made in New Zealand.
Included are 400 cards & 1600 questions - ALL about New Zealand. Questions are general knowledge questions from a range of areas. The questions are set at 4 different levels - so that a range of different ages may play.

Topics covered include:
History , Geography , Sports , Birds, Animals, Fauna, Politics, Famous people, Music , Mori, Film, Place Names, Literature, Climate, Business, Art, Technology, Disasters, World Firsts, Quotes , Music, General Knowledge

name: Snuffy Race
description:
The goal of Snuffy Race is for players to propel their dog along the winding path, using a small plastic bellows against the dog’s fan-shaped tail, right into the bowl in the center which contains dog bones.

As soon as a dog has reached the bowl, that player collects a bone, moves their dog back to the start of their path, and sets off again to get another bone.

If the dog falls over or falls off the path, then it must be returned to the start of the path.

The player whose dog retrieves the most bones is the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Racing

name: Keep on humming
description: Party game where players have to guess which song is being hummed. Part of a series of games published by John Lewis and Ginger Fox Ltd.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Wickie: Schatz Ahoi!
description:
Description from the back of the box:

"Vickie the Viking" and his Strong Men are setting sail to capture merchandise, golden coins, jewelry and diamonds.
With some fortune rolling the die and willing to take some risk you'll help the vikings to gather many valuable treasures.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Junior Kimble
description:
Junior Kimble is Kimble variant for younger children.

Players race around the board with their pawns, but color die replaces the regular die in the Pop-O-Matic. Players simply move to the next matching colored spot based on the die roll. First player to get all their pawns to finish is the winner.

name: Pizza Paletti
description:
Hungry customers order pizzas and the players have to get the dough and the ingedients for the pizza. As soon as they have a complete pizza, they deliver it to the customer by bike or by car.
The orders appear as cards with a pizza and the desired ingredients and the first one who delivers the correct pizza, gets the fee.

name: Meine Goldene Wetterau
description:
Take an exiting journey across the Wetterau, a broad fertile landscape in the western German state of Hessen!

In Meine Goldene Wetterau, players guide a single hiker along the paths through the cities and communities of the Wetterau, trying to direct the hiker to locations that match the cards they hold in hand. Each player has a hand of four cards, with the remaining cards being placed next to the game board as a deck. On a turn, a player takes one or both of these actions in this order:


Move the hiker along the path 1-3 locations in a direction of their choice.
Play location cards from their hand that match where the hiker is located or where it started the turn.


At the end of their turn, a player refills their hand to four cards. Play continues until the deck runs out and one player has no cards left in hand. Whoever has played the most location cards wins!

name: Election Day
description:
Election Day is a card game where you, the candidate, are attempting to collect the votes of as many special interest groups as possible. Cards are played face-up during your turn in an area called your caucus. Here all candidates can see your vote tallies. It is possible to split votes or use special cards to effect the number of votes in your opponents caucus.

The endgame begins when a candidate plays the "Polls Open" card. Now the game will end when ANY player plays the "Polls Closed."

It should be noted that Election Day is a parody game. And the humor concerning the special interest groups can be very sharp. Jabs are taken at Big Business and the Tobacco Industry. The recount card comes with a tourism logo for the state of Florida.

Election Day was designed by Ed Evans for Alien Menace Games for 2-4 players Ages 13 and up.
mechanics: Hand Management, Line Drawing, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: She's Charmed and Dangerous
description: She's Charmed & Dangerous: the pass it, match it, and grab it game. Players race to collect a fab foursome of She's Charmed and Dangerous characters, and then grab charms from the center playing area before they all disappear. The last player left in the game is the glamor girl!

name: Monopoly: Utah
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Monopoly with Utah themed spaces and cards.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Beverly Hills
description:
The object of this game is to accumulate status. You do this by trading your Ford up to a Rolls, Mercedes or Cadillac, by dining at the "right" places and, of course, by spending extravagantly. Each player starts with a credit line of 25 k$ (cash being too tacky for this game); you win by gaining 500 status point *and* having at least 10 k$ left.

You move about town (the board is a simplified street map of Beverly Hills) and follow the instructions of Status, Bank and Jet Set cards. When you reach the Gold Streets, you get to patronize various establishments, where you spend money and spin the Status Wheel (which directs you to instruction booklets).

The box is lined with a fake velvet which leaves tiny short hairs everywhere. Eeek.

name: Twin Peaks Murder Mystery Game
description:
The famous television show by David Lynch and Mark Frost was one of the pop culture hits of the 1990's; in this British board game the players each take the role of one of the show's principal characters and try to discover who BOB is using as a host to commit murders.

The game includes:

Playing Board

1 arrow spinner (attaches to Playing Board)

Agent Cooper's Handbook (rules)

6 Pentagon Puzzles (30 pieces in total)

1 Pack of Suspect Cards (50 cards in total)

75 Donut Counters

1 Regular and 1 Poker Dice

6 Playing Pieces

name: Der Blaumilch-Kanal
description: In digging the BlueMilk Canal, problems arise. An grown-up mix of tiles, voting, wordplay and satire, impenetrable to non-German speakers.

name: Chop Stix
description:
Test your skill with chopsticks by stacking 70 wooden logs as high you dare!

How high will your wooden pagoda soar before disaster
befalls you?

Contains:
70 poplar logs
3 pairs of conventional chopsticks
a scorepad
a pencil
One pair of ROOKIE STIX, the easy to use plastic chopsticks that allow anyone to play.
publishers: Paul Lamond Games Ltd, TDC Games, Inc.

name: Le Clou Moqueur
description:
Can you choose the correct hammers and be the quickest to drive the nail in?

There are 3 decks of cards with nails. The cards are numbered 1/3, 5/10 and 20/45. And there is a deck of hammer cards. The hammer cards represents the force which the nails are hit. Players try to smash the nails with the hammers. When the points aren't reached nothing happens. If a player oevrrun the points on the nail card or hit the nail with the hand than he/she receives a Mockin Nail' card.
A player who has collected 3 'Mockin Nail' cards is eliminated from the game. The last player wins the game.

name: Heave The Heffers
description:
The heifers (little plastic cows) are rolled like dice. Points are awarded to each heifer according to the position in which it lands. If both heifers land in the same position the points are doubled. The aim of the game is to score as close as possible to 32 points. If any player exceeds 32 points they are out of the game. The game ends when all players pass on their turn.

Similar to:

Pass the Pigs

name: Lügen-Kniffel
description: Yahtzee with a twist.

name: Great States Junior
description:
From the publisher:

Based on the best selling game, Great States!, this junior version provides the same fun, hurry-up action while introducing young players to the map of the 50 states. Find the shape! Find the picture! Find the name! Kids will have a blast searching the game board to find where things are as they travel along the red, white and blue game path. Even pre-readers can play by matching the objects on the cards to the pictures on the board.

name: Gody
description:
Gody ("The Rut") is a Polish card game for two to five players.
It was published as a X-mass'03 joke by Portal Publishing.

Players are the Orcs and try to make the only orcish girl choose one of them. Ostensibly a romantic game.

Components include 45 cards and no box.

name: Dragon Keeper
description: Oh noes! While Momma Dragon was out hunting she was away her eggs hatched and her babies wandered into town. As the chosen Dragon Keepers it is up to you to take care of the babies and get them back to the cave before their Momma gets angry and comes to town looking for them.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: Ett Filmspel
description:
A Swedish quiz game about movies. Contains 500 questions in 6 different categories ("Festivals/Awards", "Popcorn", "Characters", "Actors/Actresses", "Quotes" & "Swedish film").

The player in turn roll a die to choose which category to answer a question from. The winner is the player who has the most points when all cards have been used once.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Backword
description:
BACKWORD is a new, fun and different wordgame.

The game is divided into two fases. All players draw 8 letter-cards and make a word. Afterwards the players atempt to guess each others words, by gruadually show the letters - one by one - from behind!

The game is for adults, but is simple enough for larger children. Also possible to play in teams.
2-5 players
Age: 15+

name: Flinker Willi
description:
Flinker Willi is a quick-playing word game in which players first lay out a circle of 21 letter chips, each of which has one of nine categories hidden on the obverse side. The wooden Willi figure is stacked on 13 wood tiles and placed on one of the letter chips at random.

In a round, players start by revealing the category under the chip lying to the right of Willi. Then one player rolls a die and everyone must count left from Willi to find the chip lying this many spaces away, after which the players must race to yell out something starting with that letter that matches the revealed category. The first player to do so receives one of the wood tiles on Willi if her answer is correct; otherwise she must return one tile to Willi.

To continue play, move Willi to the chosen letter tile, then start a new round. The first player to collect four wood tiles wins!

name: Enthüllt
description: This is a party game with question cards in five categories (love, sex, life, spirituality and leisure). The active player rolls a color die to determine a category, reads the question on the first card of the corresponding color and answers it. The other players form a jury and award 0-5 points for the answer. The first player to reach a certain number of points (depending on the number of players) is the winner.

name: La Boîte à Enquêtes Criminelles
description:
Another version of the La Boîte à énigmes.
There are some crimes to be solved in this game.

Players or teams compete in crime-solving (sometimes timed, sometimes not) in order to score points in different categories. The first team (or player) to score a point in 4 of the 6 categories wins the game.

Every turn, the current player/team draws a card and hands it to the Dealer, a non-competitive figure that reads it aloud and then manages the competition between the people trying to solve the riddle.

name: The Heroic Dragon Ball Z Adventure Game
description:
Dragon Ball Game edited in English. The objective is to get all 7 dragon balls,travelling a board where there are 10 important locations which have 10 balls of dragon (only 7 are the real) and where events are produced by the cards.

The battles are decided by a bout of throwing balls to a crater where you put a figure to be cut down. The movement is done by obtaining dragon ball points, to be stealing in the game.

An entertaining game for little ones and customizable for more fans.

name: UNO: Disney Planes – Fire & Rescue!
description: The fun spreads like wildfire with UNO Disney Planes: Fire & Rescue! Classic UNO rules apply, but the addition of a special rule and 4 extra cards gives players a chance to experience all new game changing moments! When you play a Water Drop Card, each blue card in your hand acts like water: empty them ALL into the discard pile like water from your tanks putting out a fire. Then you get to choose the next color to resume play! Fans of the film will recognize their favorite characters—like Dusty Crophopper, Skipper Riley and Blade Ranger—all of which are featured in true-to-movie detail on the cards they play. And do not forget to yell "UNO" when you only have one card left! Includes 112 cards and instructions.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: 12 Realms: Dungeonland
description:
The standalone game 12 Realms: Dungeonland expands the fairytale world with a dungeon-crawling game in which powerful magic has mutated the lands of the 12 realms, invading their tales and attempting to change them forever. Evil spreads everywhere, twisting and mixing the tales in sinister stories where the ending is never good. Horrific villains have come back for their revenge on the heroes of the tales, this time more dangerous than ever. The source of this magic is unknown, yet whispers of an ancient evil spread through the lands. The once green fields and lush forests are now dark and dead as nothing grows anymore and all the beauty of the realms is gone. With more tales being affected by the dark magic every day the heroes of the tales combine their powers to save the 12 realms and banish this evil once and for all.

In the game, the players take on the roles of famous folklore characters like Little Riding Hood and Prince Charming, each with a unique ability, then attempt to travel across the tales to stop the great villains that have returned by dark magic to change their endings to bad ones and cast the realms into eternal darkness. In their quest to fight this great evil, the heroes face great challenges, but they will have at their disposal powerful weapons, skills, and ancient magic. They will travel across many tales gathering clues about the source of this mysterious evil, while fighting for their lives using a unique combat system that features a set of completely custom dice. Through their adventures, the heroes will gather experience, hone their skills or acquire new ones using an innovative skill-tree system offering tons of customization and options, collect gold, and find powerful artifacts to aid them against the foul magic that has spread through the lands.

The heroes will face strong villains and their minions with a new A.I. system that allows the bosses to react to certain circumstances while utilizing amazing abilities that will challenge the heroes' might and resourcefulness. The battle for the 12 realms has just begun, yet time grows short as more and more tales are being corrupted by this foul magic. Will the heroes be able to find and stop the source behind it before it's too late, or will the tales be lost forever into twisted evil versions of themselves?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Boereplaas
description:
User summary:

You have a farm in South Africa, your worker is Oom Sakkie, but somehow, he is doing everything wrong. Work out how you can run your farm best.

Every player gets a player aid, which is your farm. Every player gets 1630 Rand to start with. Shuffle all cards and place them in the middle of the table.

First, a player draws a card and decide if he want to buy the goods, livestock or other supplies. If the card is an action, the player has to take the action immediately and win or lose some money.

The player who first fills the 10 spaces on their farm with the appropriate goods wins the game.
mechanics: Events, Move Through Deck, Simulation, Tile Placement

name: Jump In
description:
Jump In is a fast-paced card game created by Lycee Classique Echternach students (Luxemburg) and developed by D. Kirps and C. Kruchten. The clever combination of dice and cards throws demands constant attention, good reflexes and provides high playing pleasure.
—description from the publisher (English)

Jump In ist ein reaktionsschnelles Kartenspiel, erfunden von Studenten des Lycee Classique Echternach (Luxemburg) und entwickelt durch D. Kirps und C. Kruchten. Die pfiffige Kombination aus wuerfeln und Karten abwerfen verbindet ständige Aufmerksamkeit, gute Reflexe und hohen Spielspass.
—description from the publisher (German)

Jump In est un jeu de cartes rapide invente par des etudiants du Lycee Classique echternach (Luxembourg) et developpe par D. Kirps et C. Kruchten. La combinaison intelligente de lancer le de et defausser ses cartes attire l'attention et necessite de bons reflexes chez les joueurs qui y prennent plaisir rapidement.
—description from the publisher (French)

name: Ninja Bees
description:
It turns out that competition for flowers and the pollen that they produce has become fierce. Regular bees can't tack it. Killer bees can'd do it either. Who can? Ninja bees!

Your Ninja Bee starts in a Hive and has to wage a stealthy path through charted territory to a flower and back safely to the Hive. But beware, for other bees are looking for the same flowers and are not above sabotaging your mission - in fact they relish the chance.

Ninja Bees is a competitive card game for two or three players.
It is mentally challenging (meaning it will hurt your head).
It may ruin all of your friendships.
Includes 46 cards play cards and 2 instruction cards, all 3.25" x 3.75" hexagonal and in a beautiful box.

—description from the designer

name: Talent Show
description:
Talent Show is a silly party game with a variety of different challenges. Play against the game...or each other! Do you have what it takes to win the talent show? Roll the dice to complete the challenge for the round. Challenges include: drawing, singing, miming and combining words together. You will score points if the other players can guess what you are trying to represent.

—description from the publisher

name: Italian Railroads
description:
This is Italian Railroads! The game is for 3-5 players and plays in less than an hour. It has one page of rules and new mechanisms. The suggested age is 47 and up.

The game is won by having the most victory points. Italy starts in the Kingdom Phase, advances to the Unification Phase, Privatisation Phase, then to the Modernization Phase, ending in the European Union Phase. Player have a choice during their turn: Take Stock or Place Stock.

The game is short, simple and moves fast. It requiring constant vigilance. It can get nasty, especially with the special rules for the Sicilian railroad.

—user summary

name: Mish Match
description:
In Mish Match, players race to spot and slap cards that match in unusual ways.

Get in the mix with Mish Match, the fastest fun you’ll ever have! In this competitive, fast-action party game, be the first to spot and slap matching theme from a variety of Animals, Colors, Foods, and Moods! The objective changes as categories to match are called at the top of each round. Collect the stack if you’re on point. Call it, flip it, slap it, claim it! The player with the most cards when the deck runs out, wins!

name: Wormy Apples
description:
Part of the "Lunch Box" line of games from Fundex. From the publisher's website:

"Nobody likes worms in their apples! Rid your apple of the pesky worms first and you win! Do whatever it takes -- pull worms out, give a worm to an opponent or even trade for an apple with fewer worms. Lunch box tin contains 4 plastic apples, 32 worms, spinner, and instructions."

Spin a spinner and follow the resulting action shown. The first to empty his apple piece of worms wins the game.

name: Community
description:
From the box:

A game about communal living. We try to develop a happy, complete village. There are hardships and opportunities. There are Bad Feelings to handle with Love and Forgiveness. The Meeting hall is the heart of the community. If we succeed in building a community, we all win together. A medium-complicated game that explores both material and spiritual values.

The Game of Community: the non-competitive game based on the principle of co-operation.

Build a community together, work through hardships together, develop your resources together. Play together, not against each other.

Players cooperate in this draw-cards-and-move game, moving around a track, collecting resources and trying to supply enough resources to recreation, industry, necessities, education and inner life to create a complete community. The game also uses event cards including love, unity, work, plain-speaking and bad feeling cards, which players accumulate.

Depending on which variants are used, the players can lose, unlike some co-operative games. This can happen if the players don't have any resources to pay for a harmful event, or if all the players are immobilized.

Players: "4 are ideal, but more or less can certainly play and sometimes a very exciting game can be played with ten."
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Professor Noggin's National Parks
description:
Professor Noggin travels around to develop a game that celebrates our beloved parks, which have helped preserve history, heritage, and the natural beauty of North America for the enjoyment of all its citizens.

Card topics include:
Eastern Woodland Parks
Park Safety
First Peoples Heritage
Paleontological Parks
Archaeological Parks
Park Recreation
Prairie Parks
Yosemite National Park
Yellowstone National Park
Death Valley National Park
Everglades National Park
Grand Canyon National Park
Big Bend National Park
Banff National Park
Flowers of the Parks
Seashore Parks
Mountain Parks
Historical Parks
Desert Parks
Parks of Hawaii
Great_Smoky_Mountains_National_Park
Volcano Parks
Civil War Parks
Parks of Alaska
Caves & Caverns
Acadia National Park
Parks of Canada
Parks of California
Badlands National Park
Endangered Wildlife

name: Spel van het jaar 1998
description:
Spel van het jaar 1998 (dutch for 'game of the year') offers a full-view of the year as a quiz game; an educational question/answer game. The most important, sensational and talked about moments of the year will be questioned in 1100 questions of October 1997 till October 1998.
The first to collect five different colors (corresponding with question categories) chips wins the game.

Contents;
112 question cards
25 year chips
1 color-die

name: 8mal durch Ostfriesland
description:
This game advertises the Northwestern German region of Ostfriesland and was published by a PR agency. The mechanisms strongly resemble Monopoly. When reaching a region, you can buy the corresponding card and then individual sights and places in that region (similar to houses or hotels in Monopoly). There are also event cards which also give information about Ostfriesland.

From the Alte Spiele website:

8 times by Ostfriesland,

a lively and informative tour of East Friesland

for 2-6 persons
10 years and up

Everyone makes a journey through East Friesland and its adjacent areas. He learns to know the country with all the trimmings.

At the beginning of the journey - which is a kind of rally - everyone gets part Ehmer travelers checks at a certain level. These are issued by the East Friesland Bank. These checks can pay fees and fee events.

During the game, players can also take money if he has leased islands, cities, towns and sights or other attractions for sports and entertainment. After each trip by each player gets a Ostfriesland Ostfriesland Cup. This cup has a value of 2000, -. Now you can begin the new holiday and eight times. The purpose of the game is to know not only Ostfriesland and its villages, but also their sights. Relation is the game with profits, speculation, fees, offices and duties. Who his vacation plans and financially properly calculated, buys and sells early enough or offices to add, has won at the end. Who has the best tactic?

name: Hufvudstaden
description:
Trivia game about Stockholm with 1500 questions.

The object of the game is to be the first to claim an area of the city by answering questions or being lucky with the dice.

Event cards can be used to steal questions and more.

name: Star Wars: The Clone Wars – Angriff der Jedi
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Support your favorite heroes in the fight against the droids! In Star Wars: The Clone Wars - Angriff der Jedi, you want to fight as many droids as possible as you score points at the end of the game if you collect more of a type than anyone else. Super-powered opponents also await you in battle...
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Fresh Trax
description:
Fresh Trax is a light “roll and move” type card game with a 3-D board and a snowboarding theme.

From the publisher’s web site: “Check out FreshTrax, the new board game from the makers of the HuckDoll. Take the lifts up, then ride through the trees, hike to higher ground or hit the terrain park. But be sure to collect a FreshTrax card on the way, cause you need one to win. Your FreshTrax card isn't all that safe anyway, cause your friends can pass you and take it away!”

From the back of the box: “Fresh Trax the board game captures the excitement of downhill skiing and snowboarding in a box. Shred your way through awesome terrain, including high traverse, hiking across, and a miniature terrain park. Race across the entire mountain, draw LIFT and TRAIL action cards, and be the first in your group to finish with Fresh Trax.”

Components:
Trail Map
Spinning Board
Ski & Snowboard Spinner
Ski & Snowboard Playing Pieces
