6 3-D Inserts (mountains and terrain park that mount onto the game board, similar to The Game of Life)
Lift Cards
Trail Cards
Lift Die

Rules in brief:
Draw Lift cards to get up the mountain. At the top of the lift, pick a trail to ride down, then pick Trail cards to determine what actions happen to you on your way down the hill. Win by drawing a Fresh Trax card and getting back to the finish line first.

name: Greedy Gator Game
description: Greedy Gator Game: The toucans and the monkeys are trying to cross the bridge to take home their fruit, but in opposite directions. With a hungry alligator waiting below, they need to be careful and get across without getting knocked off to become prey. It's light strategy mixed with suspense and unpredictable destruction as players slide the alligator roller at the rotating planks of the bridge both in an attempt to knock their opponents off and to determine how many spaces they can move. The trick is to figure out how many spots to advance each of the movers. The first team across the bridge wins, but remember, you don't want to be knocked off and sent back with the hungry alligator lurking below.

name: Jack Labrador
description:
Imagine Rock-Paper-Scissors, but good. Imagine four people could play at the same time (and it was still good).

Jack Labrador is a high-action, take-that beer and pretzels card game. It adds two new symbols to traditional Rock-Paper-Scissors, ability cards, and a soupçon of strategy to keep things interesting.

The Jack Labrador deck consists of 110 cards, comprising three games:

MOTOR CITY SHOWDOWN
The flagship game, for 2-4 players. 30-60 minutes.
Players attempt to out-strategize or out-guess their opponents, playing and anteing cards and throwing Rock-Paper-Scissors(-Jack-Labrador). Action cards can affect who wins ties, steal an opponent’s anted cards, or if the stars align, cause a Motor City Showdown, where the entire deck of points is on the line! Cards are points, and the first player to reach a predetermined total (usually 500 or 1000), wins.

SPELL MY NAME
A quicker, heads-up game, 2-4 players. 30 minutes.
Players attempt to win five cards spelling J-A-C-K-Labrador via a series of one-on-one Rock-Paper-Scissors(-Jack-Labrador). Play a single hand or play for points.

PINK SLIP
Per the creator, “The ultimate card game for delivering the thrill of victory and the agony of defeat.” Each copy of Jack Labrador comes with a single Pink Slip, meant to be signed and dated by the owner. This can be anted against another owner’s Pink Slip—winner keeps both Pink Slips and earns bragging rights for life.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Sudden Death Ending, Take That

name: Gargoyles
description:
Players choose one of four gargoyle characters. The gameboard is a four level tower. The object of the game is to reach the top level to rescue Elisa, the heroine, and defeat Xanatos, the villain. A player must battle any enemy pawns that share the same space as one's own gargoyle otherwise one may advance.

A player advances by following the random instructions of a spinner. A player does battle by choosing a tactic, each of which has a fifty-fifty chance of victory.

The game is based on the animated television series.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Flutsch
description: Try to catch the most fish your crew of fishermen, but be careful. Other players try to steal your fish or change the fishing nets. Sometimes your crew may go overboard or all the fish or gone because the Flutsch card is drawn.

name: Instant Replay
description: Players try to make an exact copy of a tile design that was created by another player before the timer runs out.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Do Over!
description:
The game of second chances

Do Over!™ is the fast paced game where everything can change at a moment’s notice. Just when you think you have your opponent right where you want them, it’s a “Do Over!” Look out for the “bomb” card, as it will level the payload you were about to unleash on your foe! Be the first to get rid of your cards to claim victory.

Try playing Do Over!™ just once - it’s a game you’ll want to “Do Over” again and again!

name: The Chronicles of Narnia: Prince Caspian Quest for the Throne Adventure Game
description:
Game is a basic roll and move where players move their pawns about the track on the board trying to win a series of five battles. Players earn one jewel for their crown for each battle they win. The first player to win all five jewels and be first back to Aslan wins the game by crowning Prince Caspian as king of Narnia.

The game includes:
Game board
6 translucent battle dice (6 side)
1 large movement die (6 side)
12 plastic stands
30 jewels in 5 different colors
Deck of battle cards
Deck of helper cost cards
6 cardboard character stand ups
6 cardboard Helper stand ups
Instruction pamphlet.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Memo+
description:
Memo+ is a game, or rather six (!) games, from Tactic, all played with the same memory tiles. Rules are provided in twelve different languages for all six game variants:

Memo: A game variant that copies classic Memory (see https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/7688/memory)

Bang!: Tiles are mixed and placed face down. Players take turn flipping the tiles. When two identical tiles appear, players must react quickly and try to put their hands on the first tile, calling out "Bang!".

Fast Fingers: All cards are dumped on the table in a mess. Someone shouts "Go!" and all players then try to collect as many pairs as possible. I think of it as "Galaxy Trucker" for non-gamers. :)

The House: Another variant of matching pairs, with only half of the tiles spread out on the table, and the other tiles piled on top of each other. First, a player draws a tile from the pile, then he/she tries to find the matching tile on the table.

Trio: Basically a variation of "The House" (see above), where you draw three tiles instead of one.

Four in a row: Basically a variation of "The House" (see above), where you draw four tiles instead of one.

name: Disney Frozen Frantic Forest
description:
A wild windstorm has blown snowflakes all around the forest. So Olaf’s taken refuge inside a mighty tree. Will you be the player to reveal Olaf’s hiding place and bring the forest alive with a soaring surprise? In Frozen Frantic Forest Game, players move along the board, collecting and hanging snowflakes on the tree branches as they go. Whose snowflake will cause the tree to open, sending Olaf through the air? Find out in the game where the fun really flies!

As players take turns, one player will hang the leaf that causes the tree to open and Olaf to come soaring from his hiding place! Kids will learn valuable skills as they play. Color matching, strategy and counting are reinforced as players travel the board and hang snowflakes on the mighty tree.

—description from the publisher

name: Rebound Ramp It Up
description:
Based on the classic action game Rebound, Rebound Ramp It Up adds a new dimension. The second half of the board is height adjustable, with pits at each scoring ledge. The scoring ledges are worth 100, 200, 300 or 400 points. At the top of the ramp is a bonus basket that is worth 600 points. Each player has three pucks to score with. The first player to reach 3000 points is the winner.

There are 3 game options:

High Point (for 2 players) - Players earn points by landing on the scoring ledges. Pucks that fall into the pits score zero points.

Slam Dunk (for 2 players) - Players only earn points by landing in the pits. Pucks not in a pit score zero points.

Solo Slinger (for 1 player) - The player tries to score 3000 points in the fewest number of rounds, using all six points. Pucks landing in a pit score zero points.

Re-implements:

Rebound

name: Odd Bodz
description: Meet Wacky Jackie, Bill Loney and Moe DeLawn along with 21 of their off-the-wall friends in this hilarious card game of match-making and memory. Try to collect the most odd pairs by drawing from the deck or asking other players for cards. If you ask someone and they have the matching character, you win the pair. But be careful who you ask for or you might lose your match! Contents: 48 Character Cards and Rules of Play

name: Pizza Party
description:
(publisher blurb):
A mouth-watering way to learn fractions! This set of 12 realistic 12" (30. 5cm) pizzas is the "main course" upon which eight different fraction games are based. Includes 12 cardboard pizzas cut into halves, thirds, fourths, sixths, eighths, ninths, twelfths, and sixteenths, plus two spinners and an activity sheet. Comes in a sturdy pizza parlor box! For two to six players.

(from box front):
Pizza Party Includes:
- 2 spinners
- Activity Sheet with 8 Games
- 59 Full-Color Fraction Pizza Pieces

Players Will:
- Identify halves, thirds, fourths, sixths, eights, ninths, twelfths, and sixteenths
- Identify fractional parts of the whole
- Match fractional notation to concrete models
- Identify equivalent fractions and fractional parts
- Subtract fractional parts from a whole and other fractions

For 2-6 players
Grades 1-6

(description of the 8 games from the activity sheet):
1. Pizza Cover-Up
Skill/Purpose: Identifying the fractional parts that make up a whole.
Goal: The goal is to be the first player to cover a pizza with pizza pieces.

2. Pizza Play-Off
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models; identifying the fractional parts that make up a whole.
Goal: The goal is to be the first player to complete your pizza, with no overlapping pieces.

3. Pizza Pickup
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models.
Goal: The goal is to be the player with the most pieces after eight turns.

4. Penny a Pair
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models; identifying equivalent fractions/fractional parts.
Goal: The goal is to be the player with the most points after three rounds of play.

5. Fraction Line-Up
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models; identifying equivalent fractions/fractional parts
Goal: The goal is to be the first player to have one pizza piece of each size: 1/2, 1/3, 1/4, 1/6, 1/8, 1/9, 1/12, and 1/16.

6. Pizza Patch
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models; identifying fractions that are even parts or multiples of another fraction.
Goal: The goal is to be the first player to have two pizzas in a winnings pile.

7. Undercover
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models; identifying equivalent fractions/fractional parts.
Goal: The goal is to be the player with the most points after 20 rounds of play.

8. Empty the Pan
Skill/Purpose: Matching fraction numerals with concrete models; identifying equivalent fractions/fractional parts; subtracting fractional parts from a whole/other fractional parts.
Goal: The goal is to be the first player to have no part of a pizza left.

name: Ninja Squirrels
description:
Ninja Squirrels is the game of color matching, nut snatching fun! Ninja Squirrels are fast food fighters. They race to gather acorns to fill their dens before the winter. To help them grab the most acorns, players take turns flipping cards. When there is a color match, be the first to snatch the correct nut. Collect the most acorns to win!

—description from the publisher

name: Beat the Parents: Disney
description:
It’s Kids vs. Adults in a head-to-head challenge on everything Disney! Relive your favorite Disney moments and create some new ones as Kids and Parents compete in a game of Disney questions and challenges. Take on multiple question categories such as “Name The Character”, “Disney Detective”, “Wild Card” and more. The first team to get both mover pieces across the board wins the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Reminiscing: The Game for People Who Remember The Beatles
description: A trivia game that asks questions based on the 1950's to 1980's. In addition to answering questions, players also have to 'reminisce' - i.e. tell stories about themselves, or others, on a variety of topics.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Martini: the Game
description:
Martini: the Game is a classic card and dice game in which players are bartenders competing to finish their martini before anyone else. Bartenders must match their cards with the martini order shown on the roll of four dice.

Each die represents part of the martini including Spirit (gin, vodka, tequila), Garnish (olive, lemon twist, onion), Action (shaken, stirred, stand), and Type (dry, double, dirty). Martini is a great dinner party game and the perfect hostess gift.

name: Star Wars Force Attax
description:
A collectible card game from Topps based on Star Wars universe. There are 190 cards to collect for this CCG. Cards are jam-packed with Star Wars characters and scenes including the wise and powerful Master Yoda and the supremely evil Darth Sidious.

With the fate of the galaxy at stake, the time has come for you to decide if you will take up arms with the Jedi and fight for the Republic, or succumb to the power of the Dark Side and join the Sith and their Separatist allies?

Cards are distributed in packets with 5 random cards. Cards are divided into three allegiances (Republic, Separatist and Mercenary), and 12 character types (Jedi Knight, Navy, Mandalorian, Bounty Hunter, Droid, Senate, Sith, Crime Lord, Clone Trooper, Vehicle, Viceroy, Pirate). Each card has two values - defense rating and attack rating.

The game is designed for two players. Each player must have 12 cards in their unit (deck), with the following deck building rules - at least 4 different character types, only 1 star foil, only 1 force master.

Players lay their cards (all 12) faced down, and flip a coin to see who goes first. First player pick the card to play with and the type of action (defense or attack). Second player responds with his own card of choice. Player with higher number wins the turn. There are 12 turns in the game. Played cards are discarded and the game continues with remaining cards, until all 12 are played (12 turns). Winner of the game is the player with the higher number of winning turns.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Rolled Bones
description:
Description from the box cover:

Rolled Bones is a fast paced, dice based, roll playing strategy adventure game where quick thinking and the luck of the dice rule. As you draw dice from your Chaos Bag and bring them into play you will find a huge assortment of characters and magic waiting to bring your realm to victorious power! Archers, Goblins, Dragons and the like, interact with Magical Spells like Hey You, Cup Runneth Over and Fist of Removal to create glorious battles and exciting game play.

name: Disneyland
description: The players walk around Disneyland. When you land on a ride/attraction you are allowed to rent it. If you land on a ride/attraction that another player owns you have to pay him an entrance fee. The entrance fee increases when the player has several attractions of the same set.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Carlit, Educa Sallent SA, Kärnan, Sallent hnos, S.A.

name: Achi
description:
Achi is a traditional game from Ghana. It is played on a 3x3 board.

There are two versions to this game. In one version, each player has four pieces to drop. In another version, each player has only three pieces to drop, which makes it identical to Tapatan.

The objective is to place all 3 of your tokens in a row. Players take turns placing the tokens on the board. If neither player has achieved 3 in a row after all tokens are on the board, they take turns moving a token along one of the lines until a winner is determined.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement
publishers: (Public Domain), Guild Publishing, Kreeda, L. P. Septímio, NewVenture Games

name: You Go to Hell
description:
The object of this game is to send your friends to Hell before they send you. The last person left wins the game.

Play 'Black Mark' cards to send someone on the way to Hell. 'Black Marks' can be partially erased by 'Flimsy Excuse' cards. If someone plays the 'Sorry, but I just don't buy it!' card, your excuse fails. Transfer the blame by playing a 'Actually , that was something YOU did' card. Cancel a 'Black Marks' card played against you with 'Special Dispensation.' If you can't deflect 'Black Marks' and you only have a 'Out of Flimsy Excuses' card, you still get 'Black Marks.' Reduce the marks against you with a 'Random Act of Kindness', but some else may claim credit with a 'Actually, that was something I did. Remember?' card.

Accumulate 100 'Black Marks' and you are out of the game.

name: Muggins
description:
Players are trying to not be the last player with cards remaining in their hands. The game is played with 4 packs of cards numbered 1-25. Each turn a player takes the top card from his face down cards and places it elsewhere on the table (this can be on one of the piles that lies in the center of the table or on another players pile). Seems to be like Flinch but the rules seem to be more restrictive!#

The game says that any number (at least 2) can play, but recommends between 4 and 10.

Equipment
100 cards arranged in 4 sets numbered 1 to 25
5 cards numbered 12,17,18,24,25
1 card printed with MORE AND LESS

Not to be confused with Muggins, a rule set for Dominoes.
publishers: Gibsons, H. P. Gibson & Sons, House of Marbles

name: Spider-Man
description: Using the die-launcher, players attempt to shoot villains off of the Daily Bugle building without hitting Peter Parker's pals. First player to knock down three villains and then finally Kingpin wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: Itsy Bitsy Spider
description: A simple nursery rhyme game for kids Ages 3 and up. Players take turns spinning the spinner, trying to build up their waterspout (8 tiles). The first person to complete their waterspout and place the spider on top wins.

name: Wicked Willie The Boardgame
description: Adult boardgame based on the comic Man's Best Friend by Gray Jolliffe. Player move up and down a track, advancing by answering questions, with words starting with a letter decided by a drawn card. Acceptable answer lets you advance 1-3 spaces. getting to the end of the track gives you one hat (that looks like a condom). First player to get three hats win.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: Witchcraft Ritual Kit
description:
Avalon Hill's trademark for its Psychic Awareness Demonstration Kit.

Produced by AH in 1974, concurrent with the Black Magic Ritual Kit.
Both kits were based on research by Dr. Brooke Hayward Jennings.

name: Top Dividend
description: This card game, based on the Football (soccer) Pools, is played over six rounds with Dividend pay outs at the end of each round. The object of the game is for each player to try and win as many dividends as possible and on the final round Scoop the Pool.

name: Speedy Sam!
description: Speedy Sam! is a children's game where you have to drive the little train Speedy Sam from one end of the board to the other. You move the train by playing tiles of the correct color based on where Sam is on the board. The one who drives Sam past the finish line wins the game.

name: Pick up the Pizza
description:
From the back of the box:

"As players discard ingredient cards onto the table they form pizza pies. Once a pizza is complete, with cheese and toppings, it can be claimed by placing a pizza box cover card on top of it. The trick is, don't lay down a card that will allow the player next to you to grab a pie.

"Whoever claims the most completed pizzas wins the game!

"This fast-moving game keeps players in suspense until the end. There are Pizza Thief and Order Mix-Up cards that, when played, can really create bedlam!"

-54 cards
-Ages 4 and up

name: Birds Eye Race Against Time
description:
"An exciting race against time to get your peas to the Birds Eye factory. But watch out, your opponents' harvesters and shuttle lorries aren't far behind. And your peas may not be small enough or picked quickly enough to satisfy Birds Eye quality controllers. So get your harvesters rolling. The first grower to unload a batch of peas wins!"

A collect a coupon promotional game which Birds Eye offered in 1981 to its consumers suitable for Ages 7 and up.

The game is split into 2 phases, Harvesting and Delivery.

Each player takes it in turns to roll the dice and move around the outside spiral of the board representing "The farm" and stop at various harvest areas to collect magnetic pea counters which stick to the top of your harvester.
Action Cards are drawn whenever a player lands on an action card space, consequences range between delays or move backs and extra moves or turns.

The player then aims to get to the transfer area and begin the delivery phase taking the shortest route they can to reach the factory. Delays or detours are printed on the board and must be taken if landed on.

At the factory the player draws cards in order to unload peas of the matching color.

The standout feature of the game are the two sets of playing pieces (Harvesters and Lorries) which were nicely detailed with the Birds Eye logo on the side and had a small piece of metal in the top for the magnetic peas to stick to.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopoly: PSV Edition
description: The Monopoly edition of Dutch soccerclub PSV. No streets, but players instead: Berry van Aerle - Jan Heintze - Huub Stevens - Stan Valckx - Erik Gerts - Jan van Beveren - Hans van Breukelen - Ronald Waterreus - Ralf Edström - Willy van der Kuylen - Coen Dillen - Ronald Koeman - Jaap Stam - Willy en René van de Kerkhof - Mark van Bommel - Philip Cocu - Gerald Vanenburg - Luc Nilis - Romario - Ronaldo - Ruud van Nistelrooy - Mateja Kezman. The pawns: ball, goal, cup, shoe, cap, whistle, hamburger, milkshake.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Milleniumpoly
description: A Monopoly game in which, instead of buying city blocks you buy the greatest human achievements of the Millennium. e.g. The Internet or Leonardo da Vinci's Gioconda.

name: Kon-Tiki Spillet
description:
The story of Thor Heyerdahl and his many adventures was the background for a competition held by the Kon-tiki Museum. There were lots of entries from all over the world, but the there were three 19 year old girls from Moss who won. The game retell Thor Heyerdahl and his fantastic journey on a balsa fleet from Peru to Polynesia.

In the first part of the game the players have to build a fleet containing 9 balsa sticks. This is done by answering questions about the journey and picking the right answer out of 4 alternatives. When they have collected the 9 sticks the second part of the game begins.

On the long journey towards Raroia in Polynesia the players must deal with lots of challenges the suddenly occur, rough weather conditions and additionally practice on miming in order to be understood once they reach Polynesia.

Will you be able to get through the dangerous coral reefs and be the first to reach Raroia?

(Translated from the publisher's site from Norwegian)

name: Kaart tennis
description:
At first sight this "card tennis" game resembles the game Tennis ( http://boardgamegeek.com/game/2841 ) a lot. On close examination, however, there are differences which will be discussed underneath.
First of all it should be noted that the (c) from this game is 1973: two years before Tennis was released! Further, on the box it says (literal translation) "The first and only cardgame on the world based on tennis". The box furthermore states that the game was issued on occasion of the 75th year of the Dutch Tennis Association. However, a publisher cannot be found on box, or on rule sheets. Based on these data I do believe that this was the predecessor of Tennis.
Differences with Tennis: a) In this game there is no 'ball' nor a pawn (you just move the stack of played cards to the correct position). b) Cards are strictly for either backhand or forehand strokes (indicated with either B or F). c) There are more rules of which card may be played on what card (eg. smash may only following a lob).

name: Skudo
description:
"The object of the game is to be the first person to move his four pieces around the board and up the path of his color to Home."

Skudo is a traditional roll and move game that's reminiscent of Parcheesi, Sorry, and Trouble. The main differential elements are 4 on-board discs that allow only the matching color, passage to the paths beyond. By throwing doubles or landing on the "Skudo" space, one can turn a disc thereby continuing their movement or blocking their opponent.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Copp Clark Publishing Company, John Waddington Ltd., Parker Brothers, Waddingtons

name: Monopoly: Leicestershire Edition
description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Leicestershire, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Funny Domino
description:
This is a domino variant for children. The game consists of 35 cards depicting various animals. After placing a card, the player decides on which end the next card has to be played. He is doing so by imitating that animals sound. Now all players check their cards and the fastest gets to play his card. First to get rid of all his cards wins.

Ages 4 and up.

name: Party & Co: Girls
description:
This is a game from the Party & Co family.
Party & Co Girls is the ideal game to spend a great time during a relaxing evening or a pajama party with your friends. Party & Co Girls have 5 different challenges:

dear diary - write a diary trying to hide 3 word in your story
travel bag - remember some objects in the right order
categories - give the more concepts you can in a certain category
celebrity hunting - 3 levels: a lot of words, 1 word, just charades
zapping - find an object in a tv channel, while the other team changes it


For ages 8+
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Memory, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Singing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game
publishers: Diset S. A., Jumbo, Nordic Games GmbH

name: Dessinez c'est gagné !
description:
A pencil & paper charades game with six different categories:-

Objects

Events & Actions

Nature

Persons, Characters & Professions

Technical expressions & Objects

Proverbs & Sayings

Similar to Pictionary but with more variety & can be played by younger players !

name: Chase
description:
Another one from the Pepys Double Feature Games series.

The game contains 17 gallop cards, 20 jump cards (4 each of 5 colours), 10 water jump cards (2 each of 5 colours), 4 fall cards and 4 whip cards.
Added is a paper playing mat enforced with raw canvas on the back and 5 cardboard horses on coloured wooden stands.

In this horse racing card game players try to be the first past the post.
To achieve this they have to find the best moves with their hand of 5 cards.
This game is really tricky, as some cards allow only one horse of a certain colour to move and some other cards affect all horses.
As there are also several obstacles on the course which require certain cards to surmount you have to find the best moment when to play which card to move your horse and to hinder the others.

If you want, you can use a portion of the mat to place bets for the horses.

name: 5th Column (fan expansion for Fortress America)
description:
Quoted from the 5th Column Rules Introduction:

With rules easy enough for a novice to understand, yet subtle enough to delight the expert, 5th Column adds the rules and new playing pieces to add increasing realism to Milton Bradley’s Fortress America, while maintaining the game’s ease and speed of play. 5th Column adds the ability to influence your game with unconventional tactics.

Yet the new rules don’t overwhelm the old game. A large army will still defeat a small army. However, in a close battle, long range planning with unconventional forces can tip the balance. New rules and plastic playing pieces are included for fifth column activities, commandeering civilian airlift capacity, radar, and fuel supplies.

Each of the 4 armies has 8 new pieces:

2 × Payoff Units (Dollar Signs)
2 × Fuel Supplies (Oil Rigs)
2 × Radar (Satellite Dishes)
2 × Airlift Units (Aircraft)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Ex und stop
description:
Content:
board, 80 action and question cards, 90 garbage cards, 6 pawns, 1 detour marker, 1 disposing truck, 1 die

Ex and hopp! How easily the banana peel lands in the garbage pail and the old school book in the wastepaper basket.

But here in the game's "Clean-Town" the players are very busy to avoid garbage and to recycle it. Here the motto is "Ex and stop".
The players have the duty to bring the garbage cards to the right disposal locations. The winner is the player who disposed his garbage correctly and is back in his house first.

name: Circus
description:
The aim of the game is to find the Ring Master.
Each player is a small clown.
They turn around the ring to collect three different cards (monkey, seal, dog) to be able to enter the ring and try to find the Ring Master hidden in 7 ring cards (3 lions cards, 3 public cards and one Ring Master Card).
Players have to avoid bad square and they also can steal each other cards if the are on the same square.
The first player to find the Ring Master wins.

name: Trivial Pursuit: South Australian Charity Edition
description:
From the back of the box:

It's the most popular trivia game in the world, and now South Australia has its very own edition. The Trivial Pursuit South Australian Charity Edition.

With 1800 uniquely South Australian questions and answers specially written for this local edition, it's the trivia game all Crow Eaters will love to play.

This limited edition games is as South Australian as a pie floater, and covers everything that makes South Australia so unique.

Not so trivial are the funds raised by this game for the McGuiness McDermott Foundation and for Surf Lifesaving SA. So special thanks must go to all of our great sponsors who are represented with questions throughout this game, and to Imagination entertainment for making this happen.

The Trivial Pursuit South Australian Charity Edition. It's South Australia's very own trivia game.

Contents:
1 Gameboard
300 Question-and-Answer cards
1 Card holder
6 Scoring tokens
36 Coloured wedges
1 Die
1 Game rules sheet

name: Constructing and Piling Zoolino
description:
Back of the Box: Who can bring order into the chaos of the animal paradise? Two color die games introduce children in a child-friendly manner to their first games with rules.

The game can be played in two variants "3,2,1 - collecting fun!"and "No trace of the animal".

In the first variant the animals are build up in the center of the table at the start of the game. In turn the players roll a color die and take a building block in the corresponding color. The player who gathers the most blocks wins.

In "No trace of the animal" an animal of three different colors is build for each player. Now the players try to deconstruct the animal top to bottom by rolling the correct color. The player who finishes first wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Night Sky Solar System Edition
description:
From USAopoly.com:

Bring the wonders of the solar system into your living room with this special Night Sky Solar System Edition of the Monopoly game. Halleys Comet, Jupiter, Earth and the Moon are all up for grabs as you buy, sell and trade popular celestial bodies in your quest to own the universe. Six collectible tokens include a telescope, the Mars Rover, observatory dome, binoculars, a radio telescope and the Hubble space telescope. A planetary delight that’s out of this world for astronomy enthusiasts of all ages.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Smurfs Tag-athon!
description: A collectible miniatures game sold in single figure blind packaging. A game can be played with as few as 4 figures to as many as both player's agree. (Three or four figures per player is best.) To start the game, each player places a small object on their side of the table and nominates it as their base. Next all of the Smurf figures are placed in contact with their designated base. The object of the game is to be the first to tag your opponent's base. Each turn, a player may move his entire team of Smurfs. To do so, he may move the length of one standard playing card (such as the the enclosed rule card) an any direction indicated by the arrows on the smurf figure's base. If at anytime you can move one of your Smurfs into base contact with an opponent's Smurf, you may immediately move EVERY Smurf on the opponent's team (including the one you tagged) the distance of two short sides of the card, again in any direction indicated on the Smurfs base. The first one to tag the opposing base, wins!
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Miniatures

name: Åkeri
description:
In Åkeri ("hauler firm"), players assume the roles of lorry drivers transporting goods, mostly fragile or hazardous ones, across a city. Four warehouses contain goods waiting to be evenly redistributed, and deliveries can be made along the bypass that connects the warehouses or through the unpredictable streets of the city centre. Hazards are found in the form of event cards and the blocking vehicles of other players. When a car crashes into a wall or hits another car, a die is rolled to determine whether there's damage to vehicles and goods, which can be costly or even disastrous. Players have the option to purchase insurance policies to mitigate the effect of such misfortunes, or to join into cooperatives with shared assets and some added benefits (the promotion of cooperative ideology being an explicit goal of the producer). The goal is to end up with the most money having made successful deliveries of valuable goods and avoided expenses caused by the destruction of goods or vehicles.

Although the game is nominally for 4-8 players, it would no doubt be possible to play with 2 or 3, optionally with adjustments like having more than one car per player.

The box sides show titles and short captions in Swedish, Norwegian, Danish and Finnish, but the Swedish edition at least (assuming there are others) has a rules sheet in Swedish only.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Toy Story 3
description: Roll and move game, where players collect toys when they stop on a step of their own color. When players get to the last straight they give up all of their toys and move as many steps ahead as they had toys. First to reach goal wins.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: Damm / Egmont, Egmont Litas, Kärnan, Kirjalito

name: Hur fan visste du det?
description:
Swedish quiz game (english: "how the hell did you know that?").

The questions are of a somewhat embarrasing nature - ranging from sex and gossip to drugs and crime - leaving participants wondering "how the hell" that person knew the answer.

The game is played by one player drawing a card and reading the question. If the players on the other team(s) answer correctly they get to keep the card. The game ends when the draw pile runs out of cards.

name: Squinkies Gumball Surprize Playhouse Game
description:
From the Rules:

"Let's help the Squinkies find their way back to the Squinkies Gumball Surprise Playhouse! Be the first player to collect 4 different "Squinkies" cards; a friends, Babies, Puppies and Kitties card, and the So Cute card in hand. Then return to the Gumball Surprise Pakyhouse and be the first player ready to play with yoru Squinkies!"

This is a basic children's roll-n-move game where you collect the cards by landing on the corresponding space. Also, there is only ONE So Cute card.

name: Gettysburg 1863
description:
A simulation of the most important battle of the US Civil War. The game contains 2 scenarios, one for each day of the battle.

Gettysburg 1863 was published in 28th issue of Taktyka i Strategia magazine.
The game uses the "Taktyka i Strategia Napoleon" system rules, created for all XIXth century battles, but some modifications are introduced.
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: The Greedy Gull
description:
Dice game with five dice numbered 2 to 6, with a seagull replacing the "1" spot.

Object: collect a bucket of 50 clams (points), by rolling the dice.

Each spot is worth one clam. The active player may roll the five dice as many times as he/she wishes, but if a gull appears on any of the dice, the gull steals all the clams collected on that turn. If the player stops rolling without the appearance of a gull, he/ she keeps the clams and passes the dice to the next player.

Winner: the first player to collect 50 clams (points).

name: Suomi 1918
description:
Suomi 1918 is a quick and easy-to-learn card game about the birth of the Finnish state and the civil war and the events that led to it. Can history have unfolded differently?

The game consists of a deck of 49 cards, of which 7 are victory condition cards. The remaining cards represent significant places, people, events, and social conditions during the civil war. These are in 4 colored suits: black (social turmoil), blue (peace efforts), red (socialists), and white (conservatives).

Players each have a secret victory condition representing a goal of either the Reds or the Whites. They take turns placing cards in increasing sequential order onto 4 central piles (one for each suit) and try to achieve their victory condition without the state collapsing (completing the black pile) or reaching peace through compromise (completing the blue pile). Special event cards can also cause the top card of a pile to be discarded, temporarily stalling progress.

name: Huvi-matka Avasaksaan
description:
Huvi-matka Avasaksaan (also in Swedish: Lustfärd till Avasaksa) is a roll and move board game. Published game included a game board with 64 squares, and a rules booklet. Players were required to provide their own game money, suggesting that the game has been played as a low stakes gambling game. In the rules booklet there is a description for each game board square, including the information of money gained or lost in that square.

The theme is a travel trip from Helsinki to tourist location of Aavasaksa and back. This is the first known Finnish board game published.

—user summary

name: Råttfällan
description:
Råttfällan is a roll and move game where players are rats trying to collect various food items from the board. If landing on one of those squares, the player will take an amount of game money from the next player, depending on which type of food item it was. Eventually all players are forced into the rat trap in the center of the board as moves are not allowed to go away from the rat trap, only towards it or sideways. The player with most money in the end wins.

—user summary

name: Things... Schitt's Creek
description:
Everyone’s favorite game meets everyone’s favorite show! In this hilarious game, you read a topic card and then write down your response. It can be anything that comes to mind—there’s no right or wrong answer! Then all the responses are read aloud, and you have to figure out who said what! You won’t believe the THINGS… the people you know will come up with! With the Schitt’s Creek Edition, explore your thoughts about the show and it’s hilarious characters and see what THINGS… you’ll say!

—description from the publisher
categories: Deduction, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Puzzle Me!
description:
Puzzle out your victory!

Puzzle Me! is a family-friendly board game packaged inside a cute, little box. In Puzzle Me!, players connect jigsaw puzzle-shaped pieces to build the biggest puzzle they can. During each player’s turn, they may either place a puzzle piece into their own puzzle, or they may choose to place a piece into an opponent’s puzzle to try and block that opponent’s expansion. But watch out! Making a play like this may lead to similar payback in the near future. It’s Karma!

name: Het Grote Wereldreisspel
description: A small question and answer game where people move around different continents on a board while answering questions about them. There is a nice twist however, if you answer a question correctly in a category you already have completed yourself you can take away a marker from another player.

name: Boganology
description:
Players take the part of bogans, attempting to buy and then develop their acquisitions. Income is gained by other players visiting their properties and money is spent when they visit properties belonging to other players.

Gameplay:
On their turn, the active player roll the dice and move its Beer token. When you land on a space with something to sell you can buy it with cash. Give the money to the Bogan Boss and leave one of your beer bottle cap marker tokens on the space to mark that it now belongs to you.
Each time another player lands on your space they will need to give you cash to lend the space. Liekwise, if you land on something another player own, you will have to give them cash.

There is two ways to win:
- Quick Game: As soon as someone loses all of their cash the game is over. Everyone else adds up how much they have in cash and stuff (space own on the board) and the player with the most is the winner.
- Long Game: Keep playing until all players but one have lost their cash. The remaining player is the winner.

Release your inner bogan!

Reckon youse got what it takes to sweet talk you way to some extra Centrelink payments? Can you outrun the cops in thongs? Will you pay your child support or take off to Kuta with ya mates? Well, find out in the game that’ll let you and your friends be the bogans you all wanted to be.

- Packed with Aussie Kulture.
- It’s more ocker than you
- Straya designed and developed mate.
- It’s about beer, BBQs and bludgers.
- “A dead set cracker of a game”
- Play in your trackie daks!
- It’s unaustralian not to buy it.
- For the price of a couple of lamingtons
- Are thongs your primary footwear? Then have we got the game for youse.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Tower of Bunnies
description:
Also called "Bunny Paletti" or "Villa Rabbitti." Build a tower out of little plastic bunnies and cardboard discs. Roll a special color die, and pull out a bunny of the appropriate color. The winner of the game is the player who has the most bunnies when the tower falls!

Notice the year of copyright. Which came first, the bunny or the Spiel des Jahres?

name: Klondyke
description:
A Finnish boardgame that is in many ways similar to Afrikan tähti, but is set in the 1849 goldrush in Alaska, and expands on the basic idea of that game. The game board has spaces for 25 face-down chits but there are actually two sets of chits placed on top of each other, green and black; and black chits may only be searched (turned face-up) after ALL the green chits have been discovered. Instead of looking for one special chit that allows a player to win the game, the aim is to dig gold worth of $2000 and then head for the nearest starting point, which are located corners of the gameboard. At this point, other players however still have a chance to compete for victory, for if one of them manages to find the 'Letter from Home' chit among the black chits, that triggers an end-of-game race in which the first player to reach any corner is the winner. As an added bonus, the finder of the letter gets to double their movement afterwards, while other players (excluding the one who triggered the end of the game) have the added handicap that they have to visit Klondyke first.

The starting points are named after six well known gold diggers from this period: Big Hawk Haida, Annie "Get Your Gun" Oakley, James W. Marshall, Kit Carson, C. G. Larsson and Jim Bridger. There is a very short biography of each in the rules, and a short history of the Alaska goldrush.

The game is dedicated to the designer's daughter Inka.
publishers: Alga, Damm / Egmont, Oy Fenno-Alga Ab

name: PATIOS: Manitas Promo Card
description:
Expand your patio!

This is a new special card to be included in the Improvement deck.

If you take the Albañil (builder/stonemason), you can expand your patio without penalty.

-description from designer

name: Monopoly: Marvel Universe
description:
Play Monopoly with the greatest heroes and villains from the Marvel Universe! X-Men, Avengers, Fantastic Four; all famous Marvel characters are there. Play the game with one of six exclusive playing pieces, such as Sabretooth, Hawkeye of Captain America.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Orcs in the Hood
description:
The war was long. The war was bloody. But now, the Orcish Brotherhood has the last of the Human Alliance holed up in the crumbling ruins of the lower east side. Victory is assured, but when the dust settles, who will lead the victors?

A strategic combat game for 2-4 players.

name: Tickle Bee
description: A children's dexterity game where players use a magnetic wand to push a magnetic bee around a track on the board. Players must be careful not to get the want too close to the bee or he will "sting" them (lift up off the board and touch the wand) and they will lose their turn.

name: Cars Bingo
description:
(from back of box)
"Get SUPERCHARGED with Lightning McQueen and his pals as they prepare to compete with cars from around the world in the Radiator Springs Supercharged International Grand Prix! The neon's sizzling, the asphalt's hot, and Lightning's pals are sporting slick new paint jobs as they gear up for the big race. Put your pedal to the metal and steer right to the hottest spot in racing - Radiator Springs. Play this supercharged spinner Bingo with Lightning McQueen and his pals, all your favorite Cars characters!"

This is a children's bingo game with a Cars theme. Each player receives a bingo card with a 5x5 grid of Cars characters (Ramone, Doc Hudson, Guido, Lightning McQueen, Mater, Sally, Luigi) with different colored backdrops (Red, Green, Yellow, Blue, Purple). A spinner is used to call spaces. For example: If the spinner arrow points to the color blue and Mater's face, "Blue Mater" is called out. Any player with a Blue Mater picture on their card would cover it with a chip. The first player to cover 5 characters in a row with chips wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Where the Wild Things Are Game
description: The Where the Wild Things Are Game brings Max and the wild things to life in the beautifully detailed characters and wonderfully illustrated dimensional game board. Children get to imagine they are Max, travelling to the forest and becoming king of the wild things as they roll their dice and draw cards that help or hinder their journey. Once they reach the top of the hill and get their scepter they race to be the first Max home to win! Love the book, now live the game!

name: Campaign Secrets
description:
Campaign Secrets is a political card game where you are a candidate in the race for the White House. You must out-campaign your opponents to win the favor of your constituents. And most importantly, don't let those voters find out about your dirty little secrets!

Campaign Secrets is a fun educational game. Each card has tidbits about real presidential elections. In addition, the campaign strategies and secrets in the game, are all taken from real-life strategies and scandals. Playing the game can give many children and adults alike an insight into how a real election comes together.

In the game, you play a series of campaign strategies trying to get more percentage of the vote than the other players in the game. Eventually, through game play, you'll either choose or stumble into your running mate. Together the two of you must do your best to wrangle as many votes as possible away from the other players, and to hold on to your secrets so you can pick up a few extra votes at the end of the game.

The game was designed for families and classrooms, so while it can be fun and educational for hard-core gamers, it's still simple enough for everybody to play. If you're looking for a fun way to learn about the election process, or just a fun game to play with your family, then this is the game for you. If you're looking a hard-core strategy game then you might want to look elsewhere.

NOTE: You may have played the First Edition of this game, but the Second Edition plays considerably different. The first edition was a quick and dirty version put out as a free give away for trade shows, the second edition is the real game.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: The Very Hungry Caterpillar Game
description:
Based on the children's book of the same name by Eric Carle, Philomel Press.

From the box back:

Match colors and create a beautiful butterfly. Each player has five fruits of matching color and shape. Play proceeds with a spinner, first player to place all their shapes on the butterfly wins. Can also be played cooperatively.

This game helps young players to develop color recognition and matching skills as well as important social skills: taking turns, following rules, and sharing.

This is a different game from the same-named Very Hungry Caterpillar Game, which is made further confusing because both games have very similar box-fronts, using the same picture from the cover of the book. This game uses a Cootie or Jumbolino mechanism where players must collect pieces based on random rolls/spins.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Where in Time Is Carmen Sandiego
description:
Description from the box:

THE MYSTERY HISTORY GAME

Carmen is hiding somewhere in time - your mission is to check each century on the game board until you find her.

Along the way, you'll race to put historical events in their correct order. Then, match stolen loot to its correct century. Is Paul Revere's horse from the 18th century or the 17th? Did it appear before or after Pocahontas saved Captain John Smith? You'll find out as you track Carmen in this exciting game that brings history to life.
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia, Video Game Theme

name: Burger Time: The Card Game
description:
Data East's Burger Time the Card Game takes you back to the arcade of the 80's. When we were all young and had pockets full of quarters! Burger Time is a 2 player (can be played by 1 player) card game in which each "chef" tries to build the burgers from their menu first.

Players draw cards from the deck and build their burgers in order. Each burger is different and requires unique ingredients! Watch out for the bad guys...

Each player takes turns drawing cards from the deck. Each card is one part of a burger. The goal is to assemble a burger one part at a time.

The game is over as soon as a player assembles the predetermined number of burgers (shorter games require fewer burgers). This player is the winner.

name: Proverbial Wisdom
description:
In 60 seconds, complete one of the following activities:

Draw a proverb for teammates to guess (a la Pictionary)
Guess the proverb meant by a picture already drawn, or
Guess the correct meaning or origin of a proverb.

name: Clue: Little Detective
description: Be the first little detective to make it from Start in the attic, through the mansion, and out the kitchen door to the safety of the front gate at the Finish.

name: Best in Show
description: This board game will not only test your "doggie" knowledge but will teach you a thing or two as well. This is a fun, fact filled trivia game that includes 200 questions about our furry friends. Which dog has a blue-black tongue? or What is the original reason behind a poodle's haircut? These are just a few of the facts one can learn playing Best in Show. For 2-7 players. Ages 7 and up.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Aktiemillionær
description:
The game is set in a big city with large corporations, businessmen, hotels and casinos. You buy stock in the different companies and hope their value increase.
The goal of the game is to be the last player left in the game having ruined all competition through timing and alliances.

name: Galloping Golf
description:
Galloping Golf is a dice driven game in which players compete at par 4 holes by rolling five dice with various outcomes. Each player scores between 2-9 per hole (no hole-in-one). Scores are tallied on scoring sheets and the lowest score wins.

A collectible feature of this game are the Bakelite/Catalin dice that are included. The game may have had several reincarnations, including being produced for Wilson Sporting Goods and for a company called Arl-Hi.

from the gameboard explanation

To anyone not experienced in golf, this game will prove very interesting and instructive. Anyone who does not play golf can quickly learn the Golf Game by reading the accompanying rules. Every member of the family will find this game delightfully instructive as well as a fascinating pastime.

The experienced golfer will be subject to many of the same interesting and thrilling situations which are found on the links.

This Golf Course is modeled after the famous Championship Golf Course, designed by the late Seth J Raynor. It is located in Fairyland, atop Lookout Mountain, Tennessee-Georgia, near Chattanooga, Tenn. The Location of greens, tees, hazards and the par figures shown are identical with the Fairyland Course.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Bee-Line, Capex Company, O. B. Andrews Co.

name: Chessword
description:
From the rules:
"Chessword is an original game combining chess and words. All the chess pieces are used except the pawns, and they move and capture the opponent's pieces the same way as in chess. But instead of attempting to check the King, each player tries to gain all the letters of the chosen word before his opponent."

Played on a 8 by 14 chessboard with letters in the dark squares, each side has the normal complement of chess pieces, minus the pawns, and tries to form words by landing on the right letters on the board in sequence. Kings may be captured and the game is only won by completing the word, or capturing all of the opponent's pieces.

name: Buckopoly
description:
Monopoly version re-themed to fit The Ohio State University landmarks and history. Gameplay is just as in original Monopoly.

Tokens include:
Drum Major, Buckeye Leaf, Football, Brutus, Letter O.

Board Spaces include:
The Oval, High Street, Ohio Stadium, Coach Woody Hayes, Varsity Club and many others.

Cards:

OHIO STATE vs. MICHIGAN! Advance to Ohio Stadium. GO BUCKS!

YOU DOT THE I! You're in the OSU Marching Band. Advance Token.

SPHINX LINKING! Advance the token of your choice to the Oval.

Place $10 in center of board in exchange for quarters. DO YOUR LAUNDRY!

And many more...
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: High School Musical DVD Game
description:
From bestbuy.com summary:

"High school is a stage and here's your chance to be a part of the show. Jump into the hit Disney Channel movie High School Musical with this fun, interactive DVD game. Enjoy video clips, original outtakes and all of the songs and dances you love from the movie.

Compete against your friends in four challenging categories: Outtakes, Song, Dance and Relationship. The first player to make his or her way around the school for the final call back audition is the winner. Prove you have what it takes to make it in high school. After all, it really is just a song and a dance. "
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Farkel & More
description:
From the publisher:

Press your luck, but don't Farkel!

What, you haven't heard of Farkel, the fast-paced, fun dice game? Each player takes a turn rolling ten dice until they either Pass or Farkel, depending on what you roll. You can press your luck by rolling the remaining dice, or score your points earned. Then the next player rolls to add to your score or start new. We know you will also enjoy having MORE fun with the complete rules for ten MORE dice games like Bumble Bee, Sequences, Centennial, Best Ball and MORE. Great for the entire family.

Content:

10 SimplyFun dice
1 Wipe board for score keeping
1 Dry-erase marker
1 Ring of rules
1 Cowbell
1 Carrying bag

name: Das Perfekte Dinner
description: This is a game based on the successful German TV cooking show. You have to collect cards with ingredients you need for "cooking" the menu from special menu cards.

name: Het Mega Mindy Time Bordspel
description:
Mega Mindy is a "world Famous" Flemish (Belgian) character, kind of wonderwoman, for the kids.
She has her own TV series, puzzles, pyama's (pajamas???) and .. her first game.

This is a racing game between you, as Mega Mindy, and a crook, a race to get to the money. By rolling the dice, you have to turn yourself into Mega Mindy, giving you special powers (faster/bigger moves) to get hold of the money first.

Good luck.

name: Hexapawn
description:
A simple game on a 3x3 grid, where each side has 3 chess pawns. The objective is to get a pawn to the other side of the board, or leave the opponent unable to move. Normal chess rules apply except that the pawns are not allowed a double move from their starting position.

Not really intended as a two-player game, it was designed to demonstrate an artificial intelligence learning technique by using beads in matchboxes. (Old enough to remember matchboxes?) Twenty-four matchboxes were used to represent the possible moves. Essentially, there were two phases. The first phase was to "teach" the matchbox computer to play the game, then a second phase allowed the matchbox computer to play other opponents. The learning speed depended on the skill of the opponent in the teaching phase.

There are variants in which taking the opponent's piece is mandatory ("Dawson's chess") and ones that use larger boards.

Martin Gardner first published this in his Mathematical Games column in March 1962, and subsequently in his book, "The Unexpected Hanging".

name: Seikkailu Merellä
description:
"Adventure at Sea - The great submarine hunt"

An abstract naval strategy game for 2 players. One player is the submarine commander and controls a mothership-submarine and nine mini-subs; the other is the surface commander and controls a fleet of sixteen destroyers. The board has an asymmetric (roughly 10 by 16) grid on which the vessels move; initial setup is printed on the board and is always the same.

There are several exit points at the edges of the grid. The goal of the submarine commander is to take the mothership off the board through an exit point; the surface commander tries to prevent this and capture the mothership. (For the purpose of the victory condition, the mini-subs and destroyers are expendable.) Both sides can capture the other's vessels by sandwiching an enemy vessel between two of their own. Captured vessels are removed from the game.

The board also has several "military secrets"; by placing any of his vessels on such a space the sub commander forces the surface commander to remove one destroyer (her choice).

The game includes one rules variant.

Similar to:

Hnefatafl

name: Bling Bling Gemstone: 7-Card Mini Expansion
description:
7-Card mini expansion offered during the Bling Bling Gemstone Kickstarter campaign. The first 500 backers got them for free. The remaining backers could add-on for $2.

From the Kickstarter:

At the start of the game shuffle and deal one of each of these cards to all players. Graphics for these cards are coming soon but they will fit the theme/feel of the existing art. Each card is a one-time use card.


Cave In! Play on another player, that player loses their turn.



Dead Canary: Play this card on another player's turn, this player must hit the tower with their pick, with their eyes closed!



Strike it Rich! Play this card on your own turn, you score double points for anything you knock off this turn (even center cores!)



Dynamite! Take an extra turn (4 hits instead of 2)



Broken Handle! (Play on another player) Your pick axe is broken, you have to strike the column while holding one tip of the axe head and striking the column with the other tip of the head (do not use the handle at all!)



Claim Jumper: When you play this card, randomly take one collected gem from each player: Warning, if a player has no gems you must take a stone column piece from that player. If the player has no pieces then they steal a piece of their choice from you!



Jeweler's Loupe: Play this on any other player, you discover imperfections in their gems. All of that player's red gems are worth one less point during final scoring.

name: Farrago
description:
Farrago is an entertaining quiz game where you start off with $75,000. You need to travel around the world and visit the casinos of Las Vegas, Atlantic City, Monte Carlo, and Macau. On the way you must answer questions: Correct answers wins you money, but it costs if you can't answer.

You also have the oppertunity to gamble. You can challenge your opponents in Black Jack to win their money - or loose. You can put money on the dice, the one-armed bandit, or try a fortune cookie, which can bring fortune but most certain also the opposite.

The winner is the first to visit the four casinos, reach the board's center and correctly answer a crucial question. BUT only if you also have the most money in your pocket.

In Farrago there are plenty of opportunities to both gloat with your knowledge and tease your opponents, when winning their money from them. You must dare to gamble, challenge your opponents and have the fate on your page. Or you can go completely bust when the playing fever runs away with you.

name: Mundo Neurente
description:
ENGLISH: Tired of fighting each other for religious supremacy and that these wars have caused many human deaths and the need to remain toghether against the threats of evil, the good neurents have agreed to face each other in a peaceful competition. In this event can participate up to six of the world's great religions. The winner will prevail as the only world religion and thereafter guide the designs of human beings until you play again. Instead of acting directly on humans, they have decided to conquer their sources of survival: earth, water, air, fire, flora and fauna. The first to achieve to conquer any of them will win because humans depend entirely on it to survive. Each religion will have four participants in the competition shall strictly comply with the following rules. You will be responsible for guiding your steps. Hopefully your gods help you in this mission.

Using their pawns, the players (as individuals or teams) must conquer areas that are not initially of their own color. When anyone has managed to conquer all tiles of a given resource will become the winner.

ESPAÑOL: Cansados de luchar entre sí por la supremacía religiosa, de que estas guerras hayan causado tantos muertos humanos y de la necesidad de estar unidos ante las amenazas del mal, los neurentes buenos han acordado enfrentarse entre sí en una competición pacífica. En la contienda podrán participar hasta 6 de las grandes religiones del mundo. El ganador prevalecerá como única religión mundial y guiará a partir de entonces los designios de los humanos... hasta que se vuelva a jugar. En lugar de actuar directamente sobre los humanos, han decido conquistar sus fuentes de supervivencia: tierra, agua, aire, fuego, flora y fauna. El primero que logre dominar alguna de ellas será el vencedor porque los humanos dependerán completamente de él para sobrevivir. Cada religión tendrá cuatro participantes en la competición que deberán cumplir estrictamente las siguientes reglas. Tú serás el encargado de guiar sus pasos. Esperemos que tus dioses te ayuden en esta misión.

Utilizando los peones, los jugadores (individualmente o por equipos) deberán conquistar zonas que no sean inicialmente de su color. Cuando alguno haya logrado conquistar todas las casillas de un recurso determinado se convertirá en el ganador.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Kariera polityczna
description:
Everyone knows politics in our country. Are you sure? Political career requires incredible intuition, intelligence, skill and perseverance. Welcome to the department: shine with charisma and originality, give rich speeches, promise voters a paradise on earth and fight to stay in politics. If you do not compromise, the idyllic reality of the MEP awaits you.

Political Career is a mocking game about the situation on the Polish political scene, deftly mixing mechanics known from Monopoly games with humorous drawings of Andrzej Mleczko.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Baby Shark Let's Go Hunt Game
description:
On a player's turn they point the arrow on the sound pad to any other player and presses the button.

Part of the song will play and the player the arrow is pointing to has to give the active player all cards of the matching shark.

If the chosen player doesn't have any of those cards, the active player must draw a card.

Once a player has 4 matching shark cards they place them face up and those cards are safe for the rest of the game.

To win, be the first player to collect three sets of four matching cards

name: Escape Room: The Game – Challenge 2
description:
You are locked up by a genius, with no hope of release, are you…? He'll let you go if you can prove you're worth it! Show that you can remain calm under pressure. Solve as many puzzles as possible within 10 minutes; only then do you have a chance of surviving this… Play alone or in a team and unravel the riddles under time pressure, while the seconds tick away.

There are 48 riddles to solve, with an encoder included to check your answers.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending

name: Voyagers
description:
Voyagers is a pre-progammable race game where you step in the footsteps of famous voyagers. It is your goal to (re-) discover the marvels of the world, while being sabotaged by your competitors.

Initially 3 locations to be discovered are set out and every player needs to try to become the first voyager discovering these sights. Every turn 5 navigation cards are chosen and put in a 5 step program, which needs to be programmed upfront. Once the program is executed step by step, you need to set out course to these discoveries and avoid being sabotaged.

After the fourth discovery is done, every player gets its own secret discovery card and once the first player has discovered this last secret discovery the game ends. The player with most discovery points wins the game.

—description from the designer

name: Igelkottens hämnd!
description: The Hedgehogs Revolt! Players have four cars and four hedgehogs, and one secret goal for each car. The objective of the game is to get all of your cars to their goals while using your hedgehogs to obstruct the other players' cars. When a hedgehog and a car ends up on the same space a card is drawn. The card asks for a certain type of insurance card. If the player can't provide said card, he has to act out a certain mission. The missions are something like "Imitate your favorite animal", "Walk backwards around the table", "Laugh for one full minute", or "Sing a song from the Eurovision Song Contest".
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Humor, Music, Party Game, Transportation, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing
publishers: Alga, Brio AB, BV Leisure Ltd

name: Scramble!
description:
This is basically a two-player version of the 1970's game Perfection, in which you have a set of plastic shapes that fit into holes on the board. The board is pushed down into a spring-loaded box with a timer. When you fit all your shapes into the right holes, you turn off the timer. If you don't turn it off in time, it pops and sends all your pieces flying.

Scramble! is exactly like that except each player has his own set of pieces, and you play on opposite sides of the game unit. There are 18 pieces for each player. The game also includes a "junior version", which amounts to a piece of cardboard that covers up six of the holes.

name: Bacon Road Trip
description:
The town of Piggsburgh is holding their annual Bacon Buddy Cook-Off, and they are looking for this year's winner. Chefs, cooks, and other weekend warriors have come from far and wide to compete and enjoy in the festivities. Do you have what it takes to battle through the odds and win this year's top prize? If you love bacon as much as we do, then heed our call. Enjoy the sights, enjoy the sounds, but most importantly, enjoy the sweet savory samples of bacon delicacies throughout the town of Piggsburgh.

Players will move along the game board collecting ingredients, toll passes and recipes needed to win the Bacon Buddy Cook-Off. Fending off Vegan assaults, players must collect 4 recipes (and their ingredients) and get them back to their kitchen. The first player to acquire 4 recipe tokens and return to their kitchen is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: CitiesUP
description:
Welcome to CitiesUP!
County officials just offered new opportunities for land purchases, and you are now an official investor for a new city. Build, develop, and increase your income.
Your job is simple: outperform all the other investors in the game. But don ́t be a shark! And remember the little people: the inhabitants of your new city need services to be satisfied!
Let ́s build this city!

CitiesUP is a 2-4 player board game. Every player acts like an investor. Build residential, commercial, bank, farm, or industrial buildings, and then supply them with electricity, water, and services.
Every player collects tax revenue from their buildings, which each have to be supplied with different services to thrive.
Your goal: purchase as many buildings as possible and supply them with water, electricity, and services to reach a higher score than the other players. Buildings have to be supplied properly to generate taxes for the owner. Taxes, bonuses, and upkeep each generate points for the owner. When the last demand card is turned face-up, the round is complete and the game is over.
If two players have the same amount of points, the tie will be broken by counting each player's money tokens.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Pattern Recognition, Simulation, Tile Placement

name: Insikt
description:
A trivia game (Insikt = Insight) where you in the basic version should first get 21 points through answering questions correctly. Then starts the end-game towards the finish. The winner is the first one who first gains a better insight, i.e. come to the middle of the game board. Tactic, a good poker face and the ability to, during pressure against the hour-glass make well thought-out long shots, are things which determine how well a player may succeed. (Quotation from the rules leaflet.)

There's an advanced version, where you secretly may bet upon if somebody may manage to answer the questions of not.

A lot of companies have used this game as a gift, so there exist a large number of boxes with different logos on them (and they are dirt common in thrift stores).

name: Monopoly: Rugby World Cup
description:
A limited edition Monopoly game based on the 1999 Rugby World Cup held in the United Kingdom. Variations on the origional theme takes the palce of the houses and hotels being replaved with terraces and stadiums. Players get the opportunity to purchace rugby teams and the stations have been replaced with stadiums.
As with all themed Monopoly sets the tokens are unique to the game. Rugby 1999 offers players the chance to play as the Webb Ellis trophy, a rugby player or the goal posts. The boot token gets an upgrade to a "Rugby Boot".
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: MCI Classic
description: Your standard Monopoly with the theme surrounding the MCI Classic Golf Tournament. These were not made available to the public. There were only 5,000 copies made which makes it both rare and desirable to the Monopoly collector.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Mystical Empire CCG
description:
Mystical Empire is an Action-Based game, so everything that takes place during the game requires the use of an Action by either a Character or a Creature or a combination of several.

With your Character’s Actions, you may Hire Creatures, Play Items & Structures, or (if able) cast Spells & Effects. Your Character may also Attack once per turn, if you choose, and may save an Action to Defend against Attacks made during your Opponent’s turn.

With your Creature’s Actions, you may Attack your Opponent’s Character or Built Structure(s), Defend against Attacks made by your Opponent’s Character & Creatures, use Special Abilities (which will be written on each card), or (if able) cast Spells & Effects.

Your ultimate goal is to destroy your Opponent’s Character. Once this has been achieved, you win the game.

name: Euro Touring
description:
With your friends you embark on an adventure through Europe, answering questions about different countries, and trying to travel to the countries that will earn you most money. A mixture of monopoly/jumbo jet, money- and dice-wise, and the trivia aspect of general knowledge about the different countries in Europe.

Questions that can be asked are: "Of what country is the 'Kron' the currency? and "What county does this flag belong to?"

Players travel across Europe and are buying souvenirs from sights they are visiting. The first player who finishes his journey wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Charlie's Angels
description:
From the box: Kelly, Sabrina, and Kris make up the team of Charlie's Angels. Charlie's phone calls give this beautiful squad of crime busters the information needed to capture the target villain. They work as a team, each using her special talents to apprehend the culprit.

Each player controls three agents and attempts to trap the villain using their team members. You score points once the villain has been surrounded and is unable to move.
categories: Adventure, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Enclosure, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Milton Bradley, NIG Brinquedos, Somerville Ltd.

name: Swindle
description: In this game, players travel around the board trying to unload their genuine and worthless "antiques" on unsuspecting suckers without getting caught out by the other players. The player to get rid of all their antiques (cards) first is the winner.

name: Connecting London
description:
Connecting London is a strategy game, where 2-6 players build the iconic Zone 1 London Underground Map and work to be the first to complete their underground sign, all while dodging surprises along the way. While collecting map tiles, you will need to make connections between London mainline stations and famous landmarks. Can you stay on track to win, or will you be derailed by another passenger? Test your skills in this fast-paced board game as you make the most connections and become the King or Queen of the underground!
—description from the publisher

This is a tile-placement game.
Map tiles are drawn at random, with each player having a "hand" of 5 tiles.
During their turn, players add tiles to the board, aiming to connect stations with tourist attractions.
The game is won by the first player who successfully makes 5 connections to complete their underground sign.
Box contains: 53 map tiles, 6 sets of scoring tiles, 1 game board, 1 travel bag
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Parasites Unleashed!
description:
In Parasites Unleashed! you control a parasite, trying to complete your life cycle, mate, and lay eggs before your opponents. Do all the things real parasites do -- bore into vital organs, hide inside a blood cell, hitch a ride inside a mosquito, even take over your host's brain. However, opponents can add stages to your life cycle, and zap you with medicine.

Parasites Unleashed! is a simple and fast-paced non-collectible card game for 2-4 players ages 8 and up. Gameplay is simple enough for younger players, but more sophisticated gamers can discover subtle strategies. Each set contains 55 cards with entertainingly gross information about real parasites and blackly comic illustrations by artist Fred Zinn.

Home Page: http://www.zygotegames.com/pu.html

name: World of Wines
description:
From the publishers website:

World of Wines is a new, entertaining and educational board game for everyone interested in wine – experts as well as novices. Players can play at different levels of expertise simultaneously, allowing the whole family to join in. Test your knowledge and learn more about the world of wine from the classics, such as Romanée-Conti and Petrus, to the rising stars, such as Pingus and Opus one – even about the common table wine.
publishers: Dutchport International, HUCH!, Re:creation Group Plc

name: Winkers the game
description: "The Strategy Game you can lose in a wink!" a 19 space hex board, 20 neutral checkers that can only be played on the board, 10 winks each that can only be played on a checker. 3 in a row wins.

name: Auf Teufel komm raus!
description: Using triangular tiles, players try to connect devils with their tail ends. The longer the tail (number of tiles), the more the devil/tail scores.

name: The Crow
description:
Based upon The Crow, the first movie, this card game allow two players to face off each other by playing the characters from the movie.

One player plays as The Crow and his allies, while the other one plays as the criminals of the town.

Online Play


CCG Workshop (no longer available)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Get Over It
description: Use the chopstick doodads to pick up the little pieces and drop them in the tower. The pieces are worth points. Get the most points and you win before the timer runs out..
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver

name: The Secret Of Nimh Game
description:
