You are in the shoes of Mrs. Brisby as she makes her frantic journey to save her home and her children. Based on the movie of the same name, this children's game is full of excitement and fun.

The game consists of a board, cards, spinner, and pawns. The board represents the adventures Mrs. Brisby meets with in the movie. Along the board you will meet with various obstacles. To pass each you must play a matching card. The first player to reach the finish and play an "Amulet" card is the winner.

This game is great for children, and only requires the ability to count. Hours of fun for the kids and mom and dad too.
publishers: Mrs. Brisby Ltd., Western Publishing Company, Whitman

name: Showdown
description: Four ranchers cast their eyes on the Stadt Dice City. You are one of them and send your three best cowboys into the city, in order to take it over. Play your people correctly, so that they can keep your competitors off. The citizens will help you.

name: Formel 1
description: Light card driven Formula One racing game. Players are able to move all cars (but only one a single turn) depending on the cards they get. The own car is hidden. Game contains an even simpler dice driven variant for kids.

name: Mythic
description:
Mythic is a card game where the goal is to assemble as many families as possible and make points with them. A round ends when a player has no more cards in hand and the points of all the families laid previously are counted. Rounds are played until the points limit is reached.

Some special cards exist forcing some families to be taken back or redistributed, thus it can be dangerous to play "full frontal"...

name: This Game Sucks
description:
Prepare to do battle with the greatest foe you have ever faced. It's more insidious than a secret agent, more cunning than a cyber-ninja and more devastating than than a three headed dragon with a hangover.

This Game Sucks places you in the battle of your life as you match wits with a bumbling GameMaster and his poorly planned plot lines. As you struggle to free yourself from the warped, twisted, and totally lame RPG you have landed in you will meet many familiar figures. Thwart the tedious ramblings of the Rules Lawyer. Berate the Closet Gamer as he is forced to make yet another excuse to his girlfriend. And find subtle cruel ways to torment the Gamer's Little Brother as you force the GM to finally give up all hope and quit the game.

name: Catch the Animals
description: Six popular pets are in the middle of the table as cards. The same six pets are on the sides of the four dice. Who will be the first to find the animals shown by the dice? Players have to react quick as a flash and grab the right cards!

name: Split the Ward
description:
From the back of the box:

Welcome to the Happy Valley 314th ward! Does it look familiar? We have six nursery classes, two independently running Primaries, and two elders quorums. We’re packed like sardines into our ward building and it’s time to Split the Ward! In this fun, action-packed game, you and your friends and family have been called to help rearrange a cast of zany characters into new leadership positions as quickly as possible. The first person to organize three completed presidencies wins! The action cards and wild cards will keep things interesting and you’ll be surprised at how many of the “peculiar people” in our ward family remind you of someone in your own ward! Find out how much fun it is to Split the Ward!

name: Stedenspel
description:
A set of trivia games about Dutch cities. 2 to 4 players have to answer questions in different categories. Whoever manages to answer a question in each category correctly first wins the game.

Four editions are available for the four largest cities in the Netherlands:

- http://www.stedenspel.nl/
- Amsterdam Spel - http://www.amsterdamspel.nl/
- Rotterdam Spel - http://www.rotterdamspel.nl/
- Den Haag Spel (the Hague) - http://www.denhaagspel.nl/
- Utrecht Spel - http://www.utrechtspel.nl/

name: Musaraña
description:
This is a Charades kind game. Team A picks a card in the category shown on the board and gives it to team B. Team B reads the theme and writes a word for that theme. Then it shows it to the member of team A that will do the charade.

The categories are:

T.V.
Movies
Sports
Literature
Culture
Characters
Music
Geography
Miscellaneous
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game, Sports
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: JAKBO!
description:
"Starting from opposite sides of the board, players try to out-maneuver their opponent to cross the board and score points before all the pieces are played. Points are scored by playing your pieces in your opponent's end. The player with the most points when the pieces run out wins!

Play up, down over and around to block, defend and attack. Use the range of JAKBO pieces to discover a depth of strategy that will captivate beginners and experts alike!"

name: Finding Nemo Storytelling Game
description: This is a storytelling game for young kids. The game feature cards with characters from Finding Nemo and words that are relevant such as swim or jellyfish. Players make up a story using the cards and filling in the rest of the spaces.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Das Spiel des Lebens Kartenspiel
description:
The highs and lows of an entire life in just 20 minutes: great advancement or even the total bankruptcy. An exciting life begins with each new shuffle...

The life cards are divided into 4 colors (green/love, blue/education, orange/life, pink/luxury). Each color includes 10 numbered cards and a joker. The joker can be used for any other number. At the end of the game you gain life points for the sets of cards you have made during the game.

There are 2 possibilities to form a set – cards of the same color in number order (4,5,6,7) or a group of the same number (3,3,3). In addition, each life card shows a picture. If these images match your lifestyle cards, you get extra points when playing.

Goal of the Game: to win the most life points by playing life-card sets and achieving your own lifestyle.
publishers: ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, Hasbro, Parker Spiele

name: ZEIT-Roulette
description:
In ZEIT-Roulette players are guessing the time in seconds between the start and stop of a time watch controlled by another player (20-80 seconds). Victory points are won by betting on different sized time frames.

spielbox edition #82, published in issue 1/2008.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Mälumängudoomino
description:
Mälumängu Doomino (Trivia Dominoes) is a boardgame that puts a trivia element into the well known dominoes game. The tiles have two categories marked on them, out of total ten. The tile placement follows normal domino rules, but each time you are placing a tile, you have to answer a question on the topic marked on the tile in question.

The game includes:
100 question cards with 1000 questions
55 domino tiles

The categories in the game are: history, people, nature, geography, science, entertainment, sports, Estonia, culture and varia

name: Grimassimix
description:
Players attend the Clown School Grimassimix, where making faces is subject matter instead of maths and languages – to the student’s delight. Sticking out their tongues and wrinkling their noses; everything’s allowed when players try to imitate the faces on the cards. After all, they are trying to trains their facial muscles, aren’t they? The game comes with a little mirror to control your funny faces. The player, who recognizes most of the faces, wins the game.

Grimassimix is a unique board game to tackling the topic of speech therapy. The game focuses on the training of facial motor skills and has been developed by a team of four speech therapists with years of professional experience.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Humor, Party Game

name: Dino-Deal
description:
Four dinosaur cards are openly placed in the middle of the table. Each player now secretly bids on one of them. If s/he is the only one bidding on a particular dinosaur, s/he gets it. If several players are after the same dinosaur, the owner is decided by die rolls.
The player with the most valuable dinosaur collection at the end of the game is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Imps Vs Puppies
description:
Recently revised into a deluxe box, Imps Vs. Puppies is a trick-taking game about players competing to smash open the top card of the Crate Deck. The game offers 15 different Imps with various abilities that will trigger at different points of the round. Each of these Imps come in 6 different colors to support the different teams and there is often a pregame draft to pick which Imps are included in the game. The crate deck is also customized with a mixture of points and traps.

Each round has 5 phases which will determine when Imp abilities will trigger and how the round is resolved.
Phase 1- Send Imps: Each player sends an Imp of their choice from their hand to the battle. If the card is sent face it, this means their ability will trigger. Sent face down, their identity is unknown so their strength can be bluffed.
Phase 2- Reveal Imps: Imps that were sent facedown are revealed and any Imps that are matching in strength are sent home immediately.
Phase 3- Ability Phase: Several Imps have abilities that will trigger right before the center crate is smashed.
Phase 4- Smash Crate: The top crate card is revealed and resolved. If the card is a puppy, players put this card in their score pile. If the card is a bomb, the Imp who smashed the crate is killed. There are a number of other traps that could trigger as well, including Ninja Kittens and Mega Bombs.
Phase 5- Cleanup Phase: Players pull any Imps in the Infirmary into their hands and the Imps used that round enter the infirmary.

This continues until the Last Round Puppy is revealed and players count the number of points in their score piles. Ties are broken by the person who smashed the most puppies.

name: Murder Mystery Mansion Travel
description:
One player (or team) creates a murder case, by selecting a suspect, place, motive and method. The other player (or team) then has to find out this information by making guesses, also consisting of a suspect, location, motive and method. After each guess, they are told how many items they got correct, but not which.

If the guessing player (or team) solves the case within seven attempts, they score points.

After each round, the roles are reversed. The first player to reach a pre-determined amount of points wins the game.

This is the travel edition of Murder Mystery Mansion. It uses magnetic tokens instead of cards. Other than that, the main difference is the size: this travel version has four suspects, three locations, three motives and three methods. The regular version has six of each, and the guessing team gets twelve rounds to solve the crime.

name: Princess Lillifee: I Pack My Bags
description:
Princess Lillifee would like to go on a journey and is packing her bags. Since she would like to to take so many things along, she takes notes on small pieces of paper. But where did she place all her things in her room? Can you help Princess Lillifee to find her stuff?

Components:
24 function cards
24 item cards
1 Princess Lillifee figure with base
1 Manual

How to play the game:
The youngest player starts. When it is your turn you show the top card of the function cards. It shows two or three things that Princess Lillifee would like to take along on her journey and which have to be packed into her bag. You have to try to reveal these items by showing the correct item cards. The order is up to you. If you make a mistakeand show the wrong item card with an item that is not on the function card, you turn only this item card face down again and it is the next players turn to try and find the correct items on the function card. As soon as one player has revealed all items on a function card, he can keep the card and as soon as all item cards are turned face down again, he can continue with a new function card.

End of the game:
The game is over as soon as all function cards are given out or if one player got 6 function cards. Now you count your points on the cards. Each item on a function card counts 1 point, so you have as many points as items on your function card. The one with the most points is the winner.

name: GenDu: The Gentleman's Duel
description:
GenDu "The Gentleman's Duel" is a trading card game where you play as a gentleman in The world of the Gents. You can challenge other gentleman to a duel to test their might and prove your own. The gentlemen set up dungeons and battle to the death.In the game players build their respective dungeons while the objective is to get one of their nouns (also referred to as creatures) through the opposing player's dungeon whilst destroying anything in its path. Both players build dungeons and then try to conquer each other, which makes for an intense experience.

Gentlemen duel for many reasons; honor, respect, recognition, fancy shoes, the love of a fair maiden, crisp bacon, a good shawarma, or to maybe one day be a
Master Gentleman.


Gentlemen can build their own deck of 50 cards and duel against other Gentleman.
You can also purchase Starter Decks, which are a built deck of 50 cards ready to play. All Starter Decks are random.
Or you can purchase Booster Packs and build your own deck from scratch.
Trade with your friends to get cards that will help your deck and increase your odds of winning
Or try and collect all 136 different cards in the series.


The cards in a Gentleman's deck are the powers and defense they have at their disposal to defeat any challenger. Build wisely.

For more information on how to play GenDu The Gentleman's Duel. Check out our Game Play Video on our Rules page.

You can also create your own GenDu cards!!!

GenDu The Gentleman's Duel is the first and only trading card game ( TCG ) where all cards released in every series are created by the players.


Every Booster pack and Starter deck comes with blank GenDu cards.
Starter decks have 3 blank cards and Booster packs have 1.
Players draw their card ideas on the cards provided and Send Them In.
Players can also use our Card Maker online to submit cards.
The cards are posted on our Facebook page for votes.
The cards with the highest votes are printed into the next series.
Author of the card has their name printed on the card
Author also gets first copy of the printed card sent to them for FREE!


This is what sets GenDu apart from any other TCG. Now for the first time players have an opportunity to be a part of the game creation. Furthermore with player input and collaboration, GenDu can will always remain fresh and interesting. We welcome all players to send in as many ideas as they want so that they have a better chance of one of them being picked to be in the next release of GenDu.

The Gentleman's Duel awaits....

name: Atlantic City
description:
Atlantic City is a narrative card game set during the time of prohibition in the U.S. Players receive cards to determine their character, relationships and secret goal. The game is then played over six rounds/acts in which the participants freely narrate their story and trade items depicted by additional cards, always having their secret goal (e.g., richest gang, must own no weapons, or most alcohol) in mind.

Atlantic City is the first title in the "Mini Story" series of games from Noris Spiele.
mechanics: Hand Management, Role Playing, Storytelling, Trading

name: Jeopardy! Junior Edition
description:
FROM THE BOX:
Based on the hit tv game show.

The fast-action quiz game developed just for kids! Featuring over 2000 fun and challenging questions.

Jeopardy!'s trademark is that answers must be asked in the form of a question.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Sturdy Birdy
description:
Sturdy Birdy - Roll the dice! Strike a pose! Find the perfect balance!

Reggie the Pigeon dreams of life in the circus as a high wire acrobat. (Sadly, Reggie's flight abilities have never taken off.)

Reggie needs your help to perfect 12 poses to land the high wire balancing, birdseed providing job he's always dreamed of.

To do that players must master 12 unique poses and be the first to make it to the end of the line. Ahh... 12 poses can't be so tough you say. Wait until you add counting spectators, flapping wings and a few choruses of "tweety, tweet, tweet"!

Strength, balance, counting, and determination all come into play as players attempt to master 12 different poses. On a player's turn they roll the dice to determine how long they must hold a pose and where on their body they must balance a bean bag while holding that pose. The first player to make their way through all of the poses wins.

No reading required.

Contains: 12 large Reggie the Pigeon Pose Cards, 12 card stands, 4 seed bags, 2 foam dice

name: Pixbox
description:
In Pixbox, the active player lays out six transparent cards at random. These cards show one or more blue squares on them, with the squares arranged in various patterns. The player then lays out a red task card, and everyone must visualize — without touching the blue cards! — how they could arrange one or more blue cards in an overlapping manner, but with only the transparent areas covering one another, so as to recreate the image shown on the red task card.

As soon as a player thinks they have a solution, they yell out and attempt to demonstrate their idea with the transparent cards. If they're correct, they keep the cards they used, and whoever collects the most points wins.

name: Tjuv och polis: Kortspel
description:
Card game version of Tjuv och polis (a classic Swedish boardgame).
A simple card game there you try to collect as many of the money-cards you can before a police-card is played.

You take one card fram the draw-pile and take to the hand. If you have collected at least one thief and money-card in the same color you can either play it and collect the money or wait for more money-cards. But as soon one player draws a police-card you can risk to lose the money-cards.

The player that has collected most money when the last card is taken from the pile is the winner.

name: Colour Blind
description:
In Colour Blind, players act as apprentices to the art greats, but disaster has struck and they must reorganize the spilt paint before their masters come back. Players place cards in the center of the playing area, and when a player can recognize a valid order of paint on the table, they hit the timer. The goal of the game is then to build a set of paints in order from what is on the table before the timer runs out. If they do, they win a point.

A battery-powered timer is included in the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Potlatch: A Game About Economics
description:
Potlatch, the game, is a strategic, educational card game based on indigenous philosophies. It is designed to meet Washington's K-12 educational standards for teaching about native history, economics, culture, and government. The game was developed as a community effort with local elders and language experts. The game is written in both English and Lushootseed, the indigenous language of the Salish Pacific Northwest. Game mechanics are based on sharing resources to meet other players’ needs for food, materials, technology, and knowledge.

This is a collaborative game where there is not one winner. Success is determined by whether or not all houses have their resource needs met by the end of the game.

The game is named for the Potlatch, which is a ceremonial distribution and re-distribution of resources, property, food, knowledge, and wealth with the purpose of affirming social status via the historic economic systems of subsistence, prestige, and sharing. Potlatching is practiced by indigenous peoples of the Pacific NW coast of the U.S. and Canada. Historically it supported a large socio-economic system to maintain a high level of food production and to equalize food accessibility. Individuals, families, or communities host potlatches and planning takes a year or more. Skagit elder and historian, Vi Hilbert, wrote “Public acts of distributing valuables to guests were the ultimate confirmation of a host’s achievements and personal high-status in their family and community.”

name: Botched Operation
description:
It's an adult party version of the classic Operation board game! There's a laughing gas leak in the operating room and the doctors are feeling a little…buzzed. Can you make Cavity Sam better before time is up? In the Botched Operation board game, you get to be the doctor and use the tweezers to remove the silly ailments from Cavity Sam, but you've got to do it while performing the stunt shown on the Challenge card. The card you pick might say to remove parts without using your thumbs, or while getting tickled. If the tweezers touch the sides of the openings, the buzzer goes off and you have to move on to the next ailment. Try to get as many parts as you can before the timer runs out, without getting buzzed.

—description from the publisher

name: Il collegio
description:
Inspired by the Rai TV Show, the game offers a challenge set in a sixties-style college to achieve the middle school diploma of the time.
Players must answer questions in Italian, History, Geography,
Mathematics and Sciences, but also of Latin, Technical applications and Home economics.
To win you have to enter the classrooms to take the exams and avoid the overseers who bring the students in punishment to the principal's office.

—description from the designer
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Alice Cooper's HorrorBox
description: This game is in the style of Cards Against Humanity with added Dare cards.

name: Loopino
description: A card-flicking card game in which a target card depicting some tasty fish is placed on the table and players attempt to flick (actually, according to the rules, this is a wrist-toss rather than a finger-flick) cards depicting dolphins as close to the target as possible - the twisting motion of the flicked cards is supposed to represent the playful antics of the dolphins. A crosshair appears in the corner of each card, and distance is measured by the closest crosshair on the flicked card in relation to the closest crosshair on the target card. The number of cards to be scored is determined by the number on the closest card to the target (i.e. if a "4" card is closest to the target, the four closest cards all will score). Each card scores a number of points equal to the face value of the card multiplied by the number of crosshair symbols on the card that remain uncovered. If all four crosshairs on the target are covered, the player covering the last takes a penalty, as does any player causing the target card to fall off the table. Suggested game duration is as many rounds as the number of players; highest point total wins.

name: Ostroleka 1831
description:
A game about the battle of Ostroleka (May 26th, 1831) which was the turning point of the Russo-Polish War (November Uprising).

Also included are the counters and scenarios dealing with the Napoleonic battle of Ostroleka (February 15th-16th, 1807) between the French and the Russians.

The game is the herald of the new "Napoleonic" system designed for Taktyka i Strategia's games, dealing with medium and large battles of the Napoleonic Wars and the Russo-Polish War of 1831. Counters represent entire regiments, one hex represents 250m, one turn represents 30 minutes.

At present rules and all publications about the game are only in Polish language.

name: PowerTechnics
description:
My copy is dated 1992 but the copyright goes back to 1978 (it was renewed in 1980 and 1982 as well).

The game is a sort of cross between Monopoly and a light wargame like Risk. The board has an outer track, very Monopoly like, but a map occupies the space inside. It is divided into 16 countries, forming colour groups known as Cartels. As you go around, you buy up "countries" to charge other players "port fees"; the countries can have their industry developed by buying Factories (e.g. houses/hotels). The Community Chest/Chance cards have been replaced by Spot Market and Commodity Exchange decks, which are used to simulate a player's speculating on the spot market. A key difference from Monopoly is that you can build up your military and use it as an alternate means of conquest.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Big John
description:
FROM THE BOX: Whatsa matter BIG JOHN? You feeling a little flushed? You say you're full of SCUZZIES and you're going to explode? Just don't explode on me - explode on the next guy! Put some plastic Scuzzies into BIG JOHN - then push the randomize handle. Will he flush? Will he burp? Will he blow? You never know! Keep stuffing Scuzzies and flushing till somebody makes BIG JOHN flush big time - and sends all the SCUZZ BALLS flying!

Get rid of all your plastic scuzzies first, you win!

Contents: Big John toilet, pipe, base, 4 plastic Scuzz buckets, cardboard tile, basement floor, 36 Scuzzies

name: Cold Turkey
description:
Place the gameboard in the middle of the table and put Freezin' Freddy in the center of the pond. Each player receives an ice tray in a different color. Place all the ice cubes randomly in the pond.

Switch Freezin' Freddy on and it will start turning, picking the ice cubes out of the pond. Each player tries at the same time to pick up the ice cubes. Put your color cubes in the tray and continue playing and toss the other players cubes back into the pond.

The first player that filled up the tray with six cubes of his/her color wins the game.

name: Winnie the Pooh Tip 'n' Topple Game
description: Help Pooh and his friends climb the wobbly tree, but be careful. . . If the tree tips Pooh and Friends will t-t-topple! Be first to help all of your characters onto the tree to win.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Oink!
description:
This is the game Spoons with little rubber pigs instead of spoons. You use one less pig then the number of players in the game and put them in a pile in the middle. You pass cards around in a circle and when one player gets four of a kind they say "Oink!" and grab a pig from the pile in the middle. The person who doesn't get a pig gets a letter, and if you spell Oink you are out of the game.

The game has 12 different cards and there are five of each type of card so the games go a little quicker than they do just playing spoons with a poker deck.

name: Knaves of Charlemagne
description: Knaves of Charlemagne features an original, fast-paced card game in which 2 players vie for position as an attacker or defender. The player who has no cards in his or her hand after the deck as been emptied is declared the winner. The set includes two decks of woodcut-style illustrated cards inside a hand crafted wooden card box. In addition, the game includes rules for 11 classic card games.

name: Pirates of the Caribbean Pirate Game
description:
This game plays almost exactly like UNO (it is actually closer to Crazy Eights). Even though the action cards differ a bit from those of UNO, they're strongly based on them. The game also includes one or more jokers. With a joker you may play an action of your choice. Another difference is that this game lacks the scoring mechanism which is included in UNO.

Differences between versions:

1:Pirates of the Caribbean:
- Has larger cards
- Drawn images are shown on the cards
- Includes only one joker
- Shows only UNO-like symbols

2:Pirates of the Caribbean - Dead Man's Chest:
- Has normal sized cards
- Photos of the movie are shown on the cards
- Includes three jokers
- Shows playing card symbols besides UNO-like symbols

3:Pirates of the Caribbean - At World's End:
- Has normal sized cards
- Photos of the movie are shown on the cards
- Includes two jokers
- Shows playing card symbols besides UNO-like symbols

Sets 2 and 3 are identical, except for the Joker count (3 vs. 2).
Set 1 differs significantly in card distribution:
- numbers run from dedicated 1 thru 8 (instead of suited A/1..10)
- special cards are fewer, there are only 2 of each type (instead of 4, or 2 for +2/+4)
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: 2012: The Day of Fallout
description:
2012: The Day of Fallout
Tactical game for 2-4 players

Lead one of four armies: Human Section 8, Arkanian alien race, Triad and CyberZona. Fight for domination over the Last District on Earth.

Section8 is last hope of mankind, has powerful offensive units. Arkanians - insectoid invaders form space with heavily armoured units trying to take over the earth.

Phases of game:
- choose Orders Card
- move or attack opponents
- use Strategic Command Card's

Scenarios:
- standard deathmatch for 2-4 players,
- cooperative deathmatch
- capture the flag,
- capture the region,
- escort unit,
- defend region/s
and more.

Victory is achieved by:
- implementation scenarios, or
- collecting victory points, or
- destruction of all enemy units on board

Game in Polish language version.

In box:
- 25 pieces of the map (modular board)
- 60 cards of Army (15 for each army)
- 24 cards for Strategic Action
- 16 cards of Orders (4 for each army)
- 12 cards of Teams (3 for each army)
- 5 card - walls
- 3 cards - flags
- 20 bases
- 2 dices
- 1 rulebook

Game Designer: Łukasz S. Kowal
Art designers: Łukasz S. Kowal, Agnieszka Kowal
Publisher: Essencegame

Essencegame.com
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Crazy Yatzy
description:
Crazy Yatzy is Yahtzee with all the catagories you have longed for. Built upon the scandinavian version of Yahtzee Crazy Yatzy includes, among others: Almost a pair, Almost three of a kind, Another chance, yet another chance and CRAZY. The last one is thrown with the eyes closed, and then you have to either trust, or distrust which dice your fellow players tell you to reroll.

Note that Alga also published another Yahtzee variant under the name Crazy Yatzy which included dexterity elements, nonsensically named categories and so on.

name: Zootopia: Suspect Search
description:
Description from the box:

Judy Hopps and Nick Wilde have identified their suspects. It's up to you to track them down and solve the case.

Object of the game:

Be the first player to nab three suspects.

To play:

File tiles are arranged face-down in a 4x5 grid. Each player takes a Case Lead Tile and places it on their Detective Desk Mat. Suspects are lined up nearby. Each suspect has three evidence symbols on its base. On a turn, players may look under one tile to find evidence symbols without showing their opponent.

At the beginning of a turn, if a player thinks she knows where two Evidence file tiles are, which, along with her Case Lead Tile match a suspect, she may nab the suspect instead of searching under a tile. To nab a suspect, declare which suspect you are accusing. Then, flip the corresponding Evidence file tiles over. If correct, the suspect is placed on the Detective Desk Mat on a numbered space. If the player is mistaken and the Evidence file tiles do not match, they are flipped back over and play continues, but the opponent has now seen where two tiles are. The first player to nab three suspects is the winner.

name: Rudolph the Red Nosed Reindeer: Christmas Journey
description:
You've been chosen by Santa to help Rudolph, Hermey the Elf, and Yukon Cornelius find all the lost Misfit Toys. Christmas can't start until this courageous trio returns all the toys to the North Pole, so they can be delivered to a lucky boy or girl. Gather your friends as you all journey through an icy winter wonderland on your quest to the Island of Misfit Toys and back to ol' Saint Nick's workshop. Who will be the first to help Santa?.

Players take turns rolling dice to move around the game board, playing out actions such as sliding up or down the North Pole, picking up a Rudolph & Hermey card, swapping character placement, or entering into a Reindeer Games competition. In order to determine the winner, the first 2 players to reach the finish square on the game board compete in a final Reindeer Games competition. This competition will be best 2 out of 3, with each player taking turns rolling the die, highest roll wins the round.

Game includes game board, 4 character pieces, 48 Rudolph cards, one 8-sided die, and rules.
For 2-4 players, ages 8+.

name: Glücksrad
description:
Glücksrad is a simple card driven betting game for 2-6 players. Players receive a hand of 8 cards with different movement points (+, - and +/-)printed on them. By playing those cards, the players move the same figure around the "wheel of fortune".
Before playing those cards the players have to secretly predict where the figure will end after all cards are played, thus receiving more or less points at the end (which can eventually be doubled by a joker).

After 6 complete rounds, the winner is decided.
A special twist is the "canyon" at the bottom of the wheel which can only be crossed by playing a special card.

name: The Garden Game
description: Essentially an educational game for children focusing on the science and mechanics behind gardening, The Garden Game comes with a board and spinner but is basically card driven. Players move about collecting and trading cards in order to grow plants in their garden.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Kurre
description: A children's game for Ages 4 and up. The game features a squirrel piece and a bunch of cone-tokens and a die with numbers from 1 to 3. The board consists of 7 squares each with from 1-5 spots for the cones.On his/her turn the player rolls the die and moves the squirrel in any direction the exact number of squares. If the player lands on a square that's filled with cones then he takes all those tokens into his pool and ends his turn. If he lands on a square that's not yet filled he must place one of his cones on that square. After this he must choose whether to end his turn or take another turn. The game ends when a player lands on a square that's not yet filled and doesn't have any cones left to place. The player with the most cones left is then the winner.

name: Aficionado
description: Aficionado is entirely in French. In the game, 45 cards, with on each side three beginnings of songs titles, movie titles, proverbs... The active player reads these three sentence fragments. Then the others, as quick as possible, form a new incongruous sentence with the ends of these sentences. The fastest to give the correct answer gets the card. The winner is the first player with seven cards.

name: LifeStories
description:
Basically, roll the dice, move, draw a card, and share something about your life as directed on the card.

From the front of the box:

A fun game of telling tales and sharing smiles with family and friends.

name: Airline
description:
You draw a passenger manifest card which lists the destinations you must drop the passengers at. Various spaces on the board have you draw what are in effect random event cards that affect your "flight plan". Planes must move the exact amount thrown on the die, which typically leads to multiple passes over an airport, trying to land...

Very random, with few player decisions.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: M*A*S*H Game
description: Hawkeye Pierce, Major Margaret Houlihan, B.J. Hunnicutt, and Klinger of the M*A*S*H Team, are hard at work once again bringing wounded safely to the chopper pad so the injured can start their journey home. It's up to you to rescue at least six wounded and get a complete chopper to the chopper pad by moving along the path, in either direction. You do this by trying to land on M*A*S*H spaces where you can collect wounded and chopper parts. But be careful, some of the M*A*S*H cards on the M*A*S*H spaces can hinder your rescue mission. The supply depot can help you complete your chopper so you can make a speedy escape to the chopper pad and send your wounded safely home. Beware of the fire zone spaces where you will lose a turn and possibly lessen your chances or rescuing your wounded and getting your chopper. So select your favorite M*A*S*H character from the gameboard, roll the die and begin your rescue mission.
categories: Children's Game, Medical, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Presidents Game
description:
Learningames offers a new and exciting way to have fun while learning about the American Presidency. Through these innovative and easy-to-play games players master important information about all presidents and their administrations.

Two to six players sit around the playing board. The playing board includes the portrait of each chief executive. In place of the names of the presidents are the numbers 1 to 43. To begin the game a player draws a card from the deck. Each card has the name of a president on one side and a number with important information about the head of state on the other side.

In the basic game players win cards by locating and naming the president on the numbered playing board or by correctly challenging incorrect answers. When playing advanced games, players master important information about the presidents identified in the basic game.

name: Negamco Pro Golf Game
description:
a 1962 Golf game with 25 individually rated golfers of the time by Nemadji Game Company of Duquette Minnesota. There are several charts (Tee-off, Fairway, Off-Green) that you (representing the golfer) use to move your golf ball (marked by a Tee) down the 9-hole course. The individual player cards are only used once you are on the green. There is a spinner in the bottom of the box where you get a result of 1 to 25 and look up a result on a chart or on the player card.
Some of the golfers included: 1942 Byron Nelson, 1937 Byron Nelson, 49 Sam Snead, 54 Snead, 53 Ben Hogan, 51 Hogan, 35 Gene Sarazen. I think this was a set of All-stars and might have been an extra option. There is also a set of 1962 golfers: Weiskopf, Crampton, Dent, Wadkins, Watson, Player, Floyd, Nicklaus, Trevino and others.

name: Full of Dollars
description:
The game contains 160 cards and 85 notes and has got a mafia theme. To win the game you have to be the richest player and to ruin the others.

Steal sports cars, repaint them, get into the sex industry, open a night club or a gambling club, it's all good to be full of dollars.
Make alliances, rob the bosses who are falling asleep on a large pile of bills, call the police and sell your enemies to justice. During the trial, take advantage of it by sticking a good piece of plastic in their casino, this will reset your competitions to zero!
The next day, when the poker game between bosses arrives, learn that with a few more aces, you always have a better game. The other players won't hesitate to cheat!
But be careful, don't insult a boss who plays honestly, he will make you pay dearly, very dearly!



Devenez le plus riche des caids an ruinant vos adversaires!
Volez des voitures de sport, repegnez-les, lancez vousdans l'industrie du sexe, ouvrez un night club ou un cercle de jeu, tout est bon pur etre full of dollars.
Faites des alliances, braquez les caids qui s'endorment sur un gros paquet de billets, appelez la police et vendez vos ennemis a la justice. Pendant le proces, profitez-en pur coller un bon pain de plastic dans leur casino, cela remettra lex competes a zero!
Le sour, quand arrive la partie de poker entre boss, apprenez qu'avec qeulques as de plus, on a toujous un meilleur jeu. Les autres jouers, eux n'hesiteront pas a tricher!
Mais attention, n'insultez pas un caid qui joue honnetement, il vous le fera payer cher, tres cher!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Batalha de Sao Borja
description:
Batalha de São Borja is a postcard game available in issue 1 of Riachuelo Games' Strategos magazine.

The Battle of São Borja is one of the opening offensives of the Triple Alliance War (1864 - 1870), in which a small force of Brazilians defend São Borja (in the Brazilian state of Rio Grande dul Sul) against a much larger force of Paraguayans.

The Paraguayans must take São Borja in 11 turns or eliminate all the Brazilians. The Brazilians must prevent this from happening.

Counters: 8 Paraguayans vs. 6 Brazilian
Stats:

Top Left: Range
Top Right: Defense
Bottom Left: Movement
Bottom Right: Attack

name: UNO: Disney Princess
description:
UNO: Disney Princess is the standard game with of UNO with a special wild card and depictions of Disney Princesses on the cards.

The new special wild card is called a Curse card. When the curse card is played all other players are under a spell. The player who played the card calls out a color. Then all other players must take turns drawing cards and adding them to their hands until the color that was called has been drawn. Then the player who played the curse card calls a new color to be played (the same way a standard Wild card would be played).

Another UNO version named UNO: Disney Princess was released in 2004. This version contained a Dragon special card.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Trampoline Zombies!!!
description: Trampoline Zombies!!! is a game where you need to re-assemble your body with the best arms, legs, and head you can find. Assign roll combinations to each body part and push your luck to try and get the body parts worth the most points. Once a player completes their zombie with this unique push-your-luck mechanic, the zombie with the most points wins.

name: Riket
description: Swedish trivia game based on a TV-show. Questions in six time periods.

name: Beat the Clock Game
description: Beat the Clock was based on a popular TV program in which participants perform various stunts within a time limit. This game contains a ticking, automatic timer and all the necessary props to enjoy 60 hilarious skill contests at home. The cards explain and illustrate the stunts, and state the time limit allowed for players to beat the clock.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver
publishers: Endless Games (I), John Sands Pty Ltd, Lowell Toy Mfg., Milton Bradley, Spear's Games

name: Bang! Zoom!
description:
This is part of the Big Deal series of card games by Patch Products.

Players start with six cards each, which are used to spell words. The first person to spell BANG gets a 10 point bonus. Once this occurs, when someone spells ZOOM, they get a 10 point bonus and the game ends. Points are scored for each letter used in words. The winner is the player with the most points.

name: Monopoly: University Of Leeds Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with elements from the University Of Leeds, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Parker Brothers, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: The People's Court
description: The People's Court game is based on the very popular television show where the litigants settle their disputes in Judge Wapner's courtroom. An exciting game where the players are plaintiffs trying to win cases by landing on 'Case Cards', such as Problem Pets, Neighborhood Feuds, Disservices and Shoddy Goods. And, just as on the TV show, Judge Wapner is the ultimate authority."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Track Movement

name: Drivetime
description:
Drivetime, the exciting new game for everyone who has ever said, "If I had designed this road ... "

Drivetime challenges you to a rush-hour race to build the best road possible between work and home. Add game tiles to your opponents' roads to block their progress, divert their paths and add time to their trips. The player whose road produces the best commute time wins!

name: Fart The Game
description:
You guessed it. Farting on command is a rare act to be nurtured. At its best, the act blossoms into a rich symphony of sound along with the expulsion of powerful gases ripe with pungent odors.

Roll the die to move. When a you land on a square that says drink, drink. When you land on a square that says eat beans, you may of course substitute an obnoxious substitute that causes gas. When landing on a square that directs you to fart, you will have two minutes to summon up your best effort. The other players decide how you score on the fart meter on the game board. You will then be awarded the appropriate number of gas coupons. Winning the game is done in one of two ways. 1) First person to score 25 gas coupons or 2) Let rip with such a powerful fart that you clear the whole room!

name: Die Magische 7
description:
Quite simple card game by Leo Collovini. Players take tricks by making the sum of the numbers on the cards in the trick seven. (Guess it's the magic 7 the title mentions.)
Some special cards spice things up a bit. Game can be played with either 2 or 4 players.

name: Monopoly: Ipswich Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Ipswich, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Fórmula Turbo
description:
Formula Turbo is a simple racing game for kids. Just roll the dice (a single D6) and move you car - the game is as simple as that. Throw in a few event cards (good and bad) when you land on the "radio" spaces and hope not to land on the red spaces. That's all the rules in this game!
A double sided board for two different tracks on a game of luck suitable mainly for young kids.

name: Lightning Reaction Revenge
description:
The game consists of four handles, each equipped with a button. Each player grabs a handle and the game is started. A red light starts to blink and a nasty wailing sound is played. Then, suddenly, the light will turn green and sound goes silent. At that point, players must push the button in their handle. The LAST player to do that gets an electrical shock. Players will also be shocked, if they push the button while the light is red.

"Extreme" mode : in this mode ONLY the fastest button pusher is safe, while the rest are shocked. Obviously this only makes a difference with 3 or 4 players. With 2, it plays identical to the original.

"Revenge" mode : in this mode each player chooses who they would like to shock if they were to win. Press the button on the handle until the red light on your base control is targeting your chosen victim. The 3 lights correspond as follows : centre is the player opposite, left is the player to your left and right is the player to your right. Start the game and the fastest finger gets to shock their chosen victim.

The game uses three AAA batteries, so the shock is not dangerous, but it certainly adds an element of tension to the otherwise rather simple test of reacting speed.

Re-implements:

Lightning Reaction
Lightning Reaction Extreme

name: 4ty4
description:
A tactical Mancala variant. There are stones in three colors, and the board has some intersections where you can choose where to go with your move.
You can only move stacks with your own stone on top, and you score points if you manage to create three stacks next to each other with differently colored stones on top.
publishers: Darmstadt spielt, Österreichisches Spiele Museum e.V., Spielezentrum Herne

name: Conocer Europa
description:
A family game that takes you all over Europe. It has more than 1.600 trivia questions at different levels of difficulty (easier questions for kids and harder ones for adults). With every question the players will travel a route trough Europe and collect flags, the first to complete its route wins.
Questions cover topics like monuments, history, public figures and curiosities.

name: Go to Hell! The Game
description:
Whoever thought that telling someone to “Go to Hell!” would be a compliment? Gather your friends and family together for a devilish dash through the fiery pits of Dante’s Inferno! Compete with your loved ones to be the first to make your way through all seven deadly sins and go to Hell. It includes one gameboard, one die, four game pieces and 20 Hell Cards! Just don't get sent to Heaven unless you have the Get Out of Heaven Free card. It's a race to the bottom that's so much fun, it's sinful!

—description from the publisher

name: Escape Room The Game
description:
Choose a Game Master to set the combination lock and select 4 puzzles. You and your team are then invited to test your skills with the riddles, codes, symbology & puzzles to crack the combination lock and escape the room!

Includes 16 different puzzles and a reprogammable combination padlock, so you can play game after game with multiple outcomes!

name: Worldwide Wines
description:
A card and board game where a wine novice can beat a connoisseur.
Worldwide Wines patented mode of play features "Region Cards", which provide the game's strategic element and "Money Cards", which educate players to the many aspects of wines of the world.
Players must collect and BUY certain combinations of "Region Cards", which relate directly to the 106 wine regions on the game board map (Winning "R. Card" Combinations:3 stars/$24 Million each OR 4 wine bottles/$18 Million each OR 5 wine glasses/$14 Million each OR a "flush").
Over 300 "Money Cards" present players with a wide range of challenging questions and interesting facts on the wine regions, their wine styles and production methods. The "Money Cards" also give OR take away the cash needed to buy strategic "Region Cards". WILD "Opportunity Cards" (included in the "Region Card" deck) give players the opportunity to buy owned "Region Cards" right out from under opponents.
All players have an equal chance of winning due to the "Region Card" strategy aspect.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Trivia

name: Acquisition
description:
ACQUISITION
Is a board game for up to 6 players, and is recommended for ages 18 years and over. The game is unique and delivers a combination of social interaction; forward thinking, challenges, strategy and most importantly fun!

GAME OBJECTIVE

The object of the game is a race to acquire three (3) of the five (5) Gold Status Symbols to determine who will become "The Ultimate Status Champion".

The decision as to which Gold Status Symbols you acquire depends on your strategy to try and win the game against the other players, although it is compulsory for every player to acquire the "House" as one (1) of the three (3) Gold Status Symbol Cards required to win the game. Each player starts the game with a mortgage (debt) that must be cleared before the game can be won. That is why the "House" is a compulsory acquisition.

Each player must collect sufficient credits to enable the purchase of silver status symbol cards as shown on the game board, to increase their wealth and status.

Each Gold Status Symbol card has four (4) silver status symbol cards that must be purchased before the Gold Status Symbol Card can be issued.
All Silver and Gold Status Symbol cards are color coded for easy playing reference (Red, Green, Purple, Blue, White).

name: Stonehenge: Ring of Stones
description:
Ring of Stones is a fun and easy game that can be played with one or two players. For one player, see how fast you can build the ring of stones and compete against your friends for the best time. For two players, take it in turns to roll the dice to add or dismantle pieces of the circle. The one who completes or clears the board is the winner.
It consists of a circle of stones that replicates the design of Stonehenge’s outer sarsen circle.

—user summary
categories: Ancient, Dice, Prehistoric, Puzzle, Territory Building

name: Combat Cards
description:
"An abstract game of military strategy set in World War II"

This card game is played in partnerships by two, four or six people. Each team represents the combined resources of a bloc of nations at war with the other team. Points are accumulated by conducting offensives, opening new fronts and successfully countering enemy offensives. The game ends once all the cards have been drawn and played.

On your turn, you may shift a combat card between two of your fronts before drawing and playing or discarding a card. Fronts are prepared face down, until the offensive is declared. Fronts are laid out like in Caesar & Cleopatra (or Hera & Zeus --those kinds of games). Cards come in two types, combat and "special". The combat cards represent units of infantry, armor, mine fields and so on. Special cards include Strategic Bombing (which permanently reduces a player's hand size), New Front, Offensive/Supply (which launches or sustains an offensive, or can be used to shift Airborne combat cards between fronts).

Points are scored mostly during offensives; every turn an offensive goes on, the difference between the attacker's total offense and the defender's total defense is scored by the stronger side. There is also a bonus point score when opening a new front.

The cards are very bland looking with a simple APP-6 or SPI-style symbol, a pair of offense/defense ratings and some explanatory text. Most combat units lack character: Armour, Infantry and Combat Engineers work nearly the same way except for their different offense/defense ratings. I'd have given the Combat Engineers a special power against Mine Fields, for example.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game

name: Monopoly: Hawaii
description:
Buy! Sell! "Pass GO and Collect $200!" or "Go directly to Jail!"

All the fun and excitement of Parker Brothers classic real estate trading game is here in this Hawaiian Edition of the Monopoly Game. Buy airlines, utility companies, and properties of all types - including the valuable Kahala Mandarin Oriental and The Royal Hawaiian. Increase the value of your properties by adding houses and hotels. Amass the greatest fortune in money and property and you're the winner!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Tangled Webs
description:
Print the game board, bugs and rules. Some form of tokens can be substituted. The spider defends and reigns supreme in its web. But the trapped insects unite, and attempt to defeat the spider. Will they succeed?

From the designer's webpage:

BUGS ARE REVOLTING!
(Wait ... that didn't come out quite right ...) The Bugs are taking up arms (and they've got a lot to take up!) against their long time oppressor - the Spider. No more having to watch where you're flying! No more being left hanging! No more being eaten! This time it's personal! This time it's full scale insecticide! (Ok, ok, I know, spiders are not really insects, they're Arthropods of the class Arachnida, whereas true "insects" are Arthropods of the classes Chilopoda, Diplopoda, Pauropoda, Symphyla, and Insecta ...duh!) It just sounds cooler this way!

Download the game at: http://kenmgames.wordpress.com

name: To the Races!
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

Up to six cars compete in a six lap race around an irregular oval track. Each car/driver counter is rated for speed, acceleration, and turning. The game focuses on making a successful die roll for each space through the corners. The cars may pass at will.

name: Hats Off
description: Put on your game cap for a frenzied round of hat matching mania. Hold three hat cards in your hand and balance one on top of your head. Be the first to match the center hat card and collect the pair. But don’t drop your hat or else someone can yell “Hats Off!” and steal a card! Win the most cards and crown yourself the top hat.

name: Strawberry Shortcake Berry Princess Hide and Seek game
description:
"Strawberry Shortcake and her friends need to find all their princess accessories in time for the ball. You can help Strawberry Shortcake, Orange Blossom, Angel Cake, and Frosty Puff seek out their belongings by using your memory skills. The first player to collect her belongings and get to the entrance of the castle for the ball wins!"

Includes a colorful board, 4 Princess cards, spinner, 4 Princess tokens with plastic bases, 16 Princess accessory disks, and rules printed on a pink storage insert.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Holey Cow!
description:
From the Publisher:

The UDDERLY INCREDIBULL CARD GAME! Pass and stack your cow cards, count the holes in the Holey Cows and guess whether you have the most or the fewest holes. To win, count up your points and be the first cow to cross the pasture.
Features the pictures of the world renowned CowParade cows!

name: Stockery
description:
(Publisher Blurb)
The stock market started and stock prices move up-and-down. You can profit from the market simply by buying low and selling high. But watch the transaction fee which can significantly eat into your profit. You can also earn income through dividend issued by companies you are holding and other investment opportunities available in the market. However, you should not over-invest because you may need urgent cash to support your expenses. Being the major shareholder also allows you to exploit the cash reserve of the company to benefit yourself. The person who can obtain the maximum wealth at the end of the game is the winner.

This is a stock market game in which the players buy and sell stocks in 5 companies. Stock prices fluctuate according to the market position which is driven by a die roll. Each company's stock behave very differently. Event cards trigger the paying of dividends, right issues, share allotments, and such. Each company also accumulates a cash reserve which is split among its shareholders at game end (or sooner if the company becomes privatized).

This is an original game designed and published in Hong Kong.

name: Repel
description:
From the box:
Repel is an intriguing new game played between two people on either side of a clear vertical board, using magnetized playing discs. Players quickly learn how to use the magnetic forces of attraction and repulsion to their advantage, as their magnetic discs interact through the board.
Not from the box:
The playing discs are white on one side and colored on the other side. The object of the game is to form BOTH three in a row white side out and three in a row colored side out. You may place discs so that they repel your opponent's piece off the board or in such a way that both his/her piece and your piece "attach" and become permanent. Each player also has two "Power Discs" which may not be repelled nor attached to.

name: Walking with Prehistoric Beasts
description: Walking with beasts is a safari style game set in prehistoric times. Each player controls a group of prehistoric animals that battle opponents. Inspired by the BBC television series. Ages 7 and up

name: Monopoly: Frankfurt
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Frankfurt, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Colorforms Silly Faces Game
description:
From the publisher:

Be the first to build a complete silly face! Spin the spinner to see what silly feature you can add to your face. Wacky eyes, funny noses, goofy mouths, and silly ears! An easy-to-learn game that encourages gallons of giggles. Simple rules, large formats, fun graphics, sturdy components. For 2-4 players
publishers: Alga, Chad Valley Co Ltd., Colorforms, University Games

name: Action D-Day
description:
The object of the game is the conquest of 5 chosen squares on the first line of the opposing army. Each player makes his own choice of his objective squares, which are not known to his opponent.
A nicely made game with actual plastic soldiers!

name: Olipa kerran ihminen -lautapeli
description:
Back of the box (translated):

"Once Upon A Time Man" is an exciting trivia and task game for schoolchildren, adolescents and adults. Test your knowledge of the history of mankind and win the fabulous race through millennia from the Big Bang all the way to the launch of the Space Rocket.

The game includes 1300 different history questions and tasks in two levels of difficulty. This makes the game playable to everyone able to read.

Included is a DVD with full episodes of Albert Barillé's animated series "Once Upon A Time Man", "Once Upon A Time Life" and "Once Upon A Time Space".
mechanics: Line Drawing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Astérix et la Potion magique
description:
Each player receives 7 cards with which he established his career. It starts from the Gaulish village by throwing the dice. Having gone through all the boxes designated by the cards, he must return to the village with a sickle and a gourd.

1 to draw dice is equivalent to 6. You can enter in a box "element" even if it has drawn more points than necessary. Submit a map "element" after entering the box "component" corresponding. A player can be sent "Strawberry" it is in a box "element" of any kind. You can go to Lutece in turn to play without having to throw the dice.

name: Slots Dice
description: Essentially a one-armed bandit in dice form, each turn players contribute to the pot and roll the dice. Depending on the outcome, the player who rolled gets a set amount of whatever is being played for, a free roll, or nothing.

name: Super Dungeon Explore: Frostbyte Ravagers
description:
The Frostbyte Ravagers warband box brings the unparalleled brutality of the orcs to Super Dungeon for the first time! Rampaging through the Frostbyte Reach, the savage hordes have spilled out into Crystalia. Combining potent offense and a hardy resilience, the orcs are driven into further frenzy by the ferocious Rage Fiend Mini-Boss. Standing in their way is the Lightning Mage, whose crackling bolts arc through multiple foes with a single blast.

CONTENTS:
Lightning Mage Hero Model
Rage Fiend Mini-Boss Model
14 Orc Monster Models: 2 Skull Stone Spawning Points, 4 Neck Splitters, 4 Face Beaters, 4 Knuckle Smashers
Game Cards: Hero, Classic Monsters, Arcade Monsters, Treasure Card
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Emotify
description:
In this party game 2 teams play against each other. The goal of the game is to get rid of all his EMOTIS.
For this every team is given a writing board, a felt-tip pen and a screen. Without looking, every team take 10 EMOTIS chips from a bag and place them behind their screen.
The team that starts chooses a player who spins the hand of a rotating dial and carries out the instructions. The dial is split into 10 fields:

6 themes with a maximum number of EMOTIS(Leisure, People, Places, Actions, Brands and Friends)
4 special fields (Open Theme, Gifting, Removing, Swapping)


If the hand points to a theme, the choosen player turns over the timer, puts together a row of EMOTIS behind the screen (to represent the name/title etc. of something within the theme), writes the answer down on the writing board (without any of the other players seeing it) and removes the screen.
Now all players of his team have to guess what it is in the given time. In addition, the choosen player can give his team a given hint (find on the inside of the screen). If the team guesses correctly, the EMOTIS used are removed from the game. If not, the team take (without looking) as many EMOTIS from the bag as they have used and the opposing team may try to give a correct answer (if correct, the opposing team remove as many EMOTIS from their pile as the other team used). Then the turn goes to the other team.
If the hand points to a special field, the choosen player take, deposit or exchange of EMOTIS respectively give one of your EMOTIS to your opponent and choose a theme of your own.

—user summary

name: Zon Ahl
description:
An ancient American Indian game in which players' horses (represented by sticks) race around a circle made of forty stones. Movement is determined by three stick dice which are thrown against a striking stone, placed in the center of the circle.

Variations appeared in tribes throughout North America. This version, published by Natural Wonders and Ancient Graffiti was sold in the mid-'90's.

Other names (from Natural Wonders edition instructions):

Settilth (Navaho)
Owasokotz (Keres)
Tasholiiwe (Zuni)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: (Public Domain), ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, L. P. Septímio, Natural Wonders, Sprea

name: UNO: Texas
description:
Themed Uno game based on the the state of Texas.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The special "Last Stand" cards and rules (referring to last stand at the Alamo), which allows players to switch hands and does not correlate to cards/rules in regular Uno.

name: Elemental Spark
description:
A fantasy brawl battle royale where you fight for the magic of Galecia. Play as 12 distinct characters attuned to one of the four classical elements of Air, Fire, Water, and Earth. Before the fight, use the tileset to create your battlefield. By playing to your strengths, you can out-maneuver and defeat the other players in order to be the last mage standing.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Map Addition, Map Reduction, Modular Board, Pieces as Map, Player Elimination, Square Grid, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Fat Cats
description:
Tricks win the treats in this a-meows-ing strategy card game Fat Cats from Ridley's Games. Are you the talented tabby that will win the most treats?

You and your fellow felines have two rounds to win after starting off with nine trick cards for nine chances to win the most treats and be the ultimate fat cat. Each trick and treat card has a points value, and players must play cards like strut, pounce, and a cat-tastic performance along with other tricks to try to win treat cards like a chin scratch, milk and a tasty fishy!

Purrrfect for cat lovers, this game is suitable for ages 6+, 2 to 5 players, and has an average gameplay of 15 minutes.

—description from the publisher

name: Maharadscha
description: Players try to collect as many gems as possible using their 4 followers. This is done by selecting a die (1-3 or 4-6) and rolling and moving. However, there are interesting movement rules - no jumping over other followers; landing exactly on another gets another move, or sometimes a chance to steal a gem. There is also a hand management aspect, as to collect a gem, you have to have a card for it. Card swapping is done by getting a follower to the right place. Add cobras (blocking pieces) and snake charmers (to get past cobras) into the mix.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: See the USA
description: A player spins the spinner to get a letter and then turns the sand timer over. That player has until the sand runs out to peg as many locations as he/she can on the USA map that begin with their letter. The first player to peg all of their locations wins. There is also a variant where everyone plays simultaneously.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Travel

name: Trivial Pursuit: The Year in Review – Questions about 1992
description: This first edition of the new TRIVIAL PURSUIT Year in Review Series captures the highlights of the year just past, and it lets you play your favorite trivia game in a whole new format. The game consists of cards with over 1300 questions, a color-coded die to decide categories, and six scoring tokens with enough wedges for six players or teams. The special book-style slip case makes it a perfect addition to your book or game shelf.

name: Tri-Pin
description:
Objective: get your three pins in a straight line diagonally across the board
1 Each players places his three pins consecutive into the holes
2 Players move by turn (green/amber)
3 Move only, a pin may not 'jump'
4 The central hole may be occupied any time during a player's turn
6 Try to 'trap' your opponent's pins to get 3-in-a-line
7 Start a new game changing starting player

name: Cut the Rope
description:
Put down your cell phone and reach for Cut the Rope, the Mattel game that brings the excitement of the video game to a board game. The monster Om Nom waits at the top; you need to cut ropes to bring him down. Along the way, you face obstacles and dangers that keep you from getting the best score. Each rope has a variety of stars; the winner is the person who collects the most.

Om-nom, munch! Based on the award winning Cut the Rope video game and top selling iPhone and Android application for children, this Cut the Rope Game lets you get hands-on while feeding the hungry monster, Om-nom, by cutting the ropes that hold the candy he wants. Ages 5 and up.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: Wallet Battles
description:
The American Civil War was a bloody conflict that took place 150 years ago between 1861 and 1865. After the war ended many Confederates said that the South would rise again. Now with the help of Wallet Battles their dream can come true.

Wallet Battles essentially takes an old Civil War coin flipping game and combines it with the new micro board game concept to create a fun interactive game that can be enjoyed over and over wherever you go.

Game Overview:
Wallet Battles is a micro board game for two that is played on a plastic card that has battle maps available on both sides of the card. Players flip coins to earn the right to perform actions that will help them battle for ownership of various locations on the map. The key objective is to have the most points by the end of the game. To achieve this objective you need to control as much of the map as possible and build stacks of coins to strengthen your defenses.

Setup:
Place the map you wish to use face up between both players. Now divide equally between both players a handful of coins. We recommend 6 quarters, 6 nickels, 6 dimes and 6 pennies for optimal play, however, any amount of coins can be used to manipulate the length of play.

Decide who wants to represent the Confederates (Tails) and who wants to represent the Union (Heads). If needed, a regular coin flip can be used to decide for you.

Play:
Each turn begins with both players flipping a coin onto a table. Each flip has three potential outcomes:
Heads: Both coins show heads.
Tails: Both coins show tails.
Odd: One head and one tail is shown.

If the coins land on Heads the player representing the Union can place one of his coins on the map or if his opponent already has coins on the map he may capture one of his coins to place in his pile for later placement.

If the coins land on Tails the player representing the Confederacy can place one of his coins on the map or if his opponent already has coins on the map he may capture one of his coins to place in his pile for later placement.

If the coins land Odd the coin flip must be repeated. No other action is required, however, if Odd is flipped three times in a row all players must remove a coin from the map and return it back to their pile.

To strengthen your defenses you must build stacks of coins. Smaller coins must go on top of larger coins. Therefore, if your base coin is a dime you won’t be able to build a stack. You can’t build on your opponents stack, however, you can capture coins from him.
Game End:
The game ends when all coins have been captured, your opponent is out of coins or when all possible locations on the map have been used. Players earn 2 points for every location they control and 1 point for every coin located on the map. Stacks of coins consisting of three or more coins will be doubled in value. Any coins not used will be counted as 1 point. The player with the most points is declared the winner.

name: Z-Game: Fast & Dead
description:
Z-Game 2 is a competitive strategy game for 2-4 players who accumulate resources, recruit mercenaries, destroy the last strongholds of civilization, fulfill missions and fight with zombies.

Try to survive in post-apocalyptic world! On their turn, the player moves around the city tiles, destroy them, enters into battles with other players and zombies by playing cards from the hand - all in order to fulfill the current goal of the round.

At the beginning of each round, a new event card is opened. If this is the 8th card, you will play the final round.
Then update the goals of the round. In each round, goals are different, so players will always have something to do.
After this setup of the round, players perform their turns which include three phases: 1. moving, 2. fighting, if they meet with enemies, and 3. getting resources from occupied territories and feeding crew.

The game also ends if one player has completed eight or more goals.

The winner is the player who accomplished most of the goals. If there is a tie here, then the winner is the one who has more people left in the city. If there is a tie here, arrange an arm wrestling - in the post-apocalypse there is always only one winner!

The game boasts simple rules, dynamic mechanics, large number of components, unique art, and exciting scenarios! Win in a world of senseless cruelty and causeless violence, crowded with hordes of zombies and crazy gangs in the board game about the zombie apocalypse Z-Game!

name: Up the Creek; The Salmon Survival Game
description: Each player represents one of six species of Pacific salmon in their actual round trip from the spawning grounds to ocean, & back again to British Columbia. Avoid extreme dangers, maintain health, or go extinct. Rules for a basic and advanced game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Guerre à Outrance
description:
A simulation of small unit (single vehicle) armored combat in France following the German invasion in 1940.

Dana Lombardy, who designed the game, also provides a complete review of the equipment, organization and tactics employed by French, British and German forces in 1940.

name: 25 Random Things About Me
description:
Play 25 Random Things About Me and get to know the people you thought you already knew!

During game play, you'll try to match fun facts on the game cards with your opponents. Make a match and then add a new, totally random thing about yourself to your list. The first person to complete a list of 25 random things about them wins. It's great fun to compare lists at the end of the game!

name: Villin Lännen Poppamies
description:
Villin Lännen Poppamies (Finnish for "The Medicine Man of the Wild West") is played on a map of North America. It is similar to the classic Finnish game "Afrikan Tähti" but here the objective is to find the token for the Medicine Man on the map and deliver him back to Washington (from where all players start) to win the game.

The players travel on the roads/waterways between cities where they flip tokens to reveal indians or military/settlers. The game uses rifles as its currency, to protect the players from hostile indian tokens flipped over or to pay tolls for crossing borders or using waterways.

This seems to be a rare Fenno-Alga game in that it has no Swedish counterpart.

name: Boundaries Baseball
description:
Boundaries Baseball helps children understand and respect boundaries. Boundaries are essential for positive relationships with peers and adults; children who act out are often asking for the security of clear boundaries and the skills needed to respect them.

Boundaries Baseball utilizes a baseball diamond format as a visual reminder for not going out of bounds. As part of the action of the play, students will also have opportunities to toss a “ball” so that it stays within the boundaries of a “strike zone.”

Game cards teach four kinds of boundaries:
(1) Saying and accepting “No,”.
(2) Managing strong emotions (called feelings in the game).
(3) Respecting personal space and property.
(4) Relationship/communication limits.

Players use a special spinner to see what happens for each pitch. For example, they could get a strike, a ball, a single, or a pop fly out. Players move their pawns, counterclockwise around the diamond. Their pawns are baseball players (see photo). The players then advance according to the instructions on the spinner and pick and answer cards that match the color of the space landed on. For example, a strike results in going back one space, a ball advances the player three spaces, and a single brings the player to the next base. The four decks of cards correspond to the four categories of boundaries mentioned above. When players reach home plate, they add one to their score on the scoreboard.

name: Llamanomics
description:
Llamanomics (a contraction of Llamas and Economics) is a supply and demand negotiation card game where you use Llamas to buy, transport, and sell goods.

Each turn a player takes a card from the deck. Throughout the deck there are 'Burgermeister' cards. When a 'Burgermeister' card is pulled players may choose to sell any of the commodities they have on their llamas for their current point value (determined by the 'Demand' cards). The values of the different commodities change throughout the game.

During the game, you can play action cards to upgrade your own llamas, or apply negative effects on other players.
