The game ends when the deck runs out of cards. The player with the most money wins.


Llamanomics is a card game about supply, demand, and llamas (and the occasional alpaca).

The goal of the game is to get the most valuable commodities and sell them for the most points.
You play as a trader, taking his/her commodities to the market to sell. And what will be carrying your commodities? Why, your trusty llamas! The more llamas you get, the more you can carry. The more you can form corner the market on different commodities and squeeze out your competition. Capitalism style! Llama style!

So, the strategy comes in with 'ACTION CARDS', which allow you to upgrade your llamas, downgrade your competitors llamas, steal llamas, swap commodities, and all sorts of other shenanigans!

'DEMAND CARDS' add yet another element of gameplay as the value of the commodities changes throughout the game.

You have to be clever in placing llamas, commodities and action cards. You have to be even more clever in choosing which other players you will trade with, or harass, make alliances with, and take the free-llama-market by storm!
categories: Card Game, Economic, Negotiation, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Take That, Trading

name: UNO: Monster High
description:
Monster High UNO Card Game:


The classic game of UNO gets a new twist with the Monster High edition.



It's the original UNO card game featuring favorite Monster High characters and scenes.



Plus, there's a new special rule: the Creeperific “Urrrhhh” card allows the player to channel his or her inner zombie and give away some of those frightful cards! It's Fast Fun For Everyone!



Includes 112 cards and instructions.


—description from the publisher

name: Tea Party Game
description:
The object of Tea Party is to be the first player to gather a complete place setting and tea time treats.

Players take turns twirling a tea pot spinner and collecting the seven items they need for afternoon tea (plate, napkin & utensils, tea cup, cream & sugar, sandwiches, fruit, dessert). A plate must be collected before any food that would be served on a plate can be collected. And if the spinner stops on the bees, the player must give back an item they have collected.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Name That State
description: Name that State is an exciting geography game that takes you around the USA. Learn about states, landmarks and capitals as you spin your way around the country. The game contains entertaining, informative postcards from all 50 states

name: Going! Going! Gone! The Flea Market Auction Game
description:
This is an auction game set in a flea market in which players try to gather the highest total net worth. Players bid on items in multiple categories such as glassware, furniture, toys, jewelery or art. They must be careful, however, as items could be forged or defective.

An interesting feature is the plastic gavel accessory.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation

name: Care Bears: On the Path to Care-a-Lot
description: Each player starts with a different combination of star chips with pictures that match the bellies of various bears. Each turn you spin the spinner, and everyone who has a chip with that symbol may play one on their row of stars. When you complete your row of stars, you then move up the stars toward Care-a-Lot, but only one space at a time whenever someone spins that next space. The first player to Tender Heart Bear in Care-a-Lot is the winner!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Amazing Animal Trivia Game
description:
From Dr. Toy:

"This game allows children to delve into the world of animals and will fascinate them for a long time. Children can collect sets of cards. There are 200 multiple choice and true/false trivia questions. In order to have a turn, you must correctly answer on the card drawn. Excellent graphics on each card make the animals sharp and interesting to look at."

name: Greedy Greedy
description:
GreedyGreedy is a card and dice game that is fun for the whole family. Players race to reach 10,000 points by adding to their own score and by taking away points from their opponents.

With over 30 unique cards in the GreedyGreedy deck, players have the opportunity to use strategy and skill to gain an advantage over their opponents. Enjoy a range of abilities as you put foes to sleep, create mass effects or cripple your opponent’s ability to gain points along with dozens of other opportunities. With thousands of combinations every game is different and each roll is exciting!

GreedyGreedy is perfect for family time or small parties. Be prepared for outbursts of laughter, moments of disbelief, and many other memorable moments as you play this fast-paced game. With GreedyGreedy it never gets boring, it just gets better!

name: Splat!
description:
The Birthday Party has not been going well. The soup was lumpy and the main course was stodgy and overcooked. Now dessert is served—the table is laden with Chocolate Mousse, Rice Pudding, Cherry Pie, Fruit Salad and so much more. The guests start to grin wickedly…

The object of Splat! is to furiously flinging food at other players while dodging food they are throwing back at you. The more food that hits you, the messier you get. At the end of the game, the cleanest players are allowed to think that they’ve won.

The game uses three types of cards:

Food Cards : Each food card has a special power which takes effect when the food is either eaten, or is thrown at another player and hits. Some of these powers are long lasting while others are instant (e.g. the banana split is vitamin fortified and so increases a players hand size, while the revolutionary cupcakes contain added additives which force you to throw all your food at other players). Food cards are either green (generally beneficial powers) and red (generally not beneficial).

And Then Cards : Event cards which can be played during the food throwing process to impact the course of the game. These cards act as interrupts which provide much of the interactive story telling character of the game (e.g. Amy throws Birthday Cake at Clare but Bob catches it and throws it back at Amy on his next turn). These cards can also be played as dodges to avoid food that is thrown at you.

Object Cards : Throughout the game players may also stand in front of objects (e.g. The Children, The Gnu, Uncle Harry or The Mirror). If a player standing in front of an object dodges then the food hits the object instead and the thrower gets yelled at by either the Host or the Hostess--forcing them to discard all their And Then cards and eat a food (if they have one).

Each player has a 'You' card with 5 hit locations--when food hits someone the thrower rolls to see where (Head, 2 x Arms, 2 x Legs, 1's miss). Food which hits a location that is already messy replaces the previous food.

The Butler (Jeeves) also has a hit location card--players may choose to throw food at him through the game and in addition any food that is thrown which does not hit a player or an object may hit Jeeves instead. Once Jeeves is completely covered with food he chases the players out of the house, ending the game.

Splat! is a reworking of Ed Carter's 1992 food-fight card game, Kersplatt!
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Animorphs: The Invasion Game
description: Join the animorphs - Jake, Rachel, Cassie, Marco and Tobias - as they fight off the deadly alien invaders. Head for the trouble spots, like the mall, the school and the beach. Choose the quickest path - land, air or sea. Then use a morph card to acquire an animal DNA and make the changes. Will you travel as an ant? An eagle? Or maybe a dolphin? Change again and again to your best advantage. At each danger zone, battle Yeerks, Hork Bajir, Taxxons and maybe Visser III himself to collect a card. Once you have three cards, morph into an elephant and destroy the kandrona ray generator to win.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: What's the Time, Mr Wolf?
description:
From the box:
Race through the forest, but watch out for the hungry wolf! A fun strategy game.
Roll the dice to move the wolf, then spin the spinner. If you get too close to the wolf at dinner time, you will have to go back to the start! Based on the favorite playground game.

name: Wtopa
description:
Wtopa is an exciting card game.

You are one of the captains of the submarines and try to become a King of Ocean. You move your submarine, shoot torpedoes and try to sunk other players using your special abilities, different factions and lots of interaction.

On your turn you move or shoot. Use your torpedoes wisely, because when you are out of it, you can not defend yourself.

The last one to survive is a winner.



WTOPA to bardzo emocjonująca, karciana gra towarzysko-imprezowa.Gracze wcielają się w odważnych kapitanów okrętów podwodnych walczących o tytuł Króla Oceanu. Manewrują w głębinach oceanu, ostrzeliwując się potężnymi torpedami, by zatopić okręty swoich przeciwników.

Planuj swoje ruchy, używaj umiejętności specjalnych i pozostań ostatnim na placu boju.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Player Elimination

name: Alphabet Zoop
description:
"Four Fun-tastic Alphabet Card Games In One Zooper-Dooper Deck!" Developed by a team of educators and parents. The four games are:


Monkey's Uncle!: "A terrific new twist on Old Maid, where no one wants to be the Monkey's Uncle!" (To play Monkey's Uncle, the dealer passes out all the cards. Everyone looks at their cards and places all matching cards face up. Players then take one of the remaining cards from the player on their left. If this new card makes a match, place the match face up on the table. If not, just add the card to your hand. Play continues until all cards are matched. The player left with the Joker/Gorilla card is the "Monkey's Uncle".)



Go-Go Gorilla!: "A racing game where players scramble to put their playing cards from A to Z!" (Separate the card deck by color, giving one color to each team/player. At the word "Go!", each team/player races to put their cards in alphabetical order from A to Z. The first player to finish takes the Joker/Gorilla card and yells "Go-Go Gorilla!")



Big Big Fish!: "Nate, do you have any 'A's? No? Then 'Go Fish' in the fish school pond!"



Mr. Moose's Memory Match!: "A fun flipping game where you try to remember where the animals are hiding!"


Ages 3 and up
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Football Billionaire
description: A roll and move set collection game where players race to assemble a team of players (and a manager/coach). The game incorporates cards that can be collected and traded.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Star Wars: Board Game
description:
The Death Star's strategic plans are hidden inside R2-D2. Transport R2-D2 to Yavin 4 and help the Rebel Alliance win!

In this adventure game you are part of the galactic rebellion. Inside R2-D2 are the strategic plans for the Death Star but it needs help to reach the rebel base on Yavin 4. Your mission is to defeat Darth Vader and the Imperial forces by transporting R2-D2 to the rebel base so they can destroy the Death Star. Use the Force, follow your galactic route ja make your way to Yavin 4. Is the Force strong with you... or with your opponents?

The game contains 1000 multiple choice questions and 250 picture cards which are suitable for all ages. The questions are from all areas of Star Wars galaxy from movies and TV to books. Join the galactic war and destroy the evil Empire - for good!

One player starts with the R2-D2 and others try to steal it from him. Whoever transports R2-D2 to Yavin 4 first wins the game. Luck is major factor in this game and answering the questions and getting them right may turn the tables in a heartbeat.

Mechanically, this game is the same as Aku Ankka.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monkeys Up
description: Each Monkey sports a number from 0 to 15. Players randomly choose three monkeys and, without looking at the numbers, place the monkeys number-side down in front of them. A die determines the action that a player takes on his turn: flip a monkey, trade a monkey, or take a monkey. The game ends when a player has three number-side up monkeys. The winner is the player whose monkeys' numbers add to the highest total.

name: Aces in the Pot
description:
This is a simple game for two or more players, played with two dice and two counters (e.g. coins) per player.

Roll one die to see who goes first. Then players take turns (clockwise) rolling two dice. If either die displays a 1 (an "ace"), a counter is put in the pot (that is, in put in the middle of the table). If two 1s are thrown, two counters are put in. If either die displays a 6, both dice and one counter are passed to the player on the thrower's left.

A player without counters cannot roll the dice, and thus merely passes them on. (He or she is not out of the game, however, since he or she will receive a counter if the player on the right rolls a 6.)

Play continues until there is only 1 counter left outside the pot. The player with this counter makes three consecutive rolls. If he or she does NOT roll a 6, then he or she has won. If, though, a 6 is rolled, the counter and the dice are passed to the player on the left, who in turns rolls three times. And so on. The first player to roll three times without a 6 wins the game.

Despite being entirely luck-based, the game is fun on account of its dramatic twists and turns and come-from-behind wins. The luck is an equalizing element that makes this game especially suitable to play with children

Source: R. C. Bell, Board and Table Games from Many Civilizations

name: Escape Room: The Game – Challenge
description:
You've been captured by a mad genius. He'll let you go only if you prove yourself worthy! Solve as many puzzles as you can in ten minutes and hope you'll survive! Play by yourself or in a team and deal with the pressure of solving riddles and puzzles while time is ticking away...

Escape Room: The Game – Challenge consists of a deck of 24 cards and decoder card. Each card has double-sided riddles and an answer obfuscated behind a red/blue filter. You can play solo and try to see how many you can get in ten minutes, and that's your score.

You can play cooperatively in teams and race the other team drawing from the common deck. There's a decoder card to check your answer.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending
publishers: Identity Games International B.V., Spin Master Ltd.

name: Ritter Kunibert's 12er Stich
description: Cards are numbered 1-12, with black cards representing positive numbers and red negative. Cards played to the table in turn raise or lower the running value of the trick. A player bring the value to exactly 12 or 0 takes the trick and the points (positive and negative cards all score positive points). The running value of the trick may never go below 0 or above 12. If a player cannot play, he draws from the deck in Go Fish style. Play ends when one player empties their hand, and that player scores a bonus for doing so.

name: Akropolis
description:
The board shows the temple mountain of the Akropolis and the surrounding buildings. It is covered with a grid network that divides the mountain and some adjacent houses into fields. At the edges there are additional marks for the initial positions of the players. In addition the central mountain fields are provided with numbers between 1 and 3.

Each player has several small temple buildings and with the help of Oracle stones (small wood disks) they indicate how far they want to pull their own temples in a round.
The goal is to place as much as possible own buildings on the temple mountain. With 2 players one must place 7 buildings in order to win (there are 13 spaces). With 3-4 players one must achieve at least 12 points to be the winner. Each round is divided into three phases.

In the first phase each player decides the number of steps that he wants to move one of his building. Accordingly it takes and puts as many Oracle stones into its right hand, while keeping the remaining Oracle stones covered in the left hand. Every player place a bet on the total amount of Oracle stones that will be played in the current round by all players (it's not permitted to call a number already called by a previous player). After each player called a value, everyone open their right hand, and if someone called the exact value, he will have benefits in the third phase.

In the second phase every player moves one of his buildings (horizontally, vertically or diagonally) according to number of Oracle stones played. During the movement one can jump over one or more buildings, but the target field must be however free. If one jumps over an opponent building with the next to last point of movement, he can strike this at the end of its movement, if he wants to. The building is then put again into the supply of the opponent.

In the third phase only the player that called exactly the value in the first phase can place one of its temple on a free starting position on the board. If all starting positions are occupied or if the player has already all temples on the board, the action is not taken.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Picnic Game
description: The object of The Picnic Game is to be the first player to set their place and gather all the food. Players take turns spinning a spinner and collecting the items they need for the picnic (including a main dish, a vegetable, a fruit, a drink, a dessert, a plate, a napkin & utensils, and a picnic blanket. There is something of an order in which the items need to be collected, but if the spinner stops on the ants, a player must give back an item. The pieces of the game are made of laminated chipboard and the artwork is very appealing for younger children.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Gridiron Football: The Realistic Football Card Game
description: This is a simple, luck-based game designed to simulate the play of American football. Using a deck of 78 cards, players select from among eight play types, including special teams options, then turn over the topmost card to determine the result. Two plays through the deck constitute a complete game. In addition to the card deck, the game contains a rules pamphlet and a pegboard for marking field position, down, and distance to go for a first down.

name: Zuc!
description:
Description from the publisher:

Zuc is a simple card game where you have to avoid being killed by the bombs in the deck. In your turn you must draw a card and show it to the other players. If it's a bomb, you lose. If it is not, you can keep the card and play any action card from your hand. Action cards are useful for making the other players drawing extra cards (more possibilities of drawing a bomb), skipping your own turn (and avoid drawing), shielding against the bombs and more similar actions.
Last player standing wins the game.

It's mostly about luck but still a very funny party game.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Raising Hell
description:
"A party game for adults who know kids can be a real pain"
"Match captions with photos. Laugh. Repeat."
"Kids are awesome. Parenting is hard."

1. Place the photo and caption cards in 2 separate piles, face down
2. each player draws 7 caption cards from that pile. The player most likely to make a baby cry goes first as the judge.
3. Each round:

The judge draws a photo card and flips it over.
All other players choose a caption card to match the photo and play it face down.
The judge reads each card aloud and decides which is best. The player with the winning caption keeps the photo card as a point.


4. The player with the most photo cards at the end of the game wins. Play until you run out of cards, or until you feel like doing something more productive with your life.

name: Barn-Alfapet
description: This children's game is a cross breed from Scrabble (Alfapet) and a crossword puzzle. The game board has two different sides. One side is a huge crossword with pictures around the house and some animals and a partly completed crossword. The other side is an empty board with pictures around the crossword puzzle and the children will have to figure out where to put those words. Every word gives points and if you are able to cross words, then multiplying is introduced. Some letters give more than others and there are some bonus tiles also. Winner is the one who gets most points by the end of the crossword puzzle if they are able to solve it! There is 1 complete solution, but many many incomplete possibilities, it all depends on the first word.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Puzzle, Word Game

name: Aloha: Le jeu rituel des archipels
description:
Each player represents a tribe who races to bring their tiki across the archipelago in order to name the next king. Players move around their (or sometime, their opponents') pirogues across an ocean of tiles with special effects to bring their tiki to an opponent's island. The game comes with two sets of rules, one familial (basic) and one expert (advanced). Even though the game and the rules are in French, the components are multilingual.

Material :
32 ocean tiles
16 pirogues
4 tikis
4 beaches
12 markers
2 rulebooks

name: Kuku
description:
Kuku is a Polish traditional card game for two or more players. It's slightly modified version of Kemps.

It is played with standard deck of 52 cards. Each player is dealt a hand of 3 cards, but one player is dealt a hand of 4 cards. The rest of cards are irrelevant. If any player has three cards in the same color or value he says "kuku!" and wins. After dealing the player with 4 cards gives one of his cards to the player on his left. One card (not necessarily the same) is going around until one of the players has three cards in the same color or value.

name: Where the Wild Things Are Puzzle Maze Game
description: Game consists of three playing levels for different ages with 84 puzzle pieces and 4 King of all Wild Things pieces. Players connect puzzle pieces to form a continuous maze.
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: UNO: American Kennel Club
description:
This is a slight variation on the standard Uno card game, in which you try to be the first to play all the cards in your hand by matching the last discard by color, number, or card type (Wild, Draw 2, Reverse, Skip, etc.).

This version features different dogs for each number card (i.e., all the 1's have one specific dog, all the 2's have another dog, etc.), and each dog is a particular breed as recognized by the American Kennel Club.

This is packaged in one of 4 sets: Terrier Group, Sporting Group, Non-Sporting Group, and Herding Group. Each group showcases dogs from that category of the AKC.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The Best in Show card. When you play this card you name a card color (red, yellow, blue, or green). Each player draws a card from the draw deck until he draws a card of the named color. Once all players have done this the player to your left resumes by playing a card of the named color.

name: Pantomimik
description:
In this Charades-like game, three special dice or two decks of cards determine the categories in which, and the body parts with which, a player has to charade a card. Other players award points for the action.

The 1987 edition was the third edition; the first edition must be older.

name: DOS: Second Edition
description:
DOS Second Edition is the true sequel to the classic game of UNO. As that game's spiritual successor, DOS Second Edition plays a lot like UNO but with a few twists.

Like UNO, the object of DOS Second Edition is to be the first player to get rid of all your cards, but now there are two discard piles and players are allowed to add two cards together to help empty their hand faster.

On your turn you can play cards from your hand onto one or both discard piles by matching color, number, or symbol. You can also add two cards together to make a number match, but both cards must be the same color (for example, if the top card of a discard pile is a red 7, you can add together a yellow 3 and a yellow 4 and play them together as a 7 on that pile).

Watch out for classic UNO action cards like Skip, Reverse, and Draw 2 as well as the all-new Wild Play 2 card, which forces the next player to play 2 cards on their turn or lose their turn and draw 2 cards as a penalty.

Note: DOS Second Edition is has completely different gameplay than the earlier DOS card game (2018).

-description from designer

name: Crime Busters
description:
Players are shown a picture of a "crime scene" and try to answer questions about it. Since only twelve pictures come with the game, repeated playability is limited.

While there is only one listing for Crime Busters, it should be noted that three volumes were released, each with 12 mysteries to solve.

name: The Wine Game
description:
THE WINE GAME - A superior drinking game which will increase your appreciation of wine and will provide a very entertaining evening for 2-8 players.

From the box:

"A delightful journey through vineyards, wine tastings, wine bars, wine parties. You may be lucky enough to take the Gourmet Wine Tour, the Grand Tour or the Mini Tour. You will glide effortlessly around the board, answering a question or two about wine (Red - hard, White - easy) and being asked to take a drink or two from your glass, which always seems to replenish itself....."

The object of the game is to move around the board collecting bottles of wine. The first person to collect a case (i.e. 12 bottles) is the winner. By answering questions correctly you will keep moving around the board giving you greater opportunities to collect bottles...and to take more drinks.

name: Harry Potter and The Sorcerer's Stone: Levitating Challenge Electronic Skill and Action Game
description:
In this game you have to put a floating ball through a kind of maze, without hitting any objects, so the ball keeps floating. Time is the target of this game when you play it with more then one person.

From the box back:

"How fast can you navigate the ball through this magical maze challenge?"

"Use your powers of levitation to actually raise the ball out of the cauldron...it's amazing! Then, skillfully navigate the ball around the maze as fast as you can in mid-air! Listen to the wizard trainer's instructions as you go - he'll record your time and let you know if you've mastered the art of levitation."
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Foqus
description: Guess what the different images represents. The images are revealed bit by bit in 3 steps, before you can see the whole image. The smaller holes, the more points (=steps on the game board). Some squares give an extra guess or infinitive guesses next turn. The winner is the one who comes around the board first.

name: Bogstav Rebus
description: A dice game, where players roll 13-15 dice with letters on them, and within a limited amount of time, try to make words and get the most points. The winner is the player with the most points.

name: Top Gear
description:
(From the game box)

Top Gear: The Ultimate Car Challenge Board Game

It's just like on the telly... but in a box.

Prove you're the ultimate Top Gear fan and win. How hard can that be?

- Know Jezza, James and Richard better than their mums
- Know what's cool, sub-zero, and what's in the fridge
- Beat the Stig's Power Laps
- Know that caravans are for playing conkers with... and never, ever for taking a holiday in
- And always, always drive faster than Captain Slow.

Object of the Game
Collect the points that make up your ultimate car and be the first player to land on or pass the Finish space to win the game.

Contents:
- Game Board
- Player Guide
- 12 Ultimate Car Cards
- 43 Hazard Cards
- 165 Question Cards
- Score Pad
- 4 Player Movers
- Die
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Transportation, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Hummingbird Game
description:
From rules:
Object of the Game: To develop bird "nests" (or sets) made up of a Bird card, a Range card for that Bird card, and a Flower card. A nest may also have a Feathered Fact card (for that Bird card) and an Insect card.

In order to develop bird nests, each player adds to her/his supply by leading on her/his turn, a card upon which the others will play a card. Usually the lead card will take the trick (a trick is all the cards played, one from each player), but watch out! Every kind of card when led, can be taken by some other card. See the PECKING ORDER. Tricks taken are put in the hand to be used for making nests or for further play.

name: Abacan
description: ABACAN. Don't let the simple appearance fool you. ABACAN is a fun new strategy game that uses simple rules to provide a depth of strategy that grows with the experience of the players. ABACAN is a variation of the nearly 3000 year old Chinese mathematical game of Nim. To play, players alternate turns sliding 1,2, or 3 beads on the same bar from one side of the game to the other. The winner is the player who forces their opponent to move the last bead. The rules have been drafted so that there is always a winner, not ties, stalemates, or cat's games. Hand crafted from high quality hardwoods, ABACAN is pretty enough to be left out on the coffee table or bookshelf to be played again and again. Great gift item!

name: Saucy Charades
description: Saucy Charades is an adult version of charades full of innuendo. Some of the clues to be acted out include "Eager Beaver," "Booby prize," and "Bosom Buddies."

name: Side Track
description:
This game features the Pop-O-Matic bubble, a clear plastic hemisphere placed over a flexible sheet which prevents the die from being lost and allows for quick die rolls.

The first player to move all four men from the start position around Side Track and back to the Finish position wins.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Star Trek Game
description:
Box blurb says:
Deep Space Mission Briefing. Captain's Log Stardate 30.26.5. The Enterprise is menaced by a deadly Klingon War Ship. Only Zithium and Beton Crystals from the Planet of Fire and the Ice Planet can destroy it.
Your Mission. Bring back both Crystals and plant them in the War Ship Bridge. Look out for the Blurg, the Spider and the Klingons. Also look Out For Refuge Squares, Avoid Capture, Closed Circuit TV, Alarms and the Baroom Card!!

This Star Trek Game is a board game for two to six players produced in 1975 by Palitoy for the UK game market. This game is TOS-based, and was advertised as "Taken from the popular BBC TV Series Star Trek". Much of the game's artwork seems to have been done by – or at least, influenced by – the artists who worked on the Gold Key Star Trek comic. Players play crewmembers of the Enterprise assigned to obtain alien crystals from two planets that can be used to destroy a nearby Klingon warship, while avoiding capture by either the Klingons or the indigenous creatures on either planet.

Gameplay: The object of the game is to land on two planets – the "Planet of Fire" and the "Ice Planet" – to retrieve a sample of "Zithium" and "Beton" (respectively) to use against the Klingons and destroy their ship.
As crewmembers of the Enterprise, you have been assigned to obtain a crystal of each substance from their respective plantes, while avoiding a giant alien spider (which protects the crystals on the Planet of Fire) and an amorphous blob called a Blurg (who protects the crystals on the Ice Planet).

Each player starts in the Enterprise transporter room and tries to roll the number of the transporter pad to which they are assigned to "beam down" to one of the planets. (If they cannot do this within three rolls, they "beam down" automatically.) The player then traverses the game path on the planet to try and reach the cavern containing the crystals at the path's end. Players can obtain help from Kirk or Spock by landing on the space with their picture. They can also be captured if landed on by either creature or a Klingon (spaces on the path allow either the creatures to move or the Klingons to beam down to the planets), but by the player having Kirk and/or Spock with them, the player can have their "senior officer" "stun" their attacker and continue play.

Once a player obtains the crystal from one planet, they return to the Enterprise and go through "decontamination" (moving along the red and white path near the transporter room). They then return to the transporter (via the yellow and green path) and attempt to "beam down" to the other planet and get the second crystal. They then return to the Enterprise and undergo "decontamination" again before proceeding to the Enterprise's "airlock" and attempting to board the Klingon ship. From their, the player must enter the Klingon bridge, plant the crystals, and beam back to the Enterprise and undergo "decontamination" a third time before landing on the "Detonator" space and playing the "Baroom" card on the Klingon ship, thus destroying it and winning the game.

Source: Memory Alpha Wiki

name: Bestseller
description: Time to flex those improvisational skills! Bestseller has the players take on the role of writers trying to pitch their book concepts to the publisher, and beat out all the others. Bestseller plays on common Young Adult novel tropes, bringing a note of humor, and a lot of creativity. The base game comes with 150 cards in the deck.

name: Tooth Terror
description:
Tooth Terror is a hilarious 2-3 player card game in which you assume the role of a particularly nasty dentist. You score 'Pain points' by performing treatments. These vary from moderately (Drilling) to excruciatingly painful (Root Canal). Try to make your treatments as painful as possible in order to collect as much Pain points as possible.

To hinder your opponents, you play cards that make their treatments less painful (Anesthesia, Sterile equipment). Of course you can also make your own treatments more painful by playing cards like Blood loss.

The game ends when there are no more cards to draw from the shared deck. Everybody compares their points and whoever has inflicted the most pain upon his patients is the winner of Tooth Terror.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Medical, Party Game

name: Jumanji: The Next Level – Falcon Jewel Battle Game
description:
Welcome back to the jungle with the Jumanji: Falcon Jewel Battle Board Game! As always, we’re in for a wild ride. Players choose characters and get special advantages based on their unique character abilities. Compete with other players as you race through the jungle. Your goal is to collect tokens to fill your character tracker. Battle the evil forces and encounter windfalls but remember to be careful! Everything could change at a moment’s notice!

The first player to gain 6 tokens is the winner of the game.

Each player has 3 lives until they are dead (this is from the movie).

There are three cards that are placed face up. On a players turn, they select one of the cards to use for the turn. Cards may give you an extra life, give you an extra die, allow you to steal a token (VP) from another player, or fight a bad guy. Fighting the bad guys are the main event battles you will perform.

Combat is very easy. Each card (bad guy) allows you to ask other players to join a fight. Then there is a number that collectively all the players must roll equal to or higher than. If they do so, they each get a token (VP). If not, the lead player loses a life (you only get 3!).

—description from the publisher

name: The Backyardigans Game
description:
(From Game Box)

Make imaginative play and important part of each day. The Backyardigans Game lets kids sail on a Pirate Adventure or blast off on a Mission to Mars with their favorite pretend friends, Pablo, Uniqua, Tyrone, Tasha and Austin!

As they play kids will practice:

Color Matching
Picture Matching
Taking Turns
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Cheerios Play Book Bingo Game
description:
This game is excellent for children Ages 3 - 6. Cheerios Play Bingo Matching Game help children increase their vocabulary by putting their breakfast cereal playing pieces on the corresponding noun. Children are also given matching tiles, so they can work on their matching skill, for a whole new depth to the game.

This game makes breakfast just a little more educational and a lot more fun.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Word Game

name: The Berenstain Bears Missing Dinosaur Bone Game
description: Race through the rooms of the museum, finding all the missing objects. If you are the first to find a dinosaur bone and return it to its proper place, you win!
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Novel-based, Prehistoric, Racing
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Palette
description: A player has five seconds to memorize a specific shade of color. He then tries to match it to the same color on one of the color wheels. The first player to make six matches wins.

name: Skworms
description:
"The Worms Crawl In, The Worms Crawl Up Game"
The object of the game is to be the first to get all your worms up the skeleton's bones so they disappear into his skull.

The players divide the worms between themselves, the youngest starts and the oldest gets the brain (a bad thing). On your turn, you spin the spinner to find out what you're allowed to do; this can be:
- hang one of your worms on the skull,
- pull a worm out of the skull and give it to another player,
- give a worm to the player with the brain,
- give/take the brain and spin again,
- feed 1 worm to the skeleton, or
- feed 2 worms to the skeleton.

When feeding worms to the skeleton, you turn the crank and hope your worm(s) will crawl up into the skull--but there's a chance it'll fall right back out into your lap, possibly accompanied by other worms that got stuck during a previous player's turn.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Anti-Monopoly III: Washington-Moskau
description:
Each of the players represents a Nuclear Power. The aim of the game is to maintain world peace and avoid nuclear war. An "Arms Spiral" is in the middle of the board, representing the arms race. When the "BOMB" arrives at the end of the Arms Spiral, world peace is over and everyone has lost! However, if all players work together in such a way that one reaches the "World Peace" space, then the arms race is over. All players have won and the one who has contributed the most to maintaining world peace is declared winner.

To prevent destruction each player must simultaneously pursue his own goals as well co-operate with the other players to maintain peace. Each one can pursue his personal selfish goal to come to a victory, but this promotes the arms race.

The American version of this game is called Star Peace: Anti Nuclear War.

name: Starunner
description:
Starunner takes place in a balkanised galaxy; the Galaxy-wide Empire has fallen, and centuries later small empires have appeared all over. The re-invented warp (hyperdrive) technology is crude and a little hazardous. Power crystals are relics of the fallen empire, still impossible to create anew, and can be integrated into the engines and computer systems of the ships to make them much, much better performing.

You are a power crystal smuggler, or Star Runner.

The object of the game is to be the first to smuggle six power crystals to the Para system. As the locations of the crystals are unknown at the outset, you'll first need to accumulate Clues. For every six clues, you find a crystal --that is, you roll to deploy one; although you're the only one who knows where it is, you still need to get there and back...

There are three basic strategies: One At A Time, where you find and fetch each of the six crystals in sequence; All At Once, where you locate all six before attempting to retrieve them; and Piracy, where you lie in wait of those who have found crystals...
mechanics: Action Points, Pick-up and Deliver, Role Playing, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: General Hospital
description:
"The game of GENERAL HOSPITAL, A role playing board game.

Play your favorite character. This new concept incorporates the simplicity of a board game with the freedom of a role playing game.
Assume the role of your favorite character; pick Luke Spencer, Jackie Templeton, or any of the many characters. The game includes everything needed to bring GENERAL HOSPITAL into your home."
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Quadragammon
description:
On a four-sided backgammon table, two teams face each other; one team moves clockwise, the other counterclockwise. Otherwise, the rules follow standard backgammon pretty closely. A variant is supplied allowing four *individual* players.

A newer version from 2005, Quadrogammon, features a silk-screened roll-up board.

Though not the same game, another 4-player backgammon variant is Backgammon 4
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game
publishers: F.X. Schmid, John N. Hansen Co., Inc., Quadrogammon, LLC

name: Quickely Dice
description:
Quik E Ly Dice is part dice game, part card collecting and melding game.
A single set consists of 8 dice in 2 colours and 54 cards, 27 of in each of the same two colours as the dice.
One set is suitable for two players, and there are three sets in all; Using all three with half the 162 cards allows up to six players.
The cards depict two dice faces, one above the other. The object is to score points by collecting and then melding the cards, a la rummy.
Players may meld numerical sequences of up to 11 cards, scoring 1 point for each card in the meld. These sequences must be along the top row dice face of the cards. Bonus points are scored for also forming certain combinations along the bottom row. For example, a sequence showing Red 1/4, 2/5, 3/6, 4/6 would score 16 points; 4 points for the 1,2,3,4 sequence along the top row, multiplied by 2 for all the cards being the same color, multiplied by 2 again for the 4,5,6 sequence along the bottom. There are several other bonuses which may be scored.
The mechanics of the game are very simple. Several cards will be face up on the table at any one time. Each player may roll up to 3 of their 4 dice in an attempt to capture 1 or more of these cards.
Cards are captured by rolling the two numbers corresponding to the two dice on a card. Thus, rolling a 1, 4, 5 will allow you to capture a 5/1, a 4/1 or a 5/4 card, provided they are available.
If a player rolls just one of the numbers on a card that he/she wants, that player may "reserve" that card by placing the single dice on the card. If the player subsequently rolls the second number in a later turn, he/she can take the card. Reserved cards may still be captured by other players.

name: Strike It Rich
description:
Strike It Rich Playing The Stock Market appears to be a Monopoly clone share dealing game, but isn't. The board has the usual track of famous British companies (Tarmac, Racal, Tesco, Courts), decks of Fact Cards and Venture Cards, a die showing cash gains, a huge stack of plastic money chips for each player and a genuine Casio HL-811 calculator in its own box!
You need the calculator because the game also has a book of actual weekly share prices for each company. On your turn, you buy into one firm or another by placing chips onto the board. Later you may sell your investment, making a profit or loss as the prices fluctuate. You draw a Fact Card, which gives info about the price of gold, the currency exchange rates, the FTSE index (the UK's Dow Jones) for a certain week. Based on that info, you decide if your shares will be up or down and whether to sell or hold. If you sell, the Banker checks the actual price in the Market booklet and debits or credits you accordingly. Rolling a VC on the die draws a Venture Card, with the usual hazards and gains to your cash.
More of a crude stock market simulation than a game of strategy, the makers proposed selling fresh decks of Fact Cards and Market booklet for successive years.

name: Underwriter
description:
Underwriter, The Names Game, is an insurance game in which 4 players become Names at Lloyd's of London, taking on risks in the Aviation, Marine, Non-Marine and Motor markets. Each player has a Syndicate board and puts tokens into each Market slot. You roll and move round the board, drawing the relevant market card which may show a profit or loss (eg opening of new airport increases premiums for Aviation syndicates, football team trashing hotel costs Non-marine claims damages). You can also gain Stop Loss markers and face a Solvency test. You win by your Syndicate getting 4 tokens in each Market and passing the Solvency test.
A nicely made set with a quarter-board, but, being a British game, there is no more thought than roll & move and draw hazard cards. As boring as it sounds.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Clue Jr. Travel Game
description:
Detective Game for Juniors
Ages 5 - 7

Game Case
4 Game Cards
4 Movers
Notepad

name: Quip Qubes
description: Quip Qubes is similar to Scrabble, only players form sentences instead of words. On their turn players roll their (remaining) dice and use the words that come up to form a sentence that can be placed on the board crossword style with the other sentences that are already there. Bonus points are scored when special spaces on the board are covered.

name: 1-2-3 OY!
description: 1-2-3 OY! is a set of ten card games which are adaptable to any age level or ability. Flexible rules provide for optional use of one or all of the basic math skills (addition, subtraction, multiplication or division) up to 16x tables. Both fast and slower card games are included and the games are suitable for ages 5 to adult. Directions in English, French and Spanish.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: A-B-C OY!
description: A-B-C OY! is a collection of eight word and spelling games for all ages. You can learn your alphabet backwards and forwards with YO! YO! OY! or speed spell with SLAP SPELL OY!. Many of the games of A-B-C OY! are played similarly to Dream Green's 1-2-3 OY! and instructions are in English, French and Spanish.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Word Game

name: Challenge of the Lion Lord
description:
In Challenge of the Lion Lord, you roll to move around the board and collect pieces of artifacts that give you bonuses for fighting (which is more dice rolling). Eventually, you will have enough bonuses to take on the Lion Lord.

From the back of the box:

Somewhere beyond this world, lies the realm of the Lion Lord. The Talanay legend tells of a time long ago, when the Lion Lord ruled the land. Many courageous opponents challenged his power, but none succeeded. For their bravery the Lion Lord gave each challenger a territory to hold as his domain.

Now you must challenge all those who have come before you. Powerful warriors and fierce creatures stand ready to test your courage, skill, and strength. Take this journey at your own risk. This is a game only for the bravest of warriors.

Challenge of the Lion Lord is a board game of mystical adventure for two to four players. You will battle the Harpy, the Minotaur, the Hydra, the Cyclops, and other warlords of the fantasy realm. You will gain power, weapons and protection to be used in the ultimate test of courage and strength.

Includes:

3 decks of game cards: power, challenge, and wizard
4 molded game pieces
4 sets of the artifact tablet cards
a large full color game board and
set of 4 dice

name: Harvey Smith's Show Jumping
description: In Show Jumping, up to 4 players attempt to run their horse through a series of jumps, in the least amount of moves. Dice rolls are used to determine movement, but each player can maneuver their horse to the best possible point to attempt a jump. Jump cards can also be obtained and held, which can help a player go over a particularly hard jump. The jumps on the board can be set up in many different configurations, to make many different courses. The game can also be played solitaire, with the lone player attempting to complete a course in the fewest possible moves.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sell Out by National Lampoon
description: The totally unethical, incredibly realistic game of making it to the top. With just a couple of breaks and a couple of bluffs you can make the move out of the daily grind and into the fast lane. Then all you have to do is...well, lie and cheat a little! Compromise your principles, confuse your competition, exploit your resources, betray your buddies and make a bundle.

name: Resistoly
description:
A promotional game produced for the pharmaceutical firm about the prevention of virus illnesses through the strength of defensive agents.

For Ages 8 and up.

name: Spellcast
description:
From the Northern Games website:

Spellcast™ is a mystical card gaming experience designed for two to six players that lets you jump into the realm of spells and spirits. Its bold, colorful, and filled with excitement. Come and explore the magic that is inside and all around us.
The players gather ingredients to cast spells, fly to different realms, battle against their opponents with power cards, and play hands-on with crystals. So, has it captured your attention?
Spellcast™ also features a game within a game. A starter pack of 45 Coven's Circle™ battle cards is included in every game. Coven's Circle™ is designed to be integrated into play of Spellcast™ however, this highly exciting card game can be played totally on its own.
Play Spellcast™ and jump into the realm of spells and spirits... if you dare!

name: Scouting Trails
description:
THE SCOUTING TRAILS GAME IS INTENDED TO BE BOTH FUN AND EDUCATIONAL. YOU WILL SOON START DOWN ONE OF THE TRAILS IN FOX VALLEY AS YOU TRY TO ADVANCE TO THE RANK OF EAGLE. THE QUESTIONS WILL BE HARD AT FIRST UNTIL YOU LEARN THAT ALL OF THE ANSWERS CAN BE FOUND IN THE 'OFFICIAL BOY SCOUT HANDBOOK'.

SCOUTING TRAILS CAN BE PLAYED BY TWO TO SIX PLAYERS. THE OBJECTIVE IS TO BECOME THE FIRST PERSON TO ADVANCE THROUGH ALL SIX RANKS, FROM TENDERFOOT TO EAGLE. IF YOU/ANSWER THE QUESTION CORRECTLY WHEN YOUR PLAYING PIECE IS ON A TRIANGULAR 5PACE YOU WILL BE REWARDED THAT RANK (A COLORED DISK). AFTER YOU COLLECT ALL SIX COLORS YOU MOVE TO THE CENTER SPACE (CAMP) AND TRY TO PASS THE BOARD OF REVIEW. IF YOU PASS YOU BECOME AN EAGLE IN FOX VALLEY'S

name: An Evening of Murder: Dead of Winter
description:
One in the series of "Max Haines Invites You To An Evening of Murder (tm)" party games. Plays like the popular "How to Host a Murder" series. This particular edition is "Dead of Winter." As this is a later entry in the series (after Canada Games), the components aren't as flashy as in earlier years. From the box...

Crime Scene: In a secluded ski resort nestled deep in the mountains, a murder takes place. Lisa Sherman, daughter of the late Charles Sherman, was three days away from inheriting an estate worth 1.2 billion dollars. The winds that night howled across the mountains and through the trees as the snowstorm descended upon the lodge. Windows rattled, the wooden beams creaked, no one could possibly have heard Lisa's screams as she plummeted from the balcony to her death. Within minutes the storm blew out and the moonlight glistened upon Lisa's lifeless body.

She had been pushed...

The Suspects:

Jamie Tomlin: The activity co-coordinator at the lodge, with a dream of being an Olympic skier. How far would she go for the gold?

Drake Stone: A ski instructor who couldn't resist wealthy, good looking women. His best moves were not on the slopes.

Lacey Sherman: The grieving twin sister, identical in every way. Did she have any special insight into her sister's death?

Sterling Brannigan: A successful business tycoon, shrewd to the very end. His motto, "where there's a Will; there's a way!"

Iris Hudson: The manager of the lodge, and the victim's half sister. Running the Twilight Lodge was all she knew. Would she commit murder to keep what was rightfully hers?

Dr. Jeff Barlo: A Psychologist with a hidden past. Hypnosis was his specialty. Was murder part of his act?

Marcy Brannigan: A wife with an ulterior motive. Greed and deception are her pride possessions.

Chet Granger: A charming Texan who loves his freedom. He thrives on the thrill of danger. Was his arrival at the lodge a mere coincidence?
publishers: Irwin Toy Ltd., Pentalpha Game Corporation

name: Fangface
description:
Fangface is a roll and move game, with simple interactive elements, based on the cartoon series of the same name.

Players spin a spinner in order to move around the board. Some squares are safe while others cause you to move back. The most common square on the board is "throw fingers" where two players randomly put out a number of fingers. If the total is odd, the active player moves back while if it is even, he/she stays on the square. There is also an element where you must guess in which hand a player is holding a token. During the game, a special "moon card" can be used on a player to move them back on the board to a specific square.

The first player to make it to the End space is the winner.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: It's Only Money The Game
description:
From the box:

"Shoppers enter the It's Only Money Mall via the spinner and begin shopping, with the aim of acquiring 5 spaces on the It's Only Money Shopping Money Card, while denying opponents' the ability to do the same. Perilous pitfalls and profitable bonus spaces all contribute to the playing excitement. The first player to acquire the five spaces, as well as the $50,000 in game money, is the winner. It's a fast paced game of shopping strategy, savvy and spending. Do you have what it takes to win it all?

name: Jack and the Beanstalk Memory Game
description:
From the box:

An ideal family game: challenging for all ages, yet a game that children frequently (usually!) can win against adults. Requires concentration, memory, and a bit of luck!

Note - it's a simple race game with a mechanism like Chicken Cha Cha Cha - you move forward if you can turn over a tile matching the space in front of your pawn. You continue to move until you cannot make a match.

name: Among Nations
description: An easy-to-play card game of international wheeling and double-dealing. Each player represents the executive leadership of one country. During each round, players determine their country's agenda and try to promote it while helping or hindering the agendas of other nations through fast-paced card trades and diplomacy. Originally sold with GameFix issue number 9.
publishers: Game Publications Group, One Small Step

name: Impromptu
description:
'Impromptu: The ultimate challenge of getting your message across.

The object of the game is to concoct a story in one minute that will convey a given word without specifically mentioning the word. You'll be amazed and amused at some of the outrageous stories you and your friends will create.

You don't need a public speaking background and you don't need to be a novelist. With a few friends and a lot of laughs you'll be the expert at getting your message across.

name: American Derby
description:
American Derby has up to 6 horses race to the finish line at various lengths from 4 furlongs to 1¼ miles distances using the deck of 54 cards.

All cards are shuffled and distributed equally to each player. On each turn every player is allowed to play one card which allows their horse to move from 1-5 spaces or apply a penalty to another horse.

Plays very similar to the more recent game of Win, Place & Show by 3M. Comes with 6 painted metal horses.

name: The Addams Family
description: This weird family does everything different than most folks and this game follows that concept. The object of the game is to lose, not win, for if you win you lose and it's fun either way! The object of the game is to try and stay near the trailer site on the island and not finish first.
categories: Children's Game, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Golf Ace
description:
Golf Ace strives to simulate the intricacies of golf in a card game.

It comprises four boards, depicting golf holes of various lengths and bearing different hazards, two packs of (conventional) playing cards and comprehensive playing instructions including example holes for the novice to play through. Each hole has a dominant suit (hearts, clubs, diamonds or spades) and a stroke is made by playing a combination of cards to determine the distance and lie. Thus playing a 2 + King (picture cards count as 0 or 10) + Ace, equates to a drive of 201 yards. Only certain distances are permitted, as shown on a distance table on each board, and certain cards may land you in a hazard (which, tactically, may still be worth playing). Playing a card not of the dominant suit incurs a one stroke penalty. A player may opt to draw from the stock, in the hope of improving his position, or play a stroke with the cards he has been dealt.

Golf Ace works best with 4 players, but can be played as a solitaire, trying to beat your own lowest score for a round of 9 or 18 holes.

name: Star Trek: The Next Generation – Romulan Challenge
description:
From the rules:

Twelve planets in federation space, near to the Romulan Neutral Zone, have been occupied by the Romulan Empire. The planets are strategically very important as they have some of the most valuable mineral deposits in the galaxy.

The Romulans have surreptitiously taken control of the planets making accusations of espionage against the Federation. The leaders of the planets are being interrogated and the mining personnel treated as slave labor. The Romulans are forcing the use of dangerous intensive mining techniques which allow very rapid extraction of the minerals, but could soon make the mines unworkable. The remaining mineral deposits would be almost impossible to extract. The Romulans must be stopped. The minerals taken and the damage caused will enable their empire to become even more powerful.

One by one the planets must be liberated. It is essential for the Federation to regain control in order to maintain peace throughout the galaxies.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Trivia, Wargame

name: Fowlplay
description:
'Fowlplay, the board game where it's duck season 365 days a year!

Object of the game: kill your limit of six ducks without going over the limit and return to the clubhouse.

Two to 10 players move shotgun-shaped playing pieces around the board to land in one of four hunting locations: a blind, a pit, a boat or a log. Once there, Shell Cards are played to "shoot" and Duck Dice are rolled to see how many birds fly over. Players draw from the Duck Deck to see what kinds of ducks they kill; some Miss Cards included. As players move around the board they may land on certain spaces that require drawing a card from the Draw Deck of various consequences. Fowlplay simulates a real duck hunt featuring real photographs of six species of ducks.

The game is enhanced by the availability of custom playing pieces with your own picture on them! Fun for ages 6 and up. Made in USA.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Happy Hour: The Game
description:
The object of this drinking game disguised as a trivia game is to acquire trivia tokens for Beer, Mix, Music and Sports.

When a question is answered correctly, they receive a token for the category they answered. When a question is answered incorrectly, the player must drink. If a player has a token for that category, that player doesn't have to answer any more questions in that category. If a player is sent to "Hoistland" all tokens are lost and that player must drink when anyone rolls a six. That player can only leave Hoistland when they roll a six themselves.

name: Treasure (in the Canadian Rockies)
description:
Each player has a team of three figures, two adventurers and one guide. The guide is used to collect "Grub Stake" cards which allow you to climb the mountain and get the treasure. Your adventurers are used to climb for the gold and to delay other players.

The game is interesting in that it has a molded plastic wall which must be climbed. The square 'Grub Stake' cards are placed into slots on the wall to allow a players figure to ascend the mountain.

Movement is by roll of two dice which may be split amongst any of your three figures. The pieces move in a straight line only... no turns are allowed during a move.

If a "Bear" card is discovered while exploring, it can be used to send an opponent back to start or delay him while he's climbing for treasure.

The game is entirely dependent on the roll of the dice and the cards gained through random draw. Nevertheless, it's a fun little race game with a 3D board.
mechanics: Line Drawing, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mini Casino
description:
Mini Casino is a collection of Casino Games. It includes: Roulette, Sic Bo (ancient Chinese gambling game), Baccarat, Blackjack 21 and Craps (exciting betting game). Every game has its own board to play with; there are 5 different ones to choose from.

Contents:

5 boards
3 dice
1 Roulette
100 different color tokens
Deck of poker cards
1 instructions manual in English and Chinese that explains every game.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Deduction, Dice, Number, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: The Lucy Show Game
description:
Lucy and Vivian are each given a lot of money... the bet is on as to who can spend their money the fastest.

Players roll the dice and move around the board to attempt a visit to every store at least once and spend all of their money exactly. Players may buy an item at each place they visit. Everything from Jewelry to Real Estate is represented by cardboard tokens.

The first player to spend all of their money wins.

name: Student Survival
description:
Student Survival is a loose simulation of college life.

Players roll the dice and move around the board, taking classes, getting part time jobs, passing exams, etc. Players start as Freshmen and advance through Sophomore, Junior, and Senior before either quitting because their money runs out or graduating to end the game.

The basic premise: get through four years of college by spending the least amount of money.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: National Velvet
description:
The game is divided into two parts.

In the first half of the game, players run their 'horses' around the paddock to train them (by collecting different coloured hurdle tiles).

When training is complete, all players enter the Steeplechase Race by playing their hurdles around the track to hinder their opponents. Horses require a certain event on a spinner to make a jump... each hurdle makes it more difficult.

The first person to cross the finish line in the big Race is the winner.

name: RohSzamBo
description:
Based on the classic games of Checkers and Rock-Paper-Scissors, RohSzamBo is an outer space abstract strategy game.

Players move pieces representing three aliens: ROH, SZAM, and BO. To win squares on the board, ROH beats SZAM, SZAM beats BO, and BO beats ROH. There is also ZIP, a special alien who adds to the fun!

Easy to learn, challenging to win, with two exciting ways to play... can you be the "Last One in the Galaxy".

name: DiGiCharat's Game of Life
description:
Loosely based off Milton Bradley's Game of Life but with more choices to be made throughout the game.

This version is based off the anime DiGiCharat. DiGiCharat being the cute catgirl on the cover that is also the mascot character for the "Gamers" line of stores in Japan and their parent company Broccoli. It's still an extremely 'light' game. You can change occupations many times throughout the game, and collect items that are worth money at the end of the game (or you can have items worth negative money that you want to try to get rid of). There's good-natured "Fight" squares and the like as well.

name: Chase Across the Planes
description:
Chase Across the Planes is a boardgame for two to four players set in the worlds of the Intruder. The game was published in Intruder magazine #1.

Player assume the roles of supernatural characters who are testing their powers for the first time... each character has a special ability that allows them to 'bend' the rules in a slightly different way.

Players move around a small stylized mapboard that represents the different planes of existance, attempting to visit each one and 'leave their mark'. Along the way, they may battle other characters and/or destroy other player's markers.

As soon as a player has markers in all of the planes required (depending on the number of players, this can be 4 to 6), he wins.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Escape from the Brotherhood
description:
A solitaire game, based on the Agent 13 comic, published in 13: Assassin magazine #2.

All you have to do is get from Start' to the Agent 13 Cell by avoiding loss of life points and trying to evade as many random encounters as possible. There are more encounter tokens than game spaces, so every game is different.

name: Battle for the Sprawls
description:
Battle for the Sprawls is a two-player boardgame that was published in Buck Rogers #2. The game is loosely based on the novel Rebellion: 2456 by M.S. Murdoch.

Each player plays one side of the conflict, either NEO (New Earth Organization) or RAM (Russo-American Mercantile), the current masters of Mars.

The game includes a map (which represent the sprawls of Old Chicagorg), 3 pages of rules (covering basic initiative, movement and combat procedures), and one sheet of cut-out playing pieces.

The game is decided on Victory Points, which are given for eliminating opponent's units, or for destroying enemy transports. Effectively, to win as the NEO player, you must get more of your transports off the ground than have been destroyed.

Additional, optional rules are provided for ranged combat, transport defenses, and secret passages.

name: Nix
description:
Nix is a rummy-like game with a gimmick - there are no fixed sets of cards you are trying to get, but instead 18 different scoring rules (4 cards of the same color score 25 points, for example), of which 7 are chosen randomly in the first 7 rounds of each hand.

The scoring rules are on large stackable plastic cubes, which makes them easy for everyone to see, but does bulk up the game quite a bit.

name: Dragon Quest: Fushigi na Meikyuu (Mysterious Labyrinth)
description: A mix of Labyrinth with one of those picture puzzles with the sliding blocks. Basically, you move around the board trying to find the treasure. There are special squares with trolls and the like, and certain places where you draw event cards, but most of the gameplay comes down to trying to get to the treasure chests. You then open the treasure chests to see if there's treasure inside or if the treasure chest is a mimic. The middle of the board is made up of corridors on blocks that can slide.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Gambit
description:
Each player has 15 pieces, one king and 14 knights. Players alternate moving their pieces one orthogonal square. After a move, if an orthogonal line of one players pieces is next to an orthogonal line of another, the person with the longer line captures the other line. The King counts as two pieces for the purpose of capturing.

The object of the game is to capture the opponent's king, or the 14 knights.

name: Coma: Guerra Biológica
description:
The players take turns playing as Body defenses/medication/etc. (one per round), while all the other players play as external agents trying to take over the control of the body. The battle takes place using a schema of the human body, and the winner is the player, when playing as defense, who can eliminate all the aggressors.
It's a Brazilian boardgame made by one of the best game creator's of this country.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Trak-Chek
description:
A unique mixture of checkers and wargame theming. Single checkers are "platoons"; double checkers are "battalions". Platoons can only move counter-clockwise around the board and only on the outside track. Battalions can move in either direction and can use the bridges to move to and from the inner track. A platoon becomes a battalion by reaching enemy territory and surviving for a turn.

Movement is handled by rolling two dice that generate a number from 2 - 3. Yes, that's right, one of the dice is nothing but 1's, and the other is 50/50 split between 1's and 2's. No, I have no idea why they bothered with the first die. Maybe they thought it would be less confusing than saying "roll the die and add 1". Yes, having a die that is 50/50 2's and 3's would have made the most sense, but maybe they bought these on clearance somewhere.

Capturing happens just like checkers, though you do not have to jump if you do not want to. Captured pieces are kept in the POW camps (for theme). Safety zones provide spots where pieces can not be captured.

name: Blank
description: Blank is a word game from the UK. Designed by 2 word game fans for anyone who loves crosswords, word searches, Scrabble, Boggle, etc. Blank can be played with any number of people. It's very competitive, educational and fun. The game revolves around the precision engineered LetterSelector. It's been specifically designed to be simple to learn, but difficult to master.
categories: Educational, Party Game, Puzzle, Word Game
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Paris Zoom
description:
Commissioned by the Paris board of transportation, players move around the Paris subway and bus networks. Each has a specific character chosen from the twenty-four available, e.g. Architect, Student, Nightclubber, Movie Buff... Children down to age 8 can play the Urchin and the Parisian Kid. The players must answer questions pertaining to their chosen character. The first who completes a predetermined circuit wins.

The questions are general knowledge, historic, cultural, weird... :

- For the Writer: What kind of animal did Gérard de Nerval take out for a walk at the Palais-Royal ?
- For the Musician: In which famous club did Boris Vian play jazz ?
- For the Cemetery Keeper: What did Cyrano of Bergerac and Molière have in common ?

The characters were drawn by the French artist Tignous.

I find it interesting to combine variable powers with a trivia game.

name: Totally Twister
description: Totally Twister is an electronic contraption that looks something like a multi-colored cube. There are a few different types of games available for it, such as "Pass It" and "Turbo Pass" but the object generally involves quickly passing or moving the contraption between two people by placing it between the two named body parts. It's more akin to Funny Bones than the original Twister game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Humor, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Phoney Baloney
description: In this trivia party game, the object is to guess which of three answers are wrong, not correct. Whoever can guess the most incorrect answers is the winner!

name: Mission Aloft
description:
A tactical game of air-to-ground and air-recon missions. Each counter represents an individual aircraft, turns are 30 seconds, and each hex is 2 miles across. The game uses the same map sheet for all 10 scenarios.

"This game simulates some aspects of air warfare during the period 1960-1980. One player or team called the A-player must carry out one or more assigned air-to-ground attacks or a reconnaissance mission. The other player or team called the B-player employs interceptors and surface-to-air weapons to frustrate the A-player's mission. The game consists of many scenarios drawn from Arab-Israeli, India-Pakistan, and Southeast Asian conflicts as well as hypothetical situations."
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: Miners' Mountain
description:
Played on a three dimensional board game, Miners' Mountain, for two to seven players, takes you back to the mining days of the Klondike era. The object of the game is to become the wealthiest prospector.

A dice roll moves your game pieces up the mountain until you reach one of the numbered mine entrances. Placing a numbered marble in the mine entrance enables player to actively mine that mine. To recover gold, a player rotates the mountain using mountain movement cards. Amount of payment for gold depends on marble landing in assayer's tray. Once paid, the player reuses the game piece, to start over climbing the mountain to mine for more gold.

More advanced players can challenge each other to gunfights or steal each other's mines by claim jumping. A dice roll determines who wins a gunfight or takes over a mine.

A third dimension to the game, Bushwhackers, is a game of capture. It uses the gunfight rules along with the location on the mountain to gain advantage against your opponent.

name: Interpretation of Dreams
description:
Interpretation of Dreams lets everyone play amateur psychiatrist in an unbelievably funny game where with the aid of a specially compiled Dream Dictionary you will get to know yourself and your friends better."

Each player writes down an account of a dream. The moderator collects all the sheets and reads a dream aloud to the group without identifying the author. The group then identifies the symbol words in the dream and these are looked up in the Dream Dictionary. Each player writes an analysis of the dream, which are read aloud to the group. The players also write down a guess as to who they believe wrote the dream. The winner is the player who has the most correct identifications.

name: Hulk Busts Loose
description: Be the first player to get past the obstacles and make it to the finish line. Players start off as Bruce Banner and get the chance to turn into the Hulk and race across the board with extra speed. Features Banner-to-Hulk transformation piece with a photo of Eric Bana as Bruce Banner and Dale Keown Hulk artwork
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: Popular de Juguetes, Pressman Toy Corp.

name: Foreign Legion: Moulay Ishmael
description: The Arabs attacked when the column was in the middle of the valley. At first it appeared as if this was merely a small force of Arabs, and the Foreign Legion companies deployed to drive them back from their positions. Then like a thunderbolt, the Arab cavalry struck. Veterans that they were, the Foreign Legion troops were unable to stand before this new attack . . . The battle of Moulay Ishmael ended with the French retreating while the Arab cavalry made occasional attacks against them. Of the French force of twety-five hundred, one thousand of whom were Legionares, five hundred had fallen and the fight was not yet over . . . Although a complete game in itself, Moulay Ishmael can be combined with Macta using the optional rules in the Macta game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Harassment
description:
"The Object of the Game: To collect the most points by correctly predicting how your opponents will judge certain cases of Harassment."

Harassment, the newest catch word of The Nineties, is so controversial that no one can even agree on how to pronounce it. Harassment, The Game, creates hours of lively conversation as you and your fellow players wrestle with some of the most perplexing social issues of our time."

"Contains: 156 Case Histories, 312 Arguments, 24 Voting Cards, 12 Scoring Pegs, 3 Game Booklets, 1 Score Board."

Unlike similar games, the cases used in this game are fictional.

name: L.A. Law
description:
"LA LAW GAME BRIEF"

"Players take the roles of their favorite LA LAW lawyers and argue controversial and humorous real-life legal cases. Using the pro and con points provided, the 'attorneys' put their cases to the 'jury' (the other players), using all the logic, passion and powers of persuasion they can summon. After a vote is taken and the verdict is brought in, the real-life verdict is revealed - the results are often surprising, sometimes shocking - and points are awarded to the 'attorneys,' both for being right and for successfully persuading their friends, right or wrong!"

"Great for parties, or just among intimate friends."

"Includes 150 cases, 10 case files, file holder, 10 yes/no verdict cards, 10 character discs, verdict viewer, blind justice cup, score pad, instructions."
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Silly Golf
description: Similar to the auto-return practice putting cups that "big people" play with, this is a putting game for pre-schoolers (Ages 3 - 6). Players take turns trying to putt their ball into the cup. Guarding the cup are three gophers (Birdie, Chip, and Spike) who pop up at random to block shots and say silly phrases. Score 1 point each time you sink a putt. First to 6 points wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Sports

name: Emboscada
description:
The name translates as "Ambush". Cowboys versus indians in the North American old West. This is one of the first two published games by the pioneer Brazilian game designer, Mário Seabra.

(Playing time is a wild guess.)

name: Adventures with Clifford, the Big Red Dog
description: This is a cooperative children's game. Clifford is traveling from home to the farm, and the players are telling the story of his adventures en route. Each turn a player turns over a card that shows a picture on it (say, a fisherman carrying a fish). That player then adds something involving that picture to the story (e.g., "Then Clifford saw a fisherman who had just caught a fish!")
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Ana contre Corax
description:
Ana and her clan must save their talisman, Lacerto. Following a bad spell cast by Corvus Corax, he was transfixed into the form of a bracelet. However, Corvus Corax and his clan will do everything to prevent them and to guard their own talisman Vipera.
Ana contre Corax is an episode of ‘Ana, voyage dans les îles’. Ana is a child, who was born on the ‘Belle île’. She lives in an imaginary world populated by animals, equipped with powers and magical abilities.
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Bullwinkle Hide-N-Seek
